description: Domaine de la Mordorée's 2014 rosés are fitting tributes to proprietor Christophe Delorme's final vintage (he died in June 2015). This blend of 50% Grenache, 30% Syrah and 20% Cinsault is weighty and rich, blending raspberries and white chocolate into a wine that could be served as a light red wine, with grilled meats or poultry.
title: Domaine de la Mordorée 2014 Le Dame Rousse Rosé (Côtes du Rhône)

description: This crisp, lively and dry rosé is made from Mourvèdre and Grenache grapes. it shows great acidity and a rather lean and thirst-quenching texture that carries the vibrant raspberry and apple flavors right along. The color is a pale salmon, the body is light, and the finish fresh and clean. It's a perfect lunch wine for salads, seafood and grilled fare.
title: The Withers Winery 2014 Rosé (El Dorado)

description: This revitalized négociant has bottled a fine rosé that's showing its best in 2015. It's deep pink in color, with perfumed aromas of rose petals and cracked pepper. It's ample in body, picking up hints of cardamom, cinnamon, watermelon and red berries on the palate, before finishing long and refreshing. Drink now.
title: Lavau 2013  Tavel

description: Coming from seven vineyards and showing more yellow, orange and tan than pink in the glass, this blend of 80% Grenache, 17% Mourvèdre and 3% Counoise suggests orange and lemon peels, just-sliced melon and frozen strawberries on the nose. The palate is more about great acidity and a stony minerality, along with some watermelon elements and orange rind.
title: Tablas Creek 2014 Patelin de Tablas Rosé (Paso Robles)

description: Chalky accents add character to the red berry and white strawberry aromas and flavors of this wine. It's fresh and clean in the mouth with zippy acidity and an easy finish. Drink now.
title: Galil Mountain 2010 Rosé (Upper Galilee)

description: This Provençal-style blush is made from Syrah, Mourvèdre and Grenache. It's a good wine, dry and crisply acidic, but not without its faults. The main problem is a streak of green mint and vegetables. But there's enough sweet raspberry and cherry fruit to get by.
title: Lasseter 2010 Enjoué Rosé (Sonoma Valley)

description: This is our first peek at MacPhail's 2012 Pinots, and to judge by it, they'll be pretty good. The wine is dark in color and full-bodied for a rosé, with the weight and texture of Chardonnay. It's enormously flavorful in raspberries, vanilla, honey and spices.
title: MacPhail 2012 Rosé of Pinot Noir Rosé (Sonoma Coast)

description: Another satisfying Rosé from Horse & Plow, which uses organically grown Carignane, Syrah and Grenache grapes for this wine. With refreshing acidity, it's dry, bright in lime and grapefruit with spicy layers of strawberry and orange.
title: Horse & Plow 2012 Rosé (North Coast)

description: An easy, fun rosé, with apricot, peach, orange and melon flavors, brightened with crisp acidity. The finish is nice and dry.
title: Stepping Stone by Cornerstone 2012 Corallina Rosé of Syrah Rosé (Napa Valley)

description: This salmon-colored rosé is made from the País grape, a.k.a. the Mission Grape. On the nose, it's a cypher with weak fragrances of peach and mango. The palate is cidery and hard in feel, while briny, tart citrus flavors are pithy and fail to evolve or improve on the finish.
title: Viña Bisquertt 2013 Missing Rosé (Curicó Valley)

description: There's a green, brambly quality to this rosé that is enhanced by powdered licorice, dried mint, green tea and cassis. The wine is nice and refreshing but slightly disjointed in places. Made from a 70-30 blend of Refosco and Merlot.
title: Masi 2006 Modello delle Venezie Rosato Rosé (Venezie)

description: Touches of bramble and smoke meander curiously amid sweet strawberry and cherry in this off-dry rosé. While a bit candied on the palate, it's a juicy approachable wine for casual imbibing.
title: Gaul 2013 Rosé (Pfalz)

description: A bit heavy for a rosé, without quite the liveliness you want. It's a very fruity wine, with forward raspberry, vanilla, cocoa and spice flavors.
title: Buena Vista 2008 Rosé of Syrah Rosé (Carneros)

description: Pretty dark for a rosé, and heavy in the mouth, with the density almost of a red wine. Shows soft cherry and spice flavors.
title: Mosby 2009 Rosato Rosé (Santa Barbara County)

description: This is a crisp, Syrah-based rosé, with some passion fruit on the nose, but then ripe berry flavors on the palate. It's plump and medium-bodied, yet finishes with a zing of refreshing acidity. Drink now.
title: Château Beaubois 2010 Expression Rosé (Costières de Nîmes)

description: Sweet and sour, with cherry and raspberry jam flavors finished with acidity that stings the palate, like vinegar.
title: Sunstone 2007 Syrah Rosé (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: A subtle, pretty nose of vanilla, cherry and strawberry is backed up by bigger flavors of sour cherry, spice and vanilla. Fun and exuberant but not terribly delicate. A good match with meats and poultry.
title: Red Tail Ridge 2008 Dry Rosé (Finger Lakes)

description: Bright pink in color, this is a soft, ripe and fruity wine. It has a light texture that supports the raspberry flavors. A delicate cut of acidity comes through at the end. Drink now.
title: Pelvillain Frères 2014 Zee Original Rosé (Côtes du Lot)

description: This wine is bone dry, very crisp and fruity. It presents a bright and lively character plus orange peel tang. The acidity at the end is very fresh, with just a touch of caramel.
title: Château de l'Aubrade 2014 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: A bold pink color suggests the richness of this vanilla-flavored wine that misses out on a truly refreshing character. It is full and soft, with a touch of bitter acidity at the end.
title: Château des Antonins 2014 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This caramel-flavored, lightly pink wine is soft and full in the mouth, with a light touch of tannin in the background. Drink now.
title: Château Maison Noble 2014 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Deep pink in color, this gently fruity wine has too much caramel flavor. It offers red currant fruit at the end and attractive acidity.
title: Château Ramage la Batisse 2014 La Rosée de Ramage Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This is a soft wine, fruity without great definition. A ripe, red fruit character contrasts with a bitter acidity. It is ready to drink. The blend is 50/50 Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon.
title: Château Taussin 2014 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This wine is rich while also crisp. Refreshing red fruits are laced with a touch of orange peel and spice. A blend of the local Nieullucciu and Sciaccarellu, it is fruity and very ready to drink.
title: Domaine Vico 2015 Rosé (Corse)

description: Pale peach in color, this wine offers pleasing aromas of watermelon and strawberry. It drinks just a hair off dry, with a light spritz that perks up the interest.
title: Anew 2015 Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Made from 50% Syrah and 50% Mourvèdre, this rosé offers direct notes of red cherry, currant and raspberry on the nose and mouth. Hints of savory herbs and underbrush add depth to the palate, finishing short and slightly bitter. Drink up.
title: Domaine Cazes 2014 Le Canon du Marechal Rosé (Côtes Catalanes)

description: Orange pink in color, this is a fat wine. It has acidity and red berry fruits although they are surrounded by a plump texture. It is ready to drink.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2014 Bridão Classico Rosé (Tejo)

description: This is a fresh but also full and rich wine with ripe pear and raspberry fruits. The wine is balanced and ready to drink.
title: Château Fonfroide 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This attractive sunset-pink colored wine has light acidity along with its rich, structured fruit. This is as serious as rosé gets, with red plum and berry fruits supported by a concentrated texture and acidity. It could age, so drink towards the end of 2015.
title: Mas de Cadenet 2014 Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: Refreshingly mineral, yet deeply concentrated in red fruit, this wine is a standout amidst a growing contingent of quality New York rosé. It's revitalizing in acidity and nuanced, showcasing hints of bramble against a backdrop of deep cherry and berry flavors. Dry, elegant and quaffable, it's an ideal summer staple.
title: Kelby James Russell 2014 Nutt Road Vineyard Dry Rosé (Finger Lakes)

description: Crisp and fresh, a well-balanced wine that shows vivid fruit, acidity as well as weight. The crispness at the end gives a delicious final burst.
title: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez 2009 La Cave de Saint-Roch-les-Vignes Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
winery: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez

description: Bright and perfumed while also rich, this is a full-bodied wine. It has spice and pepper that come from its alcohol although everything is kept fresh by the red-currant fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Château d'Azur 2015 Jardin du Soleil Cuvée Prestige Rosé (Bandol)

description: The Mourvèdre in this ripe wine lends a wonderful spice and herbal character. While the wine is full and rich, it also has a fine refreshing line of raspberry fruit. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Château d'Azur 2015 Tradition Rosé (Bandol)

description: This pale peach, lightly bricked wine brings aromas of strawberry and melon rind. It drinks dry with a broad feel and fruit flavors that linger.
title: Fielding Hills 2015 Estate Riverbend Vineyard Cabernet Franc Rosé (Wahluke Slope)

description: Blended from 70% Syrah, 18% Mourvèdre and 12% Grenache, this concentrated refresher offers light, crisp waves of vanilla-cherry, grapefruit and orange. It will remain restrained in the glass if not revelatory in ripe fruit.
title: Lasseter 2015 Enjoué Estate Grown Rosé (Sonoma Valley)

description: Produced close to the sea at Bandol, this wine has a good proportion (20%) of Mourvèdre in the blend. That adds to the richness and brings out a fine aromatic floral character. Wild strawberries flavors give a rich ready-to-drink aftertaste.
title: Le Charmel 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a refreshingly fruity wine with a fine balance between acidity and ripe red-currant and raspberry fruits. The wine is crisp, clean and full of fruitiness with a bright fresh aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Estandon 2016 Lumière de Provence Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: This is a pale-colored wine—lightly fruity and with a crisp clean texture. It is balanced with acidity and orange-zest flavor, giving the wine a refreshing lift at the end. This is an apéritif style, ready to drink now.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2016 Les Jolies Flles Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A perfect balance of watermelon and strawberry fruit flavors introduce this lovely rosé. It's bone dry and as perfect a companion to your holiday turkey as your mid-summer picnic.
title: Dusted Valley 2009 Ramblin' Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: With 45% Mourvèdre and 35% Cinsault this has turned into a highly flavored and aromatic wine. It has great fruits and a rich texture that has a herbal edge. It is certainly a food rosé and with its up-front fruit, it could do with a few months to calm down. Drink from late 2017.
title: Les Vignobles Gueissard 2016 Cuvée G Rosé (Bandol)

description: With a high proportion of the local Rolle grape in the blend, this is a lightly perfumed wine with a strong herbal element. It is a ripe finely structured wine, with great acidity and orange flavors. A style of wine that will be better for a few more months, it should be drunk from late 2017.
title: Bernard Magrez 2016 Château des Muraires Séduction Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is the latest wine from the same producer as the popular Whispering Angel rosé. It has a wonderful herbal character that lifts the bright red-currant fruit. Acidity and fruit are allied with the mineral texture to create a wine that will be just right for food.
title: Château d'Esclans 2016 Rock Angel Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: An eclectic range of grapes including Tibouren and Rolle go into this harmonious wine. The Provence cru classé estate has made a rich wine, full with red fruits as well as intense acidity and a tight structure. The wine is ready to drink, although it will be better from 2018.
title: Château du Galoupet 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Organically grown grapes from one of the top Provence estates have produced this light grey-pink colored wine. It is a delicious fruity confection of bright red berries and tangy acidity. There is an attractive touch of minerality to give the wine structure. Drink now.
title: Château Gassier 2016 Le Pas du Moine Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: This is a beautifully structured ripe wine that is full of dense red fruits and tightly wrought acidity. Crisply textured raspberry flavors dominate. This is a rich wine that can be kept for a few months. Drink at the end of 2017.
title: Château la Mascaronne 2016 Quat'Saisons Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is the ripest wine in the Béatrice range. With generous red fruits and balanced acidity it has weight and richness alongside the crisp, tangy fruitiness. This is a textured wine with spice and pepper flavors to add complexity to the fruit. Drink the wine from late 2017.
title: Château Sainte-Béatrice 2016 Cuvée Vaussière Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Located at the base of the Sainte-Victoire mountain, this vineyard, owned by the Dragon family for four generations, has produced a ripe wine, full-bodied and with concentration. It has raspberry flavors and a touch of spice that gives the wine extra richness. Drink this dense wine from late 2017.
title: Domaine Dragon 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: This is a strongly flavored blush, packing a punch of raspberry, fig, sweet tea and rose flavors. It's dry and very crisp in acidity. Give it a chill and enjoy with salted, smoked meats, or a nice fish stew.
title: VML 2011 Rosé of Pinot Noir Rosé (Russian River Valley)

description: Apples and strawberry combine easily in this soft, fresh rosé. It's fruity, light, with a slight prickle in the mouth.
title: Aveleda 2010 Casal Garcia Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: Stony aromas of minerally citrus and nectarine are clean and upright. This Garnacha rosé is simple but good in feel, with generic but clean flavors of stone fruits. Bitter, pithy flavors rise up to dominate the finish.
title: Las Rocas de San Alejandro 2013 Rosé (Calatayud)

description: Pink lemonade and cherry pie mesh together into a strong, slightly boozy aroma on this adventurous blend of 30% Petite Sirah, 30% Syrah, 30% Grenache and 10% Tannat from Matt Villard's Petite Sirah-focused project. Cherry and orange juice dominate the palate.
title: MCV 2013 Pink Rosé (Paso Robles)

description: Fresh, light and fruity, it has ripe strawberry flavors, bright acidity and just a touch of caramel. It is full in the mouth, with a rounded feel and a soft texture at the end.
title: Château Tour de Guiet 2013 Rosé de Guiet Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Made from Zinfandel, this wine has dark color and an intensity of weight, but also enough of a high-toned taste of fresh tangerine to remain captivating in the glass, refreshing and substantial.
title: Gracianna 2015 Arozza Rosé (Russian River Valley)

description: Crisp raspberry, red-cherry and blossom notes lend exhilarating freshness to this Cabernet Franc rosé. Dry in style yet concentrated and juicy, it's an irresistible quaffer that you'll want to keep drinking long after the summer's end.
title: Sheldrake Point 2015 Dry Rosé (Finger Lakes)

description: Whispers of cherry blossoms and briar patch add flair to the sweet black-cherry and blackberry flavors. Dry in style, with notes of fresh and dried herbs, it's a perfect pairing for an elegant late-summer barbecue.
title: Channing Daughters 2011 Rosato Cabernet Sauvignon Mudd Vineyard Rosé (North Fork of Long Island)

description: There are notes of wild berry and rustic game that add a shadow of darkness to this refreshing, cherry-laden rosé made from the Italian Refosco grape. It's bone dry and vivacious with acidity.
title: Channing Daughters 2011 Rosato Refosco Home Farm Vineyard Rosé (The Hamptons, Long Island)

description: Named after Madeleine Herbeau, co-owner of the estate, this wine is a balanced, clean and crisp. It has intense red currant acidity allied to warmer strawberry flavors. The aftertaste is packed with bright fruit.
title: Château Barbebelle 2015 Cuvée Madeleine Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: The entry-level wine in the Esclans range, this is as fresh and fruity as possible. Juicy red currant and tangy acidity combine in this delicious blend of Grenache, Cinsault and Syrah. The wine is dry while showing exuberant fruit. It can be drunk either as an apéritif or with food.
title: Château d'Esclans 2015 Whispering Angel Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The estate wine of Sainte Roseline has a pale color and perfumed, lightly herbal fruit. It has structure from the Mourvèdre that also perfumes the riper Grenache and Syrah in the blend. This concentrated wine is destined to go with food.
title: Château Sainte Roseline 2015 Cuvée Lampe de Méduse Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This wine is named “the three brothers” after the owner's siblings. It is a tight, mineral-driven wine, although the citrus and apple fruit flavors are not far behind. With acidity and spice, the wine is rich and ready to drink.
title: Domaine des Aspras 2015 Les Trois Frères Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: From one of the small outliers in the Loire valley, this crisp wine made from Pineau d'Aunis is bright and lively. It has fresh acidity, red currant flavors and a light, tight aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Cave Cooperative du Vendômois 2014 Lieu-dit Cocagne Rosé (Coteaux du Vendômois)

description: Pink in color, a smooth wine, layered in caramel, missing real fruit.
title: Borges 2010 Lello Rosé (Douro)

description: Darker in color than normal rosé, Bordeaux Clairet also has more richness. This wine is concentrated with vanilla and sweet strawberry flavors, although with a lack of freshness. Treat this as a red wine.
title: Château de Parenchère 2010 Rosé (Bordeaux Clairet)

description: Now sourced from the estate vineyard on Red Mountain, this exceptional rosé includes portions of Counoise, Cinsault and Grenache. Though the pale, coppery pink shade suggests a light wine, this is fragrant and full-bodied, with salmonberry and strawberry fruit, light spice and excellent length.
title: Tranche 2013 Blackrock Vineyard Pink Pape Rosé (Yakima Valley)

description: In its tall square bottle, this makes a striking presentation. The wine inside has the same sense of presence, with a ripe, full-bodied structure that's full of red fruits with only light acidity. Fruitiness makes it delicious as an apéritif.
title: Château de Berne 2013 Terres de Berne Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Quat' Saisons, meaning four seasons, suggests that this wine isn't just for summer. It is certainly a food wine with its dry, full-bodied character and ripe caramel and red plum flavors. Lively and fresh at the end, it's ready to drink.
title: Château la Mascaronne 2013 Quat' Saisons Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The heavy bottle indicates the importance attached to this wine by its producer. Structured and full bodied, it bursts with crisp fruits, mineral acidity and a touch of herbaceousness. Keep it until late 2014 to broaden out.
title: Domaine Saint-André de Figuière 2013 Première de Figuière Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A new addition to Boschendal's line-up, The Rose Garden Rosé pays tribute to the estate's iconic grounds and garden. Fresh aromas and flavors of raspberry, strawberry hull, white cherry and melon rind recall sunny days spent outside. Light sweet-spice accents carry through the refreshing finish, ending clean and mouthwatering.
title: Boschendal 2013 The Rose Garden Rosé (Coastal Region)

description: Rich in style, this full-bodied rosé boasts ripe red fruits and a rounded, smooth character. The lift from acidity gives essential freshness at the end.
title: Château de la Galinière 2013 Le Cengle Vieilles Vignes Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Close to Saint-Tropez the vineyards of the Massif des Maures have produced an attractively fruity wine that has an unusual blending including the rare Caladoc grape. Raspberry fruits are right up front, giving a bright, ripe character.
title: Domaine d'Astros 2013 Cuvée Prestige Rosé (Vin de Pays des Maures)

description: Properly light in color, this is crisp, fruity and deliciously fresh. Some weight comes from ripe strawberry fruits as well as touches of vanilla. The acidity at the end brings refreshment.
title: Les Quatre Tours 2013 Classique Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Reminiscent of a good southern French rosé, this blush of Syrah, Grenache, Mourvèdre and Cinsaut is dry, crisp and minerally. It has subtle, complex flavors of rose petals, herb tea, cherry skins, anise, cloves and lavender, and is quite complex, especially considering the price.
title: Robert Hall 2007 Hall Ranch Rosé de Robles Rosé (Paso Robles)

description: This bright wine has red fruits, citrus and a light minerality, finishing crisply. Wait until late 2014 for it to open up.
title: Château les Valentines 2013 Le Caprice de Clémentine Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Warm while also fresh, this rounded wine is full of red fruits, lit up by a touch of spice and freshened with acidity. Clean and crisp, it's just bursting with fruit at the end.
title: Château Montaud 2013 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Strong caramel aromas lead to a wine that is rich, vanilla-flavored with some attractive ripe strawberry flavors. It's soft and full in the mouth, revealing its acidity only at the end.
title: Domaine d'Eole 2013 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Dark in color, this rosé made from Grenache grapes is quite sour and a little off-balance, though the bottle it comes in is very pretty.
title: Duarte Georgetown 2009 Georgetown Divide, Rouge Grenache Rosé (El Dorado)

description: Darker in color than a rosé, this Clairet is fruity with ripe strawberry fruit. But it does seem heavily laced with caramel as well as some tannins and spice.
title: Château de Fontenille 2010 Rosé (Bordeaux Clairet)

description: Muddled notes of ripe berry on the nose come into sharper view on the citrus-focused palate. There is a vestige of tannin and pleasant dryness. Drink soon.
title: Markus Altenburger 2014 Jerry & Barry Für Fruchtige Rosé (Weinland Österreich)

description: This medium-bodied blend features aromas and flavors reminiscent of bubble gum and cantaloupe. It's mainly Grenache and Cinsault, which impart ample weight, balanced by some slightly bitter, pithy notes on the finish.
title: My Essential 2014 French Rosé (Mediterranée)

description: This is an expressive wine and quite powerful for a rosé. There are lovely peach and apple notes upfront while the earthy palate is enlivened by refreshing notes of orange zest. Woodsy notes on the finish suggest this wine is best drunk up before 2011.
title: E. Guigal 2007  Tavel

description: Light berry and sugar cookie aromas kick it off, followed by peach pit and nectarine flavors. For a wine that's basic in composition and a little dilute, it's also fresh and held together by good acidity. Straightforward but solid.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Bodegas Eguren 2007 Reinares Rosé (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: Clean, fresh and simple. Gran Feudo will neither thrill nor disappoint as it delivers adequate citrus, raspberry and rhubarb flavors propelled by choppy, stinging acids. It shows a good attack before breaking up on the finish. A can't-fail rosé for the summer and fall of 2008.
title: Bodegas Julián Chivite 2007 Gran Feudo Rosé (Navarra)

description: An unusual tawny color blends with deep pink in this wine that conveys cinnamon aromas and persimmon flavors. It's certainly an unusual style but has its own appeal.
title: Cornerstone 2014 Rocks! Rosé (California)

description: Very light, crisp, fresh, it has some sweetness that is balanced by the acidity and raspberry fruit. For those who like a really pink color in their rosés, this is perfect. Screwcap.
title: Remy-Pannier 2012  Rosé d'Anjou

description: Crisp and fruity, this is a classic rosé. It shows a lightness that comes from the delicately handled fruits, giving gentle berry flavors, bright acidity and a textured aftertaste.
title: Château l'Afrique 2012 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This attractively crisp wine is full of fruit with just a touch of caramel. Light, bright and very dry, it finishes with intense acidity.
title: Domaine D'en Ségur 2014 Le Rosé (Côtes du Tarn)

description: This deliciously crisp estate-produced wine is full of the freshest strawberry fruits. It dances with its acidity and light touch of spice. From one of the largest private vineyards in France (2,300 acres), the wine is ready to drink.
title: Domaine du Tariquet 2014 Rosé de Pressée Rosé (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: Dusty peach, nectarine and chewing gum aromas are clean and standard. A lively palate shows bright but controlled acidity and citrusy notes. Stone-fruit and red-plum flavors finish mild. Drink this year.
title: El Coto 2014 Rosé (Rioja)

description: Lightly fruity, this all-Pinot Noir rosé just hints at strawberry, but seems overloaded with flavors and scents of pastry crust and vanilla cookie.
title: Winter's Hill 2014 Dry Rosé (Dundee Hills)

description: This is a delightfully light-pink blend of Grenache, Merlot, Sangiovese and Syrah from different pockets of the county. Subtle strawberry, Mandarin orange and nutty flavors play off the moderate acidity and pretty white flower notions.
title: Angels & Cowboys 2016 Rosé (Sonoma County)

description: Off-dry and fruity, this is a bright, lively rosé. It has a soft texture, aromatic from the Grolleau in the blend and with light acidity at the end. Drink now.
title: Barton & Guestier 2013 Passeport  (Rosé d'Anjou)

description: Definitely sweet, this soft, red fruit flavored rosé has enough crispness to stop it being cloying. It is fruity and ready to drink.
title: Sauvion 2013  Rosé d'Anjou

description: This rosé starts with scents of anise, pepper and spice, followed by an earthy array of spice and cranberry and cherry flavors. Exotic but refined, the wine will pair well with aged cheeses and beef.
title: Tsantali 2015 Kanenas Rosé (Greece)

description: This wine is deliciously fruity and crisp, with perfumed red fruit and lively acidity. Bone dry, and full of bright fruitiness, it makes a classic, easy to drink apéritif wine.
title: Casa S.M. de Tourais 2015 São Matias Rosé (Dão)

description: Dominated by the local star grape Mourvèdre, the wine is ripe, spicy and packed with fresh red-currant and strawberry fruit. It has spice, crisp acidity as well as a full rich aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Château d'Azur 2015 Bastide d'Azur Rosé (Var)

description: This good varietal rosé has a little more body and a little more breadth in the mouthfeel than many others, along with mild strawberry and cherry flavors that give it substance.
title: Cline 2016 Ancient Vines Mourvèdre Rosé (Contra Costa County)

description: Soft white cherry and strawberry are hit with a pink floral accent on the nose of this easy, breezy rosé. Lightweight and refreshing, the finish is clean and bright in white berry flavor. Drink now.
title: Les Collines du Bourdic 2016 Éclat de Gris Rosé (Pays d'Oc)

description: This blend of and Syrah is more ripe fruit than freshness. It is rounded and soft with caramel and spice flavors as well as rich strawberries. Drink now.
title: Domaine le Roc 2015 La Saignée Rosé (Fronton)

description: This is a pale, peach-scented rosé, with hints of cherries as well. The blend of 40% Cinsault, 30% Grenache and 30% Syrah lacks the lively acids of some Provençal rosés, but features a pleasant roundness on the palate instead, finishing soft and easy. Imported by Routas USA.
title: Château Routas 2007 Rouvière Rosé (Coteaux Varois)

description: A blend of Grenache and Rolle, this easy-drinking rosé features peach and canteloupe aromas, simple ripe strawberry and grapefruit flavors and a fruit-driven finish.
title: Château d'Esclans 2006 Whispering Angel Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a serious wine with a lighter brighter side. Its wood aging adds spice to the ripe red fruits and brings out the concentration and intensity. It is, in its way, an unexpected side of Provence rosé, emphasizing richness and complexity. But it all comes together: a fine wine that, after a year of aging, is ready to drink.
title: Château d'Esclans 2015 Garrus Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is one of the classics among Provence rosés. Produced from organically grown grapes and coming from an impressive red-wine producing estate east of Aix-en-Provence, the wine is structured and ageworthy with its blend that includes Cabernet Sauvignon. Rich and full of red fruits, the wine should be drunk from late 2017.
title: Château Vignelaure 2016 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Gournier's rosé is a full-bodied, richly textured wine, filled with cherry-berry fruit and accented by hints of crushed stone on both the aromatic nose and lengthy finish. Drink up.
title: Domaine de Gournier 2012 Rosé (Vin de Pays des Cévennes)

description: A good value in rosé, this Tavel is medium bodied yet remains bright and juicy in style. Raspberry and cherry fruit sets the mouth watering, then lingers harmoniously on the finish. Should drink well through at least early summer 2014.
title: Lavau 2012  Tavel

description: This blend of Syrah and Grenache provides a well-made, largely neutral canvas to wash down a wide range of foods. Hints of tangerine and peach add nuance and interest to the wet stone elements that dominate, then finish dry and mouthwatering.
title: Marrenon 2014 Petula Sélection Parcellaire Rosé (Luberon)

description: This attractive wine is so drinkable, fresh and fruity. Its edge of texture gives it more than just simple fruitiness, while acidity adds just the right boost and liveliness. Red currants, tangerines and lemon peel are there to finish.
title: Château de Berne 2014 Terres de Berne Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Pale pink in color, it has a slender body and ample lemon acidity that promise soothing coolness on a hot day. Linear, lemony and very refreshing.
title: Jäger 2013 Zweigelt Rosé (Wachau)

description: This is complex, ripe and full of sweet raspberry fruit. Impressive and dense, it's balanced with acidity and a tense tannic structure.
title: Château Gassier 2011 Cuvée 946 Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: This is a delicate, beautifully-poised wine, so crisp and lively. The ocean-influenced vineyard site helps to keep the wine light. This is what summer rosé is about.
title: Domaines Ott 2011 Clos Mireille Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Elegant, taut and poised, this has enough texture to suggest it needs a few more months of aging. It has a finely wrought character that comes from the mix of zesty acidity and sweet fruit.
title: Château Sainte Marguerite 2011 Grand Réserve Cru Classé Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: With a dominance of Mourvèdre, this is big and rich. It has weight, with intense fruit flavors and a dense texture. Structured and concentrated, this is a food-friendly rosé.
title: Domaine Sorin 2011 Rosé (Bandol)

description: With additions of Syrah and Pinot Noir, this blush wine is full-bodied and a little heavy. It has flavors of raspberries, cherries and tangerines, with a needed bite of acidity, and the finish is sweet.
title: Tolosa 2010 Rosé of Grenache Rosé (Edna Valley)

description: Reddish in color and big on the bouquet, with sweet berry and cherry aromas. The palate is full and fun, with acidity and heavier, sweeter flavors of strawberry, raspberry and sweet plum. Handles its size well. Made from 80% Garnacha and 20% Graciano (for acidity).
title: Ilurce 2010 Rosado Rosé (Rioja)

description: Tart red-berry and savory herb aromas lead the nose of this rosé made from 70% Barbera and 30% Merlot. The palate offers light tannins and red-fruit-skin flavors, ending clean and crisp.
title: Recanati 2011 Rosé (Galilee)

description: This is tan in color, with a flat, murky nose of stone-fruit aromas and chemical harshness. A round, oily textured palate tastes of briny nectarine and pithy bitterness. In many ways, this is like sucking on a peach pit.
title: SignoSeis 2014 The Angel Oak Rosé (Valle de Uco)

description: Bright pink in color, this 100% Touriga Nacional rosé is ripe with caramel and red berry flavors. It misses out on acidity, leaving the wine flat at the end.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2014 Rosé (Tejo)

description: A rusty red color, this hearty rose shows bright red cherry, dark strawberry, sultry plum and clove spice aromas. The palate is quite rich and full-bodied with punchy plum and raspberry flavors. A bit unctuous for a pink wine.
title: Graveyard NV Paso Tombstone Pink Rosé (Paso Robles)

description: Great value comes from this light-hearted wine with crisp fruitiness. A touch of tannin gives some shape, but the wine is above all attractive and bright with flavors of red fruits and citrus. It will make a fine summer apéritif.
title: Château de Brigue 2015 Brigue Provence Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Lightly citrus aromas open this wine that offers tropical fruit as well as red currant. A lively, perfumed wine, it's bright with acidity and has a juicy, aftertaste.
title: Château l'Afrique 2015 Cuvée A Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Produced by the Bunan family whose main estates are in Bandol, this light, simple and fruity blend includes Syrah, Grenache and Cinsault. It is soft and approachable, fruity with strawberry flavors and totally ready to drink.
title: Domaines Bunan 2015 Le Petit Rouvière Rosé (Var)

description: This easy, open wine has ripe red fruits and lively acidity. A warmer, rich core brings out a generous character. It is fruity and soft at the end.
title: Estandon 2015 Lumière de Provence Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: With its classic blend of Grenache, Cinsault and Syrah, this wine is crisp and bright with peach and citrus flavors. The acidity is lively and perfumed with summer blossom. It finishes with fruit and freshness.
title: Vignobles Ravel 2015 Château l'Oasis Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Soft and gently fruity, this has red-currant as well as red-plum flavors lightly cut with acidity. The aftertaste is soft, almost off dry. It is immediately attractive and drinkable.
designation: Alain de la Treille Le Rosé
title: Bougrier 2015 Alain de la Treille Le Rosé Rosé (Vin de France)

description: This wine is soft, gently fruity with light raspberry and red-currant flavors. An attractive zesty lemon character adds to this pale-colored wine.
title: Château de Saint Martin 2015 Cuvée Grand Réserve Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Zucca has made a fragrant and floral Sangiovese Rosato here, dry like cherry jam on toast and a nutty finish. Pair it with tropically seasoned seafood.
title: Zucca 2010 Sangiovese Rosato Rosé (Amador County)

description: Luscious watermelon and berry aromas perfume this buoyantly fruity dry rosé. It's robust in body and amped with concentrated red-cherry flavor but maintains deft balance. Lingering raspberry notes finish brisk and bright.
title: Damiani 2015 Dry Rosé (Finger Lakes)

description: A very pretty shade of pink, this blend of 89% Grenache and 11% Syrah shows crisp nectarine and peach, squeezed lime, fragrant honeydew, jasmine, strawberry ice cream, sweet onion and a green-mint twist on the dynamic nose. The palate is nicely tense, with lime rind leveling the riper peach, strawberry and watermelon flavors.
title: Chronic Cellars 2015 Pink Pedals Rosé (Paso Robles)

description: Picked and vinified expressly for this rosé, the grapes were sourced from the Armada Vineyard. It has a pale, copper-like onion-skin shade, it is aged for a year longer than most rosés, but it has lost none of its freshness. The pretty strawberry note gains complexity and textural interest as it lingers on the palate. Persistent, focused, leesy and long, this elegant rosé looks deceptively light, but offers powerful flavors.
title: Cayuse 2010 Edith Rosé (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

description: This is made from the most widely planted red grape in Vinho Verde, Vinhão. It is soft and juicy with a ripe character and almond and caramel flavors. Drink now.
title: Quinta de Paços 2016 Casa de Paços Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: An attractively crisp wine, this has fragrant acidity and a lively raspberry-fruit character cut with a tight mineral edge. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Yves Leccia 2015 YL Rosé (Ile de Beauté)

description: A rich pink color, this opens with pretty floral aromas of sweet pea and peony that are framed by red cherry and raspberry tones. It's attractive and bright on the palate, with forward red-fruit flavors and delicate sweet-spice accents that unfold on the close. Drink now.
title: Rustenberg 2015 Petit Verdot Rosé (Simonsberg-Stellenbosch)

description: Coming in at just under 13% alcohol, this is a dry, Provence-styled rosé marked by crisp strawberry and citrus flavors. Ending on a refreshing, slightly chalky-mineral note, this would make a fun summer sipper.
title: Robert Oatley 2010 Rosé of Sangiovese Rosé (Mudgee)

description: Composed of 60% Grenache and 40% Syrah, here's a tasty and attractively priced rosé with a gorgeous bouquet of fresh white strawberry, ripe plum and a touch of mango-infused tropical acidity. The palate is like a strawberry creamsicle, with a balanced richness that fosters the impression of decadence. A full and lush but still vibrant rosé.
region_1: Vin de Pays des Côtes Catalanes
title: Cuvée de Peña 2009 Rosé (Vin de Pays des Côtes Catalanes)

description: This is a typical sweet rosé from Anjou. A light and fruity blend of Groslot and Gamay, it is sugary but has attractive acidity to balance the sweet wild-strawberry flavors. Drink now.
title: Sauvion 2015 Loire Valley  (Rosé d'Anjou)

description: Prickly aromas of nettle and cactus include crushed vitamin scents and tropical fruit notes. This feels gritty and dilute. Tart tropical-fruit flavors of lychee, pineapple and lime finish crisp, tangy and angular.
title: Finca Wölffer 2016 Rosé (Mendoza)

description: A blend of 64% Pinot Noir and 36% Chardonnay, this pale rosé is light and slightly searing, with high acidicy and faint notes of strawberry hull and firm peach on the nose and mouth.
title: Graham Beck 2015 Gorgeous Rosé (Western Cape)

description: A crisp and fruity blend of Douro grapes, this is packed with raspberry fruitiness, offering delicious acidity at the end. The wine is dry and ready to drink.
title: Casca Wines 2016 Monte Cascas Colheita Rosé (Douro)

description: Rose gold in color, this rosé smells fresh and inviting, with pleasant underripe strawberry, mango and citrus zest scents. The palate is similarly light-footed, yet ripe tropical fruit tones lend some substance and richness.
title: Domaine la Colombette 2016 Notorious Pink Rosé (Vin de France)

description: Produced from Languedoc grapes by the Château d'Esclans team in Provence, this is an easy, open wine with both red berry richness and delicious acidity Drink now.
title: Sacha Lichine 2016 Single Blend Rosé (Vin de France)

description: Sourced from vineyards on the east coast of Corsica, this attractive, fruity wine is made from 100% Sciaccarellu. Its lively, light and crisp red currant and lemon flavors make it ready to drink.
title: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté 2016 Marestango Rosé (Ile de Beauté)
winery: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté

description: This light, fruity wine is a perfect summer apéritif. With a crisp texture and attractive red fruit, it's lively and refreshing. Drink now.
title: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté 2016 Terra Santa Rosé (Ile de Beauté)
winery: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté

description: Made from 100% Castelâo, the local grape of Setúbal, this wine is attractively fruity, with a crisp texture. Warmer, ripe red-berry fruits contrast with the acidity, leaving a balanced wine that is ready to drink.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Azul Portugal Rosé (Península de Setúbal)

description: This is a pale, light-bodied rosé with aromas and flavors reminiscent of underripe peach and melon. It's clean, dry and even a bit austere on the finish, making it a fine apéritif.
title: La Vieille Ferme 2016 Rosé (Vin de France)

description: This crisp red-currant-flavored wine is packed with acidity. It is tense and juicy with a light brushstroke of vanilla. But it is the intense acidity that sets the tone for this wine. Make this a food—not an apéritif—wine.
title: François Millet 2016 Domaine des Côtes Blanches Rosé (Sancerre)

description: Syrah-like aromas make this an attractive, soft wine. Its red berry fruit and balanced acidity are well in place for warm-weather drinking.
title: Gabriel Meffre 2016 La Châsse Syrah Rosé (Vin de France)

description: Bright, lean and vibrant, this is a medium-bodied rosé with gingery-citrusy notes that could go well with fish or poultry dishes.
title: Hancock & Hancock 2016 Home Vineyard Grenache Rosé (McLaren Vale)

description: This beautifully balanced, flavorful wine combines vivid watermelon and canteloupe flavors with medium body, a rich texture and lingering finish. It has great concentration without being heavy.
title: Lazy Creek 2015 Rosé (Anderson Valley)

description: Pale peach in color, the aromas bring bright notes of passion fruit, guava and strawberry. It drinks dry, but with plenty of kiwi and other tropical-fruit flavors bringing a sense of sweetness. Distinctly fruit forward for a rosé, it delivers a lot of appeal, despite occasionally seeming a bit weighty.
title: The Walls 2016 Cruel Summer Rosé (Columbia Gorge (WA))

description: A blend of 50% Syrah and 50% Grenache, this is an attractive and enticing rosé, with delicate aromas of pressed pink flowers, white raspberry, melon rind and underripe guava. The light-plus body lends a slight opulence to the mouthfeel, with flavors of red raspberry and tangerine that end slightly pithy. Drink now.
title: L'Ostal Cazes 2016 Rosé (Pays d'Oc)

description: This tropical mélange of fruit and blossoms lives up to its equally ebullient packaging. While deft in body, it bounds from the glass with floral perfume and juicy watermelon and cherry flavors. It's zesty and bold yet spry and fresh—an aptly named accompaniment to summer.
title: Wölffer 2016 Summer in a Bottle Rosé (Long Island)

description: Pink grapefruit, Meyer lemon and watermelon candy notes show on the nose of this rosé. There's a burst of vibrant energy to each sip, with lemon, raspberry and cherry syrup flavors. It's lively and fun.
title: Villa San Juliette 2015 Reserve Rosé (Paso Robles)

description: Extra fruity, packed with strawberry and crisp red currants flavors, this is all freshness, richness and clean acidity. It has some weight but this just emphasizes the fruitiness.
title: Gassier 2012 Château Beaulieu Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Lively, crisp wine from an estate founded by the Knights Templar in the 13th century. It is full of delicious red fruits, light acidity and a nervy, mineral aftertaste.
title: Commanderie de la Bargemone 2012 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Soft, dainty scents of pressed sweet pea, white raspberry and cherry dance in the bouquet, while pithy citrus and cherry-skin flavors unfold on the palate. The midpalate shows a touch of roundness, but brisk acidity and a slight bitterness lifts the close. Drink now.
title: Villa des Anges 2014 Old Vines Rosé (Pays d'Oc)

description: Cleanliness is a fleeting quality on this rosé, which smells compromised and artificial. A modest palate feel and dry, hollow, mostly fruitless flavors lead to a bland finish.
title: Sierra Cantabria 2015 Rosé (Rioja)

description: This light-weight, easygoing wine offers subtle notes of red cherry, plum and currant on the nose and mouth. A hint of fresh mint adds a touch of interest to the nose. Drink now.
title: Château de Jonquieres 2015 Cuvée Cersius Rosé (Languedoc)

description: This copper colored rosé is a touch flat, with notes of mushy red berries and melon rind that are hit with a minty accent. The palate is zippy and lifted by ample acidity, though there's a noticeable sweetness to the ripe-fruit flavors.
title: WYSIWYG 2015 Rosé (Pays d'Oc)

description: While this wine is dry, its warm strawberry fruit rounds out its character with a softness. Lemon sherbet acidity gives another touch of almost sweetness. Drink now.
title: Roquevale 2015 Ossa Rosé (Alentejano)

description: This is the finest of the winery's three new rosés, and kudos to them for specializing in blush. The vineyard is in the Green Valley, and the wine shows long hangtime raspberry and cherry fruit, brightened with crisp acidity. It all leads to a dry, spicy finish, and the alcohol is a refreshingly low 13.2% by volume.
designation: Dellinger Vineyard Rosé of Pinot Noir
title: Ousterhout 2012 Dellinger Vineyard Rosé of Pinot Noir Rosé (Russian River Valley)

description: Pricey for a blush wine, but this is an excellent one, among the best rosés of the year. It's fairly dark in color and full-bodied, but very rich in strawberry and spice flavors, and the finish is smooth and dry.
title: Chiarello Family Vineyards 2012 Chiara Rosé of Zinfandel Rosé (Napa Valley)

description: This wine comes from vines south of the Mont Sainte-Victoire and close to the edge of the Aix-en-Provence region. The cool vineyard site helps the wine keep extreme freshness. Plenty of wild strawberry flavors are lifted by acidity and a refreshing citrus edge.
title: Provence Wine Maker 2015 Rose Infinie Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Light and delicate bubblegum aromas are cut by pink lemonade, a touch of honeydew and a peachy ripeness on this blend of 67% Grenache, 22% Picpoul Blanc, 8% Mourvèdre and 3% Syrah. There is lots of minerality on the sip, with rainy slate and wet cement, as well as rounded watermelon, strawberry and bubblegum flavors, all sliced by lime and tangerine zest.
title: Halter Ranch 2015 Rosé (Paso Robles)

description: This rich wine is ripe with red-berry fruits, mango and peach. Full in the mouth, it has a touch of spice from the Mourvèdre in the blend. Crisp and lively, the wine could age until 2018, although it will be best from late 2016.
title: Les Vignobles Gueissard 2015 Cuvée G Rosé (Bandol)

description: This gentle, quaffable wine offers light flavors of strawberry and apple. There's generous acidity, and despite the fairly substantial alcohol, it's modest in its proportions.
title: Van Duzer 2016 Pinot Noir Rosé (Willamette Valley)

description: This field blend of Grenache, Zinfandel, Carignane and Cinsault was fermented in stainless steel and partially aged in neutral oak. Its strawberry and orange flavors combine effortlessly within its light, dry frame.
title: Spicy Vines 2016 Violet Rosé (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Light and almost effervescent in the glass, this popular Grenache-based pink from Doug Margerum offers yeasty, Champagne-like aromas, soft lemon-peel scents and wet slate minerality. The palate's tingling acidity delivers chalky lime and cotton candy flavors, bound together with compelling tension.
title: Margerum 2016 Riviera Rosé (Santa Barbara County)

description: One of the most commonly seen French rosés in the U.S., La Vieille Ferme's 2013 delivers a mouthful of bold red fruit, plenty of weight on the palate and a pleasant but quick finish. Drink up.
title: La Vieille Ferme 2013 Rosé (Ventoux)

description: Red currants dominate this textured rosé that has a mineral element along with its fresh fruit and tight acidity. The aftertaste is brilliant with crispness.
title: Domaine des Terrisses 2014 Terrisses Rosé (Gaillac)

description: The first-ever commercial rosé from this producer is dull in color, with briny, pepper aromas. The palate on this Syrah-based wine is chunky and generic in feel, while salty flavors of apple skins and citrus finish salty.
title: Casas del Bosque 2014 Reserva Syrah Rosé (Leyda Valley)

description: This crisp, dry rosé is very fresh with delicious acidity. It has a bright character, lively and full of raspberry flavors. Drink now.
title: Château la Colombière 2014 Vinum Rosé (Fronton)

description: A light and fruity wine that is deliciously crisp with raspberry flavors and is nicely cut with acidity. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Brigando Rosé (Lisboa)

description: An attractive rosé, made from 100% Castelão, the local grape of Setúbal peninsula. It is crisp with citrus and ripe with raspberry giving a fine balance and refreshing character. Drink now.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Pegos Claros Rosé (Palmela)

description: This orange-colored rosado offers aromas of peach flesh, peach pit and sea shell. Dry, pithy, mildly bitter flavors of citrus and stone fruits end pithy. Contains 25% white Viura.
title: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2015 Rioja Bordón Rosé (Rioja)

description: Named for the proprietor/winemaker's favorite two roses, the flowers not the wine, this is indeed a wholly floral experience, subtle and delicately crafted to exude wild strawberry, orange and lime. Dry and refreshingly crisp in acidity, it's a light take on beautiful complexity.
title: Tres Sabores 2016 Ingrid and Julia Rosé (Napa Valley)

description: Onesta is Jillian Johnson's debut of her own wines; she previously made Cinsault-based reds and rosés for the Phoenix Ranch brand. She is not new, however, to the indelible Bechthold Vineyard and its ancient Cinsault grapes, and her passion and expertise with the site shows gorgeously here. Orange-pink in hue, this beauty shares notes of crushed strawberry that are perfectly in balance with its dry, elegant point-of-view. Sip this one all night long, with food or without.
title: Onesta 2012 Bechthold Vineyard Rosé (Lodi)

description: This producer has a number of estates in Sancerre. This estate, bearing his own name, has produced a delicate, crisp and fruity wine. Its acidity and tight texture make this wine really food friendly.
title: Jérôme Gueneau 2016 Domaine J. Gueneau Rosé (Sancerre)

description: Light, bright and packed with crisp fruit, this is a refreshing wine. Produced from Pinot Noir, it has red-cherry flavors along with a mineral texture and bright fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Joseph Mellot 2016 Le Rabault Rosé (Sancerre)

description: The ripe, spicy strawberry and orange fruitiness of this wine is immediately attractive. It has lively acidity within a rich framework. Drink this refreshing wine now.
title: Herdade da Malhadinha Nova 2016 Monte da Peceguina Rosé (Alentejano)

description: Selected from a portion of the family vineyard, this soft wine, named after the owner of the estate, is gently ripe but with the potential to bring out even more fruitiness. The aftertaste is crisp and ripe.
title: Château Hermitage Saint-Martin 2016 Enzo Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: It's an evocative name and that's what Provence rosé is about. The wine works well to fulfill that dream with its bright fruit and easy quaffable character. It has just a touch of spice to add an edge to the bright fruits. Drink now.
title: Château Sainte-Béatrice 2016 Summer Dreams Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This 100% Mourvèdre rosé is rusty pink in color and offers inviting red plum and poached strawberry notes. There is a dollop of yeasty acidity on the palate and an iron earthiness that complements its plum and strawberry fruit.
title: Derby 2015 Derby VIneyard Rosé (Paso Robles)

description: The name is a reference to the youngest member of the family, obviously a lively kid. The wine is pretty lively as well with plenty of bright acidity, crisp red fruits and just a touch of caramel. Drink now.
title: Domaine des Diables 2016 Le Petit Diable Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: With lees aging to give extra richness, the wine is fruity with a fine mineral texture. Apricot and raspberry fruits are right up front along with the intense acidity. Drink this attractive ripe wine now.
title: Vignobles de Saint-Tropez 2016 La Bravade Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Open and ripe, the wine has red fruits and warm tannins. Caramel and vanilla flavors lend a richness to the wine.
title: Mas Sainte Berthe 2012 Passe-Rose Rosé (Les Baux de Provence)

description: Made principally from Touriga Nacional, this is a rich wine with attractive acidity and strawberry fruitiness. It is ripe, touched with caramel and finished with wild raspberry flavors.
title: Quinta de Covela 2013 Covela Rosé (Minho)

description: Aromas of grape skins and raspberry are mild. This rosé of Tannat feels chunky, with mild acidity. Salty saucy berry flavors finish with a grabby, rubbery feel and very little to no residual flavor.
title: Artesana 2016 Tannat Rosé (Canelones)

description: There are some pleasant gamy tones to the plum and cherry fruit on the nose of this wine, with decadent touches of white chocolate and peach pit. Zippy acidity picks up the palate, finishing fresh and easy.
title: Gayda 2016 Flying Solo Grenache Cinsault Rosé (Pays d'Oc)

description: This 100% Pinot Noir rosé, produced in the northern Burgundy village of Saint-Bris, is packed with fruit. It shows a light touch of red cherry fruit and plenty of bright acidity. Along with the citrus aftertaste, this is a refreshing apéritif wine.
title: Robert Goulley 2016  Bourgogne

description: A darker shade of blood orange in the glass, this bottling of Cabernet Sauvignon shows cranberry and orange on the nose. It's quite flat on the sip, with sour orange, strawberry and plum notes, and that makes it seem more like an afterthought than a focused rosé, which is such a competitive category now.
title: Asuncion Ridge 2016 Rosé (San Luis Obispo County)

description: With an attractive pink color and soft acidity, the wine is fruity with red berry flavors and a soft, caramel texture. It's ready to drink while it is still so fresh.
title: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2013 Le Rosé de Mouton Cadet Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: A full and ripe rosé from the Sumeire family which owns a number of Provence estates. This wine has freshness along with its rich character, strawberry fruit and acidity well in balance.
title: Château la Tour de l'Evêque 2012 Pétale de Rosé Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is on the soft side for rosés, a warm wine with a sense of Mediterranean herbs and sun. It has light red fruits, spice and great final acidity.  Screwcap.
title: Estandon 2012 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Made at Provence classed growth Château Rimauresq, this soft and full rosé has attractive red and citrus fruits, a hint of pepper and herbs. It's warm and ready to drink.
title: Xavier Flouret 2012 Nationale 7 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This Tuscan rosé made using Sangiovese grapes opens with a pink-purplish color and bright aromas of rose, cranberry and wild forest berry. There's a pretty touch of bitter almond on the close.
title: Salcheto 2009 Rosé (Toscana)

description: Fresh and forward flavors mix rhubarb, ripe strawberries and sweet Bing cherries. This vibrant wine finishes with a refreshing snap of acidity, making it a pleasure to drink.
title: Ponzi 2015 Pinot Noir Rosé (Willamette Valley)

description: Slightly herbal in character—not surprising given that it's 70% Cabernet Franc, an unusual variety for the Gard. Those leafy notes persist from start to finish, balanced out hints of peach and raspberry. Easy to drink.
title: Domaine des Cantarelles 2010 Rosé de Fayel Rosé (Vin de Pays du Gard)

description: The palest salmon pink color, this refreshing rosé is fresh, with red berry fruits mingling with the acidity. A perfect apéritif style.
designation: L'Esprit de Sainte Marguerite Cru Classé
title: Château Sainte Marguerite 2010 L'Esprit de Sainte Marguerite Cru Classé Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This wine is pale pink in color, with aromas suggesting herbs, cherry and red apple. It drinks off dry and is an easy-drinking porch pounder.
title: Original House Wine 2016 Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: A pale pink color, this starts with dainty, delicate aromas of white cherry and strawberry hull. The palate is similarly light in intensity, with a clean, mouthwatering finish that's immensely refreshing. Drink now.
title: Gérard Bertrand 2016 Gris Blanc Rosé (Pays d'Oc)

description: This estate wine has rich fruits that are totally balanced with the acidity and the ripe red fruit flavors. A crisp texture offers acidity and a full body. It will be even better by the end of 2014.
title: Mas de Cadenet 2013 Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: Wölffer's dusty pink Grandioso has a saline minerality on the nose, accenting whiffs of raspberry and peach. As with the producer's standard-bottle rosé, the palate is crisp with acidity, but more intensely concentrated with juicy white peach and yellow cherry flavors. The elegant finish carries a touch of cherry blossom perfume.
title: Wölffer 2013 Grandioso Rosé (Long Island)

description: One of the two luxury wines from Château d'Esclans, Les Clans is rich, wood-aged and full of ripe and rounded fruit flavors. With the extra year of aging, it has lost some initial freshness but has gained complexity and structure. The wine is full-bodied while remaining very stylish. Drink now.
title: Château d'Esclans 2012 Les Clans Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The wine feels rich, dense and packed with ripe fruitiness. Delicious, refreshing acidity gives these red fruits a lift and crispness. This is a serious wine, demanding food.
title: Château Sainte Roseline 2013 Le Cloître de Sainte Roseline Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Made from a blend of 62% Grenache and 38% Syrah, this is a classically dry, refreshingly crisp rosé, pink-salmon in color that's intense yet soft, crafted in a Provence style. The grapes come from Rutherford, Atlas Peak and Sonoma County's Kick Ranch, tasting of fresh raspberry and spring flowers, a bite of wet stone on the finish.
title: Kale 2013 Rosé (Napa Valley)

description: Rosé Chiaretto Pergola (made mostly with Groppello grapes) opens with a vinous note of fresh grapes and raspberry followed by almond skin and white mushroom. It's an easy, no-fuss wine with a zesty, acidic finish.
title: Civielle - Cantina della Valtenesi e della Lugana 2010 Chiaretto Pergola  (Garda Classico)
winery: Civielle - Cantina della Valtenesi e della Lugana

description: This is ripe, full in the mouth and rich. It has intense strawberry fruits, a touch of sweetness and fragrant, fresh acidity. It's a wine to drink now.
title: Château Vincens 2012 Rosé (Côtes du Lot)

description: This medium-weight rosé offers rich aromas and flavors of honeydew, hard strawberry and cherry, with additional hints of yellow flowers and garrigue herbs on the nose. Ample acidity keeps the palate fresh and lifted, finishing somewhat prickly and mouthwatering.
title: Domaine Montrose 2014 La Balade Rosé (Côtes de Thongue)

description: A blend of 66% Syrah and 34% Caladoc, this pale blush-colored rosé has a nose of peach, grapefruit and freesia that lead to flavors of strawberry, tart cherry, almond blossom and nutmeg. There's a pleasing balance of creaminess and acidity.
title: Ixsir 2014 Altitudes Rosé (Lebanon)

description: The 18th-century estate that was once painted by Cézanne has produced a ripe, full-bodied wine. It is rounded and rich, full of red berries and some tannins. Age this wine and drink, with food, from early 2016.
title: Château de Pourcieux 2014 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Fresh fruit and lively raspberry juice flavors are totally up to the minute. The attractive orange-pink color emphasizes the ripe character of the wine's fruitiness.
title: Château Saint-Pierre 2014 Tradition Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: There is great texture in this wine. It is structured, tannic with a strong pepper bite balanced by acidity. Citrus fruit shows through with fresh acidity and a tangy aftertaste.
title: Château Thuerry 2014 Le Château Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Fresh strawberry and zesty lemon, redoubled on the taut, light palate, give this the ultimate refreshment factor. Oodles of fruit makes this go down far too easily. It's a true summer wine. Drink soon.
title: Pratsch 2014 Rosé (Niederösterreich)

description: Soft and rounded, this is a light and easy wine. It has fresh citrus and berry fruits that dance easily together. Acidity gives a refreshing quality, while spice adds a fine, warmer touch.
title: Château des Demoiselles 2012 Charme des Demoiselles Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The prestige cuvée from La Gordonne is full and rich, packed with raspberry and red plum fruit. As a balance, there is a taut, crisper side to the wine, leaving a bright lemon zest aftertaste.
title: Château la Gordonne 2011 La Chapelle Gordonne Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Front-loaded with cherries, watermelons and pomegranates, with hints of violets, vanilla and spices, this is one of the richer, more full-bodied blush wines out there. Great picnic or beach wine.
designation: Heritage Tree Vineyard Estate Rosé of Syrah
title: Gustafson Family 2012 Heritage Tree Vineyard Estate Rosé of Syrah Rosé (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Finished dry, this combines elements of orange peel and citrus in a simple refreshing style.
title: Catman 2016 Pinot Noir Rosé (Chehalem Mountains)

description: This is a rounded smooth wine. It does have a crisp edge of red currants and acidity but the main flavor comes from the ripe red-berry fruits and touch of caramel. Drink the wine now.
designation: Herdade de São Miguel Colheita Seleccionada
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2016 Herdade de São Miguel Colheita Seleccionada Rosé (Alentejano)

description: This is a soft wine with attractive ripe strawberry fruits and a soft texture. There is balancing acidity giving an edge of freshness to the otherwise gentle fruity texture.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Portuga Rosé (Lisboa)

description: This blend of Touriga Nacional with Merlot is perfumed and light. It has a salmon pink color, layers of citrus as well as red-currant fruit and a soft texture. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2015 Vinho Selection Rosé (Tejo)

description: Tangy and somewhat austere on the nose, this wine is made from a majority of Cabernet Sauvignon, softened by Pinot Noir, Sangiovese and Zinfandel. Floral in rose petals, the flavors lean toward strawberry, cranberry and orange, the wine refreshing and substantial.
title: Rose & Thistle 2015 Rosé (Napa Valley)

description: Dry to slightly off-dry and wonderfully crisp in acidity, this rosé has spicy cherry, herb and vanilla flavors, with no oak influences at all.
title: Quivira 2007 Wine Creek Ranch Grenache Rosé (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Following the latest Provence fashion in having a glass-stoppered bottle, this wine is the top of the range for this producer. It is soft and ripe to start but deliciously balanced and crisp at the end. Named after Madeleine or Mado, an imaginary Provencal lady, the wine is ready to drink.
title: Les Vins Bréban 2016 Mado en Provence Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: It's the play on roses (the flowers) on the label that makes this bottle seem bright and fun. The wine itself is light and fruity with ripe flavors from the lees aging. There is spice, plenty of acidity and a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Provence Wine Maker 2016 Infinie Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The blend, dominated by Grenache, produces a ripe wine. It is softly textured, full of red berries and the typical edge of pepper from the Grenache. There is a juicy spicy aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Château Barbeiranne 2016 Tradition Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Pale in color, this is a fruity slightly herbal wine. It has plenty of young fruit and crisp acidity, lively and with an attractively spicy aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Château Coussin 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: In the same family since the 18th century, this estate has produced a soft, smooth and rounded wine. It has weight while the red fruits are ripe and full in the mouth. It does miss some crispness, although with its forward fruitiness it is generous and ready to drink.
title: Château de Pourcieux 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The wine, that has been a major player in the success of Provence rosé, epitomizes the style. Fresh with red currants and red berries, it is lively and intensely fruity with just a hint of herbs at the end. This is an immediately drinkable wine, just ready for the summer.
title: Château d'Esclans 2016 Whispering Angel Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is the entry-level wine from this estate situated in the small area of Coteaux Varois. It is a really fruity blend of Grenache and Cinsault. Bright red fruits and crisp acidity give a dry wine with great fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Château d'Ollières 2016 Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: This is a full-bodied, ripe wine from one of the top Provence estates. It is rich with red-berry fruits and has been given a crisp touch from the tangy peppered acidity. The spirit (Esprit) of Gassier is obviously in good health.
title: Château Gassier 2016 Esprit Gassier Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A commanderie was a castle erected by the Knights Templar in the Middle Ages. The vineyard based around this fortress has produced a soft rounded wine that has great balance between fruit and acidity. It is stylish wine, light while having plenty of red fruits. Drink now.
title: Chateau Peyrassol 2016 Commanderie de Peyrassol Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A ripe rosé, full of rich strawberry fruits and balanced acidity. It is full bodied with just the right amount of crispness and intensity to give the wine weight and concentration. This will be a fine apéritif wine.
title: Château Roubine 2016 R de Roubine Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Supple pink papaya, underripe tangerine and bubblegum scents make for an intriguing combination on the nose of this bottling. The palate is tightly woven and full of citrus-driven acidity, with waves of light red fruit that ripple through the midpalate.
title: Demetria 2016 Rosé (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: The palest pink grey in color, it is ripe and caramel flavored. Sweet red fruits give a soft texture, full-bodied and rounded. The aftertaste is all fruit.
title: Château de Berne 2013 Romance Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Light and pretty with watermelon and faint strawberry notes, Frisk is just slightly fizzy. Its aromas almost trick one into expecting a wine that's sweet, but it finishes dry and is in balance. Made from Grenache grapes, it's a likable, refreshing drink ready for the picnic basket or patio.
title: Frisk 2011 Prickly Rosé (Lodi)

description: Dark pink and hearty, this is made from 100% Cabernet Sauvignon grapes that spent six months fermenting in stainless steel. Balanced, it offers some heft on the midpalate before finishing crisp and bedazzled in cranberry and citrus.
title: Envy 2013 Pink Passion Cabernet Rosé (Napa Valley)

description: This is a full-bodied rosé, with rich fruit and spice notes. Its ripe apricot and strawberry flavors are lifted by balanced acidity. Drink now.
title: La Bastide Blanche 2012 Rosé (Bandol)

description: The fact that there is 60% Cabernet Franc in this blend gives the wine a real perfumed attractiveness. It is fruity and light, with a crisp lively character. Red berries and plenty of acidity leave a fresh aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Château Landereau 2015 La Vie en Rose Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This is a rather big and rich wine that has a deep orange-pink color, along with quite a bit of body and red-fruit flavors. The mouthfeel is smooth, as plum and melon flavors meet soft acidity. It's more like a red wine than most of today's rosés, but is a pleasure to drink.
title: Bliss 2016 Estate Bottled Rosé (Mendocino)

description: A very light shade of pink, this blend of 49% Grenache, 19% Grenache Blanc, 13% Mourvèdre, 12% Carignane, 4% Cinsaut and 3% Roussanne offers wet river stones, strawberry, peach and pluot on the nose. The palate is quite subtle, with nectarine, brioche and airy watermelon flavors. Altogether it's very clean and fresh.
title: Bonny Doon 2016 Vin Gris de Cigare Rosé (Central Coast)

description: How can you not fall in love with this wine? It's crafted from vines specifically planted and tended for rosé, an interesting blend of Grenache, Syrah, Mourvèdre, Counoise and Grenache Blanc. Sexy, spicy and rich, it's packed with strawberry and cherry fruit backed with crisp and refreshing acidity.
title: Quady North 2014 Rosé (Rogue Valley)

description: Cool tones of slate and stone accent delicate sour cherry and raspberry flavors in this sprightly dry rosé. Zippy and thirst quenching, yet firmly anchored in minerality, it's an elegant rosé for year-round enjoyment. Drink now.
title: Wittmann 2014 Trocken Rosé (Rheinhessen)

description: Produced from the organic vineyards of Les Baux, this wine is pale in color but full of fruity flavor. The blend is Grenache (50%), Cinsault (30%) and Syrah (20%). It has a crisp, mineral texture that's tangy and fragrant with white flowers and red currants, giving it delicious apéritif style.
title: Domaine de la Vallongue 2014 Garrigues Rosé (Les Baux de Provence)

description: A drop of cherry blossom perfume mingles with strawberry and cherry flavors in this elegant, light-footed rosé. Dry in style, it's vivacious and crisp, finishing surprisingly long on a puckering cranberry note.
title: Lieb 2014 Bridge Lane Rosé (New York)

description: Light, fresh and fruity, this is a lime and lemon flavored wine. It has a tangy, textured character that blends easily with the acidity. From a blend led by Grenache and Cinsault, it's a lively wine that will be a great apéritif.
title: Domaine Val d'Astier 2014 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is so pale in color, it's almost a white wine in looks and in flavor. It has crisp white fruits with the merest touch of raspberry, backed by minerality and finishing with delicious juicy acidity.
title: Bernard Magrez 2014 Château des Muraires Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Cut with sulfur, this is a wine whose bitterness hides the potential of the strawberry fruits and acidity. Off-dry, it's unbalanced.
title: Bougrier 2013  Rosé d'Anjou

description: A rosé of Sangiovese, Montepulciano and Syrah, this has flavors of herb and raspberry, which are etched with nervy acids.
title: Raffaldini 2012 Girasole Rosé (Swan Creek)

description: A Grenache-based rosé, this features broad aromas of tart red fruits and an edgy, medium-bodied palate.
title: Jones von Drehle 2012 Rosa Dia Estate Rosé (Yadkin Valley)

description: This is a soft and fruity wine, ripe with red-berry fruits and perfumed acidity. A light touch of caramel and tannin give the right structure, and the aftertaste is bright and fruity.
title: Le Cercle des Vignerons Saint-Louis 2014 Lumière de Provence Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: Light pink in the glass with soft aromas and flavors of strawberry and blueberry. Delicate and refreshing; a great choice for hot summer days.
title: Mas Belles Eaux 2008 Rosé (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Petrol aromas lead to a wine that has ripe fruits balanced by intense acidity and delicious freshness. The palate is marked with flavors of almonds and red fruits with a crisp, bright aftertaste.
title: Domaine de la Vallongue 2012 La Garrigues Rosé (Les Baux de Provence)

description: This pale salmon rosé is fresh and clean. It opens with bright aromas of strawberry hull, watermelon rind and citrus peel that carry through to the linear yet vibrant palate. The palate boasts excellent verve and refreshment, making this a perfect choice for warm-weather enjoyment. Drink now.
title: Gérard Bertrand 2014 Gris Blanc Rosé (Pays d'Oc)

description: Basic aromas are low on fruit. This has a cutting, citric feel that's centered around juicy acidity. Sour grapefruit and tangerine flavors end with lasting citric acidity.
title: Finca El Origen 2016 Estate Malbec Rosé (Uco Valley)

description: The producer is following the Provence fashion and packaging its range of Pure Loire in square bottles. This rosé is dry with red fruit and spice from the Cabernet Franc in the blend. Tangy and crisp, it is ready to drink,
title: Bougrier 2015 Pure Loire  (Rosé de Loire)

description: This is fairly hard and fiery on the nose. The palate is tough and the wine smacks around rather than flows easily. With only modest acidity, it's not that lively.
title: Vinicola Fraternidad 2012 Impetu Rosé (Valle de Guadalupe)

description: This is a vibrantly rich wine that is brimming with delicious red fruit notes and bright acidity. Full and concentrated, it has weight without being heavy. It is a finely made wine, with a crisp finish.
title: Château Vignelaure 2011 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: The wine is textured and tight with crisp acidity as well as red-currant flavors. It's a bone-dry wine, very dry and lively and with a strongly mineral aftertaste. Drink this refreshing wine with food.
title: Domaine Michel Thomas et Fils 2015 Rosé (Sancerre)

description: Crisp, bright and delicious, this has pure red fruit, with an herb note, intense acidity and a tangy texture.
title: Château Coussin 2011 Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: Lemon peel, brioche and raspberry aromas take the lead on this pale pink wine. It drinks quite sweet for a brut but still delivers enjoyment with its raspberry flavors.
title: 14 Hands NV Brut Methode Champenoise Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Exuberant raspberry and cherry notes scent this dusty pink rosé. While brisk and dry on the palate, it's juicy and mouth-quenching with ripe white peach and red berry flavors. It finishes minerally with lingering salinity.
title: Paumanok 2013 Dry Rosé (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Along with weight and richness, this wine also has a lively fresh, red fruit character. Caramel and ripe berries are shot through with acidity to give a warm, yet bright wine.
title: Château Léoube 2013 Rosé de Léoube Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Obviously a wine to drink on February 14, this is brightly fruity and crisp while showing some good dense flavors. Red fruits push through the citrus and grapefruit acidity to give a full-bodied, ripe wine.
title: Château les Valentines 2013 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Despite the cutesy name, this is a serious rosé that's sure to please even the most discerning crowd. A blend of Syrah, Grenache, Gamay and Mourvèdre, it's ripe and red fruit-forward with a full weight, lush mouth that's balanced with medium acidity.
title: Goats do Roam Wine Co. 2010 Rosé (Western Cape)

description: A creamy hint of white chocolate adds fullness to the soft currant, cranberry and strawberry hull flavors. The palate is mouthfilling and round with a good citrus lift to the fresh close.
title: A.A. Badenhorst Family Wines 2011 Secateurs Cinsault-Shiraz-Grenache Rosé (Swartland)

description: Ripe raspberry fruit with a vanilla overlay also shows a rich, herbal character, touches of spice and bright final acidity.
title: Château d'Esclans 2009 Les Clans Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A light style with crisp red currant flavors, acidity and a touch of minerality.
title: Domaines Duffort 2010 Château la Moutète Grande Réserve Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The wine's name and label harkens back to the glory days of the French Riviera. To taste, though, it is thoroughly modern with clean crisp fruit and attractive bright red-currant acidity. Pale in color and full of fruit, this is ready to drink.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2016 Retrofollies Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: This smooth wine has a soft and fruity character. It is very open, accessible and with a lightly zesty texture. The wine has a perfumed crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Les Vins Bréban 2016 Domaine de Paris Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This dry rosé takes a serious approach and can be enjoyed in lieu of red. It has a salmon color, plummy and lightly earthy aromas, and red cherry fruit with a hint of meatiness on the palate.
title: 1850 2015 Rosé (Amador County)

description: This is the entry-level wine from this quality estate. It is simple, fruity and ripe with attractive red fruits. Brightly crisp, it is ready to drink.
title: Château des Bormettes 2016 Cuvée Tradition Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Made from 75% Sangiovese, 13% Barbera, 10% Pinot Noir and 2% Syrah, this is a fresh and lively rosé with bright notes of strawberry, raspberry and red cherry. A soft floral accent unfolds on the finish. Drink now.
title: Galil Mountain 2011 Dry Rosé (Galilee)

description: A full, rounded wine, very much a rosé for food. It is bone dry in character, although the berry fruitiness gives the wine an attractive open feel. With its firm texture, it could age a year.
title: Château Beaulieu 2010 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: The wine is ripe and rounded, full of red cherry and raspberry flavors. It has weight and enough richness while not losing its acidity.
title: Château Vignelaure 2010 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: A delicious food rosé, rich and rounded with a good structure and a bite of acidity. Red apple and pink grapefruit complement the sweeter berry fruits. The extra year of aging before release has brought some sophistication.
title: Château d'Esclans 2009 Esclans Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A fruity, strawberry-flavored wine, with crisp acidity to balance the ripe fruit. It's a clean and refreshing rosé, ready to drink now.
title: Château de Cornemps 2012 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This blend of Syrah, Grenache and Cinsault is less obviously fruity than many Provençal rosés, but makes up for that in weight and richness. It's a round, full style, with a layered texture, some dark fruit flavors and a minerally finish.
title: Domaine de la Sauveuse 2007 Cuvée Carolle Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: For a Coteaux de Varois, this shows a good amount of minerality, usually associated with cool appellations. This medium-bodied rosé features hints of red apples, currants and citrus that finish long and stony.
title: Chateau La Calisse 2006 Rosé (Coteaux Varois)

description: A lovely sunset blush color, this is 100% estate-grown Syrah. It was picked and pressed specifically for this rosé—not a saignée style. Soft and smooth, it has generous strawberry fruit and touches lightly on tropical notes as well.
title: Hightower 2013 Murray Rosé (Red Mountain)
