description: An attractive pale rosé color leads to a wine that is made from organically grown grapes. It is fruity with spice and tangerine zest. Red-currant flavors provide acidity and a crisp aftertaste. Drink now
title: Château la Tour de l'Evêque 2016 Vendanges Manuelles Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Named after a parcel of land that obviously appeals to blackbirds (merle in French), this is the entry-level rosé of this estate. It is produced from young vines that gives a simple, fruity character with plenty of acidity and a tangy orange flavor. Drink now.
title: Château Pas du Cerf 2016 Le Merle Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This perfumed, herbal blend of Syrah and Grenache is tight and very crisp. It has intense tangy acidity and a lively fruity aftertaste. This is a bone-dry rosé with a desire for food.
title: Château Roquefeuille 2016 Rosé in the Air Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The Faulkner family makes a ripe broad style of rosé. This has enough crisp fruit to balance the rich red berry flavors. It has a touch of pepper as well as a fine tang of acidity at the end. Drink now.
title: Domaine du Grand Cros 2016 GC L'Esprit de Provence Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a pale-colored wine—lightly fruity and with a crisp clean texture. It is balanced with acidity and orange-zest flavor, giving the wine a refreshing lift at the end. This is an apéritif style, ready to drink now.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2016 Les Jolies Flles Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This Pinot Gris is fermented on the skins, then aged in neutral oak for a year-and-a-half. It's a dusty rose in hue, and its tart rhubarb fruit is speckled with peppery spice. The time on skins seems to have amped up the tannins past optimal balance. This is a one-of-a-kind style of Pinot Gris.
title: Vista Hills 2014 Pinot Gris Rosé (Willamette Valley)

description: This unspecified rosé blend of Pinot Noir and Pinot Gris offers bold cherry and cantaloupe aromas, some confected, bubblegum-like flavors and a clean, short finish.
title: Marisco Vineyards 2016 The Ned Pinot Rosé (Marlborough)

description: A chalky minerality leads the nose of this Minervois rosé, mingling seamlessly with the centered notes of garrigue, crushed carnation, strawberry hull and red cherry. Medium bodied, this boasts a slightly creamy texture that's countered by ample acidity, keeping the palate lifted and the finish bright.
title: Château du Donjon 2014 Rosé (Minervois)

description: This pale rosé is very expressive of its terroir, with beautiful aromas of garrigue herbs and minerality that abound in the bouquet. Additional hints of sweet pea and orange blossom harmonize with the strawberry hull and melon rind fruitiness. Ethereal and dainty, the palate is light and bright, with vibrant acidity and a refreshing finish reminiscent of watermelon rind and orange pith. Drink now.
title: Château Ollieux Romanis 2014 Cuvée Classique Rosé (Corbières)

description: A beautiful pale-pink color, this rosé made from 50% Grenache, 30% Cinsault and 20% Syrah offers a gorgeous mélange of upfront fruit aromas, including red cherry, strawberry, peach and underripe mango. Hints of sweet pea and garrigue mingle with the ripe fruit core on the medium-bodied palate. The lightly creamy mouthfeel is lifted by bright final acidity, finishing snappy and fresh.
title: Gérard Bertrand 2014 Château La Sauvageonne Wild Woman Rosé (Coteaux du Languedoc)

description: Tempranillo could be an interesting variety in South Australia going forward. This rosé features hints of sous bois and cherries on the nose, then adds melon and spice notes on the palate. It's plump in the mouth, then finishes on a dry, silky note.
title: Gemtree 2016 Luna de Fresca Biodynamic Tempranillo Rosé (McLaren Vale)

description: Named for brothers Richard and Don Lorenzi's mom, whose favorite color was pink, this Merlot-based rosé tastes like a grapefruit sprinkled with sugar, light and perfectly drinkable.
title: Lorenzi Estate 2010 Rita's Rosé Merlot Rosé (Temecula Valley)

description: This barely salmon-colored charmer offers citrus freshness in a delicate frame. It makes a light sundowner-sip and ideal apéritif.
title: Pratsch 2013 Rosé (Niederösterreich)

description: This interesting rosé mixes 78% Pinot Noir with 22% Pinot Gris. It's a pale copper with a hint of rose, and the nose carries suggestions of rose petals as well as strawberries. It's tart and medium-bodied, with some citrus snap to the acids.
title: Spindrift Cellars 2013 Pinot Gris & Pinot Noir Rosé (Willamette Valley)

description: This Grenache, Syrah and Mourvèdre rosé is a stunning marriage of flavors and textures. Salmon in color, it invites with apricot, peach and Meyer lemon fruit, zesty acidity underlying its flavor, complexity and length.
title: Quivira 2016 Wine Creek Ranch Rosé (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Medium apricot to the eye, this rosé made from Syrah and Mourvèdre opens with a bouquet of strawberry and peach. Flavors of guava, anise and clove continue on to a spicy finish that may be too cool for some yet will be enjoyed by those who like rosé with a touch of sophistication.
title: Domaine Netofa 2013 Estate Bottled Rosé (Galilee)

description: Made from Negroamaro, this coppery, peach-hued rosé is rather weighty, with flavors that run toward cherries and chocolate. You could serve it with rich seafood dishes, but it can also stand up to grilled beef.
title: Masseria Altemura 2006 Rosato Rosé (Salento)

description: On the rich side, this smooth wine discloses flavors of caramel and toasted almonds as well as fruit. It leaves a sweet feeling, rounded and ripe, finished with a touch of pepper and spice.
title: Château Pigoudet 2013 Insolite Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: While bright and tropical on the nose, the intense ripeness of this dry Cabernet Franc rosé lends a caramelized, almost ruddy richness to the palate. Brisk acidity lends balance and structure.
title: Lamoreaux Landing 2014 Dry Rosé (Finger Lakes)

description: This medium-bodied blend features aromas and flavors reminiscent of bubble gum and cantaloupe. It's mainly Grenache and Cinsault, which impart ample weight, balanced by some slightly bitter, pithy notes on the finish.
title: My Essential 2014 French Rosé (Mediterranée)

description: This wine is fruity and crisp, with attractive balanced acidity. It's all about raspberry and red currants. A refreshing character gives citrus tang to the aftertaste.
title: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2014 Le Rosé de Mouton Cadet Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This is an attractive pale-pink wine, faintly coppery in hue. It's also a bit confected, with candied strawberry and watermelon flavors reminiscent of bubble gum, but backed by white chocolate and briny notes. It's plump on the palate, then falls off rapidly on the finish.
title: Château d'Or et de Gueules 2014 Les Cimels Rosé (Costières de Nîmes)

description: This is a well-rounded rosé that is bound to disappear quickly from the table, with aromas of strawberry, bubble gum and peach riding a rainy-day springtime freshness on the nose. The palate explodes with acidity and textural grip, carrying both ripeness to satisfy New World fans and the deft tactile experience of Old World selections.
title: ONX 2016 Indie Rosé (Paso Robles)

description: With the typical blend of a Côtes de Provence rosé, this is pale in color and light at heart. Made by the well-known Châteauneuf-du-Pape producer, it has some weight as well as ripe red fruits. A touch of tannin in the structure gives it an attractive tension as well as a tangy aftertaste.
title: Brotte 2015 Charles Brotte Cuvée Rose Secret Rosé (Vin de France)

description: Owned by the Bordeaux Castel family, this estate has produced a simple, light wine packed with fruit. It's light and bright, with just a hint of earthiness that takes away from the freshness. The aftertaste adds lemon crispness.
title: Château Cavalier 2015 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A pale-colored blend of Grenache, Syrah and Cinsault, this light and fruity wine is made from organic grapes. It is refreshing, bright and immediately accessible with its gentle texture, making it a fine summer apéritif.
title: Château Gairoird 2015 Donum Coeli Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The name is spot-on for a wine with a pink-pearl color. It is gently fruity with soft red fruits and a touch of pepper. The aftertaste is crisp, clean and refreshing.
title: Château Réal Martin 2015 Perle du Rosé Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a pretty, light and balanced wine. It has attractive acidity plus a crisp edge of grapefruit and a typical touch of spice to give it a lift and an edge. The aftertaste continues the attractive, fresh theme.
title: Domaine de Paris 2015 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This appealing blend of Touriga Nacional and Aragonez gives a fresh, crisp red fruited wine. Just the right amount of acidity produces a light, bright aftertaste.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2013 Mariana Rosé (Alentejano)

description: A salmon-colored wine, very fresh, with a full palate that carries flavors of strawberries and red currants. The wine is dry, but with the smooth caramel texture, it seems sweeter and softer.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2007 Touriga Nacional-Raboso Rosé (Ribatejano)

description: A dry rose, the color of onion skins. The Austrians describe the aroma as “sweet tart” because it suggests freshly baked, butter-sweetened pastry crust. It drinks startingly dry and rasping, with citrus flavors and acidity that will make your mouth water.  —S.H.
title: Repolusk 2000 Schilcher Rosé (Austria)

description: Close to the Sainte-Victoire mountain, this estate's vineyards run between 900 and 1,300 feet in elevation. That gives this attractive wine its cool feel. It is fruity while also having a tangy texture and fine acidity. The wine is well in balance and full of fruit.
title: Les Vins Bréban 2016 Domaine la Colombe Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: This ripe rounded red-fruited wine is soft and smooth. With its creamy texture and light acidity it is a fine apéritif style. The name means happy cicada, a common feature of life in Provence. Drink now.
title: Château Carpe Diem 2016 Cigalle Joyeuse Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: From the Cazottes family's estate, this wine is soft, although with just a touch of tannin to give it shape. A typical Gaillac blend of Duras and Braucol, it has plenty of fruit while being bone dry and finished with delicious acidity. Drink now.
title: Domaine des Terrisses 2016 Terrisses Rosé (Gaillac)

description: This is very light in color, with lightweight aromas of peach and citrus. It feels crisp and angular, with fine acidity that creates supreme freshness on the tongue. Flavors of peach and nectarine are spunky, ending like the toot of a whistle.
title: Muga 2011 Rosé (Rioja)

description: An appealing pale salmon color, this blend of 50% Cinsault, 28% Grenache and 22% Syrah displays aromas of strawberry, cherry Jolly Rancher and melon. Reflective of the warmth of the vintage, it's fruitier than recent vintages but it's still hard to put down.
title: Gramercy 2014 Olsen Vineyard Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This crisp and fruity blend is dominated by 80% Cabernet Sauvignon. The wine is bright with intense, refreshing acidity and a lively aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Cheval Quancard 2016 Chai de Bordes Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This dry rosé is 100% Merlot, fermented in stainless steel. It's rather flat in both mouthfeel and flavor, with nondescript one-dimensional red fruit.
title: Eliana 2016 Maiden Rosé (Rogue Valley)

description: This light-bodied wine has a pale pink Provençal color but quite a bit of fruit flavor. It feels soft on the palate and tastes lightly sweet.
title: Black Ink 2015 Rosé (California)

description: This Ducourt wine is tight, with considerable acidity that masks the fruit. Let it calm down for a few months when those red fruits can assert themselves. Drink from late 2017 (think Thanksgiving).
title: Château Larroque 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This is one of the best rosés on the market. With a pretty orange and copper color, the wine is dry, crisp and deeply flavored in fruits, yet feels delicate and subtle. The blend is Mourvèdre, Syrah and Grenache.
title: La Grande Côte 2011 L'Estate Rosé (Paso Robles)

description: With some extra weight, this is a solid, red currant and berry driven wine. Its fruit is right up front, backed by a mineral acidity that cuts through the richness. It's definitely a food wine, and equally an impressive wine that needs to age for up to a year.
title: Domaines Ott 2012 Château Romassan Rosé (Bandol)

description: This gris-de-gris-style wine is a pretty, pale salmon color. Aromas of cherry, watermelon and mineral lead to lightly spritzy, slightly off-dry fruit flavors and a fresh, drawn-out finish.
title: Julia's Dazzle 2014 Rosé (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: Rather dark in mauve colors and slightly cloudy, this wine by urban vintner Matthias Pippig offers rather heady aromas for a rosé, with smashed olallieberry, blackberry and a touch of cardamom spice. Once sipped, aromatic plum flavors ensue, with help from Turkish spices and noticeable grip.
title: Sanguis 2013 Rosé (Central Coast)

description: Crisp and cutting, this exceptionally refreshing dry rosé balances a dainty foot print with concentrated red cherry and raspberry flavors. There's a whisper of savory herb notes throughout but the finish is peachy and bright. An unusual blend of Merlot accented with a mélange of other red and white grapes.
title: Wölffer 2014 Rosé (Long Island)

description: A blend of Touriga Nacional and Syrah, this rosé gives ripe red fruits that are cut with lively acidity. There is a jammy, caramel-flavored backdrop to this wine that makes it heavy rather than fresh. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2014 Terra de Lobos Rosé (Tejo)

description: This wine is crisp in character, with flavors of caramel and fresh red currants. The fruity tone provides a rich character that lies under the bright final acidity. Drink now.
title: Laurent Gauthier 2014 Vintage Rosé (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Light and fruity, this is full of strawberries. The wine has a fresh character with a light touch of pepper and spice. It's attractive, bright and ready to drink.
title: Château de Pizay 2014 Rosé de Soirée Rosé (Beaujolais Rosé)

description: This gently pink rosé is soft, ripe and fruity. It has a full spicy character that gives a dry edge to the bright red fruits. Balanced with plenty of acidity, the wine is ready to drink.
title: Domaine de Souviou 2016 Lift de Provence Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This wine is a very pale peach color. Aromas of strawberry candy, watermelon and citrus peel lead to light dry-fruit flavors. The concentration seems a bit lacking.
title: Browne Family Vineyards 2016 Grenache Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Pale orange-salmon colored, this wine has a really soft character. Its flavor is as light as its color: acidity and raspberry fruit in soft focus. Drink this refreshing wine now.
designation: Domaine de la Vivonne Cuvée X
title: Château la Vivonne 2016 Domaine de la Vivonne Cuvée X Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot has produced a fruity wine, full of red fruits and with a touch of caramel. It is stylish, crisp and with fine bright acidity. Drink now.
title: Domaine Guillaman 2016 Rosé de Pressée Rosé (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: This blend of grapes from across the region is a simple fruity wine. There are plenty of red-fruit flavors as well as a soft creamy texture. A touch of spice gives the wine a lift at the end. Drink now.
title: Estandon 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This soft wine has plenty of fruit, comfortably cushioned by a warm texture and a floral character. It is ripe, full bodied and smooth. The strawberry flavor gives the wine a soft aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2016 Domaine Carambole Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The label and the name of this wine just exude summer sun. It is tight, packed with acidity as well as bright red fruits. A citrus streak shoots through this light fruity wine. Drink now.
title: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez 2016 Note Bleue Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
winery: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez

description: Made from Syrah, this is a heavy, fruity wine that offers cherry, orange and mushroom flavors. It's very dry, with pleasant acidity.
title: Flocchini 2010 Rosé (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is a ripe fruity wine that shows the potential quality of this often-abused style. It is sweet but it has a fine texture and crisp acidity to balance that simple sweetness. The fine fruitiness and crisp aftertaste make it ready to drink now.
title: Lacheteau 2016 Château de Montguéret  (Rosé d'Anjou)

description: Beautifully crisp and light, this is an ebullient wine that is full of lively red currant and tangerine fruits. There is attractive acidity, a bright aftertaste and plenty of acidity. Drink now.
title: Château de Marsan 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This is a lightly fruity wine with attractive red currant and raspberry flavors. It's bright, crisp, touched by vanilla and finished with citrus acidity. Screwcap.
title: Fischer 2012 Classic Rosé (Thermenregion)

description: From vines not far from Mont Sainte-Victoire, this fruity wine is full on the palate. A touch of spice accompanies the ripe strawberry flavors. It's rich with a soft aftertaste and light acidity.
title: Domaine Jacourette 2015 L'Ange et Luce Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The color of this wine is romantic, as is the psychedelic label. A classic blend, it's made at Château Sainte Roseline from purchased grapes. The fruit is light, red cherry and citrus flavored, packed with acidity at the end.
title: Château Sainte Roseline 2015 Love by Roseline Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Rich, lightly colored and full of acidity, this wine is rich in texture and flavor for a Provence rosé. Plenty of ripe strawberry and citrus flavors are lifted by spice and generous acidity. The wine is ready to drink, although it will be better from late 2016.
title: Domaine de la Bégude 2015 Rosé (Bandol)

description: Situated in the foothills of the Alpilles mountains, in the heart of the landscape painted by Van Gogh, this estate has produced a ripe style of rosé. A fine reflection of the vintage, it is full of red fruits and touches of orange. The crisp, lighter side makes it refreshing.
title: Domaine d'Eole 2015 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Belonging to the Stefani family for several generations, this estate has produced a tangy, zesty wine, textured and bright with red currant fruit flavors. It is so fresh and crisp with its lively, tight aftertaste.
title: Domaine Santa Giulietta 2015 Rosé (Ile de Beauté)

description: The mix of tannic texture, perfumed strawberries and tight acidity in this wine works well. The wine is tight, steely and offers raspberry and red-currant flavors. Drink from the end of 2016.
title: Vignobles André Lurton 2015 Rosé de Bonnet Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Made from mostly Merlot grapes that went direct-to-press to preserve color and tannin, this is a dark, pink and nutty wine, full-bodied and somewhat intense. While dry, the fruit leans toward the tangy end of the spectrum. It's food friendly and thirst quenching.
title: Medlock Ames 2015 Bell Mountain Estate Rosé (Alexander Valley)

description: This bright pink-ruby rosé features attractive aromas of watermelon rind and cherries. It's medium in body, fresh and vibrant on the palate, bursting with crunchy fresh fruit reminiscent of raspberries and cherries. Drink now.
title: Hentley Farm 2016 Rosé (Barossa Valley)

description: Always aged for an extra year before release, this wine is produced in honor of Jean Bagnis, a pioneer in Provence rosé. It balances richness with a light touch that gives fruity, refreshing pleasure. A shake of pepper lifts the palate and leads to the final red-fruit-crisp aftertaste.
title: Estandon 2014 Légende Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Made from Syrah and Grenache, this rosé is nicely crisp, with low alcohol. It's a little heavy in cherry and raspberry fruit flavors, but easy to like over a burger.
title: Longoria 2009 Cuvée June Pink Wine Rosé (Santa Barbara County)

description: Equal parts Grenache and Mourvèdre, this appealing wine displays aromas of strawberry, orange rind and light peppery spices. It drinks dry with a lightly spritzy feel.
title: Lauren Ashton Cellars 2014 Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Made from Pinot Noir, this is a simple, rather sweet blush wine. It has jammy raspberry and vanilla flavors.
title: Hey Mambo 2010 Kinky Pink Bistro Style Rosé (California)

description: Overtly sweet and simple, with sugary flavors of raspberries, oranges and vanilla.
title: Clayhouse 2010 Adobe Pink Rosé (Central Coast)

description: This rosé, made from Pinot Noir and Syrah, is brilliant pink in color, with aromas of strawberry and cream. The silky palate shows pronounced red cherry and vanilla flavors.
title: Vini 2013 Veni Vidi Vici Pinot Noir-Syrah Rosé (Thracian Valley)

description: Tempranillo could be an interesting variety in South Australia going forward. This rosé features hints of sous bois and cherries on the nose, then adds melon and spice notes on the palate. It's plump in the mouth, then finishes on a dry, silky note.
title: Gemtree 2016 Luna de Fresca Biodynamic Tempranillo Rosé (McLaren Vale)

description: Light and bright, this is a fragrant and fruity rosé. On the palate, strawberry flavors are gently caressed with soft acidity, leaving a soft, ripe aftertaste.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2012 Domaine Fontanyul Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A neutral salmon in color, with a slightly bricked orange tinge, this blend of Merlot, Grenache and Mourvèdre drinks dry. Abundant cherry flavors come through in this medium-bodied wine.
title: 3 Horse Ranch Vineyards 2012 Reserve Merlot-Grenache-Mourvèdre Rosé

description: A bright pink wine that tastes drier than it looks. It has bright strawberry aromas, as well as touches of caramel and lively final acidity. It's not for aging.
title: Casa da Passarella 2012 Somontes Rosé (Dão)

description: Made from Pinot Noir, this blush is dry and low in alcohol, with a great burst of acidity. It's a fun wine, but the strawberry and watermelon flavors, unfortunately, are thin.
title: Tedeschi 2012 Rosé (Sonoma Coast)

description: A fruity and aromatic wine that is a blend of Syrah and Castelão. It has bright red fruits and a soft, ripe character. Berries and acidity complement the round finish.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Samora Rosé (Tejo)

description: The wine is ripe, full with red currant and raspberry fruits and some attractive acidity. A blend of Touriga Nacional and Merlot, it is soft, fruity and needs drinking fast before it fades.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2014 Selection Rosé (Tejo)

description: As crisp as possible, this is a light, strawberry fruited wine with balanced acidity and a fresh, delicious aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2015 Rosé (Tejo)

description: Fresh and ripe, packed with red berry fruits, this is a young and fruity wine that is perfect to drink right away. It's light, bright and refreshing.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2015 Alandra Rosé (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: Funky smelling, with a mix of sweat, hot summer field and leather. It's more fresh in the mouth, with adequate acidity and stalky, slightly minty flavors mixed with mild berry notes.
title: Gauchezco 2010 Malbec Rosé (Mendoza)

description: Light, fresh, raspberry-flavored wine, with a hint of spice and great lines of acidity. The wine is fruity, delicious.
title: Château Beauregard-Ducourt 2010 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Although pricey for a rosé, this shows wonderful  complexity. The grapes come from two well-regarded vineyards, and the wine shows an elegant structure, with crisp acids and a dusting of tannins. It tastes of rose petals, herb tea, raspberries and nectarines.
designation: Russian River Selection Rosé of Pinot Noir
title: Gary Farrell 2012 Russian River Selection Rosé of Pinot Noir Rosé (Russian River Valley)

description: Part saignée, part fermented specifically for rosé, this bone dry and elegant wine offers a cascade of strawberry, raspberry and tangerine flavors. Its acidity punches through, lifting the palate and bringing its texture and length into focus.
title: Big Table Farm 2016 Laughing Pig Pinot Noir Rosé (Willamette Valley)

description: This is a soft wine, fruity without great definition. A ripe, red fruit character contrasts with a bitter acidity. It is ready to drink. The blend is 50/50 Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon.
title: Château Taussin 2014 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This smells a lot like mustard, with short, bitter flavors of red apple skins. Sweet touches of caramel and cocoa can be found on the finish.
title: Garbó 2014 Rosat Rosé (Montsant)

description: A disappointing effort from a normally reliable producer, this wine shows entirely too many rubbery, chemical aromas and flavors. Some decent strawberry and citrus fruit peeks through on the finish, so it may be worth decanting and seeing if that helps.
title: Alain Jaume et Fils 2014 Réserve Grand Veneur Rosé (Côtes du Rhône)

description: Light in color, this is a wine with flavors that seem to have been stripped away. It is crisp and only lightly fruity, with some bitter acidity at the end.
title: Château Goudichaud 2014 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This wine smells yeasty, a character that follows through on the palate. It is soft and round, conveying ripe red fruits without freshness. It reveals bitter acidity at the end.
title: Château Recougne 2014 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This bright, pink-colored wine is full of caramel and vanilla flavors that give a fat, dull character to the taste. It is dry, touched by bitter almonds and with a sharp aftertaste of acidity.
title: Les Hauts de Lagarde 2014 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: The wine is neither very fruity nor fresh. It is clean with a crisp aftertaste although the character or the interest are not there.
title: Clos Floridène 2014 Le Rosé de Floridène Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Heavy and dull, with softly candied raspberry and currant flavors.
title: Longevity 2009 Syrah Rosé (Contra Costa County)

description: This bright rosé from central Italy opens with aromas of cranberry and raspberry, followed by white almond and pressed flower. There's enough power and determination here to pair with roast chicken or vegetarian pasta.
title: Cantina Tollo 2009 Hedòs  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Cerasuolo)

description: This funky rosé is made from Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Syrah, and there's color, spice aromas and weight dictated by that grape mix. Heavy plum and cherry flavors are fruity but flat in feel, with no cut to the finish. This is interesting but not refreshing.
designation: Ros de Pacs Organic Farming Cabernet-Merlot-Syrah
title: Parés Baltà 2013 Ros de Pacs Organic Farming Cabernet-Merlot-Syrah Rosé (Penedès)

description: Tart red currant notes come with peppery, fresh verve on nose and palate of this delicate but lively wine, providing ideal refreshment. This rosé has the wonderfully tart citrus notes that go so well with food. The superclean finish provides a last, citric hurrah.
title: Nigl 2015 Rosé (Niederösterreich)

description: The 123-acre estate has been in the Rabarin family for 150 years, yielding both wine and market-garden produce. This is a delicious, crisp wine full of red-currant freshness with a tight, mineral character. It is concentrated with pepper overtones and a nervy, bright aftertaste.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2015 Domaine la Rabiotte Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Fruity and crisp, this is a ripe, refreshing wine. Lively acidity sets off the full strawberry and red-currant fruits. The aftertaste continues the fruity theme with tangy orange-zest flavors.
title: Les Quatre Tours 2015 Classique Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Fashionably pale in color, this light, bright and very poised wine is made from old-vine Mourvèdre, Grenache and Cinsault. With its acidity and fresh red currant and raspberry fruits, it is still crisp and could age a few more months, although why wait?
title: Maison Angelvin 2014 Grande Réserve Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Light salmon-pink in color, this refreshing wine is made from a combination of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot, which all provide structure and complexity. Subtle in aroma and flavor, it is light and tart, leaning toward intriguing flavors of pomegranate and cranberry.
title: Jericho Canyon Vineyard 2013 Estate Rosé (Napa Valley)

description: This is an attractive, ripe wine from the André Lurton group. It is smoothly rich, with balanced perfumed fruits and acidity. Full bodied and creamy, it is ready to drink.
title: Château Bonnet 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: There is a great burst of appealing acidity in this wine, accompanied by refreshing red fruits. This balanced wine is lively, crisp and with plenty of flavor. Drink now.
title: Château Les Hauts de Palette 2016 Château Haut Mondain Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Olivier Doujon made only 7,000 bottles of this 100% Merlot at the family estate in Fronsac. Rounded and ripe, this is a full-bodied wine with great fruitiness and attractive acidity. Well balanced, it offers red-cherry flavors with an edge of pepper. Drink the wine now.
title: Château Magondeau 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This is a real food wine, with its tangy texture, touch of spice and attractive acidity. Light fruitiness and a dry core give a structured character. Drink now.
title: Château Reynon 2016 Le Rosé de Floridène Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This lively wine comes from the Clarence Dillon group (Château Haut-Brion). It offers good balance between the considerable acidity and the red-berry fruit. With its spicy background, the wine is delicious to drink now.
title: Clarendelle 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This full-bodied wine is rounded and soft. With generous red fruits, balanced acidity and a bright aftertaste, it is ready to drink.
title: Château Goudichaud 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Véronique Barthe is the first woman to manage the estate that has been in the Barthe family since 1789. She delivered a light and bright wine, poised and stylish with its crisp fruit and tangy acidity. A delicious burst of citrus at the end continues the theme of this fruity wine.
title: Château la Freynelle 2016 La Freynelle Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This is a dry style of rosé. Packed with red currant and berry fruits, this blend of Cabernet Franc and Grolleau has a touch of spice to add extra interest. It is perfumed, crisp and ready to drink young.
title: Domaine du Petit Clocher 2016  Rosé de Loire

description: This is a finely made wine, fresh and crisp. It is dry but with a soft texture that turns it into a wine that's both good with food and as an apéritif. The aftertaste is crisp and still fruity.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2016 Portugal Ramos Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: Made from 100% Gamay, this is a crisp wine with attractive acidity, red currant fruit and a spicy aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Philippe Viallet 2016 Savoie Rosé (Vin de Savoie)

description: Produced from 100% Touriga Nacional, this is a crisp, dry wine, full of red-currant fruits and with a tang of citrus. This attractive wine is ready to drink.
title: CARM 2016 Vinha da Urze Rosé (Douro)

description: This 100% Pinot Noir rosé is ripe and full of red fruit, with a touch of caramel. It shows an attractive streak of acidity on the finish.
title: Saget la Perrière 2016 La Petite Perrière Pinot Noir Rosé (Vin de France)

description: The wine is tight with acidity and red-currant fruitiness. Made from Cabernet Franc, it is crisp, cut through with a lively, mineral texture. Drink now.
title: Domaine les Pins 2016 Cuvée les Rochettes Rosé (Bourgueil)

description: A pleasing shade of pale pink, this is a very austere bottling, with just faint touches of raspberry and tangerine on the nose. There is more light-red fruit and a hint of bubblegum on the palate, which offers decent tannic tension.
title: Ponte 2016 Pas Doux Rosé (Temecula)

description: The pale, pink-gray color indicates how light this wine is. It does have attractive red fruits, crisp acidity and a refreshing shot of green apples, all packaged in a dancing, buoyant body. Drink now.
title: Domaine de Caseneuve 2014 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Tart, fresh and a bit chunky and rustic, this blend of 60% Syrah, 20% Grenache and 20% Cinsaut features bold lime notes, scouring acidity and hints of crushed stone. Drink now.
title: Château de Pourcieux 2009 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This big and ripe wine is abundant in red and yellow fruit notes. It has a warm feel, with piercing acidity throughout. This full-bodied wine is perfect to be paired with food.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2012 Le Pont Rosé (Bandol)

description: Complex and finessed, this has loads of flavor. The pretty cherry and plum notes are framed with a milk chocolate accent. The modest alcohol in no way diminishes the concentration.
title: Sleight of Hand 2011 The Magician's Assistant Cabernet Franc Rosé (Yakima Valley)

description: A pretty coppery color reminiscent of the rosés of southern France, this unusual blend of Mourvèdre, Syrah, Malbec and Viognier is done via the saignée (bleeding the tanks) method. Muted flavors of dried peach, banana and cantaloupe combine in an interesting way, but the finish has off-flavors.
title: Eleven 2012 La Primavera Rosé (Washington)

description: Pale in color, this ripe, full-bodied wine has a rich core of red fruits and spicy acidity. The wine is concentrated while still keeping elegance and fresh fruitiness. The aftertaste is full and smooth.
title: Château les Crostes 2014 Cuvée Prestige Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This impressively concentrated wine focuses on the brilliant red fruits that shine through the generous texture. It is ripe, with a streak of fresh acidity at the end to give the essential refreshing aftertaste.
title: Domaine Gavoty 2014 Cuvée Clarendon Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: So pale, this wine is almost white. The fruit and the red-berry flavors are definitely those of a rosé, a fruity, full wine with a touch of spice as well as a tight, mineral texture. Weight and ripeness are balanced by a fresh, crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Domaines Ott 2014 Château de Selle Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This has a candied cherry color, vivid strawberry and cotton candy aromas, and on first sip a freshness that's almost startling. On second sip it's more like a light red wine, delicate, medium-bodied, very fruity but easy on the palate.
title: Chacewater 2014 Organic Grapes Rosé (Sierra Foothills)

description: Dusty strawberry and cherry aromas are hollow but easy. The palate is plump but short on edge and framing. Flavors of strawberry and raspberry roll awkwardly into a low-acid, soft finish.
title: Jardín de Lúculo 2013 Los Bohemios Garnacha Rosé (Navarra)

description: This soft, caramel flavored rosé is produced from the native Castelão grape in coastal Setúbal south of Lisbon. With rounded red fruits and light acidity, it is dry and destined to pair with food.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Azul Portugal Rosé (Península de Setúbal)

description: From one of the classed growths of Provence, this wine is intense with ripe fruits. Red plum, red currant and berry fruit flavors go with a steely, nervy texture that needs to age. Drink from the end of 2014.
title: Château du Galoupet 2013 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Complex and rich, it has ripe red fruits that are full of sweetness as well as some fresher acidity. With red plum, minerality and vanilla, it can age for a few months. Wait until 2015.
title: Château la Gordonne 2013 La Chapelle Gordonne Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Lake County producer Chacewater has made a pleasant, refreshing rosé from 100% Syrah. It's dark in color, with tastes of watermelon, ripe peach and tropical fruit. Intensely textured and full bodied in mouthfeel, it emphasizes its flavors through to the finish.
title: Chacewater 2011 Rosé (Sierra Foothills)

description: A fine example of what Tavel can be, this is a full-bodied, luscious rosé with a bit of sturdiness to its structure. Cherry and peach notes fade into hints of fresh herb and cocoa on the long, harmonious finish. Drink now and through the summer of 2014.
title: Château de Ségriès 2012  Tavel

description: A neon pink color segues to an equally loud palate of cotton candy, cherry soda and bubblegum. The intensity is there and you might pair this wine with hearty fish soup to lose that synthetic edge.
title: Chiorri 2008 Rosato Rosé (Colli Perugini)

description: Acidic and tart, with cherryskin, orange pekoe tea, thyme and spice flavors that finish dry.
title: Eberle 2007 Steinbeck Vineyard Syrah Rosé (Paso Robles)

description: Impeccably fresh and dry, this wine smells like crisp apple skin and white peaches, and tastes vivid and refreshing, while combining light alcohol with a substantial and smooth texture.
title: McEvoy Ranch 2014 Rosebud Rosé (Marin County)

description: Crisp acidity makes this blush wine clean and vibrant. You'll find strawberry, vanilla, thyme and cinnamon spice flavors that finish ripe and lush. It's a fine wine, delicately structured, and fairly priced. From Pisoni.
title: Lucy 2012 Rosé of Pinot Noir Rosé (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: A crisp, clean, deliciously fruity wine. It's light, fragrant, touched with red berries and attractive acidity. There's no complexity here, just pure fruitiness and freshness.
title: Mas de Cadenet 2012 Arbaude Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: Named after a young goat in early Indo-European mythology, this full-bodied, ripe wine has yellow fruits as well as red-berry flavors. A pepper edge contrasts with the fruitiness and gives the wine a rich texture. The fruit and acidity come through strongly at the end.
title: Château Ferry Lacombe 2015 Haedus Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: If a rosé can be serious, this is it. Named after the owner, it is a structured, concentrated wine with a dense texture and hints of tannin. It also is fruity, perfumed and refreshing. The edge of pepper does betray the alcohol although that is offset by intense final acidity.
title: Château la Calisse 2015 Cuvée Patricia Ortelli Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: Organic grapes tended in plots close to the sea have produced a delicious wine full of red-fruit flavor. It is rounded and soft in texture with an herbal hint. The right amount of acidity gives the wine a crisp fruity aftertaste.
title: Château Léoube 2015 Rosé de Léoube Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Organically grown grapes have produced a clear, crisp wine with freshness and lively acidity. These blend effortlessly into the red fruits and light squeeze of lemon juice. The wine is bright and ready to drink.
title: Château Margüi 2015 Perle de Margüi Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: Night-harvested to keep freshness, this wine has a bright, cool character. Lively acidity is filled out with spice, caramel and a peppery character. Wild strawberries and yellow-fruit flavors have just a light texture from the 20% Syrah in the blend. Drink now.
title: Domaine de l'Amaurigue 2015 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is the palest of rosés, almost white in color. Ripe red fruits, from 80-year old vines, show through on the palate, with tight acidity and a crisp aftertaste. Balanced and rich, this has a shot of spice to add interest and put the wine firmly in the food rosé category.
title: Domaine Sainte-Marie 2015 VieVité Extraordinaire Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Situated in the valley on the other side of the hill from Bandol and the sea, this estate has produced a ripe, full-bodied wine. The high proportion of Mourvèdre in the blend contributes a perfumed character and some structure. It is a complete, ripe and concentrated wine that will age, and will be better from late 2016.
title: Domaines Bunan 2015 Moulin des Costes Rosé (Bandol)

description: This is soft and rich, with a light and smooth textured. It has red fruit, light acidity and a rounded aftertaste.
title: Château de Brigue 2011 Signature Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A ripe style of wine, typified by its caramel element and full, spicy fruit. With its weight, it should pair well with food.
title: Château Deffends 2011 Cuvée Première Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Full of bright acidity, this is a crisp wine, with a taut texture and flavors of red plum and orange. This is a good quaffer with summer food. Screwcap.
title: Zull 2011 Lust & Laune Rosé (Niederösterreich)

description: This has berry fruit aromas that don't fully register as crisp and spunky. It feels narrow and tastes tart and tangy, with red plum and cherry pie flavors. Punchy and refreshing.
title: Torres 2011 Sangre de Toro de Casta Rosé (Catalunya)

description: This is soft and round, with flavors of sugared orange and caramel. It's an attractive, easy apéritif rosé.
title: Vignobles de Roany 2011 Provence Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Deep salmon in color, this pink sparkler from Norm Yost of Flying Goat offers nectarine, strawberry, mandarin zest and lees aromas on the nose. The palate is tangy, with hints of cranberry-orange juice and tangerine rind.
title: Goat Bubbles 2014 Solomon Hills Vineyard Rosé (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Full-bodied and intense for a rosé wine, the Lekkerwijn offers complexity in a dry, concentrated delivery. Savory and spicy with an herbal spin, the wine finishes long. Pair with spicy food, duck, game fish.
title: Solms-Delta 2007 Solms Wijn de Caab Lekkerwijn Rosé (Western Cape)

description: Produced by the Domaine de Chevalier team, this is a bright and crisp wine with red currant and tight red-berry flavors. These are lifted and given a refreshing character by the acidity. The wine is clean, bright and fruity. Drink now.
title: Domaine de la Solitude 2015 Rosé de la Solitude Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Though unstated on the label, this is made from Pinot Gris. It seems to be glowing, an almost day-glo shade of orange, and is quite dry, with flavors of pine needles and watermelon.
title: Château Bianca 2014 Rosé (Willamette Valley)

description: A pale wine with almost sugary flavors. It has a strawberry fruit character and soft acidity.
title: Patient Cottat 2012 Rosé (Sancerre)

description: Lightweight and silky in texture, this is a dry, refreshing rosé to drink while the warm weather persists. Hints of bubblegum detract slightly, but the primary notes of melon, citrus and wet stone combine easily on the palate.
title: Domaine Guy Mousset 2016 Rosé (Côtes du Rhône)

description: A slightly volatile nose hints at ripeness but does not suggest much fruit. The off-dry palate rounds out flavors and adds a hint of strawberry to a tart lemon core. The body is light and slightly diffuse. Drink soon.
title: una.wine 2016 Rosé (Burgenland)

description: Although low in alcohol this wine has a rich, smooth texture that adds more mouthfeel than usual. It blends plum and strawberry notes and has soft acidity.
title: Josh Cellars 2016 Rosé (California)

description: A clear salmon color in the glass, this value-priced rosé opens with attractive notes of white flowers, strawberry and peach, with the faintest hint of white chocolate in the back. Despite the rich, ripe aromas, the mouthfeel is lightweight and well balanced by ample orangy acidity.
title: Fat Bastard 2016 Rosé (Pays d'Oc)

description: Raspberry and cherry aromas are at the fore of the bouquet, with an attractive floral character teasing in the background. The palate offers ripe, juicy fruit flavors that are lifted by ample acidity and finish quick yet clean on the close. Drink now.
title: Calmel & Joseph 2016 Villa Blanche Grenache Rosé (Pays d'Oc)

description: Light and fresh, this wine has intense, spicy strawberry fruits. The acidity is balanced, adding lift to the ripe fruitiness. It has an attractive, tangy aftertaste.
title: Domaine Jean-Paul Picard 2014 Rosé (Sancerre)

description: Named after the Roman name for the village of Sury-en-Vaux, the producer's home, this wine is soft and rounded. Red-berry fruits are full and ripe, lightly spiced and with an attractive fruity aftertaste. The wine is tangy, fresh and ready to drink.
title: Domaine Philippe Raimbault 2014 Apud Sariacum Rosé (Sancerre)

description: Made of 100% Çalkarasi, an indigenous Turkish grape, this coral-colored wine offers a bouquet of strawberry and pomegranate. It is both full on the palate and refreshing, with flavors of strawberry, pomegranate, aniseed, lavender and a hint of smoke.
title: Paşaeli 2014 Çalkarasi Rosé (Aegean)

description: This blend of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay is orange in color and smells neutral except for a note of orange peel. On the palate, this has a grabby skins-driven texture. Short flavors of stone fruits are chunky and clunky. Other than having a mild flavor of nectarine, the finish is neutral.
title: Marichal 2015 Reserve Collection Blanc de Noir Rosé (Canelones)

description: From organically-grown and certified Biodemeter-grown grapes, this rosé blends 70% Grenache with 15% each of Mourvèdre and Syrah to produce a dry, robust wine aromatic in peach skin and tangerine. Orange blossom and candied orange peel on the palate add to the freshness and lively acidity.
title: Quivira 2013 Rosé (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Packed with jammy fruit and sweet raspberry flavors, this easy rosé would make a great partner to cocktail appetizers. The finish shows flavors of wild berry and bitter almond.
title: Masciarelli 2010 Rosé (Colline Teatine)

description: Vibrant, coppery salmon in color, this lively and delightful rosé is two-thirds Grenache and one-third Mourvèdre, all stainless steel-fermented. Pretty watermelon and strawberry flavors are accented by streaks of cracker and mineral.
title: Doyenne 2011 Rosé (Yakima Valley)

description: Pinot Gris, with its pale-pink skin, is the grape of choice in Reuilly for rosés. With a color that matches pale rosés from Provence, the wine is lightly spicy while also dry. Its balanced acidity is just right. Drink now.
title: Domaine de Reuilly 2015 Pinot Gris Rosé (Reuilly)

description: A very pretty shade of pink, this blend of 89% Grenache and 11% Syrah shows crisp nectarine and peach, squeezed lime, fragrant honeydew, jasmine, strawberry ice cream, sweet onion and a green-mint twist on the dynamic nose. The palate is nicely tense, with lime rind leveling the riper peach, strawberry and watermelon flavors.
title: Chronic Cellars 2015 Pink Pedals Rosé (Paso Robles)

description: This 100% Grenache was aged in neutral French oak. It's dry in style, but rich, with flavors of raspberries, strawberries, cherries and toast. An edge of acidity adds verve.
title: Archium 2012 Rosé (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: The wine is fresh, so crisp and fruity. Its red currant fruit and lively acidity are rounded out by a caramel flavor that gives richness. The aftertaste though is dry and packed with fruit. Drink now.
title: Roland Tissier et Fils 2014 Rosé (Sancerre)

description: This Hungarian rosé is a blend of 33% Kékfrankos, 22% Cabernet Franc, 21% Cabernet Sauvignon, 16% Merlot, 5% Pinot Noir and 3% Syrah. It has aromas of strawberries, freshly sliced apple and fresh cherry juice. It flavors are those of bright cherry and red raspberry with a pleasant tartness on the finish.
title: Sauska 2014 Rosé (Villány)

description: This is a charming wine–gentle and silky and soft. The pink "eye of the partridge" color is especially pretty. The flavors are a fruity and ripe, suggesting strawberries. A great summer wine that will pair well with lots of slightly sweet foods.
title: J. Lohr 2011 Gesture Grenache Rosé (Paso Robles)

description: Bright strawberry and cherry aromas are followed by a fruit cup of tropical fruit, cherry and strawberry. Easy-drinking but on the sweet side, this will pair well with fruit or spicy dishes.
title: Skouras 2010 Zoë Rosé (Peloponnese)

description: This fresh, crisp wine has a light salmon-pink color. It bursts with attractive red and citrus fruits to give a bright character plus tight acidity. Drink now.
title: Vignobles Bonhur 2015 Château Merlet Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: From the home estate of wine academic and guru Denis Dubourdieu, this tight, nervy wine has a mineral character rounded by wild-strawberry flavors. An attractive citrus tang gives it good bite at the end. Drink now.
title: Clos Floridène 2015 Le Rosé de Floridène Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Wonderfully fruity, this is a clean, crisp and food-friendly rosé. It poised and elegant, with a ripe fruit character that's balanced by taut acidity and lime zest flavor.
title: Château de Roquefort 2011 Corail Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Lively and crisp, this is a finely balanced rosé. Its raspberry fruits are allied to notes of grapefruit and mineral, with delicious mouthwatering acidity.
title: Château Maupague 2011 Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: This is a well-balanced wine that is both crisp and breezy and full of delicious red-berry fruits. It has a tight texture, with some minerality and a tangy aftertaste. This should make for an excellent apéritif.
title: Château Saint-Pierre 2011 Tradition Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Delicious and crisp, this has an initial taste of intense citrus and red fruit. The sensation carries through the wine, with a fruity yet taut and mineral-driven texture. There is great fruit on the finish.
title: Domaine du Deffends 2011 Rosé d'une Nuit Rosé (Coteaux Varois)

description: Rounded and rich, this is full of strawberry flavors. It's deliciously ripe, with crispness to go with the serious fruit. This is very much a food rosé, concentrated and intense.
title: Domaine Sorin 2011 Terra Amata Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A wine that has just the right balance between acidity and fruit. It's smooth and soft, with an attractive zesty texture. The wine has warm richness on the finish.
title: Mas de Cadenet 2011 Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: This peppery, fruit-flavored wine has a ripe character and wild strawberry flavors. Drink this full, spicy wine now.
title: Domaine Maestracci 2015 E Prove Rosé

description: This darkly colored blush may be technically dry, like the label says, but it tastes as sweet as raspberry Kool-Aid. If you like that fruity style, it's for you.
title: Pedroncelli 2011 Dry Rosé of Zinfandel Rosé (Dry Creek Valley)

description: A caramel aroma is followed by sweet strawberry fruit from the Touriga Nacional, lending a wine that is freshly fruity and soft.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2011 Rosé (Tejo)

description: Duras and Syrah grapes take credit for this ripe, spicy wine. With its red fruit and plenty of pepper and caramel flavors, it's a full-bodied rosé—much better with food than by itself. Drink now.
title: Domaine Rotier 2016 Les Gravels Rosé (Gaillac)

description: This attractively fruity wine is crisp and full of red currants. Its acidity and soft caramel flavor are nicely blended with the touch of tannin and crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2016 Lagoalva Vinho Rosé (Tejo)

description: Bright and fresh, this is a delicate rosé, showing both fruitiness and some structure. Strawberry dusted with pepper lends a spicy berry character throughout. It's not for aging, so drink now.
title: Casa da Passarella 2012 Casa da Passarella O Brazileiro Rosé (Dão)

description: Light bodied and fruit-driven, this wine leads with refreshing, easy citrus notes and friendly red apple nuances. It finishes dry.
title: Unger 2016 Zweigelt Rosé (Niederösterreich)

description: Packed with attractive red-berries and citrus, this is a warm and ripe wine. It is totally dominated by its fruitiness and by the Syrah that brings a perfumed character to this fine apéritif wine. Drink now.
title: Mirabeau 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This Rosé of Sangiovese is light in color and density, with fruit flavors of watermelon and a hint of peach. It's a fine, light and easy sipper.
title: Airfield Estates 2013 Ruby Rosé (Yakima Valley)

description: Ribera is not prime rosé country, and this wine doesn't much help the cause. Cherry cough drop aromas are about all you're going to get, while the palate is jumpy and sour, with apple skin and grapefruit flavors. Too much like a sucking candy.
title: Finca Torremilanos 2007 Monte Castrillo Rosado Rosé (Ribera del Duero)

description: Affordable and friendly, this refreshing wine offers strawberry jam and orange marmalade on the nose and a mineral-driven flavor profile. The fruit is overtaken by the acidity to some extent, but the wine still makes for a tasty warm weather sip.
title: Long Point 2006 Ciera Rosé (New York)

description: Simple and a little sugary, this Syrah, Pinot Noir and Zinfandel blend has pop flavors of raspberries, cherries, vanilla and cola.
title: Elizabeth Rose 2007 Rosé (Napa Valley)

description: Pale apricot in the glass, this rosé made of Cinsault, Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon has a bouquet of peach and clover. There is a bit of heft on the palate that belies its light color, with flavors of ripe peach, apple, and lemon curd. The finish is marked by touches of thyme and oregano.
title: Massaya 2014 Rosé (Bekaa Valley)

description: Fresh and fruity, this balances ripe red fruits with a touch of caramel and light, crisp acidity. It is fragrant and perfumed, and would make an excellent apéritif.
title: Barton & Guestier 2013 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Named after the highway that joins Paris and Provence, this a light and fruity wine, crisp yet with a soft aftertaste. It stays lively right to the end.
title: Xavier Flouret 2013 Nationale 7 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A touch of caramel lies over the crisp fruit, giving a round texture, smooth and rich. The red fruits are bright and have the fresh final acidity.
title: Château Riotor 2013 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Ripe red fruits are the main character of this soft, rounded wine. Attractive acidity with grapefruit and lemon zest flavors are balanced by a warmer element.
title: Domaine Sainte Lucie 2013 MIP Made in Provence Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This dry appetizing wine comes from one of Lodi's more adventurous winemakers, Markus Niggli. A hot-pink color and red-cherry aromas lead to bright fresh cherry and raspberry flavors, while a medium body and mild acidity form a smooth texture. Niggli made it from Syrah and Carignane grapes fermented by native yeast.
title: Markus Wine Co 2016 Zeal Rosé (Lodi)

description: Not something easily found, this pink-orange wine is made from an unusual variety in its red form, let alone as a crisp, tart companion to picnic fare. Orange peel and strawberry are the highlights in this easygoing, lovable quaff.
title: Draxton 2016 Pinot Meunier Rosé (Napa Valley)

description: Hot pink in color and showing some bricking, light aromas of cherry and spice are followed by broad-feeling fruit flavors that are a hair off dry. It comes off as a bit ponderous but there's enjoyment to be had.
title: Wine o'Clock 2014 Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Light pink in color, this shows seared orange rind, wet slate and touches of berry on the nose. Light raspberry and plum skins show on the palate, which could use more acidity and tension.
title: HammerSky NV Rosé (Paso Robles)

description: Made in the pale modern style, this has modest scents of melon and stone fruit. It's fully dry, with a zesty, clean finish that hints at lime and red berries.
title: Les Trois Couronnes 2015 Rosé (Côtes du Rhône)

description: This totally fresh rosé is crisp with bright acidity, red currant fruit flavors and lively, bone-dry aftertaste. It's a fine summer wine to drink now.
title: Cave du Marmandais 2014 Ferran Pradets Rosé (Côtes du Marmandais)

description: This blend of Grenache, Syrah, Carignan and Clairette is marked by hints of onion or wild garlic on the nose, and followed by a subdued palate that only hints at wet stone and subdued fruit.
title: Cellier des Chartreux 2013 Domaine Les Hautes Roches  (Tavel)

description: An unusual and wonderful blend of grapes has produced a simple and fruity wine. Touches of caramel broaden the crisp red berry fruits and bright acidity. It should be drunk now.
title: Château Coutinel 2014 Rosé (Fronton)

description: Pink in color, this fruity, spicy wine conveys a juicy red currant fruit character. Clean and fresh, it's packed with fruitiness and topped by intense acidity.
title: Château Laulerie 2014  Bergerac Rosé

description: With a light caramel taste, this is a fat while still fruity wine. Salmon pink in color, it has acidity that fits behind the ripe red plum flavors. It should be drunk now.
title: Domaine Roumagnac 2014 Authentique Rosé (Fronton)

description: Minty and light, the fruit here does not seem to have obtained optimal ripeness, even for rosé. Scents and flavors suggest pine needle and wintergreen rather than any hint of berry or melon.
title: Underwood 2014 Rosé (Oregon)

description: This pale rosé blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot is fruity with crisp strawberry fruits and acidity. It has a soft perfumed aftertaste that makes it immediately attractive. Drink now.
title: Château Bélingard 2015 Bélingard  (Bergerac Rosé)

description: This blend of mainly Syrah, with Grenache, is heavy and dull, with candied raspberry-cherry flavors that finish a little sweet.
title: Martin Ray 2007 Dry Rosé (Russian River Valley)

description: Pickled on the nose, with aromas that hint at white grapes such as Verdejo. This is jumpy and unsettled, with citrus and white grapefruit flavors leaving a tangy burn on the finish. Jangled and sharp.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Osborne 2007 Solaz Rosado Rosé (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: This wine is a unique blend of 59% Syrah, 31% Malbec and 10% Grenache. Dark in color for a rosé, it brings aromas of cherry and herb. The flavors tingle the palate with just off-dry flavors that seem a bit fat.
title: Longship 2016 Wild Harvest Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Pale salmon in color, this is an aromatic rosé with notes of peach and jasmine. It's off dry in style and brings easy drinking enjoyment.
title: Original House Wine NV Rosé (America)

description: Pure Touriga Nacional, this is a crisp and fruity wine. Its red currants and light tannic structure give it shape and bring out the fruitiness that makes it immediately attractive. Ready to drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Brigando Rosé (Lisboa)

description: This spicy, fruity wine, which includes the rare spicy Egiodola grape, is crisp with acidity and red currant fruit. With its touch of caramel, it's ready to drink.
title: Domaine de Ménard 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: Simple, clean, fresh, raspberry-flavored wine, with light acidity. There is an edge of apple and caramel, the aftertaste just off dry.
title: Yvon Mau 2008 Seigneurs de Bergerac Rosé (Bergerac)

description: Soft, almost sweet, with considerable caramel and sweet strawberry flavors. There is an awkward final bitterness.
title: Château Bélingard 2008 Rosé (Bergerac)

description: Finished quite dry, this brings tart rhubarb and sour berry fruit to bear, backed with ample acidity. It was whole cluster pressed, blended with Pinot Noir saignée, and cold fermented in stainless steel. It's a good picnic rosé, ready for cured meats and soft cheeses.
title: Coelho 2015 Divertimento Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir Rosé (Willamette Valley)

description: If any rosé can be serious, it's this. It has structure as well as fruit, a sense of purpose, ripe red fruits and tight acidity. It could even age, so wait to drink it until late in summer 2014.
title: Château Deffends 2013 Cuvée Première Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: From a 100-acre estate formerly the home of the Counts of Provence, this wine has a great fruity character allied to a more mineral texture. With richness and vanilla flavors it is both packed with raspberry fruits and showing structure. Keep until the end of 2014.
title: Château Réal Martin 2013 Perle de Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Made from 58% Cabernet Sauvignon, 22% Merlot and 20% Cabernet Franc, this rosé was made in the saignée method, cold fermented for six weeks, left sur lies and cold stored, producing an intense, structured wine thick in strawberry and raspberry flavor with just a hint of herbal amidst its complex layers.
title: Blackbird Vineyards 2013 Arriviste Rosé (Napa Valley)

description: This is a food-friendly rosé that's full-bodied and rich. It has orange and apricot flavors, along with a note of red plum. The acidity keeps the wine fresh and crisp while the aftertaste has a fine tang of zest. Screwcap.
title: Château Riotor 2011 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Pretty full-bodied for a rosé, with a copper-pink color and upfront red currant, raspberry cream, vanilla and cinnamon flavors that finish a little sweet. The acidity is just fine. Nice with charcuterie.
title: Vermeil 2012 Luvisi Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon Rosé (Calistoga)

description: This is a big, rich rosé, and a very delicious one. With fairly high alcohol, it's full-bodied, with complex flavors of orange peel, peach, watermelon, vanilla and spices. Perfect with paella or anything with ham.
title: MCV 2012 Pink Rosé (Paso Robles)

description: A soft, pale rosé with caramel, red fruit  and fresh acidity, finished with light sweetness. The acidity gives an extra dose of refreshment. Screwcap.
title: Felsner 2007 Hesperia Rosé (Kremstal)

description: Cherry soda, mint and crushed almond characterize the nose of this luminous rosé made with the hearty Aglianico grape. The wine is creamy and smooth with fresh berry acidity on the close. A Marc de Grazia selection, various American importers.
title: Cantina del Taburno 2007 Albarosa Rosé (Campania)

description: Here is a bigger, broader style of Italian rosé (made from a blend of Primitivo, Aglianico and Syrah) with thick aromas of raspberry, blueberry, mature peach and almond. Its color is bright pink and the wine offers a playful note of sour cherry on the close.
title: Feudi di Terra d'Otranto 2007 Passerose Rosé (Puglia)

description: A blend of Cinsault, Counoise and Grenache, this very pretty salmon-colored wine offers aromas of strawberry, melon, soda water and spice. It drinks dry but the fruit flavors are sweet, with tart acids finishing it off.
title: Tranche 2014 Pink Pape Blackrock Vineyard Rosé (Yakima Valley)

description: In its weight and richness allied to scents of garrigue and sun-warmed stones, this speaks of its Tavel terroir. The berry fruit is subdued, with spice, weight and warmth carrying the wine to a long finish.
title: Alain Jaume et Fils 2014 Le Crétacé  (Tavel)

description: This blend of Sciaccarellu and Niellucciu is delicious and light—full of refreshing red currant flavors and crisp acidity. It's bright, fruity and ready to drink.
title: Domaine Poli 2016 Sciaccarellu-Niellucciu Rosé (Ile de Beauté)

description: Delicate pink in color, this rosé boasts a strawberries-and-cream character, with a jalapeño kick. Showing a touch of breadth on the palate, this light-bodied sipper is an easy choice for an apéritif.
title: Brengman Brothers 2014 Crain Hill Vineyard Rosé (Leelanau Peninsula)

description: Watermelon and caramelized sugar notes waft sweetly from the nose of this dry Cabernet Franc rosé. While delicate in body, the palate suggests fleshy red-plum and cherry flavors. A streak of acidity leads a brisk clean finish.
title: Bellangelo 2015 Cabernet Franc Dry Rosé (Seneca Lake)

description: Sweet rosé, soft crushed strawberries with crisp, clean balanced acidity. The wine is fruity, fresh and great as an aperitif or with a fruit dessert.
title: Château la Varière 2010 Rosé (Anjou)

description: This medium-bodied, silky-textured rosé features modestly confected aromas of bubble gum and cotton candy, which give way on the palate to vinous notes of cherry and wet stone. Drink up.
title: Mas des Bressades 2011 Cuvée Tradition Rosé (Costières de Nîmes)

description: This rosé is dry, crisp, tart and complex, offering raspberry, cherry, herb, white pepper and vanilla flavors.
title: St. Francis 2011 Rosé (Sonoma County)

description: “Piano... Piano” means “easy... easy” in Italian—and this pretty rosé indeed delivers informality and friendliness. The wine is packaged with a glass cork, and the bouquet offers bright tones of raspberry and citrus.
title: Terre di Talamo 2011 Piano... Piano Rosé (Toscana)

description: On an estate about 10 miles north of Aix-en-Provence, this 32-acre vineyard has produced a pretty, fruity wine. Light and crisp, it is cut by citrus acidity, giving a lift to the lively raspberry fruits.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2015 Domaine Bel Eouve Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: The scent of summer reaches out of the glass: fresh strawberries bathed in citrus and green pear freshness. The palate provides rounded berry fruit but also bright freshness for real, lasting zip. Drink soon.
title: Steininger 2015 Rosé (Niederösterreich)

description: Red-berry fruits dominate this crisp, clear wine with its direct line of acidity and light aftertaste. It's aromatic and full of life.
title: Moncigale 2015 Frais et Délicat Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Heavy and rich in the mouth, this has jammy raspberry, vanilla and white sugar flavors.
title: Eponymous 2012 Rosé (Sonoma Valley)

description: A warm, fruity rosé, softly textured and full of strawberry fruits. There's a fine touch of acidity to balance and a dry aftertaste. Ready to drink.
title: Georges Vigouroux 2012 Pigmentum Rosé (Vin de Pays du Lot)

description: Aromas of sulfur and swimming pool blow off and leave citrusy notes. Pyrazinic flavors of bell pepper suggest barely ripe (maybe underripe) grapes. That essence is confirmed on a finish via white pepper and bell pepper flavors.
title: Tres Palacios 2016 Reserva Rosé (Maipo Valley)

description: Funky rubbery aromas include a note of compost. This feels grabby, with citric acidity. Briny salty slightly vegetal flavors leave you asking, “Where's the fruit?”
title: Apaltagua 2016 Reserva Carmenere Rosé (Maule Valley)

description: This is a really soft wine with the minimum of tannins and the lightest fruit. It has just a hint of crisp, clean red berry fruits. Drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2016 Bons Ventos Rosé (Lisboa)

description: Rubbery underripe aromas are neither fresh nor attractive. This shows high acidity and sketchy balance, while tart green-leaning red-berry and citrus flavors are bitter and pithy.
title: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2016 Los Vascos Rosé (Colchagua Valley)

description: This electric-pink-colored wine is a saignée-blend of Merlot, Malbec, Cabernet Sauvignon, Sangiovese and Barbera. Aromas of cherry and herb lead to broad off-dry tangy cherry flavors that don't seem fully connected together.
title: Mellisoni 2016 180 Degrees Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This is has flavors of apple and red currant, with a dry, light touch. The acidity cuts through the palate, giving it an attractive freshness, with a touch of spice and a crisp finish.
title: Triennes 2011 Rosé (Vin de Pays Var)

description: Ripe, luscious raspberries lend a brambly tone to this dry, invigorating Pinot Noir rosé. The palate is concentrated with summer berry flavors pierced with a stream of tart lemonade acidity.
title: Silver Thread 2013 Dry Rosé (Finger Lakes)

description: In Provence, heavy bottle seems to equal high alcohol. It's true here, with a wine that, while it has the right pale grey pink color, is almost too rich for its own good. It does have fruit and acidity but they are just a part of a powerful and ripe wine. Age it until the end of 2014 for best results.
title: Château Hermitage Saint-Martin 2013 Ikon Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Soft and fruity, it's bone dry, very crisp and totally fresh. Red currants dominate this wine that has intense acidity and light zesty aftertaste.
title: Domaine de la Sanglière 2013 Cuvée Spéciale Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This dry rosé is soft and fruity. Red-berry fruit permeates a wine that also has a rich texture from lees aging giving the wine some weight. Its acidity balances all this, finishing the wine with crisp acidity.
title: Santos & Seixo 2016 Santos da Casa Rosé (Douro)

description: A soft, fat, caramel-flavored wine, showing strawberry fruits and a creamy texture. It lacks acidity, leaving a wine that needs to be drunk soon.
title: Dopff & Irion 2009 Rosé (Alsace)

description: The Guarda Rios, or kingfisher, lives in the vineyards that produce this wine, which is bright pink, strawberry flavored, attractively dry and crisp.
title: Vale d'Algares 2009 Guarda Rios Rosé (Tejo)

description: This ripe, fruity blend of Touriga Nacional and Alfrocheiro is zesty and lightly spicy, with a warm, ripe character. The strawberry fruit is laced with acidity, allowing the smooth texture to shine. Drink now.
title: Global Wines 2016 Cabriz Rosé Colheita Seleccionada Rosé (Dão)

description: Made from 100% Gamay, this is a crisp wine with attractive acidity, red currant fruit and a spicy aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Philippe Viallet 2016 Savoie Rosé (Vin de Savoie)

description: Produced from 100% Touriga Nacional, this is a crisp, dry wine, full of red-currant fruits and with a tang of citrus. This attractive wine is ready to drink.
title: CARM 2016 Vinha da Urze Rosé (Douro)

description: This 100% Pinot Noir rosé is ripe and full of red fruit, with a touch of caramel. It shows an attractive streak of acidity on the finish.
title: Saget la Perrière 2016 La Petite Perrière Pinot Noir Rosé (Vin de France)

description: This is an easy, fruity wine made from Grenache. It has a clean, bright character, reflecting its red currant fruitiness and crispness.
title: Vinadeis 2016 Le Val Grenache Rosé (Vin de France)

description: This is a refreshing crisp wine. Made from Pinot Gris, it has a light color, red-currant fruits and lively acidity. With a delicate perfume, it is a bright wine to drink now.
title: Jean-Michel Sorbe 2016 Rosé (Reuilly)

description: This crisp, lively blend of Niellucciu (Sangiovese) and Grenache is deliciously refreshing. Its acidity and orange fruitiness are lifted by its tight texture and bright aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Les Vins Bréban 2016 Domaine Casa Rossa Rosé (Ile de Beauté)

description: Made from Caladoc, a grape variety created in 1958 by crossing Grenache and Malbec, this medium-bodied rosé is restrained in style, with ginger and citrus notes accenting strawberry fruit. It's dry and refreshing on the finish. Drink now.
title: Franck & Olivier Mousset 2016 Tendance Caladoc Rosé (Mediterranée)

description: This spicy wine is fruity while also complex with its combination of red berries and a pepper edge. It is full and ripe with a light crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Jérôme Gueneau 2016 Le Clos Chartier Rosé (Sancerre)

description: This is an impressive wine that's full of fruit, structure and acidity. It's well balanced, rich and crisply fresh, with lively acidity on the finish—a real food-friendly rosé.
title: Château de Pampelonne 2011 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: With its striking (and heavy) square white bottle, this wine will certainly make a statement on any table. The wine itself, with Hubert de Bouärd (whose family owns Château Angélus) as consultant, is impressively ripe and concentrated, but still retains its crisp, fresh poise. The acidity at the end is intense and tight.
title: Château de Berne 2015 Pur Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Structured, tight and mineral, this wine comes from a selection of old vines in a northwest-facing vineyard on the Rimauresq estate. It offers a tang, along with a firm structure and concentration. A fruitier aftertaste will show through more strongly by late 2016.
title: Château Rimauresq 2015 R de Rimauresq Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Made from low-yielding, 70-year-old vines, this is a dense wine with an almost-dark structure and ripe red-plum flavors. Powerful, it obviously will be better with food and could even benefit from decanting before drinking. Age this concentrated wine until late 2016.
title: Domaine du Clos Gautier 2015 Clos du Château Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The Mourvèdre in this blend gives this wine a distinctive perfumed, structured character. Soft and rich yellow and tropical-fruit flavors are spiced with the edge of tannins and youthful red-fruit flavors. It is intensely ripe and also crisp with acidity. Drink from late 2016.
title: Domaines Ott 2015 Château Romassan Rosé (Bandol)

description: Pale salmon in color, this wine is 63% Mourvèdre and 37% Grenache. Aromas of fresh strawberry, watermelon, spice and cherry lead to bone-dry mouthwatering fruit flavors. It brings a lot of appeal.
title: Ardor 2016 Painted Hills Vineyard Rosé (Yakima Valley)

description: Almost mauve in color, this widely distributed wine (named after the time the winemaking crew pops open their bottles at home) shows candied strawberry, watermelon Jolly Rancher and a touch of slate on the nose. Tons of tongue-tingling acidity and a expertly grippy texture cut through the watermelon and raspberry flavors.
title: Noble Vines 2016 515 Vine Select Rosé (Central Coast)

description: This wine shows hints of tar or rubber when first poured, so decant it for best effect. Once past those, berry and citrus aromas and flavors emerge, lingering on the long, mocha-tinged finish.
title: Les Vignerons de Tavel 2016 Les Lauzeraies  (Tavel)

description: This is tutti-frutti in scent, with a pear drop note that is loud and clear. It's light to medium in body, lacking some focus and concentration.
title: Chateau Morrisette 2011 Dry Rosé (Virginia)

description: A pickle-barrel aroma hits the nose first, before the notes of red berries, rose petals and bitter papaya seeds surface. The wine feels soft initially, but the acids gain some lift on the midpalate. The papaya seed note becomes more concentrated with time.
title: Rosemont 2011 Rosé (Virginia)

description: On the sweet side, this offers a soft texture, a slightly bitter edge and a pruny fruit flavor.
title: Stanburn 2011 Bull's Blush Rosé (Virginia)

description: Finished quite dry, this brings tart rhubarb and sour berry fruit to bear, backed with ample acidity. It was whole cluster pressed, blended with Pinot Noir saignée, and cold fermented in stainless steel. It's a good picnic rosé, ready for cured meats and soft cheeses.
title: Coelho 2015 Divertimento Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir Rosé (Willamette Valley)

description: From a Chablis producer, this rosé is cool, crisp and fresh. It has plenty of red fruits and a tight mineral texture. A smooth caramel flavor balanced by juicy acidity keeps the wine deliciously refreshing.
title: Domaine Céline et Frédéric Gueguen 2015  Bourgogne

description: Made from 85% Grenache and 15% Syrah, both from Kick Ranch Vineyard, this salmon-colored quaffer was fermented in concrete, and is hard to describe aromatically, taking its time to open. Dry, it tastes of watermelon and a hint of clove-like spice, remaining fresh on the palate and lightweight.
title: Kale 2014 Rosé (Sonoma County)

description: A blend of co-fermented Syrah (60%) and Viognier, this wine is a very pretty pale copper color with just a tinge of salmon. It offers nuanced aromas of pear, strawberry and white flowers. The palate is dry and fresh, sleek but with depth and texture to the fruit flavors.
title: Waters 2015 Rosé (Washington)

description: Fresh green herbs on the nose accumulate fruit and floral notes on the palate of this pretty but robust rosé. A blend of Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Chardonnay and Gewürztraminer, it offers intense red berry and watermelon fruitiness along with a pleasantly clingy, silken mouthfeel.
title: Wölffer 2015 Summer in Bottle Rosé (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Made from 62% Grenache, 15% Syrah, 15% Mourvèdre and 8% Counoise, this perennial delight is Demeter-certified Biodynamic and tastes as fresh as a summer day. Orange, grapefruit and lemon give it a sizzling refreshment and high level of acidity, while the texture of the wine stays smooth and luxurious.
title: Quivira 2014 Rosé (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Robust in body and alcohol, this lavish Pinot Noir rosé offers juicy blackberry and cherry flavors. Dry in style with a rich, slightly dense texture, it suggests pairing with a full meal rather than enjoying as an apéritif.
title: Heron Hill 2016 Reserve Pinot Noir Rosé (Finger Lakes)

description: Made from 50% Syrah, 40% Grenache and 10% Cinsault, this opens with ripe peach and red-berry aromas that are framed by mentholated herbal tones. The medium-weight palate offers a round mouthfeel and soft acidity, followed by a lightly pithy finish.
region_1: Coteaux du Languedoc Pic Saint Loup
title: Château de Lancyre 2016 Le Rosé (Coteaux du Languedoc Pic Saint Loup)

description: Made from 40% Syrah, 40% Grenache and 20% Mourvèdre, this rosé leads with herbal scents of garrigue herbs and peppercorn that dance atop fruity tones of ripe red cherry and plum skin. The soft, round palate offers richer tones of watermelon candy and peach preserves, while ample acidity lifts the finish and provides a clean close.
title: Domaine de Nizas 2016 Les Pierres Blanches Rosé (Languedoc)

description: This is toasty and vanilla-laden, but stands out for its full-bodied, lush character and intense fruit, which powers through on the finish.
title: Château d'Esclans 2007 Garrus Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Melon, Animal Cracker and tropical fruit aromas lead to a plump but solidly fresh palate. A mix of stone-fruit and pink-grapefruit flavors is chiseled, and tastes a touch peppery on the finish.
title: Borsao 2016 Rosé (Campo de Borja)

description: Light to medium in body, this rosé is crisper and tauter than many coming out of the Southern Rhône. Zest citrus aromas lead into flavors of grapefruit, with crushed stone notes reverberating on the finish. Drink now.
title: Domaine de Mourchon 2016 Loubié Rosé

description: Initial whiffs of smoke and spring ramps blow off with significant aeration, revealing fresh tart notes of raspberry and cherry. Dry and medium bodied in style, it's a refreshingly brisk Pinot Noir rosé that rewards those with patience.
title: Fox Run 2016 Dry Rosé (Finger Lakes)
