description: There's a subtle earthy funkiness to this 100% Carignan-based rosé, with supporting notes of white cherry, currant and strawberry hull. The light-weight palate offers decent acidic lift and finished short but clean.
title: VillaViva 2015 Rosé (Côtes de Thau)

description: There is enough crispness to make this ripe wine tight and fruity. Its dry strawberry fruitiness comes with a light touch of pepper. Drink now.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2015 Periquita Rosé (Península de Setúbal)

description: Dark colored for a modern rosé, this is a ripe blend of two Cabernets, Syrah and Tannat. Red fruits and a rich texture make for a wine that is almost sweet in character, certainly floral and perfumed. Drink now.
title: Domaine de Ménard 2015 Rosé (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: Made from 40% Syrah, 40% Grenache and 20% Mourvedre, this offers medium-intense aromas of medicinal cherry and raspberry, with a white chocolate accent. Fleshy and round, there's a heaviness to the midpalate, while cherry skin and sweet spice tones grace the finish.
title: Domaine de Nizas 2015 Rosé (Languedoc)

description: Briny citrus aromas are pungent, and in general this runs strong on pyrazines and bell pepper scents. A tight, juicy, firm palate is home to citric flavors of pink grapefruit and orange.
title: Calcu 2014 Rosé (Colchagua Valley)

description: Dry, rubbery aromas are low on fruit. This is pulpy and citric in feel, with flavors of apple cider, brown sugar and caramel. Sweetness carries onto the finish, which tastes mostly of molasses offset by citrus.
title: Emiliana 2014 Natura Rosé (Central Valley)

description: Get through the dirty nose and there is plenty of red fruit and acidity. The wine is dry and fruity but spoiled by that rustic edge at the beginning.
title: Casa Cadaval 2013 Vinha Padre Pedro Rosé (Tejo)

description: Labeled both as Orange and Rosé, this is Pinot Gris fermented on the skins, then aged in neutral oak for several months. A pretty sunset color, slightly oxidized, and aromatic with dried apricot and pear fruit, it's a wine for those with more-than-average curiosity. Highlights of dark chocolate and coffee creep in to a lingering finish.
title: Vista Hills 2013 Treehouse Orange Wine Rosé (Willamette Valley)

description: This blend of Aragonez and Touriga Nacional is particularly crisp and fruity. It has some richness, but it is the bright red berry and red currant fruit that makes it so refreshing. Drink now.
designation: Herdade de São Miguel Colheita Seleccionada
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2015 Herdade de São Miguel Colheita Seleccionada Rosé (Alentejano)

description: Forward aromas of menthol, bay, lavender and pink flowers dominate the nose of this pretty rosé, with soft notes of orange, melon and underripe peach underneath. The medium-weight palate shows some roundness, though it's lifted by ample acidity and a pithy astringency that graces the finish.
title: Domaine de Viranel 2015 Trilogie Rosé (Pays d'Oc)

description: A pale, almost water-like color in the glass, this is a light and nuanced rosé. Scents of white cherry, melon rind, orange peel and sweet grass unfold in the bouquet and carry through to the light-bodied palate. A tart red-currant flavor and citric vibrancy linger on the close. Drink now.
title: Gérard Bertrand 2015 Gris Blanc Rosé (Pays d'Oc)

description: This well-balanced wine is poised easily between ripe red fruits and some light tannins. It has great spice, attractive perfumed acidity and great style. Touches of pineapple give a more tropical character to the aftertaste.
title: Château Roubine 2015 Premium Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A buoyant wine, this has delicious acidity and a soft, immediately accessible texture. Red berries give a lively, perfumed fruitiness to this open wine that smells and tastes of sunshine.
title: Domaine de la Sanglière 2015 La Riviera Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A blend of Grenache and Cinsault, this is as light as its color, with refreshing red-berry fruits and a touch of pepper. The wine dances elegantly and leaves a crisp, bright aftertaste.
title: Domaine de l'Amaurigue 2015 Fleur de l'Amaurigue Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Dominated by Grenache (60%), this wine is soft and easily fruity. Along with attractive flavors of red fruits, pear and citrus, it has a light tang of lime zest and a ripe, full-bodied aftertaste.
title: Domaine du Grand Cros 2015 L'Esprit de Provence Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The herbal flavors of the wild garrigue go through this pale, almost white wine. It does have a touch of tannin giving a structure, as well as a cool character from the high elevation of the vineyards. The aftertaste is refreshing.
title: Château Pigoudet 2015 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: The grandmother of Serge Davico, the winemaker at the estate, is memorialized in this wine. A perfumed wine, it's tight with acidity and with floral overtones. The ripe red fruit is right up there along with a smooth texture and aftertaste.
title: Domaine Terre de Mistral 2015 Rosalie Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: A light and fruity wine, this is attractively crisp and with a caramel edge. The wine is bright with touches of orange and lively final acidity. Drink now.
title: La Belle Collection 2016 La Belle Colette Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This wine is soft and light. It has a gentle fruity character, with soft acidity. Well chilled on a hot day, this will be refreshing.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2016 Domaine Fontval Grenache-Mourvèdre Rosé (Mediterranée)

description: A light and soft wine, this is gently fruity with some attractive acidity. The wine is on the bland side, clean but without much interest. Drinkable now.
title: Fabre en Provence 2016 Château Saint-Honoré Rosé (Côtes de Provence La Londe)

description: A crisp nose is trimmed with light citrus and chewing gum notes. Hollow on the palate, this deals dilute citrus and nectarine flavors in front of a quickly fading finish.
title: Txakoli Primo 2016 Zarautz Rosé

description: This is a sturdy, dry wine with hefty texture and straightforward, almost neutral flavors. It has an unusual salmon-amber color, light peach aromas and slightly earthy notes on the palate.
title: Ambrose 2015 AMB Rosé (California)

description: With its floral rose motif, the bottle is attractive in itself. The rosé inside comes to life with crisp red fruits and lively acidity. This wine has a real freshness with a tangy texture, spice and a perfumed aftertaste.
title: Château Roubine 2015 La Vie en Rose Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a delicious, perfumed and fruity wine. It is crisp and clean, bright with acidity and ripe in raspberry flavors. This wine is a perfect summer quaffing rosé.
title: Château Valcolombe 2015 Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: Owned by the Quiot family of Châteauneuf-du-Pape, this is one of a pair of wines produced from the region of Sainte-Victoire. It is a full and fruity wine, rich with raspberries and freshened by final grapefruit acidity.
title: Domaine Houchart 2015 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Bunan's 18th-century castle is called Belle Raisin—Bélouvé in the old Provençal dialect (beautiful grapes in English). With a range of varieties in the blend, it is an attractively integrated wine that has red cherry, raspberry and crisp apple flavors. It is lively and full of ripe fruits, with just a touch of pepper at the end.
title: Domaines Bunan 2015 Bélouvé Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A warm blend mainly of Grenache with Carignan and Cabernet Sauvignon, this wine is typically pale in color, with just a touch of tannin from the Cabernet. A spicy undertone balances with the deliciously crisp and fresh red-fruit character.
title: Château de Beaupré 2015 Baron Maxime Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Think of a pink version of Beaujolais Nouveau. The grapy flavors light up this light-bodied, extroverted rosé even more than the almost fluorescent pink color. Very fresh, light and frothy and all those qualities seem right for it.
title: Helwig 2013 Rosé de Shenandoah Rosé (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

description: Light and bright, this is a direct and easygoing rosé, with attractive aromas and flavors of red currant, ruby-red grapefruit rind, white melon and peach. The medium-weight palate is lifted by refreshing, citrus-flavored acidity, ending with an orange and strawberry-hull fueled finish.
designation: Tête de Cuvée Grain de Gris
title: Listel 2013 Tête de Cuvée Grain de Gris Rosé (Sable de Camargue)

description: One of Spain's top value-oriented rosés. It's inviting, colorful, easy to understand and tasty. Aromas of fresh fruits and melon get it going, while the palate is clean, fresh, only mildly candied and full of cherry and red plum flavors. Scores high by keeping it simple. Drink ASAP.
title: Borsao 2008 Rosé (Campo de Borja)

description: Crisp and classic, with a nose and flavors of lemon, raspberry and spice. Clean and delicate, the wine will show well next to grilled seafood, salads and lighter fare.
title: Wölffer 2008 Grandioso Rosé (Long Island)

description: Made from Cabernet Franc, this light sunset-pink-colored wine has a rounded character. A touch of caramel fills out the palate and cuts down on the acidity. Red fruits and an orange tang leave a fresh taste. Drink now.
title: Alliance Loire 2014 Domaine de la Lysardière Rosé (Chinon)

description: This rosé, a blend of Cinsault and Syrah, is a rather low-intensity offering with minor notes of red cherry and berry fruit accented by a white chocolate creaminess in the mouth. A versatile food wine with medium weight and an overall easiness.
title: Domaine Sainte-Eugénie 2010 Rosé (Corbières)

description: A fluorescent pink color introduces this soft, full and fruity wine with fine, balanced acidity. There is a touch of caramel, along with crisp acidity from red-cherry flavors. Ready to drink. Screwcap.
title: Pratsch 2012 Rosé (Niederösterreich)

description: An attractively fruity wine—fragrant, fresh and with a touch of tannin. Raspberry flavors give the wine a good lift. Drink it this year.
title: Bernard Magrez 2012 Château Pérenne Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This is a lightly fruity wine with attractive red currant and raspberry flavors. It's bright, crisp, touched by vanilla and finished with citrus acidity. Screwcap.
title: Fischer 2012 Classic Rosé (Thermenregion)

description: Soft, fruity strawberry flavors give this wine a warm, sunny feel. The acidity and texture kick in on the palate, adding balance. Fruity but food-friendly, it finishes dry.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2012 Domaine la Rabiotte Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: A rosé with a difference: this is rich in texture and body as if it were barrel aged. It has a light peach color, plus delicate strawberry and peach aromas. A creamy mouthfeel carries the fruit flavors and adds hints of vanilla and baking spices.
title: Bink 2013 Lumineux Rosé (Yorkville Highlands)

description: This medium-pink rosé is a blend of 40% Grenache, 40% Mourvèdre and 20% Cinsault. A silken texture easily carries restrained fruit shadings of strawberry and kiwi, along with plummier undertones, through a long finish. Ready to drink now, although it might still be a pleasant surprise come 2015.
title: Château de Nages 2013 Vieilles Vignes Rosé (Costières de Nîmes)

description: Fruity and bold, this opens with direct aromas of cherry, strawberry and pomegranate that are accented by hints of sweet pea, violet and lavender. The medium-weight palate offers ample lifting acidity and a finish of tart red berries and watermelon rind.
title: Château du Donjon 2015 Rosé (Minervois)

description: Shimmering with the palest salmon pink, this is a softly scented, restrained but very refreshing rosé. Absolutely dry, it majors on fresh lemon notes with tart inflections of red currant. The slightest fizz helps the freshness even more. Lovely.
title: Iby 2015 Rosé (Burgenland)

description: The product of a partnership between Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie with the Perrin family of Château Beaucastel in Châteauneuf-du-Pape, this bottling achieves instant fame. Happily, it is also a very fine wine, perfectly balanced between crisp fruit and acidity. In the background a touch of tannin accompanies pepper and minerality. It is ready to drink.
title: Château Miraval 2015 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Simultaneously light, vivacious and flavor-packed, this bottling is a lightly faded shade of pink in the glass, and shows delicate bubble gum, sliced watermelon, pink rose buds and a squeeze of lime on the nose. The blend of 45% Grenache, 30% Mourvèdre and 25% Syrah offers zesty acidity and a pithy texture on the palate, with bright tangerine, lemon pith and a touch of strawberry fruit.
title: Clos Solène 2015 La Rosa Rosé (Paso Robles)

description: This is a rich wine, full bodied and packed with fruit. Ripe red-berry flavors are just touched by pepper and spice. It comes from selected parcels in the Faulkner family's estate, giving a concentrated, dense wine that will work best with food.
title: Domaine du Grand Cros 2015 Aurélia Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Organic grapes grown on the estate's schist soil go into this delicious, ripe and clean wine. Shot through with a good balance of red berries, red currants and tight acidity, it has good depth of flavor along with a surface glitter of bright freshness.
title: Domaine Saint-André de Figuière 2015 Première de Figuière Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This wine has an herbal aroma and a crisp palate that delivers tropical fruits cut by grapefruit. The wine comes from the privileged Mont Saint-Victoire vineyards, named after the path that runs along the south side of the mountain. It has a distinctly mineral texture and perfumed acidity. At the end, the wine is bright, tight and crisp.
title: Gassier 2015 Le Pas du Moine Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: Soft and candied, this is a ripe wine that has sweet strawberry-fruit flavors. It is ready to drink.
title: Quinta da Calçada 2015 Lago Cerqueira Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: Nice spice and strawberry fruit. The blend is a mish-mash—half Merlot, the rest Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah, Cab Franc, Viognier and Malbec. Not that it makes a huge difference in a rosé, but it does seem a bit diffuse as a result. Nonetheless, a good sipping wine.
title: Kestrel 2006 Rosé (Yakima Valley)

description: This is attractively fruity, crisp and perfumed. With red currant fruits and refreshing acidity, it's fresh and light in character. Drink now.
title: Producta Vignobles 2013 La Cabanne aux Oiseaux Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This Rhône varietal-based, pink lemonade-colored rosé starts with warm watermelon and sharp lime zest on the fresh, bright nose. The 71% Grenache, 18% Cinsault, 6% Counoise, 5% Mourvèdre blend offers light cherry flavors, some honey and a bit of bubblegum, with nice grip and racy acidity taking it to the finish line.
title: Adelaida 2013 Version Anna's Estate Rosé (Paso Robles)

description: Notes of crushed stone and restrained melon fruit combine in this medium-bodied rosé. It's a pleasant quaff, with a clean but abbreviated finish.
title: Gabriel Meffre 2015 La Châsse Prestige Rosé (Côtes du Rhône)

description: Pale salmon-colored, this is all Cabernet Franc. Aromas of herbs, flowers and green pepper are followed by bone-dry flavors that linger.
title: Dusty Cellars 2015 Rosé (Columbia Gorge (WA))

description: The Audibert family estate, close to beautiful Aix-en-Provence, is now run organically. The wine, rich and with delicious ripe fruits, is full in the mouth, packed with red-berry flavors that are cut with red currants and lemon zest. It is a very fine wine, ready now.
title: Château de Calavon 2016 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: This is a rich wine, packed with red-berry fruits. Despite its density and ripe fruits, it has a fine streak of acidity that keeps it lively and crisp. It comes from vines close to the Mediterranean, resulting in a slightly salty character as well as the warm feel to this food-friendly wine. Drink from late 2017.
title: Château des Bormettes 2016 Instinct Parcellaire Rosé (Côtes de Provence La Londe)

description: This is a serious rosé. It has plenty of fruitiness of course, but it also has texture and the potential to age a few months. The wine is rich, full of red-berry fruits and with a touch of minerality. It is fruity now, but will be best from early 2018.
title: Château d'Ollières 2016 Haut de l'Autin Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: Rose petal notes perfume this intensely aromatic rosé, accenting concentrated sour cherry and raspberry flavors. A robust blend of Merlot and Cabernet Franc, it's dry in style but rich and ripe with fruit flavors. A hint of chalk and salinity mark the elegant finish.
title: Shinn Estate 2013 Rosé (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Tempranlillo is not the most common base for California rosé, but this might change some minds. It veers into the orange spectrum of pink color, and smells like a grapefruit spritzer. On the palate, there's lemon bar, almond paste, and bubblegum, but any perceived sweetness is wiped away by brisk acidity and a slightly bitter quality too. The layers of flavor are impressive.
title: ONX 2013 Indie Rosé (Paso Robles)

description: As pale in color as it comes, this is a delicate, delicious wine. Vanilla flavors vie with the freshest acidity and then ripe red plum fruits to give a wine that is both rounded and crisp.
title: Château Léoube 2013 Sécret de Léoube Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Crisp red apples and tight fruit skins give this wine a taut, lively character. Just a touch of caramel to broaden the acidity.
title: Mas de Cadenet 2009 Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: A full-bodied, mouthfilling rosé from the Côtes-du-Rhône, the 2007 Réserve Grand Veneur features slightly confected cherry aromas and a tangy finish. It's a solid effort, best served alongside burgers or the like.
title: Alain Jaume et Fils 2007 Réserve Grand Veneur Rosé (Côtes du Rhône)

description: One of the top estates in the Côtes du Ventoux, Fondrèche's rosé is pale salmon in color, with aromas of peaches and cherries. It's fruity and fleshy on the palate, with just a hint of bubblegum on the finish.
title: Domaine de Fondrèche 2007 L'Instant Rosé (Côtes-du-Ventoux)

description: Very fresh, light and a little candylike in flavor, this vivid-pink wine is dry and fruity. It is charming and easy to sip.
title: Scotto Family Cellars 2016 Dry Sangiovese Rosé (Lodi)

description: The brilliant garnet-pink color of this wine makes a great first impression but the wine loses a few points on the nose where Camembert cheese or Parmigiano-like aromas are a distraction. Red-berry fruit fragrances do work their way to the top and the wine has an attractive crisp, spicy close.
title: Cantina Terlano 2006 Rosé (Alto Adige)

description: Soft and fruity, this is an attractive, light and perfumed rosé. It has delicious vanilla flavors, red and white fruits all laced with a good citrus element and a bright aftertaste. Screwcap.
title: Domaine Guillaman 2012 Rosé (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: This popular brand's pink version is off dry, lightly fizzy and fruity. It has a strawberry-sherbet character that is attractive and great for summer drinking.
title: Aveleda 2015 Casal Garcia Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: The first impression is that this is slightly off dry. It's a 50-50 blend of saignéed Syrah and lightly pressed Pinot Noir. It's tannic and disjointed, with sour watermelon and lemon flavors, despite that first hint of sweetness.
title: Coeur de Terre 2015 Rustique Rosé (Willamette Valley)

description: There is an attractive light sparkle to this off-dry rosé. It has strawberry fruit and a touch of acidity that balances the candied softness. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Raza 2015 Dom Diogo Padeiro Colheita Seleccionada Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: A light, sweet wine that has a faint prickle and candied-strawberry flavors. It is ready to drink.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2015 Flamingo Escolha Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: Bright and perfumed while also rich, this is a full-bodied wine. It has spice and pepper that come from its alcohol although everything is kept fresh by the red-currant fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Château d'Azur 2015 Jardin du Soleil Cuvée Prestige Rosé (Bandol)

description: The Mourvèdre in this ripe wine lends a wonderful spice and herbal character. While the wine is full and rich, it also has a fine refreshing line of raspberry fruit. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Château d'Azur 2015 Tradition Rosé (Bandol)

description: This pale peach, lightly bricked wine brings aromas of strawberry and melon rind. It drinks dry with a broad feel and fruit flavors that linger.
title: Fielding Hills 2015 Estate Riverbend Vineyard Cabernet Franc Rosé (Wahluke Slope)

description: Light, fruity, very crisp in character, this is an apple and citrus driven wine as much as red fruits. There is an attractive, exotic touch of pomegranate fruits that add an extra dimension to this lively, fresh wine.
title: Domaines Ott 2012 Château de Selle Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A pale pink color, this clean, refreshing rosé offers nuanced notes of strawberry hull, white melon rind and just-ripe peach on the nose and mouth. The bright, juicy palate is zippy and refreshing, with lively acidity and citrus-driven flavors that carry through to the mouthwatering finish.
title: Les Jamelles 2016 Clair de Rosé (Pays d'Oc)

description: Citrus peel and raw, fresh herbs dance in the nose of this delicate pale-pink rosé, with supporting tones of white cherry and apple blossom. It's clean and bright on the palate, showing beautiful harmony and acidic verve that carries through to the refreshing finish.
designation: Vin Biodynamique Rosé de Nymphe Emue
title: Château Maris 2016 Vin Biodynamique Rosé de Nymphe Emue Rosé (Pays d'Oc)

description: This blend of 50% Grenache, 25% Syrah and 25% Mourvèdre is reasonably light in body. The notes of crushed stone, berries, citrus and spice pick up a hint of brine on the palate, then finish tart and cleansing.
title: Château Roustan 2016 Rosé (Costières de Nîmes)

description: This pours an extremely pale-pink color, with dainty aromas of white cranberry, cherry and orange blossom in the bouquet. The lightweight palate is bright and lively, with good verve and tart berry and citrus flavors that finish quick yet clean. Drink now.
title: Domaine de la Métairie d'Alon 2016 Le Village Pinot Noir Rosé (Pays d'Oc)

description: Made from tank-fermented Pinot Noir and Cabernet Sauvignon, saignée-method, this wine is lightly floral and crisp in acidity, subtle in ripeness. Cherry and vanilla flavor meld together well, providing understated refreshment.
title: Emerald Hare 2016 Rosé (Napa Valley)

description: Intense bramble notes and a hint of earth lend savoriness to crisp red cherry and berry in this dry rosé. While delicate in concentration, refreshing acidity and brisk texture make this a lovely summer apéritif.
title: Fulkerson 2016 Estate Rosé (Finger Lakes)

description: Two thirds Syrah and one-third Mourvèdre, this highly aromatic rosé features hints of passion fruit alongside confected, bubblegum flavors balanced by a squirt of lime on the finish. Drink now.
title: Jean-Luc Colombo 2015 Cape Bleue Rosé (Mediterranée)

description: Deep in color, this rosé of Cabernet Sauvignon lacks zip and zest on a lazy nose. A chunky, grabby mouthfeel gives off the sensation of grape skins, while this tastes a bit foxy and herbal, with little to no fruit character.
title: Autoritas 2015 Shiraz-Cabernet Rosé (Central Valley)

description: This wine has an attractive salmon-pink color followed by ripe caramel and spice flavors. The fruit and acidity don't feature as strongly, so the end result is a wine that is fat.
title: Château de Cornemps 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This wine has a herbal character that doesn't mesh with the lightly tannic and tangy structure. The effect is of a wine that comes from grapes that were too green.
title: VIgnobles Ducourt 2015 Château Larroque Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: A strong caramel aroma and flavor spoils the suggestions of fruit. They give a ripe, almost sweet character that doesn't match with the red-currant fruit flavors.
title: Château de la Vieille Tour 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Light, fruity wine, hinting at strawberries, along with a vanilla touch from the Merlot in the blend. It's crisp and ready to drink.
title: Domaine de Lartigue 2012 Rosé (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: Bone-dry, this blend of Negrette, Malbec and Gamay is rich, packed with strawberry fruits and spice. A touch of vanilla makes the acidity ripe and soft. Drink this attractive rosé now.
title: Château Bouissel 2013 Rosenc Rosé (Fronton)

description: This delicious wine offers subtle barrel nuances, with ripe plum and strawberry fruits. Along with this is a stylish crispness, just touched by spice and toast. This is a serious wine, intended for food.
title: Château d'Esclans 2010 Garrus Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This estate wine is packed with attractive fruit. With grapefruit and orange-zest flavors, it is tightly crisp. Set against that are the ripe red-currant and berry fruitiness, layers of acidity and a pinch of pepper. Drink this refreshing wine now.
title: Château les Valentines 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Under the same ownership as Château Roubine, this estate has old vines, some up to 60-years-old. The wine is rich and with concentration as well as a crisper edge. It is full of red-berry fruits, sharpened with red-currant acidity. This is a ripe wine that will be better from late 2017.
title: Château Sainte-Béatrice 2016 Instant B Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is the top wine from the Sainte Roseline estate. With a perfect salmon-pink color, the wine is ripe and full of red fruits that are softly integrated with the acidity. It is a food-style of wine, lit by spice and finished with a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
designation: Cuvée la Chapelle de Sainte Roseline
title: Château Sainte Roseline 2016 Cuvée la Chapelle de Sainte Roseline Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This blend of 80% Grenache and 20% Cinsault comes from a 100-acre property in the center of the Côtes de Provence. The wine is ripe and with great fruit. There is a touch of spice and pepper that gives the wine an attractive edge. It is all about delicious red-currant and orange-zest fruit. Drink now.
title: Domaine de l'Amaurigue 2016 Fleur de l'Amaurigue Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The Gavoty family has been at this estate since 1806. This is their top rosé, a rich wine that is powered by ripe red-cherry and spice flavors. The wine is food friendly with a mineral texture and dry firm aftertaste. Don't hesitate to drink this wine from late 2017.
title: Domaine Gavoty 2016 Cuvée Clarendon Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a really fruity, attractive wine from a fine estate. It is crisp with delicious acidity and a lively texture that gives the wine a refreshing tang. The wine is up front, full of fruitiness and ready to drink.
title: Domaine Houchart 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a delicious fruity wine with a fine line of acidity that cuts right through the orange and red-currant fruits. It is bright with acidity and just a light mineral edge to give a textured and fruity aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Domaine Jas d'Esclans 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: An amber-peach color and slight cloudiness signal that this dry wine is atypical. Its aromas are buttery and earthy, its flavors are savory and substantial (think melon and prosciutto), and the texture is unusually creamy, giving it a long, lingering finish. With great, supportive acidity and a touch of tannic grip, it's not a simple apéritif, calling instead for bold tapas or charcuterie.
title: Donkey & Goat 2016 Isabel's Cuvée Gibson Ranch Rosé (Mendocino)

description: Coral in color, this dry wine's light, fresh watermelon aromas lead to tasty raspberry and cherry flavors, backed by bright acidity. It's medium bodied and mouth-filling, maintaining a refreshing, appetizing quality through the finish.
title: Acquiesce 2016 Grenache Rosé (Lodi)

description: Domaine Houchart is one of the top estates in Sainte-Victoire. This ripe while deliciously fruity and fresh wine is full of raspberries, ripe red currants and a refreshing line of acidity.
title: Domaine Houchart 2013 Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: A crisp, very textured wine that has red fruits and a salty edge from the closeness of the vines to the sea. It has a mineral texture, grapefruit and raspberry flavors, intense and bone dry. The wine needs food to be at its best.
title: Les Vignobles Gueissard 2013 Cuvée G Rosé (Bandol)

description: From 100-plus-year-old Carignane vines, with splashes of Grenache, too, this is a refreshing wine for spring and summer. Stony in grapefruit and peach, it's balanced, light and dry with a fruity kick.
title: McCay Cellars 2012 Rosé (Lodi)

description: This lovely rosé is made from certified sustainable grapes of indeterminate variety. Slightly effervescent in tart cherry and mint, there's a textured, complex layering of strawberry and raspberry in the mix that makes the wine bright and refreshing.
title: Benziger 2013 Dry Rosé (Sonoma Mountain)

description: Hints of bramble accent bright raspberry and peach scents on this refreshingly dry rosé. Juicy and fresh on the palate, it balances intense cherry and wild strawberry flavors with a brisk, brash acidity that drives a long finish.
title: Wölffer 2013 Rosé (Long Island)

description: A rich wine, it adds a finely textured dimension to the red fruitiness and fresh acidity. With complex fruits, structure as well as the attractive crispness, it's a dry wine, best drunk with food.
title: Château de Calavon 2013 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: This is a perfumed, fragrant wine. Its acidity is offset by the red berry and currant fruits that add freshness to the dry, crisp character. It's a full wine, with good fruit depth and ripe flavors, and will be better with food. Drink now.
title: Jean Reverdy et Fils 2014 Les Villots Rosé (Sancerre)

description: One of the top estates in the Côtes du Ventoux, Fondrèche's rosé is pale salmon in color, with aromas of peaches and cherries. It's fruity and fleshy on the palate, with just a hint of bubblegum on the finish.
title: Domaine de Fondrèche 2007 L'Instant Rosé (Côtes-du-Ventoux)

description: This rosé from Campania in southern Italy offers beautifully toned aromas of berry fruit, raspberry, cranberry and blueberry. The wine exhibits a dark pink color and an easy, light approach in the mouth. Pair it with salads or light pasta lunches. A Marc de Grazia selection; various American importers.
title: De Angelis 2007 Rosato Rosé (Lacryma Christi del Vesuvio)

description: Pale copper colored, this wine is more focused on mineral than fruit expression, with aromas of wet stone out in front of citrus rind. The medium-bodied flavors dance lightly on the palate but still show concentration, texture and balance.
title: Cayuse 2013 Edith Grenache Armada Vineyard Rosé (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: This mouthwatering rosé is a traditional blend of 50% Grenache, 40% Syrah and 10% Mourvèdre. It's medium-bodied, boasting notes of fresh herbs, cherries and white chocolate, balanced by a hints of sea spray. Drink it over the next year.
title: Mas Carlot 2014 Rosé (Costières de Nîmes)

description: 100% Sangiovese, this pale pink wine has notes of bubblegum, wild strawberry and spice. It drinks dry with medium-bodied flavors that linger on the finish.
title: Ross Andrew 2013 Meadow Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Pretty and fresh, with vibrant, well-defined strawberry fruit on the nose set against a backdrop of white flowers. Turns a bit simple and fleeting in the mouth. Drink up.
title: Xavier Flouret 2009 Nationale 7 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Almost red in color, with dusty aromas that mix in a blast of latex and dried cherry notes. The wine is made from organically grown Bobal grapes, and it offers tang and bite along with crisp flavors of plum skins, raspberry and citrus. Almost sour, but not. A solid quaffer for the price.
title: Iranzo Fields 2009 Albero Bobal Rosé (Utiel-Requena)

description: A three-grape rosé, this blends Pinot Gris, Merlot and Syrah to make a mahogany/copper-colored wine with a soft, spicy character. It was barrel-aged in neutral oak. There is a good mix of stone fruit flavors, though some of the grapes may have been a little too ripe, and the wine's finish reflects that, with just a hint of rot.
title: Cathedral Ridge 2008 Rosé (Columbia Valley (OR))

description: Boldly fruity, redolent with cherries and pink grapefruit, this medium-bodied rosé does have a slightly candied quality to it, but remains a decent summertime quaff. Serve well chilled to help mute the apparent sweetness.
title: Angove's 2009 Nine Vines Grenache-Shiraz Rosé (South Australia)

description: With some weight, this has raspberry flavor to go with its sweetness. Berry fruits dominate in a wine that is full in the mouth.
title: Château de Fesles 2010  Rosé d'Anjou

description: Wood aging (hence the extra year before release) gives this wine richness and a smooth texture. It does take away some freshness but the ripe red fruits give a rounded character that puts the wine firmly in the food-friendly category.
title: Quinta do Perdigão 2015 Rosé (Dão)

description: This blended rosé is ripe and fruity, with a spicy edge that makes it excellent with food. Its red fruit, acidity and crisp, tight texture make it tangy and ready to drink.
title: Domaine Torraccia 2016 Rosé (Corse Porto Vecchio)

description: This generous rosé was whole-cluster pressed, yielding bright, fresh flavors of just-picked strawberries. The flavors are uplifted with a backing of wet stone minerality, and if any wine captures springtime in a bottle, this is it.
title: Brooks 2015 Pinot Noir Rosé (Willamette Valley)

description: The palest color leads to a perfumed, very ready-to-drink wine. It is crisp with fruit that is now softened by a year's aging, offering a touch of caramel along with crushed strawberry flavors. Drink now.
title: Fournier Père et Fils 2013 Les Belles Vignes Rosé (Sancerre)

description: A blend of Pinot Noir and Gamay from a small region just north of Sancerre, this bright-pink wine is fresh, fruity and light. A touch of tannin gives structure and brings out the dry core of this otherwise crisp wine.
title: Hubert Veneau 2014 Rosé (Coteaux du Giennois)

description: This wine has a deep pink color with a touch of amber, and very bright and zingy aromas. Mouthwatering, crisp fruit flavors are full of citrus and cherry. The lively texture is due to great grape acidity that lights up this wine.
title: Bravium 2014 Signal Ridge Vineyard Rosé of Rosé (Mendocino Ridge)

description: Restraint, elegance, freshness. This delicate rosé has the softest scent of tart summer berries and overtones of rose petals. There is a spicier aspect and fruitier notes of freshly cut apple on the midpalate. But this delivers full flavor with immense delicacy. Bravo.
title: Schloss Gobelsburg 2015 Cistercien Rosé (Niederösterreich)

description: This ripe, lively wine is bursting with red fruits. Crisp and clean, it features a light mineral character that gives it tight texture balanced by refreshing raspberry and orange flavors. The aftertaste shines with crisp acidity.
title: Château Rimauresq 2015 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: As befits a Bandol, this rosé has a good depth of flavor, rich and smoothly textured with acidity integrated into a serious and complex wine. The structure and acidity suggest a wine that could age for 2–3 years.
title: Domaines Ott 2009 Château Romassan Rosé (Bandol)

description: Properly light in color, this is crisp, fruity and deliciously fresh. Some weight comes from ripe strawberry fruits as well as touches of vanilla. The acidity at the end brings refreshment.
title: Les Quatre Tours 2013 Classique Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Salmon-peach in color this rosé is made from 87% Cabernet Sauvignon, 10% Malbec and 10% Pinot Noir, the end result of which is a thirst-quenching array of pineapple and papaya aromas and flavors in a crisp, straightforward package.
title: Simi 2013 Dry Rosé (Sonoma County)

description: Created for the American market, the wine has some softness while retaining intense fruitiness. It's bright, light and very fresh, with just a touch of caramel at the end.
title: Château de l'Escarelle 2013 iPink Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: Burgundy producer Aegerter has come up with a bright and breezy Provence rosé whose style sums up the lighter side of these wines. It is fruity, fresh, very clean and crisp.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2013 Les Jolies Filles Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This rosé is done by the saignée method, bleeding off excess juice from the fermenting tanks. It's 48% Syrah and 52% Cabernet Franc, yielding a hard-edged yet buttery wine with lightly peppery, watermelon flavors. Not for everyone, but distinctive.
title: Patterson 2009 Rosé (Washington)

description: This is a simple but appealing rosé, defined by strawberry fruit, hints of chalk dust and a mouthwatering finish.
title: Château Grande Cassagne 2013 Rosé (Costières de Nîmes)

description: Despite this wine's very pale color, it shows ample weight and a silky texture on the palate. Peach and melon flavors pick up hints of berry and citrus on the finish.
title: Domaine de la Petite Cassagne 2013 Rosé (Costières de Nîmes)

description: Packed with fruit, this is a ripe, rich wine. Red berries are cut with attractive citrus flavors. Full in the mouth and with a good tannic character, this is a wine for food, especially spicy dishes.
title: Château La Croix de Queynac 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Lightly tannic and packed with raspberry flavors, this delicious wine has just the right balance between the ripe fruits and bright acidity. The wine is totally ready to drink.
title: Château Les Hauts de Palette 2015 Château du Barail Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This is a clean and vibrant rosé, with upfront notes of lavender, menthol and bay that frame red cherry and berry tones. The palate is fleshy and fruit-forward, with bold flavors of peach and strawberry that transition seamlessly into the citrus-zest finish.
title: Hecht & Bannier 2015 Rosé (Languedoc)

description: This is a fresh, strawberry-flavored wine with a crisp, dry aftertaste. An attractive tangy character gives life and brilliance. Ready to drink, it is a real apéritif wine.
title: Château Grand Boise 2014 Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: The use of 100% Syrah gives a deep pink color that borders on purple. Aromas are rather strong too, with the flaky, buttered crust of a hot cherry pie running into the more bitter elements of citrus rinds. Those characters play leading roles on the palate as well, cherry candy toying with just-ripe grapefruit, providing tensions that keeps the sipping interesting. Just 72 cases produced.
title: Solminer 2013 Linus Rosé (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Picturesque with a crystalline salmon color, it begins with the scent of just-bitten nectarine. The following flavors of tart apple and a slightly bitter salinity ensure the uniqueness of this wine. Mourvèdre (57%) is in the lead, followed closely by Grenache (28%) and Counoise (15%), all coming from the original cuttings of the Château de Beaucastel. This age-worthy blend will be fun to track 2017–2019.
title: Tablas Creek 2013 Dianthus Estate Mourvèdre-Grenache-Counoise Rosé (Paso Robles)

description: This very fresh wine from the Ducourt family is all crisp, crushed berry fruits and tight acidity. The 100% Cabernet Sauvignon is tangy, very dry and steely in character, with equal parts acidity and fruit. The aftertaste is lively, poised and refreshing.
title: Château Larroque 2014 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This totally refreshing wine is crisp, lively and packed with acidity as well as red currant fruits. It's a delicious wine and a fine apéritif from the Doublet family in Entre-deux-Mers.
title: Château Vignol 2014 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Attractively pink in color, this has a touch of caramel as well as ripe strawberry fruit flavors. It has a rich side, but is bright and fruity with lively acidity at the end. It will be great as an apéritif.
title: Château Vircoulon 2014 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This blend of 75% Grenache and 25% Syrah is a well-made rosé at a realistic price. Scents of crushed stone and bubble gum emerge from the glass, followed by medium-bodied strawberry and cherry flavors and a faintly chalky finish.
title: Saveurs du Temps 2014 Rosé (Costières de Nîmes)

description: Delicious, fruity rosé, and as befits the vintage, with some weight and richness as well. The red berry flavors are overlaid with caramel and cinnamon. Great final acidity.
title: Roger et Didier Raimbault 2009 Rosé (Sancerre)

description: A curious rosé that relies on a touch of Tempranillo to color the Chardonnay, Pinot Grigio and Symphony grapes, this shows sour orange and light plum on the nose. Dried strawberry and orange rind appear on the sip, which is framed by decent acidity and light tannins.
title: Reyes 2016 Renaissance Rosé (California)

description: Strawberry aromas follow through to the soft, red berry fruit flavors of this wine. The blend of 60% Merlot and 40% Cabernet Sauvignon gives both richness and structure. Drink now.
title: Rosé de Guiet 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This pretty wine, with its pale pink color, is soft and fruity. Strawberry flavors give it a ripe character that's reflected in the light acidity on the finish. Drink now.
title: Château l'Orangerie 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This is a soft wine, a blend of Aragonez and Merlot. It has a ripe rounded character that is lightly cut with acidity. It is an easy wine, perfumed and ready to drink.
title: Cortes de Cima 2016 Rosé (Alentejano)

description: It's hard to believe it's possible to buy this quality rosé for so little money. Mouthwatering scents of raspberry, stone fruit and crushed stone emerge from the glass, followed by rich, ripe fruit flavors balanced by just-enough citrusy acidity. It's full-bodied and plush, yet vibrant and long on the finish.
title: Domaine des Carteresses 2016  Tavel

description: Unusually complex for a rosé, this medium- to full-bodied wine offers a mix of red berries and melon, hints of cinnamon and clove, richness reminiscent of white chocolate and even a tinge of mocha on the lengthy finish. Drink now–2018.
title: Château la Genestière 2016  Tavel

description: A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah, this offers dainty aromas of peony, nectarine and white strawberry. Fresh and bright, this has a lively mouthfeel and a zippy finish.
title: Odem Mountain 2011 Volcanic Dry Rosé (Galilee)

description: This deep rosé—made from 70% Barbera and 30% Merlot—exhibits intense aromas of red plum and strawberry, along with a hint of pomegranate. Light weight but fruit forward, this has assertive flavors of red cherry and berry that show good length on the finish.
title: Recanati 2010 Rosé (Galilee)

description: Dusty cherry and plum aromas are nothing special. The palate is similarly just OK, with stalky flavors of citrus and red fruits. This is lightly oxidized and pithy tasting on the finish.
title: Pushpin 2011 Global Garnacha Rosé (Campo de Borja)

description: A little too heavy and full-bodied for a blush, this wine has flavors of melted cherry jam, vanilla, oatmeal cookies and pepper. It's a good wine, but could use greater delicacy and charm.
title: Lavender Ridge 2006 Grenache Rosé (Sierra Foothills)

description: Quite a deep color for a rosé—easily confused with a light Pinot Noir—this shows blackberry, black raspberry, hibiscus and fruit punch on the nose. For such a ripe nose, the palate is quite fresh and energetic, with black-plum skins, red-apple flesh and grippy cherry-pit flavors.
title: Sofia 2014 Rosé (Monterey County)

description: This is made from 80% Cinsault, 10% Grenache and 10% Carignan. It has a deep pink hue and smells more like a red wine than many rosés, with hints of smoked meat, bold notes of garrigue and just a bit of berry-like fruit. It's full bodied, complex and savory—a fine rosé to serve with grilled meats.
title: Laurence Féraud 2016 Pink Pégau Rosé (Vin de France)

description: This full-bodied, richly textured rosé is wonderfully aromatic and floral, with dried spices, plums and cherries all mingling on the nose. Made from 80% Mourvèdre, it behaves almost like a good red wine, but with extra zest and freshness. You could sip it on its own, with white meats or even burgers or steaks.
title: Domaine Saint-André de Figuière 2007 Réserve Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is light, fruity and just off dry. It has bright red fruits and crisp acidity, softened by a gentle aftertaste. The wine, pure Gamay, is ready to drink.
title: Vinovalie 2016 Tarani Gamay Rosé

description: This is a lightly fruity wine with attractive acidity and citrus and apricot flavors. It is light and lively, fresh and crisp. There is a just a touch of spice and pepper at the end. Drink now.
title: Château de Brigue 2016 Brigue Vin de Provence Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a soft pretty wine with a light fruity character. It is gently fruity, finishing with a peppery edge and crisp acidity. Drink now.
title: Château Sainte-Béatrice 2016 Cuvée des Princes Rosé (Var)

description: This wine is so soft, rounded and fat. It has hints of red fruits and acidity with a herbal edge. But with the soft texture of the wine, it is misses out on fruit and acidity. Drink now.
title: Château Lauzade 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a soft simple wine, full of ripe red fruit. It has a lightly structured edge from the Syrah in the blend while keeping plenty of bright acidity. Drink now.
title: Château Virant 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is an attractive, herbal wine. It has light spice and touches of cilantro as well as crisp red fruits. The wine is bright and ready to drink.
title: Château Coussin 2016 La Croix du Prieur Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This wine is on the pale side for this vintage. There is a yeasty character that comes across as bitterness. By contrast, the acidity and the crisp fruits are fine, light and delicate. Drink now.
title: Château de Brigue 2016 Fleur Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is an excellent rosé with some red-wine character showing through the pale-salmon color and fresh fruitiness. It has slightly meaty, spicy and cherry-like flavors, a good balance between medium body and firm acidity, and a nice tangy finish.
title: Navarro 2016 Rosé (Mendocino)

description: Here's an easy-drinking, inexpensive rosé that's perfect for summer occasions. Made from an unusual blend of Sangiovese, Zinfandel, Carignan and Grenache, it's dryish, crisp and clean, with berry and spice flavors.
title: Bonterra 2009 Rosé (Mendocino County)

description: Strained, funky aromas of corn chips don't include much fruit. This is mostly acid on the palate, while it tastes raw, choppy and citric. A tart finish fails to rescue this substandard rosé.
title: Alta Vista 2015 Malbec Rosé (Mendoza)

description: Soupy, horsey citrus and red-berry aromas precede a flabby palate with herbal red-berry flavors that upon inspection taste both sugary and green.
title: Bodega Renacer 2015 Punto Final Malbec Rosé (Mendoza)

description: A blend of Grenache, Cinsault and Carignan, this offering is very citrusy upfront, filled with grapefruit aromas. It's light to medium in weight, with flavors reminiscent of tangerines and hints of strawberries and something vaguely vegetal on the finish.
title: Jules 2007 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Made from Grenache, Malbec, Pinot Noir and Tempranillo, this is a light, zesty and dry wine. Light copper-pink in color, it is high-toned in grapefruit, plum and peach, completely bright and refreshing. Easy to love from start to finish, it finishes with a twist of tart lemon.
title: Angels & Cowboys 2014 Rosé (Sonoma County)

description: This lively wine revels in its red fruits. It is tight, tangy and packed with fresh flavors, with just the right amount of weight and dryness to put it firmly on the table with food.
title: Château Boisson 2014 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This wine is electric pink in color, with notes of strawberry bubblegum and cranberry. It drinks off dry, with watermelon and red fruit flavors that linger on the finish.
title: Columbia Winery 2013 Grenache Rosé (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: Smoky flint and crushed mineral tones contrast concentrated raspberry and strawberry flavors in this richly concentrated rosé. Full bodied and supple in texture, it's sturdy enough to accompany heartier fish and fowl dishes far beyond the summer months. Sunny acidity brightens the finish.
title: Lamoreaux Landing 2015 Dry Rosé (Finger Lakes)

description: A whiff of raspberry perfume trails through deep layers of wet rock and dusty mineral on the nose of this dry Spätburgunder rosé. While restrained in style, its fresh-cut red apple and pear flavors make a zesty year-round accompaniment to light chicken and fish dishes. Drink now.
title: Nauerth-Gnägy 2014 Ng.2 Schweigen-Rechtenbach Spätburgunder Trocken Rosé (Pfalz)

description: Medium-pink in color, this looks immediately vibrant and fruity. Scents of mealy plum, berry and watermelon fill the bouquet, while the palate offers more austere flavors of red currant and sour pomegranate. Tart and sharp in acidity, the finish is short and brisk.
title: Hecht & Bannier 2013 Rosé (Languedoc)

description: Soft and fruity, this is a ripe style of rosé. It's dry and peppery, with fresh acidity cutting through its rounded texture. It's a rosé for food, with a full aftertaste.
designation: Casa Ermelinda Freitas Monte de Baía
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Casa Ermelinda Freitas Monte de Baía Rosé (Península de Setúbal)

description: Fresh and fruity, this is a crisply made, drink-it-now rosé. With freshly crushed raspberries and light acidity, it's perfect for an apéritif.
title: Falua 2013 Tagus Creek Rosé (Tejo)

description: This pale-hued blend of Grenache and Syrah starts off a bit confected, offering up scents of cotton candy. Yet it's less so on the palate, where the fruit resembles underripe melon and the finish is stony and less generous.
title: Marrenon 2015 Grande Toque Rosé (Luberon)

description: Savory smoked-nut notes juxtapose ripe red cherry and strawberry in this full-bodied rosé. While quite substantial in mouthfeel, it has bright citrus acidity that lends some refreshment on the finish.
title: Mattebella 2014 Rosé (North Fork of Long Island)

description: This is a lively, ripe, fruity wine that has both richness and freshness in equal measure. The wine is warm, but with delicate fruitiness from crisp red fruit. Drink this wine soon.
title: Mas de Gourgonnier 2012 Rosé (Les Baux de Provence)

description: Based on Loire Valley grapes, this wine is crisp and cleanly fruity. It has pleasant red berry fruit and a cool draft of acidity. Drink now.
title: Bougrier 2016 Alain de la Treille Le Rosé (Vin de France)

description: This is a lightly off-dry rosé, with a soft texture and strawberry flavors. The wine is easy to drink now, bright with acidity and smoothly finished.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2016 Rosé (Alentejano)

description: This sweet rosé is light and crisply fruity. Strawberry flavors make it an immediately refreshing and enjoyable apéritif wine.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2016 Escolha Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: A simple, fruity and caramel-flavored blend of Touriga Nacional and Aragonez, this is soft and smooth. Just enough acidity keeps it clean and crisp.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2016 Nana Rosé (Tejo)

description: An intensely orange-pink-colored wine, this is a blend of the local Castelão with Touriga Nacional and Syrah. Its acidity is filled out with ripe red-berry fruits and a smooth texture of vanilla. The wine is soft and ready to drink.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Monte de Baía Rosé (Península de Setúbal)

description: This perfumed, spicy wine has crisp red fruit and acidity. Light and with a soft aftertaste, it's attractive and ready to drink.
title: Patriarche Père et Fils 2016 Syrah Rosé (Vin de France)

description: This ripe, strawberry-flavored blend of Touriga Nacional, Aragonez and Merlot is soft and smooth. It is rounded with an almost-sweet fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Casa Cadaval 2016 Vinha Padre Pedro Rosé (Tejo)

description: This remains a richly textured and weighty rosé, despite the fact that its color seems lighter than previous vintages. It's almost entirely Grenache, with bits of Shiraz (4%), Cabernet Sauvignon (2%) and Dolcetto (1%) filling out the blend. Hints of berries, ripe melon and white chocolate end on a mouthwatering citrus note, but this is built for the beefy side of your grilling menu.
title: Turkey Flat 2014 Rosé (Barossa Valley)

description: The price of this entry-level cuvée has crept up over the years, but it remains a very good wine at a realistic price point. Crushed stone on the nose leads into dusty cherry flavors with hints of garrigue. Medium-bodied yet refreshing on the finish. Drink now and over the next 6–9 months.
title: E. Guigal 2010 Rosé (Côtes du Rhône)

description: Here's a rosé from last season that's still bright and lively. Aromas of raspberry and watermelon are fresh and inviting, while the palate is medium in intensity, with red licorice and strawberry flavors. Drink now and this wine should still be crisp and refreshing.
title: Vega Sindoa 2011 Garnacha Rosé (Navarra)

description: This soft and lightly herbal wine has a smooth texture that brings out its ripe red fruit and plays down its acidity. That makes it easy to drink, rich and generous on the finish.
title: Château Ferry Lacombe 2016 Mira Rosé (Mediterranée)

description: This electric-pink rosé of Syrah opens with aromas of yeast, chewing gum and pie cherry. The palate is on the full side, but it's not flabby or awkward. Citric flavors are more generic than specific, while this finishes with a burst of preserving acidity and then a lasting note of spent yeast.
title: Montes 2016 Cherub Rosé (Colchagua Valley)

description: Like a Beaujolais Nouveau, this is a lively, grapey wine, with fresh-from-the-fermenter flavors of raspberries, red cherries, cinnamon and pepper.
title: Frog's Leap 2008 La Grenouille Rouganté Rosé (Napa Valley)

description: A blend of two local grapes, Niellucciu and Sciaccerellu, this wine is pale—almost white in color. It has delicious crisp acidity, a light texture and a fine, perfumed aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Les Vins Bréban 2016 Alivetto Rosé (Ile de Beauté)

description: One of a range of wines produced by the Bordeaux-based Despagne family, this is a blend of Bordeaux grape varieties. It's attractive and fruity, with crisp red currant notes and a refreshing layer of acidity. Drink now.
title: Vignobles Despagne 2016 Le Mythe d'Amphorie Rosé (Vin de France)

description: Electric pink in color, this wine brings pungent notes of flowers, green herbs, peach and lychee. It drinks off dry, with grapefruit, lychee and stone-fruit flavors that linger on the finish.
title: Eufloria NV Aromatic Rosé (Washington)

description: This assertive wine is one of the few rosés made from this bold grape variety. It has a medium red coppper color and vivid, tart cherry and rhubarb flavors. Meaty, spicy accents emerge on the finish, so it will add a little drama to any meal.
title: Theopolis 2014 Rosé (Yorkville Highlands)

description: A terrific California blush wine, rich and compelling, with a gorgeous color, sort of a salmon-koi gold. It's bone dry and crisply clean in acidity, with strong, but not heavy, flavors of strawberries and raspberries. There's a dusting of tannins that give the wine a solid structure.
title: Lynmar 2009 Rose of Pinot Noir Rosé (Russian River Valley)

description: This is an attractive, fruity, fresh rosé. It is dry but balances acidity and fruitiness with its sweet strawberry fruit and light touch of vanilla pod. Drink now.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Companhia das Lezirias Catapereiro Rosé (Tejo)

description: Hints of overripe peach and mealy apple indicate a rich, ripe style of rosé, but are immediately followed by accents of green melon, plum and menthol, adding balance and tension. Medium weight, with ample acidity that keeps the ripe fruit flavors balanced and refreshing through the finish.
title: Pierre Qui Roule 2012 Rolling Stone Grenache Rosé (Pays d'Oc)

description: Although this is almost red in color and entering its twilight, it's not bad for $8. Dusty berry aromas lead to a semifull palate with raspberry, cherry and plum flavors that end in chewy dryness.
title: Finca El Origen 2011 Malbec Rosé (Mendoza)

description: Plum and cherry aromas seem a touch oxidized. The palate holds it together but doesn't offer much, while flavors of chunky berry and plum are hollow and show additional oxidation. Like many inexpensive 2011 rosés, this is past its prime.
title: Bodegas Ontañón 2011 Mediel Rosé (Navarra)

description: There's a respectably complex nose on this pink wine, with lemonade and pressed plums blending into a wet cement minerality. The palate is very tasty, with flavors of pomegranate, dried rose petals, hibiscus, night jasmine and even a clove-laced mocha element proving quite intriguing.
title: HammerSky 2013 Rosé (Paso Robles)

description: To call this rosé deep is an understatement. In color and body, it's almost a red wine. But it does have the silky delicacy of a blush wine, and is frankly delicious in cherry jam, red licorice and Dr. Pepper flavors. It finishes thoroughly dry, and the acidity is racy.
title: Isabel Mondavi 2011 Deep Rosé of Cabernet Sauvignon Rosé (Napa Valley)

description: Winemaker Hank Beckmeyer presses Syrah and Mourvèdre to make this rosé, hoping that in the process he'll best preserve the wine's aromas and also keep it tasting fresh. He's created a nutty wine that's dominant in strawberry and stone fruit flavors. It's very light and dry, leaving you with the impression of having just bitten into a piece of watermelon.
title: La Clarine Farm 2011 Syrah-Mourvèdre Rosé (Sierra Foothills)

description: Lifted cherry, mango and peach aromas lend a slightly candied note to this slightly off-dry rosé made from Cabernet Franc. It's unabashedly juicy and fruity on the palate, but balanced with brisk acidity. A fun, easy-drinking sip.
title: Lucas Vineyards 2012 Dry Rosé (Finger Lakes)

description: With its bright pink color and fruity aromas of cherry, strawberry and raspberry, this wine is more good than bad. The palate feels fresh, balanced and juicy, while flavors of plum, cherry and red licorice finish clean.
title: Andeluna 2013 1300 Malbec Rosé (Uco Valley)

description: This unusual rosé is half Syrah and half Pinot Noir. Sometimes the combo works; here it seems like a mismatch. Tart and simple, it's bone dry and unfocused, with short, thin flavors of watermelon and strawberry that quickly fade.
title: Coeur de Terre 2014 Rustique Rosé (Willamette Valley)

description: This is a pale colored rosé, light and fruity. It has a touch of caramel to go with the ripe strawberry fruitiness. The finish is fresh and crisp. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2014 Portada Winemaker's Selection Rosé (Lisboa)

description: While the wine is clean, it tastes yeasty and heavy despite its low alcohol. There is strawberry fruitiness and final acidity, although the sweetness remains intrusive.
title: Aveleda 2014 Casal Garcia Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a plump, medium-bodied rosé at a reasonable price. Pomelo or grapefruit notes combine with stone fruit, then finish stony-dry and tart.
title: La Châsse 2016 Prestige Rosé (Côtes du Rhône)

description: Aromas of grapefruit, orange peel and chewing gum feed into a wide palate with slightly flat acidity. Melon and papaya flavors finish a bit soft, with a note of stone-fruit pit.
title: Larchago 2016 Rosé (Rioja)

description: Passion fruit, kiwi fruit and hints of strawberry mark the nose of this wine. It's strident, intense and a bit one-dimensionally fruity, yet packs a lot of flavor into a refreshing, medium-bodied wine.
title: Les Dauphins 2016 Réserve Rosé (Côtes du Rhône)

description: Whiffs of watermelon and spring blossoms abound on the nose of this dry Merlot, vinified as a white wine. Crisp yellow-cherry and citrus flavors are a bit more delicate in concentration on the palate but its vibrant acidity is refreshing.
title: Sherwood House Vineyards 2016 Oregon Road White Merlot Rosé (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Ripe bramble, crisp strawberry and cherry perfume this full-bodied moderately concentrated rosé. Dry in style, it's easy drinking with a slightly candied cherry-cough-drop finish.
title: Bellangelo 2016 Merlot Dry Rosé (Seneca Lake)

description: Dusty mineral and bramble notes juxtapose bright raspberry and sour-cherry notes in this full-bodied rosé. Made from a blend of Pinot Noir, Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon, its clingy mouthfilling texture is pleasant and plump, balanced against brisk acidity and a clean finish.
title: Billsboro 2016 Dry Rosé (Finger Lakes)

description: A soft shade of yellow pink, this wine shows red apple, nectarine and a shred of lime rind on the nose. The palate offers slightly sour lime and underripe raspberry flavors as well as a unique and intriguing touch of fresh herbs.
title: Chloe 2015 Rosé (Monterey County)

description: Tangy and textured, this is a wine that needs food. A tannic edge from the Cabernet in the blend gives the wine a tight, bright, refreshing aftertaste.
title: Dourthe 2015 La Grande Cuvée Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: A blend of half and half Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, this is a rounded, full wine. It has plenty of red-berry fruits along with spice, a tight texture and a crisp aftertaste. The wine offers a good reflection of the fruitiness of the year.
title: Château Brown 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Hints of savory herbs accent pretty peach and blossom aromas in this dry but fruity Merlot rosé. It's elegantly structured, with moderate alcohol and crisp acidity balanced out by a lush, rounded mouthfeel.
title: Palmer 2012 Merlot Rosé (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Menetou-Salon uses Pinot Noir for its rosés, like nearby Sancerre. The wine is in a fresh, crisp style, emphasizing acidity and red currant. It is light in feel and bright with red-fruit that lingers.
title: Isabelle et Pierre Clément 2015 Châtenoy Rosé (Menetou-Salon)

description: Tasting very ripe and a touch sweet, this deep pink wine smells like melons, tastes like cherry jam and feels smooth and soft on the palate.
title: Cinnabar 2016 Rosé (California)

description: One of the producer's three different rosés, this was also made using the saignée method. Its light strawberry and watermelon fruit flavors come through, with ample orange- and citrus-like acidity.
title: Coelho 2016 Coelho Estates Pinot Noir Rosé (Willamette Valley)

description: This dry appetizing wine comes from one of Lodi's more adventurous winemakers, Markus Niggli. A hot-pink color and red-cherry aromas lead to bright fresh cherry and raspberry flavors, while a medium body and mild acidity form a smooth texture. Niggli made it from Syrah and Carignane grapes fermented by native yeast.
title: Markus Wine Co 2016 Zeal Rosé (Lodi)

description: A sweet and fizzy wine, this is also tight with acidity and textured with tannins. It has a mineral edge along with the intense crispness that is really too much.
title: Casa de Vila Verde 2015 Pluma Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a sweet, confected wine. It has sugary red fruits and just enough acidity. Made from the Vinhão grape, it is soft and ready to drink.
title: Quinta da Calçada 2015 Portal da Calçada Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: Bright pink in color, this looks and tastes like candy. There is the lightest touch of acidity to at least bring some crispness to this sweet wine.
title: Viniverde 2015 Estreia Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: Generic red berry flavors turn bitter and astringent, while a chemical plastic note marks the final blow.
title: Fall Creek 2015 Grenache Rosé

description: This rosé is mouthfilling and round, with ample melon and berry fruit, a sprinkling of dried spices and minimal herb notes. It actually drinks almost like a red wine for its weight and berry-scented richness, but remains refreshing on the long, mouthwatering finish. Drink now.
title: Château de Ségriès 2015  Tavel

description: The vineyard-designated Grenache grapes are given a whole-berry press before fermenting in stainless steel, encouraging the lithe strawberry and watermelon essence of this wine to sing unabashedly, adorned by supporting minerality and an overall lightness of being. This is a lovely sipper for all manner of moments.
title: Kokomo 2014 Pauline's Vineyard Grenache Rosé (Dry Creek Valley)

description: This is an attractive blend of Braucol and Syrah which gives a ripe spicy wine. Red-berry flavors dominate with a rich texture and light acidity. The wine is perfumed and ready to drink.
title: Domaine Rotier 2015 Les Gravels Rosé (Gaillac)

description: Full-bodied red fruits typify this deep magenta rosé from Thema. The palate offers ripe flavors with a spicy finish. Good with fuller-bodied fish or poultry dishes.
title: Ktima Pavlidis 2015 Thema Rosé (Drama)

description: This wine comes from one of Côtes de Provence historic cru classé estates. It is a ripe and smooth wine with crisp acidity and a fine bite of spice. The wine is packed with red fruits and finished with refreshing acidity.
title: Fabre en Provence 2016 Château de la Clapière Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A touch of strawberry streaks through this wine's lemon scent. The palate is slender, easy and fresh, making for an uncomplicated summer drink with a dry, taut finish.
title: Familie Zull 2016 Lust & Laune Rosé (Niederösterreich)

description: Fruity, crisp with red-currant and citrus flavors, this is a bright, vivacious wine. There is a tight mineral edge that contrasts with the fruitiness and turns this into a food friendly wine. Drink now.
title: Vignobles Raymond 2016 Elodie Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Whiffs of tea leaves and tobacco lend earthiness to this slightly savory but exotic appealing rosé. There's plenty of red-cherry and raspberry flavor, but it's slightly muted, embraced in shrouds of Cabernet Franc's brambly leafy character. It's a unique, full-bodied rosé to try over dinner with poultry or other white meats.
title: Adirondack Winery 2015 Island Sunset Cabernet Franc Rosé (New York)

description: From an estate close to Saint-Tropez, this wine brings plenty of sun and richness to an attractive tangy texture. It has a crisp peppery edge as well as bright acidity and a smooth, ripe aftertaste. It is ready to drink now.
title: Barton & Guestier 2016 La Villa Barton Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The proximity of the vineyard to the sea gives this wine an almost salty, certainly tangy character. It also brings out acidity and a cool fruitiness. The wine is ripe, poised and balanced with a crisp edge of final acidity. Drink now.
title: Château du Carrubier 2016 Cuvée de Clara Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: For the vintage, this is a rich wine. It has spice, an herbal edge and a touch of pepper. Its red fruits are superripe with a bitter bite that masks the acidity. Let this settle for a few months and drink from 2018.
title: Château Maupague 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: This is the estate wine from this property named after the stag that was hunted by the French King Francis I in the 16th century. It is softly fruity with a balance between the ripe raspberry fruit and light acidity. Drink this summer.
title: Château Pas du Cerf 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A rounded style of rosé, this is ripe and soft, with acidity cushioned by the rich red fruits. The aftertaste with its lemon-zest touch makes this wine refreshing.
title: Domaine de la Sanglière 2015 Cuvée Spéciale Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: From vineyards close to Saint-Tropez on the Mediterranean coast, this wine has swathes of ripe, sunny fruits with just a hint of cooler breezes to bring out the acidity. It's an immediately attractive, fruity wine, refreshing and packed with orange and raspberry flavors.
title: Domaine Sainte-Marie 2015 VieVité Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Named after the mother of the current grower, this wine is a Rhône-like blend of Syrah and Grenache. The result is a fresh wine with an edge of tannins that give it structure. A ripe wine, it has also preserved its crisp, bright fruitiness.
title: Domaine Terre de Mistral 2015 Simone Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Produced from organically grown grapes, this wine is full of fragrant, clean red-fruit flavors. It is ripe and full bodied—perhaps too full-bodied for a really fresh rosé. It does have all the fruit, generous and with a soft aftertaste.
title: Vignerons de Correns 2015 Croix de Basson Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Subdued lemon and forest fruit back up the bright, blush colour of this fruitful, almost fleshy rosé. While this is an easy-drinking party wine, it nonetheless finishes with real freshness and leaves you utterly quenched.
title: Weixelbaum 2015 Strassertaler Rosé (Niederösterreich)

description: Strawberry with a very faint touch of rhubarb makes for a very inviting nose. The palate continues the strawberry theme with a full, fresh and luscious but dry fruit expression. This is juicy, fleshy and moreish, drink soon.
title: Zantho 2015 Pink Rosé (Burgenland)

description: Red-berry fruits dominate this crisp, clear wine with its direct line of acidity and light aftertaste. It's aromatic and full of life.
title: Moncigale 2015 Frais et Délicat Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Made from Malbec, this is a ripe, tangy wine. It is dry and fresh, crisp with acidity and red currant fruits. There is a round, smooth aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Pelvillain Frères 2014 Albatros Rosé (Côtes du Lot)

description: A bright strawberry-flavored wine, this is fruity and fresh. It has crisp acidity to lift the fruit and a light pepper touch that adds interest and turns it into a fine food-friendly wine. It is ready to drink now.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2015 Rosé (Tejo)

description: Notes of rubber and matchbook are about all that stand out on the nose of this rosé of Pinot Noir. A harmless-feeling palate tastes snappy but generic, with hints of citrus and tropical fruits but nothing specific.
title: Quintay 2015 Clava Reserve Pinot Noir Rosé (Casablanca Valley)

description: A mostly neutral nose is devoid of fruit aromas and instead offers dusty notes of crushed rocks. This is a heavy rosé made from Garnacha, Syrah and Carignan. It's rather bitter and miserly in terms of fruit flavor, with a peppercorn finish.
title: Celler Bàrbara Forés 2014 Rosat Rosé (Terra Alta)

description: While a bit quiet on the nose, watermelon, white-peach and raspberry flavors explode on the palate of this lovely dry rosé. It's exuberantly fruity but neatly balanced, offering spry acidity and a long, floral finish.
title: Hosmer 2016 Dry Cabernet Franc Rosé (Finger Lakes)

description: Compact berry and plum aromas set up a solid, nice palate with nectarine and raspberry flavors. This is very drinkable and easygoing; the finish is mellow but propped up by core acidity.
title: Dinastía Vivanco 2013 Tempranillo-Garnacha Rosé (Rioja)

description: An ambitious and successful rosé made from 50% Gamay Noir and 50% Grenache, this light yellow-pink wine offers inviting pink grapefruit skin, Gala apple and green pear on the nose. The palate shows the tiniest bit of sweetness, which makes the Pink Lady apple and tangerine-led citrus notes all the more delicious. Beware: this goes down all too easy.
title: Joyce 2015 Rosé (Monterey)

description: A good rosé, crisp and light-bodied. It has rich strawberry, orange zest, vanilla and spice flavors. Nice and silky in the mouth, as a blush wine should be, but it's a little on the sweet side.
title: Birichino 2012 Vin Gris Rosé (California)

description: A pinkish copper color, light cherry and raspberry flavors and a smooth, rounded mouth-feel make this full-bodied wine easy to sip and enjoy.
title: Julietta 2015 Romeo's Rosé (California)

description: Relatively rich in character, with toast and yeast flavors offering a contrast to the more tropical fruit flavors. There is dry spice and finely balanced acidity that offer a further dimension to this full-bodied wine.
title: Domaine de la Sanglière 2010 Cuvée Spéciale Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Whiffs of brambly raspberry and fresh watermelon introduce this ripe full-bodied rosé made from almost equal proportions of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. It's moderately concentrated in red-fruit flavors but boasts bright acidity and a refreshing clean finish.
title: Heron Hill 2016 Eclipse Rosé (New York)

description: Whiffs of vanilla and strawberry entice on the nose of this full-bodied rosé made from a blend of Syrah, Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon. It's not a deeply concentrated wine but offers delicate shades of crisp red cherry and strawberry along with refreshing acidity.
title: Kontokosta 2016 Rosé (North Fork of Long Island)

description: It displays a very pretty pink color, but that's the showiest side of a rather reserved wine. The nose smells slightly of rosebush and the palate is a bit watery, with some stone fruit and noticeable tension.
title: Vino Vargas 2013 Costa Rosa Rosé (Paso Robles)

description: A concentrated and toasty raspberry flavor permeates the light- to medium-bodied palate, which is endowed with crisp acids.
title: Sutcliffe 2012 Rosé (Colorado)

description: This wine is so soft, gently fruity and easy to drink, but without much character or freshness. It's a gentle ramble that takes no effort.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Portada Rosé (Lisboa)

description: This wine is fresh, with plenty of acidity. It also has delicious raspberry fruits, the ripeness well integrated into the wine. For immediate drinking.
title: Adega Cooperativa Ponte de Barca 2013 Hera Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: Aromas suggest pink watermelon and bubble gum ester, with an intriguing twist of licorice. It's high and tight on the palate with pink lemonade-driven acidity, offering strawberry fruit in the midpalate and more bubble gum on the finish.
title: Zaca Mesa 2014 Z Gris Rosé (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: This wine is a very appealing pale bronze color with a light peach tinge. It brings bountiful aromas of wet rock, mountain strawberry and herb that lead to a dry, broad, flavorful palate, with mouthwatering fruit and stone flavors.
title: Cayuse 2015 Edith Grenache Rosé (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

description: Made from Cinsault grapes, this is a reductive, salty and somewhat intense wine at first, that settles nicely into developed flavors of ripe strawberry, peach and vanilla. With substantive weight and breadth, it offers a pleasing texture and body without ever getting bogged down. This is a fine wine for the table.
title: VGS Chateau Potelle 2016 Riviera Rosé (Sonoma County)

description: Very fruity, this is a ripe Merlot-dominated rosé with some Cabernet Franc. It is rounded, smooth, soft at the end with bright and crisp acidity. Wild strawberries and a rich aftertaste give extra weight.
title: Closerie du Bailli 2013 Tradition Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: An off-dry blend of Grolleau and Gamay, it's crisp and attractively fruity. Strawberries dominate this fresh and aromatic wine. It's a great rosé to drink now.
title: La Grille 2013  Rosé d'Anjou

description: Almost neutral aromas of cantaloupe and nectarine are dusty on the nose. This Carmenère-based dry rosé is citric, juicy and tight on the palate, with grapefruit and other citrus flavors adding life. Orange and citrus pith notes control the finish.
title: Apaltagua 2014 Carmenere Rosé (Central Valley)

description: This bold and fruity rosé carries scents and flavors of cherry candy. It's a fine bottle for chilling and sharing with summer picnic foods.
title: Del Rio 2014 Rosé (Rogue Valley)

description: This attractively crisp wine is full of fruit with just a touch of caramel. Light, bright and very dry, it finishes with intense acidity.
title: Domaine D'en Ségur 2014 Le Rosé (Côtes du Tarn)

description: This deliciously crisp estate-produced wine is full of the freshest strawberry fruits. It dances with its acidity and light touch of spice. From one of the largest private vineyards in France (2,300 acres), the wine is ready to drink.
title: Domaine du Tariquet 2014 Rosé de Pressée Rosé (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: Dusty peach, nectarine and chewing gum aromas are clean and standard. A lively palate shows bright but controlled acidity and citrusy notes. Stone-fruit and red-plum flavors finish mild. Drink this year.
title: El Coto 2014 Rosé (Rioja)

description: The mountains rise quickly behind the French Riviera. They are the origin of this wine. It has an attractive cool feel, while keeping plenty of fruit and a ripe caramel character. It is bright with plenty of acidity at the end. Drink now.
title: Les Vins Bréban 2016 Les Hauts Plateaux Rosé

description: Made by a Rhône-based winery, this wine is smooth and ripe. It has generous strawberry and light spice flavors along with a rounded aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Louis Bernard 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This soft wine is easy and open. It has generous fruits and gentle acidity. The result is a smooth wine that is ready to drink now.
title: Bailli de Provence 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Fruity, floral aromas set the stage for rich watermelon and plum flavors in this medium-pink colored wine. The texture is soft, with a slight sweet-fruit flavor on the close.
title: Barra 2016 Estate Grown Rosé (Mendocino)

description: This is an attractive, fruity wine. It has a soft character from the ripe red-fruit flavors that are well balanced with herbal acidity and a crisp aftertaste. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Château Maupague 2016 Cabaret Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Laced with really crisp fruits and red-currant flavors, this is a brightly fruity wine. Lively and with a tight texture, this is ready to drink.
title: Les Vins Bréban 2016 Villa Aix en Provence Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Light, bright and packed with delicious fruit, this is a refreshing, immediately drinkable wine. It has raspberry flavors and a crisp aftertaste that are all part of the fruity package.
