description: This is lushly fruity, a big bowl full of strawberries, with a milk chocolate coating. There's nothing wimpy here, but the low alcohol keeps it zippy and perfect for warm-weather quaffing.
title: Lumos 2014 Chiquita Pinot Noir Rosé (Willamette Valley)

description: Delicate and dry, this offers lightly spicy strawberry fruit and supporting acids. It's pretty and pale, light but not dilute, and would be an ideal match to a pork dish with a fruit sauce.
title: Rainstorm 2014 Silver Linings Pinot Noir Rosé (Oregon)

description: This is the casual sipper of the Château de Nages rosé pair, offering slightly briny, fumé notes on the nose, but following them up with peach and melon fruit flavors that finish long, crisp and dry.
title: Château de Nages 2014 Buti Nages Rosé (Costières de Nîmes)

description: This is a stony, savory style of rosé, with its ample weight backed by firm acids and only modest melon fruit. It's a style better suited to food than casual sipping on its own.
title: Château de Nages 2014 Vieilles Vignes Rosé (Costières de Nîmes)

description: With its day-glo pink color, this smells stalky and lacks the aromatic freshness one seeks in rosé. The mouthfeel is reasonably lively and grabby, with briny, pickled citrus flavors in front of a briny tasting finish.
title: Dinastía Vivanco 2011 Vivanco Tempranillo-Garnacha Rosé (Rioja)

description: With almost no color, this spritzy rosado is prickly and feline on the nose, like Sauvignon Blanc or Verdejo. The palate is lightly bubbly, with bounce and tart tangerine and herbal flavors. Txomin Etxaníz has never made a commercial rosé prior to this. This makes you wonder why they did.
title: Txomín Etxaníz 2011 Getaria Rosé (Getariako Txakolina)

description: Slightly dusty, herbal notes distract from pleasant peach and strawberry flavors in this dry rosé made from Pinot Noir along with a splash of Chardonnay. It's delicate in concentration but refreshing on the palate.
title: Atwater 2012 Dry Rosé (Finger Lakes)

description: Crafted from a mix of 48% Syrah, 45% Grenache and 7% Mourvèdre, this aromatic rosé is spicy and bursting with star fruit, citrus, apple, pear, apricot and more. It's a lively full-bodied wine with a smooth finish.
title: Quady North 2016 Rosé (Rogue Valley)

description: This brightly colored rosé from northeastern Italy offers aromas of small berry fruit and delicate floral tones. It tastes clean and crisp and leaves a cheerful endnote of fresh berry flavors.
title: Blason 2007 Rosato Rosé (Venezia Giulia)

description: Crisp and spicy, this blush has slightly sweet flavors of raspberries, red currants, lavender and vanilla.
title: JCB 2007 No. 69 Pinot Noir Rosé (Russian River Valley)

description: This rich, reddish-orange wine has aromas like sour-cherry candy. Tasty, dry and complex fruit flavors suggest cherry, cranberry and tamarind, with a smooth texture and full body. It's made from 74% Grenache and 25% Mourvèdre.
title: Longevity 2015 Rose of Deb-ru-vée Rosé (Livermore Valley)

description: A just off-dry rosé with great fresh fruit, attractive red currants and vanilla flavor. This is bright, clean, delicious as a food rosé. Screwcap.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2010 JP Rosé (Setubal)

description: Producer of one of the first rosé Vinho Verde, Casa do Valle continues to make one of the best. Full of delicious strawberry flavors with great acidity, deliciously fruity.
title: Casa do Valle 2010 Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: For a Bordeaux rosé, this is fresh and delicious in a light, fruity style, and immediately appealing. Not for aging, of course, but with a good touch of acidity as well as vanilla. Screwcap.
title: Château Suau 2010 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Pale salmon rosé, with peach and melon aromas. It's dry and minerally on the palate, with mouthwatering acids that linger on the finish.
title: Marrenon 2010 Grand Toque Rosé (Luberon)

description: Expanding from his Provence château, Sacha Lichine's new rosé is a blend from across the south of France. It's crisp, fruity, with a touch of sweetness, giving a soft, red berry fruit texture and light, fresh acidity.
title: Sacha Lichine 2013 SLS Single Blend Rosé (Vin de France)

description: Light and fruity, this wine is soft, with a sweeter touch than is sometimes found in Provence rosés. The blend includes Cabernet Sauvignon, giving a tannic edge as well as caramel and sweet raspberry flavors.
region_1: Vin de Pays de la Méditerranée
title: Les Vignobles Gueissard 2013 Le Petit Gueissard Rosé (Vin de Pays de la Méditerranée)

description: With its bold aromas of cotton candy and two-cent bubblegum, this is just too tutti-frutti to rate higher. That said, if you like the style, it's a solid, well-made example, filled with bouncy fruit while finishing dry and refreshing.
title: Dauvergne & Ranvier 2013 Domaine des Muretins  (Tavel)

description: This interesting and complex rosé—made from 65% Grenache, 25% Mourvèdre, 7% Vermentino and 3% Viognier—is aged for six months in oak. The resulting wine is a cellar-worthy selection that boasts upfront notes of toasted spice, lemon custard, vanilla bean and ripe red berries. The oak influence currently dominates the plush and generous palate, while the creamy texture and lingering smoky spice are enticingly decadent. While you can enjoy this rich wine now, give it some time for the oak to mellow and further integrate with the fruit; drink now–2017.
title: Gérard Bertrand 2014 Château La Sauvageonne GMVV Rosé (Coteaux du Languedoc)

description: Soft and full of red fruit, with balanced acidity, this is a rich style of rosé. Its generous texture has a crisp edge that lifts its full, creamy character. Drink now.
title: Clos Teddi 2016 Rosé (Patrimonio)

description: A very pale flamingo-pink rosé, this is moderately confected in style, but vibrant and fresh. Cotton candy notes are balanced by peachy fruit and some floral elements, while the finish is mouthwatering. Drink up.
title: Louis Bernard 2012 Rosé (Côtes du Rhône)

description: Despite its unusual, five-grape blend, this is a well-balanced rosé with a fruity mix of cranberry, cherry, raspberry and watermelon flavors. It's light, forward, a little on the soda pop side, but quite nice for sipping or accompanying something as substantial as your holiday turkey.
title: Milbrandt 2012 Traditions Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This is a very fresh and fragrant style of Tavel, which can often be a bit weightier in style. Bubble gum and passion fruit aromas give way to citrus and berry flavors on the palate, finishing soft and easy. It should easily last at least well into the spring.
title: Château de Trinquevedel 2012  Tavel

description: Made from grapes picked early specifically for rosé, this bone-dry wine keeps alcohol low and flavors rich. A pale copper hue, it offers flavors that mimic a cava, without the bubbles. Racy minerality underscores a juicy, fruit-driven palate of lemon, lime and orange. A hint of coffee and crème brulée pokes through the refreshing finish.
title: Cayuse 2012 Edith Armada Vineyard Grenache Rosé (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

description: This is Mordorée's top cuvée of Tavel, and it earns that distinction by virtue of its length and stoniness on the finish. There's a hint of garrigue to the cherry aromas and a plump, complex midpalate as well. Drink it over the next year or two.
title: Domaine de la Mordorée 2013 La Reine Des Bois  (Tavel)

description: This nonvintage rosé, modeled after a Bandol, is a blend of grapes and vintages, yet retains superb freshness and offers unusual complexity. Rich and tart, with a creamy strawberry core, it also shows sandalwood highlights and a hint of barrel toast.
title: Domaine Serene NV R Dry Rosé (Oregon)

description: Syrah (61%), Mourvèdre and Gre-nache make up the bulk of this appealing wine. Bright aromas of strawberry candy, watermelon and orange rind are followed by mouthwatering citrus and cherry flavors.
title: Charles & Charles 2015 Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Musky aromas of lychee and orange are easy to peg as Torrontés. On the palate, there's zest and acid but not much substance. Tangy and tropical in flavors, and shallow in body, this is just o.k. Includes 5% Malbec for color.
title: El Esteco 2014 Amaru High Vineyards Torrontés Rosé (Calchaquí Valley)

description: This is hardly a fashionable color for rosé, deep and almost like a light red wine. It tastes heavy, although the red fruits are cut by ample acidity. The finish is rich and ripe.
title: Casa do Valle 2014 Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: A murky appearance, earthy aromas and mineral-like flavors add up to an eccentric wine. The balance is soft rather than crisp and the body light. Since the winemaker leaves a good portion of lees in the bottle, it's best to stand it up for a few hours before pouring slowly.
title: La Clarine Farm 2014 Rosé (Sierra Foothills)

description: Made from 50% Grenache, 30% Cinsault and 20% Syrah, this is a vibrant, floral rosé, offering upfront aromas of iris, lavender and laurel that complement the raspberry and strawberry-hull core. The fruity palate is bright and refreshing, with ample acidity and just a hint of orange blossom on the finish.
title: Côté Mas 2012 Rosé Aurore Rosé (Pays d'Oc)

description: This restrained, salmon-tinged rosé teases with riper fruit, even with a red-berry compote of red currant and strawberry. The plump fruit is held in a dry frame and tempered by freshness. Equally tempting with or without food.
title: Unger 2013 Q Rosé (Niederösterreich)

description: Salmon-pink in color, this 100% Chambourcin rosé is alive with watermelon Jolly Ranchers and tart peach. Bright, citrusy and fruity, it's a perfect sipper for hot summer days.
title: Rosemont 2014 Rosé (Virginia)

description: Bonheur—happiness—is an appropriate name for this fresh and crisp wine that comes in a flute à corset bottle. It is fruity, lively with orange and apricot over raspberries. Bright acidity finishes it all in good humor.
title: Thomas Carteron 2014 Le Bonheur Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Dusty mineral and herbal aromas contrast against a palate that's chock full of raspberry and cherry flavor. It's forward with fruit, but a bit strikingly acidic, spiked by a razor-like edge of cranberry and lemon.
title: Knapp 2014 Dry Rosé (Finger Lakes)

description: This has a delicious tang of citrus and acidity to go with the crisp red currant fruitiness. It is bright and ready to drink, with refreshing acidity at the end.
title: Domaine de la Sanglière 2014 Breezette Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Open and ripely fruity, this has fresh acidity, with tight and tangy flavors of lemon zest. A warm, rounded character to the wine puts it firmly as an apéritif.
title: Château Roubine 2014 R de Roubine Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This very pale rosé from Syrah master Andrew Murray shows Pink Lady apple, cantaloupe and spun sugar scents on the nose. It's very fresh on the palate, with lively acidity that cuts through the riper cantaloupe and other melon flavors on the midpalate. Chalky texture raises it above many other rosés.
title: Andrew Murray 2016 Esperance Curtis Vineyard Rosé (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: This is classy in every way, from the label to the aromatics to the mouthfeel to the elegant finish. It's a New World take on a Sancerre rouge: delicate and bone dry, yet substantial and utterly delicious. Citrus rind, persimmon, strawberry and a hint of chocolate combine, with a lingering graceful finish.
title: Domaine Divio 2016 Rosé (Willamette Valley)

description: The nose offers minor essences of apple core and more pronounced notes of wet minerality. On the palate, more refreshingly acidic characteristics shine with flavors of ripe rhubarb and red cherry. A rosé perfectly designed for enjoying with food.
title: Domaine de Nizas 2007 Rosé (Coteaux du Languedoc)

description: Offers heady aromas of mashed peaches, banana, blueberry and walnut. The palate matches the nose in flavors and intensity, but is lifted by the vibrant acidity and somewhat prickly texture. Finishes clean with moderate length.
designation: Famille Grassa Rosé de Pressée Merlot-Syrah-Tannat
region_1: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne
title: Domaine du Tariquet 2007 Famille Grassa Rosé de Pressée Merlot-Syrah-Tannat Rosé (Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne)

description: A strong caramel aroma and flavor spoils the suggestions of fruit. They give a ripe, almost sweet character that doesn't match with the red-currant fruit flavors.
title: Château de la Vieille Tour 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This otherwise fruity wine has a rustic edge. It gives an unattractive herbal character that may come from underripe grapes.
title: Château Haut Mouleyre 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Whole berry pressed with 11% saignee from Syrah and Primitivo rounding out the blend, it's a very pretty, pale salmon color with notes of strawberry, watermelon and mineral. It drinks medium sweet with abundant cherry flavors.
title: Gecko 2012 Barbera Rosé (Wahluke Slope)

description: A full and rounded wine, touched by caramel as well as red plum and ripe strawberries. It is generous, with a soft, open aftertaste. There is a light texture from the acidity that creeps in at the end.
title: Château Saint-Sernin 2012 Domaine Saint-Sernin Fare Saint-Sernin Rosé (Côtes du Lot)

description: A rare Pinot Noir rosé from Washington state, this is unabashedly ripe and pink, but not at all sugary. It offers a burst of strawberry and watermelon candy flavors, like a good, long lasting taste of saltwater taffy.
title: J Bell Cellars 2012 Pino Rosé (Yakima Valley)

description: Red cherry, clove, cola and a touch of pepper make for an intriguing nose on this rosé. The palate is a touch viscous, lacking the expected brisk acidity, but it's quite flavorful—more cherry and spice flavors with a hint of wild game.
title: De Tierra 2015 Rosé (Monterey)

description: Bright, crisp raspberry flavors on a bone-dry wine. It is fresh and vibrant, a light touch of caramel and powerful acidity.
title: Campelo 2009 Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: Rubbery and spicy in the nose, with a hint of orange peel. In the mouth, a heavy flatness sets in fast. The wine seems old, and for a rosé, it is. It just sits on your palate, tasting o.k. but needing a poke in the ribs.
title: Château Ferry Lacombe 2000 Cuvee Lou Cascai Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Almost tan in color, with neutral aromas and a dull, almondy flavor profile. Round and smooth. but all in all it's boring and fading fast.
title: Domaine de la Courtade 2001 L'Alycastre Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This light but vibrant and dry wine smells like fresh peaches, tastes like white raspberries and wakes up the mouth with crisp acidity. A floral character comes out with the second sip, and the mouthfeel seems to broaden and smooth on the finish.
title: Holly's Hill 2014 Estate Rosé (El Dorado)

description: At a time when California rosés are marching toward dryness, this one hews to a richer path. It has flavors of raspberries, strawberries and white sugar.
title: Buena Vista 2012 The Count's Selection Pinot Noir Rosé (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is a fresh wine with caramel as well as ripe red-berry flavors. With its textured acidity and crisp, clean aftertaste, it's a wine to drink as an apéritif.
title: Domaine Alban Roblin 2014 Rosé (Sancerre)

description: A pale rosé from Pinot Noir, this is light and fresh, with an intense acidity that cuts through the fruitiness. It's a fine apéritif style with its crisp texture and lively aftertaste.
title: Jean-Michel Sorbe 2014 Rosé (Reuilly)

description: In the pale style made fashionable by Provence, this rosé is fruity, crisp and lightly textured. It's an attractive wine, fresh and ready to drink.
title: Philippe Girard 2014 Rosé (Sancerre)

description: This blend of Bobal and Garnacha is clean and neutral up front. A healthy feeling palate is highly regular but solid. Standard citrus and currant flavors end with moderate length.
title: Castillo de Liria 2014 Winemaker's Selection Rosé (Valencia)

description: Fruity, young and soft, this is an attractive Touriga Nacional-Syrah wine with strawberry flavors and just a touch of crisp red currant acidity. It's made for this summer, ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2016 Terra de Lobos Rosé (Tejo)

description: Snappy but briny citrus aromas include pyrazines. In the mouth, this coastal product feels bouncy but regular. Citrusy flavors come with bell-pepper and celery notes, while this is fresh on the finish, but a touch green.
title: Santa Carolina 2016 Reserva Pinot Noir Rosé (Leyda Valley)

description: This is two consecutive vintages of sketchy to poor rosé from this label. This one smells a bit like a swimming pool, while the flavors are of tart nectarine and pickle. Doesn't much cut it.
title: Estancia Piedra 2007 Rosado Rosé (Toro)

description: Each of Channing Daughter's eight 2011 vintage rosato express a distinct personality, but the Mudd Vineyard Merlot stands out with its seamless integration of ripe, supple fruit with intense minerality and a dewy, floral flair that's irresistible, sip after sip. This is bone dry and begs to be opened as soon as possible.
title: Channing Daughters 2011 Rosato Merlot Mudd Vineyard Rosé (North Fork of Long Island)

description: A terrific expression of its appellation, the 2007 La Dame Rousse from Domaine de la Mordorée starts off a bit tight and minerally on the nose, then explodes on the palate with layers of cherries, peaches, warm stones and dried spices. It's full-bodied and rich, with a long, spice-driven finish. Treat it like a light red, serving it with charcuterie or simple grilled meats, and drink it over the next year or so.
title: Domaine de la Mordorée 2007 La Dame Rousse  (Tavel)

description: This fruit-driven, medium-bodied rosé is a perennially worthy addition to the cooler of poolside staples. Hints of peach and raspberry are ripe but restrained, with just enough thirst-quenching acidity on the finish.
title: Famille Perrin 2015 Réserve Rosé (Côtes du Rhône)

description: A pretty shade of pink bordering on mauve, this bottling shows bright watermelon, fresh strawberry and even red-plum aromas on the nose. The palate is zesty, almost effervescent, with baking-soda texture and lots of energy on the sip but not tons of flavor, with light red-berry elements.
title: Zaca Mesa 2015 Z Gris Rosé (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: This brand new, crisp and fresh wine is so young. Even a rosé can benefit from a few months aging, and this wine with its tight red fruits and lightly tannic texture will be better being drunk after the summer when its fruitiness will explode in the mouth. It is ripe, light and packed with acidity at the end.
title: Henri Bourgeois 2015 La Porte du Caillou Rosé (Sancerre)

description: Pale in color, this is a drier than usual Rosé d'Anjou. It is fresh, soft with attractive wild strawberry fruits and a touch of orange peel. The wine has a tangy texture that makes it extra refreshing. Drink now.
title: Domaine du Petit Clocher 2015  Rosé d'Anjou

description: This blend of 87% Grenache and 13% Syrah shows red apple, deep strawberry and yeast touches on the fresh and lively nose. It hits the palate with brilliant, tactile energy, delivering rounded red fruit and bubblegum flavors that make it a certain summertime crowd pleaser.
title: Chronic Cellars 2016 Pink Pedals Rosé (Paso Robles)

description: Crafted from a mix of 48% Syrah, 45% Grenache and 7% Mourvèdre, this aromatic rosé is spicy and bursting with star fruit, citrus, apple, pear, apricot and more. It's a lively full-bodied wine with a smooth finish.
title: Quady North 2016 Rosé (Rogue Valley)

description: Intensely fruity notes of red currant and raspberry abound on this fragrant full-bodied rosé. It's boldly concentrated on the palate as well, bursting of fresh berry and plum flavors. Primary and juicy in style, yet elegant and penetrating, it's an excellent rosé for year-round consumption—if you can still find a bottle.
title: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2015 Dry Rosé (Finger Lakes)

description: While light coral in color, this unusually rich and mouth-filling wine is flavorful, dry and smooth-textured. It smells like watermelon and tastes like ruby grapefruit with just a hint of maple syrup. It is hefty in flavor while light in body, and will be perfect with ham or prosciutto.
title: Terra d'Oro 2015 Rosé (Amador County)

description: Named after César the sculptor and not Caesar the Roman emperor, the wine has a strongly herbal character that seems to come from the superripe fruit as well as the landscape around Monte Sainte-Victoire. It is certainly rich, although the acidity balances out the spice and pepper character. Drink now.
title: Château Coussin 2016 César à Sumeire Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: This almost white rosé is produced from selected parcels of the estate. Citrus and pepper dominate, supported by ripe red fruits and delicate acidity. It is a beautiful wine, elegant and with a fine balance between the fruit and the crisp texture. Drink now.
title: Figuière 2016 Confidentielle Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Dating to 1740, this classed-growth estate has vines in the heartland of Côtes de Provence. This wine is lightly herbal, with crisp acidity. Apricot and green herb flavors give a lively character and bring out the crisp, tight texture at the end.
title: Château de Saint Martin 2015 Eternelle Favorite Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Tradition indeed with the traditional skittle bottle. The wine inside is structured with concentration as well as plenty of fruity acidity. It is crisp with red-currant flavors and a bright aftertaste.
title: Château Saint-Pierre 2015 Tradition Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Organic grapes go into this fresh, crisp and fruity wine. With raspberry flavors, it is bone-dry and full of acidity. The wine is refreshing—light and bright.
title: Château Sainte Marguerite 2015 L'Esprit de Sainte Marguerite Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Dominated by Syrah in the blend, this wine is full of red fruits. It comes from vineyards set at up to 1,200 feet, giving a cool edge to the acidity even though the wine is ripe. The aftertaste is full, packed with intense fruitiness.
title: Mirabeau 2015 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A fruity, lightweight wine made from Grenache, this is crisp and bright. With red-currant flavors, some pepper and an edgy tang of bitter oranges, it's totally refreshing. The wine comes from the same stable as the more expensive Château d'Esclans rosés.
title: Sacha Lichine 2015 Single Blend Rosé (Vin de France)

description: Made from a 50-50 combination of old vine Gamay and Charbono, both grown in Calistoga, this wine opens in a nondescript way and offers a thick texture of tannin and density, becoming shyly fruity in the glass, a mix of cherry and strawberry.
title: Tedeschi Family 2014 Rosé (Napa Valley)

description: Made from Grenache, this fresh and deliciously fruity wine has a soft side from its ripe berry fruits and warm acidity. Produced in Languedoc, the wine has a sunny character, full of life and lightness.
title: Le Val 2015 Rosé (Vin de France)

description: Made from organically grown grapes, this is crisp and clean. A straight line of bright red and citrus fruits is sharpened by acidity. It has a refreshing aftertaste.
title: Domaines Pierre Chavin 2015 Villa d'Ariane Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: An intensely fruity rosé, the palate is full with red berries and spirited acidity. It's very fruity, fresh and crisp with a cool-climate feel of bright, light texture. Screwcap.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2012 Espirito Rosé (Tejo)

description: A pretty shallot-skin pink, this fruity, crisp wine has red cherry freshness and a bright level of acidity. With its light mineral texture, it is obviously a food rosé.
title: Domaine Jean-Paul Balland 2014 Rosé (Sancerre)

description: This blend of Mourvèdre (78%) and Grenache is a very pretty pale peach color. Aged in a mixture of concrete, stainless steel and neutral French oak, it suggests aromas of citrus, strawberry, herb and spice. It tingles the palate with fresh, lively flavors, showing poise and presence with a citrus-filled finish that lingers.
title: Efeste 2015 Oldfield Estate Rosé (Yakima Valley)

description: This is a bright friendly open wine. With its light crisp fruitiness, layers of acidity and a twist of lemon, it is bone dry with a lively fresh aftertaste. Drink now and call it your Valentine's Day.
title: Château les Valentines 2016 La Caprice de Clementine Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A blend of 50% Grenache and 50% Cinsault from the 50-year-old Pointe de Diable vineyard, this is a soft and ripe wine. It has light acidity and rich red-berry fruits. It's a wine for apéritif drinking—gentle and fruity at the end (the road to the property is called “End of the World”). Drink now.
title: Château Malherbe 2016 Pointe du Diable Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a tangy, fruity wine, with orange and spice flavors. It is rich and full of citrusy acidity, with a tight structure. The wine needs a few more months, so drink from late 2017.
title: Chevalier de Lafoux Sainte Anne 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a warm rounded wine, very approachable with raspberry and damson flavors and crisp acidity. Well balanced, with a lively fruity aftertaste, it is ready to drink now.
title: Domaine de la Sanglière 2016 Breezette Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This wine is dominated by Grenache, which makes up 80% of the blend. That gives the spice and pepper edge as well as bringing out delicious red-berry fruits and crisp acidity. The wine, with its bright aftertaste,is ready to drink now.
title: Domaine des Mapliers 2016 Préferences Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: With a dark enough color to be a red wine and ample cherry and plum flavors, this Grenache bottling is not simply an apéritif. It's full-bodied, rather rich in texture and will pair nicely with meats and cheeses.
title: Troika 2015 Rosé (Mendocino County)

description: This takes the color rosé to an extreme. Almost white, with only the palest hint of color, it comes from 80-year-old Grenache vines. That creates what little concentration this light and delicate wine has. There is an attractive spicy herbal character that lies at the back of this fruity wine.
title: Domaine Sainte-Marie 2016 VieVité Extraordinaire Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Made from Syrah grapes with purpose, not as a saignée, this is an alluring wine, its aromatics exuberant in wild strawberry and rhubarb, with a pithy, textured vibe. With just the right amount of power and body, it's vibrant and yet has body and weight, retaining substance through the long finish.
title: Cornerstone 2014 Corallina Rosé (Napa Valley)

description: Classic, medium sweet rosé from Anjou, bottled cherry flavors and lemon acidity. Screwcap.
title: Bougrier 2011  Rosé d'Anjou

description: There's a pleasantly light, silky texture on this pretty rose-gold colored blend. It has rich flavors of red cherries, persimmons and spices. One thing to know is that it's quite sweet, like sugared tea.
title: Girl Go Lightly 2011 Rosé (California)

description: Maderized and stalky smelling, with a scratchy palate and grassy, pickled flavors that lean toward strawberry and raspberry.
title: Bodegas Valdemar 2010 Conde de Valdemar Rosado Rosé (Rioja)

description: An elegant nose of strawberry, raspberry and lemon is the start of this poised rosé. Unfolding fruit and citrus flavors keep the wine balanced and clean, but the overall character is feminine and soft. A very pretty wine with a classic touch.
title: Juno 2008 Cape Maidens Rosé (Western Cape)

description: Strawberry and pink grapefruit aromas mingle enticingly on the nose. But on the palate it seems a bit syrupy and heavy, finishing with a touch of cola.
title: Miguel Torres 2000 Rosé (Curicó Valley)

description: This rosé opens with a pretty shade of pink and offers aromas of forest berry, cherry, herbs and a touch of ash or white mineral. There's firm, crisp acidity that really keeps the palate refreshed. Shows loads of cheer and brightness in the mouth.
title: Paolo Calì 2008 Osa! Frappato Rosato Rosé (Sicilia)

description: Light and fruity, the wine comes from the sandy soils of the Camargue Rhône-delta region, known for its rugged, indigenous horses. The wine is crisp with acidity and has a bright touch of red currants. The wine is dry, refreshing for an apéritif.
title: Domaine Royal de Jarras 2015 Pink Flamingo Rosé (Sable de Camargue)

description: Produced from Pinot Gris, this is so crisp and fresh. It has light red currant flavors that give an intensely fruity character to this attractive wine that is ready to drink now.
title: Denis Jamain 2014 Rosé (Reuilly)

description: Aromas of wet rock, chewing gum and mild citrus fruits are straight down the middle. This feels modest, while cottony flavors of citrus and watermelon finish short and easy.
title: Príncipe de Viana 2014 Edición Rosa Rosé (Navarra)

description: A whiff of red-apple skins, red plum and spice make for a reasonably clean and fresh nose. This feels plump but still vital. Pithy flavors of citrus and cantaloupe turn more pithy on the finish.
title: Despierta 2014 Rosé (La Mancha)

description: Reuilly has the peculiarity of having rosés from Pinot Gris, even though its reds are from Pinot Noir. This perfumed wine with its pale color brings out the slightly dusty character of the grape. That's contrasted with the intense acidity and black currant fruit flavors. Drink now.
title: Domaine Dyckerhoff 2014 Petit Gris Rosé (Reuilly)

description: While this foamy rosé is not elevated, it should appeal to those who like sweet Moscato bubblies. Candied flavors of raspberry, lychee and dried mango finish with a note of pineapple syrup.
title: Tussock Jumper 2013 Moscato Rosé (Valencia)

description: The wine is soft and gentle, with hints of strawberry fruits and freshness. It's light, but has a crisp and spicy aftertaste.
title: Barton & Guestier 2014 Passeport Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is soft, gentle, ripely fruity and immediately drinkable. Fresh raspberry flavors are cut with acidity and lemon zest. It is fresh, balanced and full of flavor.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2014 Domaine Carambole Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Intense acidity combines with spice and just the right amount of fresh fruitiness to give this lively wine that's full in the mouth. It's ripe and ready to drink.
title: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez 2014 Saint-Roch-les-Vignes Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
winery: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez

description: A blend of 70% Grenache and 30% Mourvèdre, this is an invitingly juicy and spicy rosé, packed with strawberry-mint and pomegranate flavors and a long, savory finish. It's a great introduction to this winery and its talent for creating Rhône-inspired wines.
title: Baiocchi Wines 2011 Neophyte Rosé (Fair Play)

description: This bright, ruby-colored rosé opens with lively tones of cranberry, raspberry and white almond. It's soft and creamy with a touch of sweet berry or ripe cherry on the close.
title: Cantina Santadi 2009 Tre Torri  (Carignano del Sulcis)

description: The pale, pretty salmon-pink color suggests this wine's delicacy of mouthfeel. It's nice and light, with raspberry, strawberry and vanilla flavors, but turns too sugary sweet on the finish for true balance.
title: Black Stallion 2012 Syrah Rosé (Napa Valley)

description: A blend of Syrah and Touriga Nacional , this has a vivid pink color, and a soft, aromatic character. It is ripe and crisp, packed with strawberry juice fruit.
title: Falua 2009 Conde de Vimioso Colheita Seleccionada Rosé (Tejo)

description: A nice blush wine. Made from 100% Pinot Noir, it's dryish and crisp, with pretty flavors of cherries, raspberries and vanilla. Nice with chicken pot pie or chicken enchiladas.
title: Bonneau 2009 Rosé (Carneros)

description: A great value and a good choice for barbecue or summer seafood dishes. Moderate notes of small red berries, wild strawberry and raspberry dominate the creamy mouth along with a hint of soft garrigue herbs on the finish.
title: Les Vignerons de la Méditerranée 2008 Réserve St. Martin Syrah Rosé (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: There is a light pepper and spice character that comes through in this wine. It adds to the wine's simple fruitiness with complexity, pushing the rosé into a food friendly character. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Chateau Peyrassol 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a round full style of rosé. As a result, it is also soft and rich. The balance between the ripe strawberry fruits and the crisper acidity is just right. Drink this wine now.
title: Domaine des Fouques 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence La Londe)

description: Totally pale in colored this wine has delicate hints of red fruits as well as a tight crisp mineral texture. There is a salty edge with touches of spice and pepper. The aftertaste is bright and fruity.
title: Domaine Sainte-Marie 2016 Tradition Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Produced from organically grown grapes, this wine has attractive red fruits and a warm ripe character. Dominated by Grenache, it has a light peppery edge as well as plenty of bright acidity to contrast the fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Domaines Pierre Chavin 2016 Pierre et Paul Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a pale wine, light in fruit and texture. It is poised and crisp with some attractive red fruits. Lively and fruity, it makes a great apéritif style of rosé. Drink now.
title: Figuière 2016 Magali Signature Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a light-colored wine with warm raspberry flavors and attractive acidity. Well balanced, it has a tangy orange-zest texture along with an herbal aftertaste. Drink this attractive wine now.
title: Mas de Cadenet 2016 Nuit Blanche en Provence Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Packaged in a sexy, Champagne-style bottle, this 100% Grenache is firm and substantial. It underscores fruit flavors of peach, apricot and melon with appealing minerality.
title: Gård 2013 Lawrence Vineyards Grand Klasse Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Lively strawberry-fruit flavors are at the heart of this gluggable wine. Bottled under screwcap to preserve freshness, it bears no indication of either vintage or grape. Enjoy it for what it is—a fruity forward near-dry summertime sipping wine.
title: Eola Hills NV Rosé (Oregon)

description: This is a rich style of rosé with caramel as well as red-fruit flavors. It has enough acidity to carry its ripe character, giving the wine a fresh, crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Château Routas 2015 Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: A soft wine, with just a touch of sweetness. The ripe fruit lends a gentle, smooth texture, and it's balanced with attractive red-currant acidity.
title: Château de l'Escarelle 2011 iPink Rosé (Coteaux Varois)

description: Red in color, with sweet aromas of sugar beet, Red Delicious apple and cherry. It feels zesty, with simple flavors of red fruit and red apple. The finish is dry and a touch peppery. Drink immediately while it's fresh.
title: Pradorey 2011 Rosado Joven Tempranillo Rosé (Ribera del Duero)

description: Simple and fruity, this has tangy a tangy raspberry flavor. It's light and zesty, with a fine, fresh aftertaste.
title: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez 2011 Provence One Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
winery: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez

description: This is tightly crisp, with plenty of acidity to give it a mouthwatering character. It is balanced, with orange and caramel flavors. Great with food. Screwcap.
title: Winzer Krems 2011 Rosé (Niederösterreich)

description: This is soft and rich, with a light and smooth textured. It has red fruit, light acidity and a rounded aftertaste.
title: Château de Brigue 2011 Signature Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A ripe style of wine, typified by its caramel element and full, spicy fruit. With its weight, it should pair well with food.
title: Château Deffends 2011 Cuvée Première Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Reddish-pink and orange in color, this wine made from Cabernet Franc grapes works on every level, offering a taste of pomegranate and fresh-squeeed orange that keeps it dry and refreshing as it goes down. Given no time in new oak, it exhibits watermelon and cherry on the finish.
title: Ehlers Estate 2014 Sylviane Rosé (St. Helena)

description: Fresh strawberry, raspberry, sweet pea, orange blossom and honeysuckle abound in the bouquet of this pretty, pale rosé. It has a bright and clean but not overly simple character, with hints of garrigue and peach pit that add interest to the palate. Enjoy this refreshing sip now.
title: Domaine Montrose 2014 Les Lezards Rosé (Pays d'Oc)

description: This rosé, made from Cinsault and Syrah, offers assertive aromas of garrigue herbs—think rosemary and thyme—alongside fruity tones of minty cherry, strawberry and raspberry. The mouthfeel is light and fresh, with the mentholated character dominating the red berry core. Drink now.
title: Domaine Sainte-Eugénie 2014 Rosé (Corbières)

description: This organic rosé leads with mineral aromas that are framed by fruity notes of yellow peach, melon and green mango. The palate is clean and direct, with attractive vibrancy and freshness that carries through to the softly herbal finish. Drink now.
title: Vignobles Jeanjean 2014 Domaine Le Pive Gris Rosé (Sable de Camargue)

description: Muddled strawberry and watermelon aromas and flavors are partnered with an earthy streak reminiscent of wet leaves. The palate is similarly fruit forward, with ample acidity that lifts the fruity richness and results in a short but clean finish.
title: Domaine Sainte-Eugénie 2015 Rosé (Corbières)

description: Made from 40% Grenache Noir, 40% Syrah and 20% Cinsault, this coppery rosé is freshly fruited and quite floral, with aromas of ripe stone fruit, strawberry and orange blossom. The palate is approachable and balanced, with ample acidity and a short but clean finish.
title: Château Viranel 2015 Tradition Rosé (Saint-Chinian)

description: Dry and succulent, this brings tangy flavors of rhubarb and raspberry into focus. It's made for picnic foods—could anything be better with fried chicken? This is widely available and scores a bullseye if your target is a summer sipper.
title: Acrobat 2016 Rosé of Rosé (Oregon)

description: This small appellation is an enclave in the middle of Côtes de Provence. Its style is very similar and this wine, named after the owner, is a structured blend of Syrah and Grenache. The wine from organic grapes has a pepper and spice edge over the crisp acidity of the red fruits. Drink now.
title: Château la Calisse 2016 Patricia Ortelli Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: Made in a deliberately trim and delicate style from Rhône grape varieties, this wine has a pleasant light pink-peach color and canteloupe aromas that lead to a crisp palate of light body and fresh, tart lemon and cranberry flavors.
title: Klinker Brick 2016 Bricks and Roses Rosé (Lodi)

description: This is a blend of Grenache and Cinsault from the organic vineyard of Château Gabriel. It is a lively, crisp wine with fine acidity and refreshing red-currant fruits. It is bone dry, packed with bright acidity as well as fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez 2016 Château Gabriel Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
winery: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez

description: This is a deliciously fruity wine. It has fine red-currant and citrus fruits that give it a fresh crisp texture and flavor. The attractive wine is so bright with fruit right up front. Drink now.
title: Les Quatre Tours 2016 Classique Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: This is a blend of Syrah and Cinsault. That gives the wine structure as well as bright fruits. It is an elegant fruity wine with a creamy ripe texture along with red-currant and raspberry fruits. Drink the wine now.
title: Les Vignobles Gueissard 2016 Cuvée G Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This pale rosé has subdued strawberry aromas and a hint of residual sugar. It comes off as quite generic, without a lot of flavor to bring it to life.
designation: Limited Edition Canyon Vineyard Ranch Cinsault
title: Canoe Ridge 2016 Limited Edition Canyon Vineyard Ranch Cinsault Rosé (Yakima Valley)

description: This is spicy with a strong floral character. Its red-berry fruits are shot through with acidity. The crispness and attractiveness of the wine are spoiled just by the hint of candy and caramel. Drink now.
title: Fabre en Provence 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This blend of Grenache, Syrah and Cinsault is light and fruity, with a touch of red-fruit candy. It has a soft aftertaste that suggests the wine is not bone dry. Drink now.
title: Marrenon 2016 Triniti Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: Caramel and soft fruits in a wine that seems to be missing the zesty, crisp element. The wine feels flat.
title: Château Montaud 2012 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The wine seems flat. It has the red fruits and acidity, but they seem flabby and dull.
title: Bailli de Provence 2012 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Luscious red cherries and raspberries abound from nose to finish in this buoyantly fruity yet dry, elegantly structured rosé. Made from Cabernet Franc and Lemberger, it's nuanced by faint whiffs of blossom and bramble. Revitalizing acidity makes it temptingly quaffable.
title: Keuka Spring 2015 Dry Rosé (Finger Lakes)

description: Made from Tempranillo and Syrah grapes from Stagecoach Vineyard, this inaugural release is unctuous yet light. Six months of aging in mostly French oak has added complexity and a touch of weight. Its orange and peach flavors are juicy and substantial.
title: Krupp Brothers 2016 The Damsel Rosé (Napa Valley)

description: Cherry red, aromatic with scents of crushed roses, strawberries and cherries, this brings a gentle touch of sweetness to the lush fruit flavors. It's pretty as can be, bursting with strawberry fruit, and a very good value. Drink chilled with mild cheeses.
title: High Pass 2016 Pinot Noir Rosé (Willamette Valley)

description: A whole new generation of Italian rosé is finally gaining the attention it deserves. This is an exceptionally fresh and clean wine that would pair with smoked salmon, fish carpaccio or insalata di mare.
title: Carpineto 2011 Dogajolo Rosé (Toscana)

description: Despite the low abv, this is a dry rosé, made from 100% Sangiovese that was picked at 20.5 brix. It's delicate and satisfying—a pretty pale copper/rose color, with flavors of strawberry hinting at peach. There's a dusting of baking spices and cocoa, adding welcome highlights to the finish.
title: Paul O'Brien 2015 Rosato Rosé (Umpqua Valley)

description: This is a simple rosé that could withstand some concentration. It was crafted from barrel-fermented Pinot Noir, and it shows very light flavors of watermelon and strawberry.
title: Methven Family Vineyards 2011 Rosé (Willamette Valley)

description: The cave cooperative in Tavel is hitting on all cylinders, turning out numerous consistent, top-rated examples. Différent doesn't have the spicy nuances of the very best Tavels, but it offers a bold, ripe mouthful of raspberry and cherry fruit, ample weight and richness and a long, slightly dusty-textured finish. Drink now–2018.
title: Les Vignerons de Tavel 2016 Différent  (Tavel)

description: This is 100% varietal, quite pretty in shades of pale pink, and perfectly dry without turning sour. Flavors of watermelon, pink grapefruit, rosewater and Jonathan apples all come into play. Drink it while the wine retains its youthful freshness.
title: Abacela 2014 Grenache Rosé (Umpqua Valley)

description: Fresh strawberry fruit with a bit of spice makes this an easy choice for warm-weather sipping. Tart, with lemony acidity, it's young and lively. Good as it is on its own, it would make an awesome punch.
title: Stoller 2014 Pinot Noir Rosé (Dundee Hills)

description: This unusual rosé blends Merlot rosé with substantial portions of Chardonnay, Cabernet Franc and Gewürztraminer, highlighting textural and flavor attributes from each. It's luscious in mouthfeel with a dense concentration of tropical fruit flavors, yet brisk and effortlessly quaffable. A delightful new take on a Hamptons classic.
title: Wölffer 2014 Summer in a Bottle Rosé (Long Island)

description: This starts off as a deceptively simple berry-cocktail sort of rosé, but then adds lime and crushed stone on the finish to provide added interest and refreshment. Drink now.
title: Domaine de Gournier 2010 Rosé (Vin de Pays des Cévennes)

description: This medium-bodied rosé is a blend of 60% Grenache and 40% Syrah drawn from the estate's young vines. Like its big brother, the Vieilles Vignes, it's gently textured, easily balancing red berry fruit against citrusy elements. It's a clean, refreshing, but somewhat simple quaffer at a bargain price.
title: Château de Nages 2013 Buti Nages Rosé (Costières de Nîmes)

description: Produced close to the sea at Bandol, this wine has a good proportion (20%) of Mourvèdre in the blend. That adds to the richness and brings out a fine aromatic floral character. Wild strawberries flavors give a rich ready-to-drink aftertaste.
title: Le Charmel 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A blend of Sangiovese, Cinsault, Zinfandel and Syrah, this dry Rosé is dark pinkish-red. Otherwise it is light and straightforward, finishing quick.
title: Estate Crush 2012 Rosé (Lodi)

description: This salmon-colored rosé is past its peak. Gritty aromas are turning oily, while the feel is chunky and sticky, with a touch of lasting citric acidity. Flavors of melon and almond skins finish bitter.
title: Luigi Bosca 2012 Finca La Linda Malbec Rosé (Luján de Cuyo)

description: Pale copper in color, this was initially pressed for a sparkling wine program before making a rosé. Its flavors are thin and underripe, with little red fruit, delivering instead skin characteristics and tannins.
title: Coelho 2016 Delfina Vineyard Pinot Noir Rosé (McMinnville)

description: This wine comes from a large 300-acre estate on the island's east coast. It has subtle raspberry fruit and plenty of acidity. With its crisp aftertaste, filled out with a touch of caramel, it's ready to drink.
title: Domaine Vetriccie 2016 Rosé (Ile de Beauté)

description: This 100% Pinot Gris wine has a light-pink color. With its soft ripe red-berry fruitiness it is crisp and clean. There is a touch of spice from these pale-pink-skinned grapes which are more often used to make white wine.
title: Joseph Mellot 2016 Les Milets Rosé (Reuilly)

description: There's nothing subtle about this blush wine made from Zinfandel. It was barrel fermented and barrel aged for 15 months, giving it a full-bodied mouthfeel and even some dusty tannins, and it has robust flavors of cherries, cola, beef jerky and licorice. But it's dry and crisp and is something different.
title: D'Argenzio 2005 D'Loiodice Zinfandel Rosá Rosé (Russian River Valley)

description: Dark pinkish-red, this wine comes from two blocks of the producer's Carneros estate, which are harvested at lower sugar ripeness to offer a dry refreshing experience, which this wine does. This exudes weighty and broad flavors of tangy watermelon, orange and cranberry, with a satisfying grip of power on the finish.
designation: Estate Grand Val Vineyard Pinot Noir
title: Clos du Val 2016 Estate Grand Val Vineyard Pinot Noir Rosé (Carneros)

description: This simple, soft and fruity wine has attractive acidity as well as red currant fruit flavors. With its final tang of acidity, it's well placed as an apéritif.
title: Château du Rouët 2014 Cuvée Réserve Tradition Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A quick extraction yielded a pale peach color for this Vin Gris made from Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot. Delicate aromas of candied banana and peach lead to a palate driven by pink grapefruit.
title: Chateau Morrisette 2014 Vin Gris Rosé (Virginia)

description: Lemon and orange peel are right at the front of this wine. It's fruity, tangy and completely ready to drink.
title: Domaine d'Astros 2014 Cuvée Prestige Rosé (Vin de Pays des Maures)

description: The flavors of this wine follow the same light character as its pale, almost-white color. It does have some fresh juiciness, light acidity and a cut of lemon at the end. Crisp and clean, it's ready to drink.
title: Château Réal d'Or 2014 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Intense red berry and cherry notes shine through this Cabernet Franc rosé. Brisk acidity refreshes, but eight months of barrel aging and lees stirring lend an unusually lactic feel to the palate.
title: Domaine LeSeurre 2013 Cabernet Franc Barrel Select Rosé (Finger Lakes)

description: This lightly fruity wine brings in layers of the freshest acidity before broadening out with citrus and green fruits. The wine is all about crisp, light fruitiness. A blend of Grenache, Syrah and Cinsault, it benefits from warm days and cool nights from vineyards at nearly 1,200 feet.
title: Pure Provence 2014 L'Opaline Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: Soft and light just off dry, this is an attractive and fruity wine. Strawberry flavors give a crispness to the background of the wine, finishing with a light, dancing aftertaste.
title: Le Charmel 2014 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A caramel aroma sets the scene for a ripe, smooth wine. It has ripe red fruits that have a nutty, toasty character that balances with the crisp acidity and tight texture. Drink now.
title: Domaine Roger Champault 2014 Les Pierris Rosé (Sancerre)

description: This is a fresh wine with caramel as well as ripe red-berry flavors. With its textured acidity and crisp, clean aftertaste, it's a wine to drink as an apéritif.
title: Domaine Alban Roblin 2014 Rosé (Sancerre)

description: A pretty pale salmon color, this 100% varietal wine is direct and appealing with notes of watermelon rind and strawberry. It drinks with a sweet-tart finish that shows a bit of heat.
title: Abacela 2012 Estate Grown Grenache Rosé (Umpqua Valley)

description: This full, ripe wine is rich with strawberry and red plum fruit. It's weighty on the palate with flavors of orange zest and a touch of spice. Brisk acidity cuts through the palate adding freshness on the finish.
title: Bernard Magrez 2012 Les Muraires Douce Vie Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: fruits touched with caramel and soft tannin. It's well balanced, with fruit and acidity integrating richly on the finish. It's a fine summer wine but also good for Thanksgiving turkey.
title: Château Castel des Maures 2012 Cuvée Jeanne Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This off-dry rosé is a blend of Chardonnay and Pinot Noir. A light copper hue, it offers simple strawberry flavors, with some supporting acidity.
title: Henry Estate NV Veraison Rosé (Umpqua Valley)

description: This is a bold-flavored, medium-bodied rose. It starts with a bright pink color, then shows effusive floral and fruity aromas and jammy but dry flavors.
title: Las Positas 2015 Estate Rosé (Livermore Valley)

description: This is a fruity, crisp wine. Red currant and candied red-berry fruits fit into a balanced, just off-dry character. The wine is bright with a light sparkle at the end.
title: Obrigado 2015 Nortico Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: A ripe, fruity wine that is bone-dry but so full of red fruits that it seems soft. It's a delicious, lightly textured wine with a good touch of minerality at the end. Drink now.
title: Vignobles Berthier 2013 Domaine des Clairneaux Rosé (Sancerre)

description: Nearly garnet in color, this offers a very strong strawberry sauce aromas, with appealing hints of shortcake. Fruit flavors suggest pressed raspberry, but there is a shiso leaf bitterness as well.
title: Coquelicot 2013 Rosé (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: This is a pale colored, attractively perfumed wine. With red berry fruit flavors, bright acidity and a lively orange zest texture, it is fruity and ready to drink.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Lab Rosé (Lisboa)

description: Fresh, fruity aromas center around red apple and cherry. This pink-colored rosé is fairly full in body, with ample acidity. Slightly salty but fruity plum flavors end steady and level.
title: Bodegas Faustino 2016 VII Tempranillo Rosé (Rioja)

description: The faintest hint of red berry marks this wine's nose. Its palate, on the other hand, brims with zesty citrus. It's very light but also refreshing and dry, with enlivening spritz and citrus flavors.
title: Höpler 2016 Pannonica Rosé (Weinland Österreich)

description: This is a delicious and fruity wine with attractive acidity and bright, ebullient character—it's just waiting for summer. The up-front red fruits and acidity are well in balance. This is ready to drink.
title: Les Vignobles Gueissard 2016 Les Papilles Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: While not as blossomy in perfume as previous vintages, there's plenty of fresh watermelon and sour-cherry refreshment here. Exceptionally light bodied and dry, it's an invigoratingly crisp summer sip. The finish is brisk but crystalline and mineral.
title: Lieb 2016 Bridge Lane Rosé (North Fork of Long Island)

description: This soft wine has attractive red-berry flavors. They are given a lift by the bright acidity. It is a gentle wine, ideal for an apéritif with just the lightest tang at the end.
title: Mas de Cadenet 2016 Arbaude Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A deliciously ripe and soft wine, this is also fruity and with a fine tang of clementine. There is a refreshing side to the red-currant fruitiness and intense acidity. It is lightly perfumed and finished with a touch of pepper. Drink now.
title: Mirabeau 2016 Pure Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This warm fruity wine is rounded and ripe with flavors of vanilla as well as red-berry fruits. It is soft with just a light tang of orange zest and finishing acidity. Drink this attractive wine now.
title: Jérôme Gueneau 2016 Domaine des Grandes Perrières Rosé (Sancerre)

description: Made from the Moreto grape, this light and fruity wine is a perfect summer rosé. It is crisp with red currant and raspberry fruits, with a delicious layer of acidity. Drink now.
title: Luis Duarte 2016 Rapariga da Quinta Colheita Seleccionada Rosé (Alentejano)

description: Modest cherry and plum aromas are weighty. This is holding onto its freshness, with flavors of citrus pulp and peel. Drink up now.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
title: Peñascal 2012 Tempranillo Rosé (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)

description: In the mouth, this feels chunky, with sugary red-berry flavors coming in front of a sticky finish. The grape variety is the obscure Prieto Picudo.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
title: Dominio Dostares 2012 Tombú Prieto Picudo Rosé (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)

description: This salmon-colored wine is powdery on the nose, with aromatic hints of apple skins and raspberry. The palate feels lean, pinched and rubbery, while flavors of pithy citrus fruits finish chalky, with some tang.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
title: Storks' Tower 2012 Tempranillo-Shiraz Rosé (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)

description: Soft Pinot Noir gives this warm, rounded wine. Red-berry fruits are freshly cut with acidity while keeping the fruitiness to the fore. This bright, juicy wine is ready to drink.
title: Domaine Pellé 2014 Morogues Rosé (Menetou-Salon)

description: A pale orange-pink shade, this rosé shows watermelon, baked strawberries, orange cream and a touch of bubblegum on the welcoming nose. Once sipped, it's sleek and easy to drink, with rich red fruit cut by a tangy, almost sour orange zest.
title: Feliz Noche 2013 Mi Pasión Rosé (Santa Barbara County)

description: Crisp fruit is broadened by caramel flavors and soft acidity. Ripe red cherries dominate along with a smooth texture. This is a fine apéritif style, ready to drink.
title: Domaine Sainte-Marie 2013 Vie Vité Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Light and fresh, this is a crisp, red berry flavored wine with lively acidity and a dry, bright aftertaste. Ready to drink.
title: Domaine Houchart 2013 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Onion-skin pink in color, this wood-aged wine is opulent and ripe. It is textured, with generous red fruits that are given a great lift by the spice and pepper that fill the mouth and give the wine power and richness. The acidity is well integrated, finishing the wine with freshness. A far cry from so many fruity rosés, this is a serious wine.
title: Château d'Esclans 2013 Garrus Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is as serious as Provence rosé can get. It is a limited production wine, selected from the best Grenache (75%) and Syrah (25%) parcels. Structured and impressively dense, its red fruits are concentrated, bone-dry and with a textured character. It is ready to drink although it will become richer from early 2016. The Sumeire family arrived in the Sainte Victoire mountain range in the 13th century.
title: Château Coussin 2014 Cuvée César à Sumeire Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: This is a crisp, fresh and fruity rosé, made from Touriga Nacional in the same region where Vinho Verde is produced. It's vivid acidity is bright, with raspberry flavors and low alcohol.
title: Quinta de Santa Maria 2010 Rosé (Minho)

description: This is brilliantly fruity, very crisp and fragrant, with delicious spice, perfumed red fruits and lively acidity. It's very dry, with a fresh aftertaste.
title: Vignoble de la Jarnoterie 2013 Quintessence  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

description: Here's a friendly, accessible and value-priced rosé that's perfect for warm-weather entertaining. Ripe cherry, plum and raspberry flood the nose and mouth, with a soft dusting of cocoa that adds interest and decadence. The ripe flavors are full and jammy, but balanced by medium acidity that keeps the palate fresh and the finish clean.
title: Château Cabezac 2012 La Tradition Rosé (Minervois)

description: A crushed carnation aroma accents the ripe fruit core of strawberry, raspberry and mango on this selection. The palate is juicy and fruit forward, with red berry flavors, medium acidity and a subtle earthy spice that unfolds on the finish.
title: Domaine Cabirau 2013 Rosé (Côtes du Roussillon)

description: There are attractive floral and garrigue tones to the subtle fruit core of this wine, with hints of white cherry, melon rind and strawberry hull. The lively palate offers brisk acidity and lively tart-fruit flavors. A touch of white chocolate echos on the medium-length finish.
title: Domaine Montrose 2013 Rosé (Côtes de Thongue)

description: Very rich, spicy and full-bodied for a rosé. The raspberry and strawberry flavors have a grilled, caramelized quality, making for a slightly sweet finish. Fortunately, there is high acidity, giving this high octane rosé needed crispness.
title: Gundlach Bundschu 2009 Tempranillo Rosé (Sonoma Valley)

description: This is a plump, medium-bodied rosé, vibrant with confected berry fruit and undertones of mossy stones and peppery spice. Should be versatile at the table, as it's fresh enough to handle fish yet intense enough to partner grilled meats.
title: Les Vignes des Prêcheurs 2010  Tavel

description: Bubblegummy and fresh in acidity, this rosé tastes like a young Beaujolais, with strawberry and raspberry fruit. It's an enjoyable wine to wash down little tapas plates of olives, ham, salted nuts.
title: Demetria 2010 Rosé (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Produced from Niellucciu, this wine is ripe, perfumed and also packed with crisp acidity. Fresh raspberry, citrus and a touch of caramel are brought comfortably together by the acidity and zesty aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Clos Alivu 2015 Rosé (Patrimonio)

description: A simple, fruity wine, this has light acidity and a touch of pepper at the end. It is a classic apéritif style of rosé.
title: Moncigale 2015 Frais et Fruité Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This bold, ripe blend even contains some Muscat that gives richness and a touch of honey and spice to what is otherwise a dry rosé. The acidity acts as a balance to this attractive wine.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2015 Jas des Vignes Rosé

description: Named after the French author who came from Provence, this wine is a bright, fruity style with pepper and caramel flavors. It has plenty of red fruits and attractive final acidity.
title: La Belle Collection 2015 Colette Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A pretty purplish pink, this rose shows deep cherry, ripe strawberry and bubblegum-ish notes on the lush nose. The palate is slightly effervescent but with crisper flavors than the nose suggests, offering cherry blossom and steely minerality, finishing crisp and tart.
title: Robert Hall 2015 Rose de Robles Rosé (Paso Robles)

description: This fresh, crisp, textured wine has pepper as well as red fruit flavors. It offers a touch of spice, ripe strawberries and delicious final acidity.
title: Château Cavalier 2014 Réserve de la Familie Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: While the wine is full in the mouth with ripe fruits, it also has a delicious poise and freshness that makes it ready to drink. It's a well-balanced wine, full of fruitiness and acidity in harmony.
title: Château d'Esclans 2014 Whispering Angel Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Full in the mouth, this is a soft caramel and orange zest-flavored wine. It has light acidity, although probably not enough to give a balance. The aftertaste brings pepper and spice.
title: Château Léoube 2014 Sécret de Léoube Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A pale gray-pink color, this is fresh, crisp and bright in the mouth, with a touch of pepper to add interest. The aftertaste is full of ripe raspberries.
title: Domaine de la Croix 2014 Eloge Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is an upfront and vibrant rosé, showing ample stone fruit and watermelon aromas on the nose. Predominately Merlot, it offers a round and fleshy palate, balanced by a lively vein of lemon. These lead to a juicy peach and jasmine tea finish.
title: Early Mountain 2014 Rosé (Virginia)

description: Just a touch pink, this delicately hued rosé penetrates with fresh watermelon and raspberry flavors. Vivid and crisp, it's elegantly mineral and boasts a cool—almost alpine—freshness making it perfect for summer months.
title: Keuka Spring 2014 Dry Wiltberger Vineyard Field Blend Rosé (Finger Lakes)

description: With a dark, weird red-orange color, this rosé feels heavy and candied in raspberry and orange fruit. It's a little sweet.
title: Merriam 2010 Rosé (Sonoma County)

description: A simple, slightly sweet wine, with jammy raspberry and cola flavors, brightened with crisp acidity.
title: Martin Ray 2010 Dry Rosé (Russian River Valley)

description: A whiff of vanilla mingles amidst fresh watermelon, berry and cherry in this bright fruity rosé. It's dry in style with lush voluminous body. A hint of phenolic bitterness juxtaposes a slightly candied finish.
title: Keuka Spring 2016 Dry Rosé (Finger Lakes)

description: A slightly deeper shade of pink, this Grenache-based rosé from the new Brick Barn Vineyard by James Sparks of Liquid Farm fame offers red cherry, plum and vanilla pastry aromas. Flavors are restrained and very clean, with strawberries and cream cut by a sharp line of citrus, reminiscent of tangerine rinds.
title: Kings Carey 2016 Rosé (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: This blend of Merlot and Syrah is a plush sip full of bright black-cherry and berry flavors. It's soft on the midpalate with a ripe yielding fullness in mouthfeel.
title: McCall 2016 Marjorie's Corchaug Estate Rosé (North Fork of Long Island)

description: This attractive pink-colored wine has plenty of red-fruit flavor and acidity. It is a warm, rich wine, full of fruit with a touch of spice. Drink now.
title: Château Laville 2016 Rosé de Laville Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This wine is fruity, packed with red-berry flavors. It has plenty of the acidity that marks this vintage in rosés while keeping a riper backdrop. Drink now.
title: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2016 Les Hauts de Smith Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Vegan friendly and made with organic grapes, this fresh informal rosé has subtle aromas of red berry, wild flower and a whiff of tilled soil. The easygoing palate offers sour cherry and a hint of dried sage.
title: Feudo di Santa Tresa 2016 Purato Organic Wine Rosé (Terre Siciliane)

description: Orange peel and raspberry aromas meet a touch of sourness on the nose of this bottling from Joey Tensley and Alex Guarachi, which comes after the label's more successful red and white wines. The palate maintains good acidity and grip, with berry compote and earthy flavors.
title: Tenshen 2016 Rosé (Central Coast)

description: A rich style of rosé that has some wood aging and a full-bodied texture. Strawberry fruit flavors dominate. Drink now.
title: Château Brown 2012 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Strawberry and cherry aromas lead in to this layered but brisk rosé from Drama. On the palate, spices, tropical fruit and a finish of salinity give the wine elegant character. A delicious and versatile pour with exotic notes.
title: Domaine Costa Lazaridi 2015 Single Vineyard Dry Rosé (Drama)

description: This fluorescent pink rosé is fairly full on the nose, with a grape skins character. Lively, balanced and lightly oily in feel, this delivers plum and citrus flavors prior to a finish that's pithy and tastes like ripe pink grapefruit.
title: Rio Madre 2015 Graciano Rosé (Rioja)

description: This 100% Syrah rosé is extremely pale in color and offers dainty aromas of pink peony, cherry, strawberry hull and barely ripe peach. The pristine palate offers more of the same, with additional hints of melon rind and peach skin that lend some bitterness and texture to the finish. Well balanced and refreshing; drink now.
title: La Forge Estate 2015 Rosé (Pays d'Oc)

description: This is made from a field blend of Cinsault, Carignane, Grenache, Zinfandel and Viognier. Medium bodied and medium in acidity, it offers a dry, fulfilling tartness of orange, grapefruit and raspberry, remaining light and bright on the palate.
title: Spicy Vines 2015 Violet Rose Rosé (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Grapefruit, strawberry and roses lead on the nose of this friendly pour. Cherry and flowers on the palate are playful and easy drinking. A great patio pour with a fun character.
title: Wine Art Estate 2016 Pink Bang Rosé (Drama)

description: Pale pink in color, the aromas offer notes of strawberry, bubblegum and apple. Lightly spritzy, it brings forward somewhat-weighty-feeling fruit flavors. Despite the spritz, it seems a bit ponderous.
title: Anew 2016 Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This luxury cuvée combines Syrah with Vermentino in a wine that resembles Sauvignon Blanc for its lively citrus and passion fruit aromas and flavors. A bit of oiliness gives it weight on the midpalate, but it finishes zesty and refreshing.
title: Château de Campuget 2016 1753 Syrah-Vermentino Rosé (Costières de Nîmes)

description: A pretty floral note, reminiscent of carnations, sits atop the crisp, fresh fruit tones of red cherry and watermelon on the nose and mouth of this easygoing wine. It's direct, yet clean, with a mouthwatering finish.
title: Domaine Montrose 2016 Rosé (Pays d'Oc)

description: Bright, fruity and crisp, this silky-textured rosé has a refreshing finish and bold, pink bubble-gum-like (but dry) flavors. Drink now.
title: Pont du Rhône 2016 Passion Terroirs Rosé (Côtes du Rhône)

description: This field blend of Grenache, Zinfandel, Carignane and Cinsault was fermented in stainless steel and partially aged in neutral oak. Its strawberry and orange flavors combine effortlessly within its light, dry frame.
title: Spicy Vines 2016 Violet Rosé (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Produced from Pinot Noir, this is a particularly crisp example of a Sancerre rosé. It has red-currant fruitiness along with an edge of tannins. The finish is smoothed with caramel. Drink now.
title: Michel Vattan 2016 Rosé (Sancerre)

description: A powerful wine, concentrated with an edge of pepper and rich red fruits, lifted with an orange zest flavor. This is serious rosé, intense and worth aging a few months.
title: Domaine de la Sauveuse 2010 Cuvée Château Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: With a pink-orange color, this rosé tastes tired and oxidized, like a bottle that was opened and left standing out on the shelf for a day or so.
title: Nobelle 2012 Bisou Bisou Grenache Rosé (Paso Robles)

description: One has to dig deep to discover much in the way of aromas on this rosé, which is made of indeterminate grapes. Dry, dark pink in color, its flavors are quite simple.
title: Jason-Stephens 2012 Estate Rosé (Santa Clara Valley)

description: Rich and fruity, this wine is a full-bodied rosé. It has ripe red fruits and a touch of tannin along with balanced acidity. With its up-front richness, it is a food wine, rather than an apéritif.
title: Château Barbebelle 2014 Cuvée Madeleine Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Touched by caramel, this is a bone-dry rosé, very crisp and fruity, with raspberry, red cherry.
title: Zull 2009 Lust & Laune Rosé (Niederösterreich)

description: This copper-colored wine was made from mostly Rhône-style grapes and has earthy meaty aromas and flavors, a light to medium body and a texture that's rich and smooth. This is not a crisp fruity version, but a more savory complex one that can fill in for a red.
title: Hess 2016 Shirtail Ranches Rosé (California)

description: This crisp, ripe Malbec rosé comes from vineyards in Cahors. Its red currant acidity and perfumed, fruity character make it immediately drinkable and refreshing. Drink now.
title: Jean-Luc Baldès 2016 Clos Triguedina Malbec Rosé

description: Bone-dry style, very crisp and with a full fruit character of red apples and peaches along with red berries. A great food wine.
title: Château Revelette 2009 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Sweet juicy fruit flavors dominate this concentrated wine. It is rich, soft in texture, showing heat even though well-balanced. It could age for several months given its firm texture.
title: Domaine Sorin 2009 Rosé (Bandol)

description: Made from 70% Grenache and 30% Syrah, this opens with attractive notes of red cherry, plum and blood orange. Rich, yet balanced by ample acidity, this ends on a slightly bitter, pithy note. Drink up.
title: Domaine La Jeanne 2014 Rosé (Pays d'Oc)

description: A light salmon color, aromas like sliced peaches and watermelon, flavors like canteloupe and a smooth texture combine for a substantive rosé that's not just a light thirst quencher. It is more rich and less tart than many others.
title: Sanglier Cellars 2014 Sun Tusque Dry Rosé (Sonoma County)

description: This is a soft, balanced blend of Aragon and Touriga Nacional. It has a a bright, fruity character that is both fresh and warm. It's a delicious wine to drink with food.
title: Monte Branco 2014 Alento Rosé (Alentejano)

description: An extroverted burst of meaty, minerally and fruity flavors defines this medium-bodied, firm-textured and concentrated wine. Imagine prosciutto wrapped around canteloupe for the flavor, plus vivid acidity and a lingering, almost smoky finish.
title: Sol Rouge 2014 Rosé (Lake County)

description: Made from Pinot Noir grapes, this drinks drier than the producer's Whole Cluster rosé. A burst of Maraschino cherry flavor leads into candied fruit notes, finishing clean and simple. It's a good quaffer that should be drunk well chilled.
title: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2016 Rosé (Willamette Valley)

description: A pale salmon color, this rosé shows ripe notes of cocoa-dusted cherry and strawberry alongside sweet citrus oil. Creamy and full in the mouth, it's a richer rosé that can stand up to heartier fare.
title: Morgenhof 2010 Fantail Pinotage Rosé (Stellenbosch)

description: If your love of animals knows no bounds, then this is the wine for you—Serene is named after a dog. Caravintas supports animal shelter, service and rescue groups so the cause is good. The wine? It has a cordial cherry liqueur or Schnapps flavor; its acidity is disheveled.
title: Carivintas 2010 Serene Rose of Tempranillo Rosé (Dunnigan Hills)

description: Smells like fresh berries and perfume, which is good. In the mouth, it's weighty and sticky, with just enough acidity to keep it pumping. Tastes cranked up and wild, with plum and nectarine flavors leading the charge. Sugary on the finish, with a slightly cloying feel.
title: Tapiz 2011 Malbec Rosé (Mendoza)

description: This vintage is sourced entirely from the estate vineyard, a mix of four Rhône varieties. Cherry red, fruity and round, it's a crisp and stylish rosé for near-term drinking.
title: Dusted Valley 2010 Ramblin' Rosé (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Shiny pink in color, with a crisp and wet nose that powerfully suggests refreshment to come. Juicy and superfresh on the palate, with cherry and raspberry flavors and citrusy undertones. A real winner in Garnacha rosé from Navarra.
title: Vega Sindoa 2010 Garnacha Rosé (Navarra)

description: Bottled in a lovely 500 ml bottle, with a label of cut paper with butterflies, this was barrel fermented in neutral oak. It's a beautiful color, a coppery salmon, much like rosé de Provence (where winemaker Virginie Bourgue is from). It's dry and fruity, but more complex than most newly released rosés, with light berry fruits, a lovely texture, and a finish that suggests malted milk chocolate candy.
title: Lullaby 2007 Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Notes of orchard apple, peach skin, yellow melon, orange blossom and a touch of beeswax unfold on the bouquet of this nuanced rosé. It's medium in weight, with a softness on the midpalate that's lifted on the close by ample acidity.
title: Château d'Anglès 2016 Classique Mourvèdre-Syrah-Grenache Rosé (La Clape)

description: This old-vine cuvée from one of the region's leading estates boasts aromas of bubble gum and passion fruit. This soon after release, that's not surprising; expect them to settle down into more restrained notes of cherry, melon and passion fruit over the next month or two. It's medium bodied and has a long, mouthwatering finish.
title: Château de Nages 2016 Vieilles Vignes Rosé (Costières de Nîmes)

description: Produced in vineyards close to Mont Saint-Victoire in the west of the Provence vineyards, this perfumed, floral wine has crisp acidity along with orange and citrus flavors. The wine is light, very fruity and bright at the end.
title: Gassier 2015 Esprit Gassier Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: With a caramel character and light, bright acidity, this is a soft, not-quite-dry wine. It has a warm, open and accessible feel to it, light and fruity on the finish.
title: Sables d'Azur 2015 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: From the region of La Londe close to the sea, this wine is warm and ripe, with rich strawberry flavors that are almost jammy. A touch of pepper and spice calms down the freshness. Probably this wine will be better as an apéritif.
title: Château les Bormettes 2015 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This soft, fruity and fleshy wine has bright red fruits and a strong pepper character. The wine comes from vineyards between 900 and 1,500 feet on limestone soil, giving it a mineral edge at the end.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2015 Florette Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: In the classic Provence skittle bottle, this is a soft, red-fruited wine. Fruity and crisp, it is refreshing and immediately appealing.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2015 Manon Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This pink blend of 66% Merlot and 34% Cabernet Sauvignon simply stood heads above other roses in its flight. Light plum and strawberry juice aromas meet with yeastyness on the nose, while the palate combines a prominent acidity with an extremely chalky mouthfeel. Light raspberry, bubblegum and squeezed mandarin flavors complete the experience.
title: Brander 2016 Rosé

description: The chalky limestone soil of Pic St. Loup allows the fruit to shine without being overpowering, translating into lively aromas and flavors of fresh red berries, nectarine, banana and ripe pineapple chunks supported by nuances of talcum and sweet pea. The creamy texture and medium weight are somewhat surprising for this aesthetically light rosé, and with the lingering finish and well-balanced acidity.
title: Château de Fountgraves 2007 Pic Saint Loup Rosé (Coteaux du Languedoc)

description: A blend of 60% Grenache, 20% Clairette and 20% Syrah, this wine represents a relative bargain in the rarified realm of Tavel. Notes of wet stone and citrus carry through from start to finish, joined on the midpalate by hints of white chocolate and raspberry. It's a relatively full-bodied rosé that can stand up to grilled meats.
title: Brotte 2013 Les Églantiers  (Tavel)

description: A nice, racy version, with lots of citrus and strawberry fruit that linger nicely on the finish. Crisp and light; a good match with grilled seafood. Drink now.
title: Waters Crest 2008 Rosé (North Fork of Long Island)

description: A simple, slightly sweet blush wine, clean in acidity, with flavors of raspberries, vanilla and spices. Pinot Noir, Cab Franc and Zinfandel.
title: Zina Hyde Cunningham 2008 Rosé (Sonoma County)

description: A pale salmon colored rosé, this medium- to full-bodied wine offers scents of honeydew, red berries, peach and crushed stones and flavors to match. The only quibble is that it finishes a little abruptly. This is very good, but consumers should be on the lookout for the fresher 2007.
designation: Château de Selle Clair de Noirs
title: Domaines Ott 2006 Château de Selle Clair de Noirs Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Seriously refreshing, this pink and copper-colored medium-bodied wine has dazzling citrus aromas, pink grapefruit and raspberry flavors and great acidity that wakes up the taste buds. Made from Grenache and Counoise grapes, it's just the thing for an alfresco lunch or to pour with appetizers before dinner.
title: Murrieta's Well 2016 Dry Rosé (Livermore Valley)

description: Packed in a pink bottle, this Garnacha rosé opens with prickly pink-grapefruit aromas. It's balanced on the palate, with a touch of oily weight. Orange and cantaloupe flavors leave a citric tang on the finish.
title: Bodegas Paniza 2015 Sleever Garnacha Rosé (Cariñena)

description: Made from almost equal parts Pinot Noir and Dornfelder, this unusual dry rosé offers ripe (almost candied) cherry and raspberry notes juxtaposed against a refreshing mineral backbone. It's not deeply concentrated but thirst quenching and spry.
title: Fulkerson 2015 Rosé (Finger Lakes)
