description: This Tempranillo-based rosé is clean up front, with hints of citrus and chewing gum to the nose. A solid mouthfeel makes for a good palate, while this offers a quick pop of zesty citrus fruit that's backed by duller yeast and wheat notes on the finish.
title: Urbina 2015 Rosé (Rioja)

description: Despite the low abv, this is a dry rosé, made from 100% Sangiovese that was picked at 20.5 brix. It's delicate and satisfying—a pretty pale copper/rose color, with flavors of strawberry hinting at peach. There's a dusting of baking spices and cocoa, adding welcome highlights to the finish.
title: Paul O'Brien 2015 Rosato Rosé (Umpqua Valley)

description: While this foamy rosé is not elevated, it should appeal to those who like sweet Moscato bubblies. Candied flavors of raspberry, lychee and dried mango finish with a note of pineapple syrup.
title: Tussock Jumper 2013 Moscato Rosé (Valencia)

description: This is a crisp, fruity and well-balanced wine. Along with its red-currant fruit and bright acidity, it has a touch of caramel that adds richness. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Domaine Sautereau 2014 Côte de Reigny Rosé (Sancerre)

description: A fresh, pale rosé from Pinot Noir, this has acidity coming from the red-currant fruits and crisp raspberries. With its light texture and total fruitiness, it's a wine to drink now.
title: Joseph Mellot 2014 Les Milets Rosé (Reuilly)

description: Made from Pinot Gris, this pale colored wine has just a blush of rosé. It is so fresh and perfumed, only lightly textured. A fine apéritif style, the wine has juicy red currant flavors, topped with orange zest. Drink now.
title: Domaine Cordaillat 2014 Rosé (Reuilly)

description: A wisp of a wine that's dark-salmon in color, this is made entirely from Grenache grapes grown near the town of Davis. It's dry, light and fun, offering a strawberry and watermelon fruitiness, with a trace of spice on the end.
title: Rock Wall 2011 Uncle Roget's Grenache Rosé (Yolo County)

description: A delicious rosato made from the hearty Montepulciano grape, this opens with pretty aromas of garden flower, wild berry, dried mint and white almond. This is crisp, fresh and would pair with fried calamari rings.
title: Talamonti 2011  Cerasuolo d'Abruzzo

description: From this estate founded in the 13th century comes a finely made wine. Its dryness combines well with great flavors of red currant, raspberry and lime. It is delicious with food or as an apéritif.
title: Commanderie de la Bargemone 2011 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: This is a finely balanced wine, showing its crisp acidity and its fruitiness along with a richer character that lends weight. This is both immediately attractive and worth aging for a few months.
title: Domaine de l'Hermitage 2011 L'Oratoire Rosé (Bandol)

description: A ripe yeasty wine in a variation of a classic Provencal skittle bottle, with red fruits and a nutty character. It is fat, full with plenty of citrus fruitiness. With a crisp aftertaste, it is bright at the end.
title: Château Sainte Roseline 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A smooth and soft wine, this is packed with ripe fruit and attractive balanced acidity. There is a layer of caramel as well as spicy raspberry that give the wine extra warmth. Drink now.
title: Collection des Anges 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This pale wine is light, bright and fruity. It has a tangy edge along with plenty of crisp acidity. The aftertaste is clean, packed with fruitiness with a soft texture.
title: Estandon 2016 Domaine de Caseneuve Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The Cinsault that dominates this blend creates a light and gently fruity wine. It has attractive acidity and just the lightest of red-fruit flavors. The aftertaste is soft and tangy with orange zest.
title: Château de Brigue 2016 Les Meyans Elégance Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This Provence cru classé estate has produced a refreshingly fruity wine. With its red-currant and citrus flavors and tight mineral acidity, it is both textured and really crisp. Drink now.
title: Château de Saint-Martin 2016 Eternelle Favorite Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The wine comes from a large estate east of Aix-en-Provence. With its light fruitiness and attractive acidity, the wine is ripe with red-berry fruits and finishes with a fine crisp aftertaste. The wine is refreshing and very drinkable now.
title: Château Pigoudet 2016 Pigoudet Première Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: This pink blend of Mourvèdre and Grenache shows rosy aromas as well as a bitter orange scent and yeasty qualities. The palate is light in both flavor and texture but makes for a refreshing hot day sipper.
title: Clos des Amis 2016 Rosé (Ventura County)

description: Softly fruity, the wine is warm and with gentle red-fruit flavors. It is an easy-quaffing style with just the right amount of acidity and a light caramel and spice aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Domaine de la Sanglière 2016 La Sanglière Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a soft and fruity wine. It has gentle acidity and a ripe blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc. The wine, with its strawberry flavor, is immediately attractive. Drink now.
title: Domaine D'en Ségur 2016 Le Rosé (Côtes du Tarn)

description: A strange orange-pink color for a wine that is somewhere between fruity and sweet and acid and bitter. This one hasn't found a balance.
designation: Companhia das Lezírias Herdade de Catapereiro
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Companhia das Lezírias Herdade de Catapereiro Rosé (Tejo)

description: Soft and sweet, this is a light and fruity wine. Touches of raspberry are balanced by acidity. Drink now.
title: Campelo 2014 Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: Vanilla, strawberry and cherry on the nose leads into a spicy but balanced blend of fresh and fruity flavors. The wine offers ample minerality so it's clean on the tongue. Delightful and flirty, and good with fruit desserts.
title: Domaine Costa Lazaridi 2009 Amethystos Rosé (Drama)

description: Composed of 40% Syrah, 40% Grenache and 20% Mourvèdre, this fruit-forward rosé offers powerful notes of ripe red berries framed with a candied orange peel and watermelon sweetness. Fleshy on the palate with a full texture and body.
title: Domaine de Nizas 2010 Rosé (Coteaux du Languedoc)

description: Winemaker Dave Potter heads to his old haunting grounds around Rancho Cucamonga to source fruit for this fun bottling, which shows wet soil and sour cherries on the nose. The palate is very down the middle and built to please, with flavors of cherry and baking spice.
title: Municipal Winemakers 2016 Debra Blush Wine Rosé (California)

description: A pale pink in the glass, this light and clean bottling shows aromas of chalk, pink flowers, watermelon and a slice of lime. It's crisp on the sip with a tight texture, offering a very quaffable bubblegum flavor.
title: Rabble 2016 Mossfire Ranch Rosé (Paso Robles)

description: This is a great option for a widely available and affordable rosé. A very pretty pink in color, it shows baked strawberry, rose petals and vanilla ice cream on the nose. The sip tightens around cherry and strawberry-brioche flavors.
title: SeaGlass 2016 Rosé (Monterey County)

description: Vibrant, coppery salmon in color, this lively and delightful rosé is two-thirds Grenache and one-third Mourvèdre, all stainless steel-fermented. Pretty watermelon and strawberry flavors are accented by streaks of cracker and mineral.
title: Doyenne 2011 Rosé (Yakima Valley)

description: Salmon pink in color, this rosé has aromas of jasmine and dried rosemary. It is savory and acid-driven on the palate, with a pleasantly astringent finish.
title: Manastira 2016 Ilaya Rosé (Thracian Valley)

description: This light-orange-colored wine has quite a bit of red wine character, from the raspberry aromas to rather meaty grapey flavors, smooth texture and medium to full body.
title: Brassfield 2016 Rosé (High Valley)

description: The top rosé from Sacha Lichine's Esclans estate, this is wood aged and the flavors of wood are apparent, if subtle. The wine has a great smooth texture, the fruit well integrated, showing richness as well as elegance. Not classic Provence, but certainly impressive.
title: Château d'Esclans 2008 Garrus Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A very rich blush wine made from the same Cabernet grapes that go into the winery's expensive dry table wine. It's silky and wonderfully crisp, with deep flavors of raspberries, rose petals and vanilla spice. Wonderful with mushroom risotto, or with little puff pastry appetizers.
title: Notre Vin 2006 Cabernet Sauvignon Rosé (Howell Mountain)

description: Cotton candy and apple cider aromas give way to a mild palate with soft acidity but a sense of complexity. Plump red-fruit flavors are not specific, and overall this blend of Tempranillo, Syrah and Garnacha is appealing but slightly vacuous.
title: Alcardet 2015 Sommelier Tempranillo-Syrah-Garnacha Rosé (La Mancha)

description: While red apple, raspberry and bramble aromas on this rosé are restrained, ruddy, slightly overripe cherry and strawberry flavors build on the palate. Dry and full-bodied in style, it finishes with a touch of exotic spice.
title: Brooklyn Oenology 2014 As If Courage Rosé (New York)

description: A fashionable pale-salmon color, this dainty rosé opens with delicate floral aromas of sweet pea and white clover that are framed by fruity tones of red cherry and strawberry. The palate is fleshy and fruit-forward, buoyed by ample acidity that finishes fresh.
title: Domaine la Colombette 2015 Notorious Pink Grenache Rosé (Vin de France)

description: From one of the four properties bought by great-grandparents of the present owner, this wine is light, bright and totally up-to-the-minute in its crisp freshness. Red fruits and touches of citrus dominate along with the lightest touch of tannin. It will make a great apéritif.
title: Fabre en Provence 2015 Château de la Deidière Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This vibrantly light, restrained wine comes from some hallowed vineyards, including Hudson, Stagecoach and Crocker & Starr, the blend comprised of 38% Cabernet Franc, 34% Cabernet Sauvignon and 28% Merlot. Dark in color, it offers aromas of cherry liqueur and orange, and remains dry on the palate, low in power and high in minerality.
title: Blackbird Vineyards 2014 Arriviste Rosé (Napa Valley)

description: Winemaker Aaron Pott saignées nearly equal parts Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon to craft this impressively complex, light-bodied and ethereal celebration of cranberry, strawberry and grapefruit. It shows more tartness on the finish as it pushes a final, refreshing suggestion of mandarin orange.
title: Blackbird Vineyards 2015 Arriviste Rosé (Napa Valley)

description: One of the deepest colored rosés around, this wine has fresh, exuberant red-fruit aromas, while flavors bring as much complexity and depth as many full-fledged reds. Made from Carignane grapes, it does not follow the current vogue of pale-pink wines and is worth seeking out for its concentration.
title: Carol Shelton 2015 Wild Thing Rendezvous Rosé (Mendocino County)

description: Sweet and sour aromas amount to a prickly bouquet, while the palate has some flesh as well as freshness. Nectarine and spiced apple flavors are solid but pithy, and overall the wine is good but lacks concentration. Good for everyday quaffing.
title: Bodegas Julián Chivite 2008 Gran Feudo Rosado Rosé (Navarra)

description: A majority of Grenache and tiny bit of Mourvèdre from Kick Ranch and McGah Vineyard were racked to concrete egg for fermentation, with the intent of preserving freshness. Successful in that quest, this orange-pink wine is dry, tangy and well-integrated in terms of acidity, subtle in cranberry, dried cherry and orange, with a light, refreshing finish.
title: Kale 2015 Rosé (Sonoma County)

description: This light blend of wines from across Provence is crisp but somewhat lacking in flavor. It has a light, bright aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Château Coussin 2016 Le Rosé de S Rosé (Mediterranée)

description: This is a light, bright rosé that is made to drink as young as possible. It is crisp with raspberry fruit and gentle acidity. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2016 Espirito Lagoalva Rosé (Tejo)

description: This red-colored rosé smells a bit briny, like pickled strawberry. The palate is somewhat round, with initial flavors of raspberry and strawberry that turn a bit peppery on the finish.
title: Santa Rita 2016 120 Reserva Especial Rosé (Central Valley)

description: A ripe and soft style of rosé with its full strawberry fruits and only light acidity. Fruity and smooth, this bend of Touriga Nacional and Syrah is ready to drink.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2016 Rosé (Tejo)

description: Ripe and full, this wine is balanced with its rich strawberry fruit, with enough acidity to keep everything fresh. It's a fruity, spicy wine that is ready to drink.
title: Clos Teddi 2015 Rosé (Patrimonio)

description: This is a very fragrant and floral rosé, reminiscent of peach gummy candies, orange blossom and orange-ginger tea. The palate is surprisingly lush, with round ripe-fruit flavors that are just barely lifted on the finish. Drink now.
title: Vintales 2015 Sunset Rosé (Western Cape)

description: Basic aromas are low on fruit. This has a cutting, citric feel that's centered around juicy acidity. Sour grapefruit and tangerine flavors end with lasting citric acidity.
title: Finca El Origen 2016 Estate Malbec Rosé (Uco Valley)

description: Deep pink in color, this blend of 42% Syrah, 30% Grenache, 11% Cinsaut, 11% Mourvèdre and 6% Counoise offers light strawberry and pomegranate aromas on the tightly wound nose. Bountiful, refreshing acidity powers the palate, but the flavors are sparse, just hinting at sour raspberry and pomegranate.
title: Robert Hall 2015 Rose de Robles Rosé (Paso Robles)

description: This wine is a medium cherry-red color, with some bricking. The volatiles are quite high and lead to off-dry cherry flavors.
title: Tucannon 2014 Cabernet Franc Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Light and lively, this Pinot Noir-based wine has subtle but delicious, fresh and tangy cherry and raspberry flavors that unfold on the palate.
title: Pennyroyal Farm 2015 Rosé (Anderson Valley)

description: This lively wine is crisp, fresh and deliciously fruity. It is packed with juicy, fragrant acidity and wild strawberry fruit flavors.
title: Domaine Sérol 2014 Cabochard Rosé (Côte Roannaise)

description: Cabernet Franc produces lightly pink-colored wines, as in this bone-dry rosé. It is balanced between fresh raspberry fruits and crisp, nervy acidity. Drink now while it is still so bright and refreshing.
title: Alliance Loire 2014 Domaine du Grand Breviande Rosé (Chinon)

description: This intensely crisp wine has bright red fruit acidity and a fresh character. It is light in texture, perfumed and textured with wild strawberries. Drink now.
title: Henri Bourgeois 2014 Les Jeunes Vignes Rosé (Sancerre)

description: This is a fruity wine with its typical touch of sweetness. It has lively strawberry fruits, a hint of pineapple, fresh acidity and a soft, light vanilla aftertaste.
title: Sauvion 2012 Loire Valley  (Rosé d'Anjou)

description: Kevin Riley packs eight varieties into this pink wine, but the major proportion of Syrah and Grenache lend it its deep hue and rose petal, red cherry and vanilla notes on the nose. Grippy red plum skin flavors dominate the compellingly tense palate, followed by Rainier cherry and orange rind touches.
title: Proulx 2016 Resistance Willow Creek Farm Rosé (Paso Robles)

description: This vintage is light in color with perfumed fruit and attractive red currant and orange fruit. It is floral, touched by raspberries as well as a strong streak of acidity. This refreshing wine is ready to drink.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2016 Domaine Saint Ferréol Les Vaunières Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: This wine's nose is shy but fresh. The palate shows taut, tart fruit, with hints of red apple and citrus. This is very slender and light with a clean, dry finish.
title: Weixelbaum 2016 Strasser Rosé (Niederösterreich)

description: This wine opens with red apple peel and citrus aromas that also play on the fresh, light and zippy palate, made livelier by slight spritz. It's dry, refreshing and light, with lots of red apple fruit.
title: Pratsch 2016 Rosé (Niederösterreich)

description: Though a slightly riper style of rosé than is de rigeur today, this is a solid and lively wine, its ripe raspberry and red plum aromas cut by lime pith and squeezed lemon notes. Ruby red grapefruit, mulberry and baking spice elements pop on the palate.
title: Fossil Point 2016 Rosé (Central Coast)

description: High-toned acidity lends verve to delicate raspberry and white grapefruit flavors here. It's not deeply concentrated but lavishly textured with a cutting, mineral finish. Drink now.
title: Hound's Tree 2015 Estate Rosé (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Ripe and tangy, this full-flavored wine may miss out on some fruitiness but it has plenty of other flavors with herbs, spice and pepper. The blend holds 50% Mouvèdre, 25% Tibouren, 15% Grenache and 10% Syrah selected from old-vine plots. It could wait a few months, so drink from the end of 2015.
title: Château des Demoiselles 2014 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A classic rosé blend of Grenache and Cinsault, this is soft, crisp and fruity. The smooth texture gains attractive lift from acidity and raspberry fruits. It is light and bright at the end.
title: Château Pas du Cerf 2014 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Produced in the area of the Alpilles mountains surrounding Les Baux de Provence, this fruity wine is full and ripe. A touch of caramel gives richness and balances the acidity and the intense red currant final fruitiness. The blend is Grenache, Cinsault, Syrah, Mouvédre and Cabernet Sauvignon
title: Domaine de Valdition 2014 Tradition Rosé (Alpilles)

description: From vineyards near Bandol, close to the Mediterranean coast, this full and fruity wine has a lighter side with its fresh acidity. Red berry flavors are cut with a lemon zest texture, the aftertaste bright and refreshing with its acidity. The blend is 30% Grenache, 20% Syrah, 15% Cinsault, 15% Mourvèdre, 15% Carignan, 10% Rolle and 2% Ugni Blanc.
title: Domaine Sorin 2014 Terra Amata Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: While the nose is quite bold, boasting concentrated notes of strawberry leather and caramel, the palate on this delicately framed rosé is demure. It's a bit light in concentration with soft acidity, but an easygoing quaffer for early consumption.
title: McGregor 2015 Pinot Noir Rosé (Finger Lakes)

description: This is a bright, fresh raspberry-flavored wine. It's fruity and layered with attractive, crisp acidity. A touch of spice accents the finish.
title: Château Barbanau 2011 L'Instant Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A delicious, crisp and fruity wine that's textured with minerality and a tang of lemon zest. On the palate a raspberry flavor dominates, with layers of acidity and a lively, bright aftertaste.
title: Château Rimauresq 2011 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a crisp, fruity and delicate wine. With its pale gray-pink color and lively acidity, it has both concentration and lightness; it's so poised.
title: Domaine Houchart 2011 Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: Occasio continues to build its case for being a winery to watch out of the Livermore Valley, releasing this lively, raspberry and honeycomb rosé made from Pinot Noir grapes out of its Del Arroyo Vineyard. The Pommard clone fruit was cold soaked in stainless steel, then pressed from the skins and racked again into stainless steel. A rosé with some meat on its bones, it's way more than an aperitif and will stand strongly aside a full range of summer foods.
designation: Del Arroyo Vineyard Rose of Pinot Noir
title: Occasio 2010 Del Arroyo Vineyard Rose of Pinot Noir Rosé (Livermore Valley)

description: A fragrant and fruity wine, this is full of red-raspberry and orange-zest flavors. It is full, with a light touch that comes from the acidity and tangy aftertaste.
title: Domaine Gavoty 2014 Cuvée Tradition Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Dainty strokes of crisp-tart raspberry and watermelon rind accent this finely textured rosé. It's a brisk delicately concentrated wine with a brambly lingering finish. Drink now.
designation: STV Estate Vineyard Dry Pinot Noir
title: Silver Thread 2016 STV Estate Vineyard Dry Pinot Noir Rosé (Finger Lakes)

description: Fruity, crisp with red-currant and citrus flavors, this is a bright, vivacious wine. There is a tight mineral edge that contrasts with the fruitiness and turns this into a food friendly wine. Drink now.
title: Vignobles Raymond 2016 Elodie Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This pale peach-colored wine brings vibrant aromas of strawberry and cherry. It's lightly spritzy, drinking almost completely dry with weighty feeling fruit flavors.
title: Julia's Dazzle 2016 Benches Vineyard Rosé (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: From a vineyard just behind the beach at Pampelonne, this wine has 20% Tibouren, a rare grape in Provence rosé. That adds to the spiciness as well as the crisp acidity. It is a light and lively wine, fresh and full of lime as well as red berries. Drink now.
title: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez 2016 Mas de Pampelonne Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
winery: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez

description: Pale, just pink in color, the wine is refreshingly light and crisp. With its attractive red-currant flavors, the wine is lively, bright and bone dry. Drink now.
title: Les Vins Bréban 2016 Domaine des Monticoles Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: Whiffs of tea leaves and tobacco lend earthiness to this slightly savory but exotic appealing rosé. There's plenty of red-cherry and raspberry flavor, but it's slightly muted, embraced in shrouds of Cabernet Franc's brambly leafy character. It's a unique, full-bodied rosé to try over dinner with poultry or other white meats.
title: Adirondack Winery 2015 Island Sunset Cabernet Franc Rosé (New York)

description: Lively strawberry and orange flavors adorn a richer biscuity midpalate in this Rhône-inspired blend. Limited in production, it doesn't hold back on depth, breadth and freshness.
title: Crux 2015 GSM Rosé (Russian River Valley)

description: The barnyard aroma gives a less than fresh feel. A bitter edge suppresses the red fruits, leaving a hard aftertaste.
title: Château des Demoiselles 2013 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: With an orange leaning to its pink tint, this is struggling to maintain its fruit and freshness. Flavors of peach and apricot pits finish round and soft.
title: Carlos Serres 2012 Serres Tempranillo-Garnacha Rosé (Rioja)

description: Aged in wood, this wine is rich and spicy. Its fruit though is beautifully in balance, ripe with raspberry and red-currant fruits that are shot through with lemon acidity. This is a full-bodied wine, impressively structured and likely to age for a year or two. It is named after the 946 steps up the mountain behind the estate. Drink from late 2017.
title: Château Gassier 2016 Cuvée 946 Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: Dominated by the local Mourvèdre grapes, this is a ripe and complex wine. Its acidity is integrated with rich yellow fruits, spice and perfume. The wine is floral, poised and very stylish. Drink from late 2017.
title: Domaines Ott 2016 Château Romassan Rosé (Bandol)

description: This is still quite closed on the nose, suggesting more mineral and struck flint than fruit. The palate opens gradually, introducing prettier cherry-blossom and strawberry notes, along with a rich lusciously enveloping mouthfeel. The finish is slightly warming.
title: Lamoreaux Landing 2016 Estate Bottled Dry Rosé (Finger Lakes)

description: Light and nutty, this combines a majority of Grenache with Zinfandel, Mourvèdre and Tempranillo. Fermented in stainless steel tanks, it maintains fresh acidity with its lightly ripe strawberry and watermelon fruit.
title: Smoke Tree 2016 Rosé (California)

description: Pay attention to the Tutiac winemakers north of Bordeaux, who have produced another good wine. Bright red fruits give it a crisp character, packed with acidity and lively fruitiness. It's a great summer apéritif wine. Drink now.
title: Vignerons de Tutiac 2016 Carrelet d'Estuaire Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Intense acidity gives this wine character. It is taut and nervy, with a mineral texture. The bright, crisp red-fruit background to this acidity will assert itself over the coming months. Drink from late summer 2017.
title: Vignerons de Tutiac 2016 Lalande Bellevue Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Pale red in color, this fruity rosé was one of the originals in the current pink Vinho Verde trend. It is still one of the best. It has a lively, ripe strawberry note accompanied by a touch of caramel and bright acidity.
title: Casa do Valle 2011 Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: Proudly claiming to be a blend of eight grape varieties, this wine is soft and gently fruity with a spicy background that gives it a bitter edge. That will blow off in a few months, so drink this food friendly wine from late 2017.
title: Thomas Carteron 2016 L'Excellence Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This wine opens with a touch of fleshy ripeness. The palate is expansive, brimming with fresh red berry notes. Light in body, it finishes with uplifting lemon.
title: Winzerkeller Andau 2016 Blaufränkisch Rosé (Burgenland)

description: A rich blend of Grenache and Cinsault, this is rounded and generous. With ripe strawberry fruit and a full mouthfeel, the wine is packed with berries and light acidity. Drink now.
title: Château Carpe Diem 2016 Castillo Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Just north of Saint-Tropez, this large estate has produced a rounded fruity wine. It has a soft crushed strawberry flavor that is balanced by attractive generous acidity. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Château d'Astros 2016 Domaine d'Astros Cuvée Prestige Rosé

description: From the color, it could be a white wine. To taste, though, it is certainly rosé. It has an attractive crisp character with plenty of bright fruit and acidity. The aftertaste continues the dry fruity theme. Drink now.
title: Château la Calisse 2016 Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: The rose-embossed bottle sets the scene for a soft, perfumed and fruity wine. It has attractive acidity as well as ripe red berries. With its spice and herbal edge, the wine is also textured, a contrast to the fine fruit. Drink now.
title: Château Roubine 2016 La Vie en Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Grenache, Cinsault and Syrah form a soft warm blend that is ready to drink. It has acidity and spice as well as red berries. It's a fine apéritif style with its light touch and final crispness. Drink now.
title: Compagnie Viticole de Provence 2016 Domaine Saint Jean le Vieux Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Crisp up front, but not overly aromatic or fruity. Feels kind of thick and chewy, with gummy, sweet berry flavors that suggest cherry and plum. Feels a little cloying and cooked on the finish, especially for a young 2011.
title: Maipe 2011 Rosé of Malbec Rosé (Mendoza)

description: A pale salmon color, this rosé shows ripe notes of cocoa-dusted cherry and strawberry alongside sweet citrus oil. Creamy and full in the mouth, it's a richer rosé that can stand up to heartier fare.
title: Morgenhof 2010 Fantail Pinotage Rosé (Stellenbosch)

description: This is a new wine designed to be a “grown-up rosé” from the Cronk family who moved from London to Provence in 2009. It is a ripe fruity and rich blend of Grenache and Syrah. Weight as well as contrasting acidity give a structured character that balances well with the intense fruitiness. Drink the wine from late 2017.
title: Mirabeau 2016 Etoile Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This rare single-vineyard rosé is all Syrah. Pale peach in color, it brings aromas of blood orange and strawberry that are followed by a textured lively palate with an extended finish. It's one of the best rosés the state has produced to date.
title: Waters 2016 Patina Vineyard Rosé (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Almost white in color, this is a rich wine with intense red-currant and raspberry fruits. It is a dry wine, destined to partner food, with fine acidity as well as a herbal edge. It is a concentrated wine, ready to drink from the end of 2017.
title: Bernard Magrez 2016 Excellence des Muraires Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is the top wine from the Jean-Pierre Fayard family Provence cru classé estate. It is full of ripe red fruits supported by a mineral texture. The wine is generous, bone dry but packed with great fruitiness and finished with refreshing acidity. This sophisticated wine could do with a few more months, so drink from late 2017.
title: Château Sainte Marguerite 2016 Fantastique Rosé (Côtes de Provence La Londe)

description: A blend of Syrah and Touriga Nacional, this is a dry wine that is just crisp, light fruit. Dominant red berry flavors are smooth, without any tannins and only the lightest texture. From its pale color to its soft fruit, this is a delicious modern rosé.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2015 Lagoalva Rosé (Tejo)

description: An off-dry blend of Grolleau and Gamay, it's crisp and attractively fruity. Strawberries dominate this fresh and aromatic wine. It's a great rosé to drink now.
title: La Grille 2013  Rosé d'Anjou

description: This blend of Shiraz and Castelão is in a soft and ripe rosé style. There is just a touch of tannin from the Shiraz to give weight. The aftertaste is lightly sweet.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Storks Landing Rosé (Lisboa)

description: Rich and caramel flavored, this is a rounded, sweet strawberry wine. It has plenty of fresh acidity to cut through the ripe texture, but it's not for an apéritif, more for food.
title: Terras de Alter 2013 Fado Rosé (Alentejano)

description: Made from Zweigelt, this has a soft feel along with lively acidity. Its raspberry flavor is paired with a note of orange peel while the wine finishes with a touch of spice. Scewcap.
title: Dürnberg 2011 Blanc de Noir Select Rosé (Niederösterreich)

description: This is rich and soft, with sweet red fruits and some acidity. It's full-bodied and should fair well with food.
title: Domaine de la Sauveuse 2011 Cuvée Carolle Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Flirty and floral, this sunny off-dry Pinot Noir rosé (blended with a touch of Dornfelder) offers forward fruitiness in an elegant frame. With a kiss of strawberry and cherry flavors, it's an accessible, yet satisfying quaffer.
title: HPSepicurean 2013 Rosé (Mosel)

description: Vibrant and lively with forward notes of fresh red berries and pink florals along with a touch of watermelon rind and soft sandalwood. Juicy and clean in the mouth with a crisp, mouthwatering finish. Drink now.
title: Mulderbosch 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon Rosé (Coastal Region)

description: A bright, saturated rosé with a pink raspberry color and bright berry aromas, this Cerasuolo from central Italy will pair with shellfish or white meat. The wine finishes with a crisp, easy close.
title: Valle Reale 2009 Vigneto Vigne Nuove  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Cerasuolo)

description: A deliciously fruity rosé, brimming with smiling red-berry flavors and enhanced by a lime-like tang. It is just what a light summer rosé should be. Screwcap.
title: Producteurs Plaimont 2011 Colombelle L'Original Rosé (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: Light pink to the eye, then fresh and vital on the nose, with a touch of stalkiness. Refreshing, lip-smacking acidity drives the palate, pushing tangy, basic citrus flavors.
title: Calcu 2011 Reserva Rosé (Colchagua Valley)

description: The only rosé made from Durell Vineyard, this one employs 100% Pinot Noir for a subtle, light, dry wine that's refreshing in strawberry and peach. Having spent six months in neutral French oak, it's structured and midweight, just right for the table.
title: Dunstan 2013 Durell Vineyard Rosé (Sonoma Coast)

description: Raspberry, bubble gum and rhubarb aromas get this pink-tinted rosé off to a solid start. Juicy and smooth on the palate, this tastes of citrus fruits, pineapple and red plum. Bright acidity ensures that this is lasting and fresh on the finish.
title: Calcu 2016 Reserva Especial Rosé (Colchagua Valley)

description: Round and harmonious on the palate, this wine is a terrific value. Floral notes mark the nose, backed up by raspberry and strawberry fruit, while an undercurrent of crushed stone provides depth and backbone. The finish is berry-filled, but balanced and savory.
title: Domaine Corne-Loup 2016  Tavel

description: Pretty and pink, this light-bodied but nervy wine brims with white raspberry and pomegranate flavors and a texture that is crisp and mouth-cleansing. The balance between fruitiness and acidity is precise and appetizing, so it pays off sip after sip. It was made from Grenache, Mourvèdre, Roussanne and Grenache Blanc.
title: Terre Rouge 2016 Vin Gris d'Amour Rosé (Sierra Foothills)

description: From the eastern side of the Napa Valley, this combines 84% Grenache with 16% Mourvèdre, harvesting the best clusters of the grapes specifically for this light, dry wine. The juice is left to ferment and rest in concrete egg and neutral French oak. Light-copper in color, it's perfumed in jasmine, with accents of white peach, lime and strawberry, light and ethereal with a backbone of focused acidity.
title: Kale 2016 McGah Vineyard Rosé (Rutherford)

description: As sure-fire as the sunrise, Ponzi's Pinot Noir Rosé is always a class act. The floral, strawberry and peppercorn aromas set your mouth watering before the first sip. There's sufficient acidity to take a bit of a chill-down in stride, and the finish, though bone dry, has ample fruit sweetness to round out the mouthfeel.
title: Ponzi 2014 Pinot Noir Rosé (Willamette Valley)

description: Coteaux Varois is a small area in the heart of the Provence vineyards. This wine is fresh, fruity and light in texture. With its strawberry fruits, it has a crisp side and attractive acidity. The wine, with its fresh aftertaste, is ready to drink.
title: Le Cercle des Vignerons Saint-Louis 2014 Diamarine Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: While rich, this wine is well balanced with its fresh acidity and wild strawberry flavors. Citrus and a tangy orange texture are both attractive and give the wine a great lift. Drink now.
title: Château la Gordonne 2014 Vérité du Terroir Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A blend of 50% Grenache, 30% Cinsault and 20% Syrah, this is a refreshing and well-balanced rosé. Though young and still somewhat tight right now, it offers bright notes of red cherry, strawberry hull and plum skin that are framed by hints of orange blossom, citrus peel and sweet spice. Silky in texture, with a mineral streak and ample acidity that results in a bright finish.
title: Gérard Bertrand 2015 Château La Sauvageonne Volcanic Rosé (Coteaux du Languedoc)

description: Bone dry and very acidic, almost sour, with watery flavors of orange and lemon cough drop candy. Gains a few points for elegance and cleanliness.
title: Loomis 2009 Air Rosé (Napa Valley)

description: Importer Robert Kacher has an impressive stable of rosés from the southern Rhône at terrific pricing. this one, from the undervalued right bank of the valley, features 70% Cabernet Franc. Peaches, cherries and hints of peppery spice combine easily, then end on a note of wet stones. Drink now.
title: Domaine des Cantarelles 2012 Rosé de Fayel Rosé (Vin de Pays du Gard)

description: The cold, uneven vintage gives this rosé a green, New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc-style gooseberry aroma and flavor that makes it odd. There are some good watermelon and strawberry flavors, but it tastes unripe.
title: Quivira 2012 Rosé (Dry Creek Valley)

description: This is a strongly flavored blush, packing a punch of raspberry, fig, sweet tea and rose flavors. It's dry and very crisp in acidity. Give it a chill and enjoy with salted, smoked meats, or a nice fish stew.
title: VML 2011 Rosé of Pinot Noir Rosé (Russian River Valley)

description: There is a strongly caramel element to this wine. A tannic edge gives structure, though its fruit is less obvious.
title: Domaine du Claouset 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Super light in color, with aromas of grape skins, nectarine and briny seashell, this rosé from Carmenère feels highly citric and shearing. Sour-leaning flavors of tangerine and lemon finish with tang and enamel-peeling acidity.
title: Apaltagua 2015 Reserva Rosé (Maule Valley)

description: Named after the lightning bugs (bellugues means spark) that lived in the nearby woods, this wine is all fresh fruit and soft texture. There is a hint of caramel to go with the bright acidity and red currant fruits. The wine is a great apéritif style.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2015 Domaine des Bellugues Rosé (Mediterranée)

description: This wine is tightly textured, firm and with a strongly tannic element. It will be better with food.
title: Château Toutigeac 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: The caramel character of this wine is less attractive than its background of red fruits. The two sides need to come into balance for it to work completely, so wait until late 2016.
title: Producta Vignobles 2015 Cabane aux Oiseaux Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Lightly salmon-pink in color, this wine is ripe, caramel-flavored and full of red-berry fruits. A zesty orange edge gives the freshness this otherwise full, ripe wine needs.
title: Les Hauts de Lagarde 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Pressed from Lagrein grapes native to northern Italy, this bright rosé offers an easy, crisp finish with tones of wild berries, peach and pink grapefruit.
title: Josef Weger 2010 Lagrein Rosato Rosé (Alto Adige)

description: With bright fruit and intense acidity, this is a crisp, perfumed rosé. Clean, fresh lines of red and citrus fruits are cut by the tight, mineral texture. It is both delicious wine and refreshing.
title: Bejot Vins et Terroirs 2015 Charles Thomas Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: Time to rock with this new, lightly oaked cuvée from Esclans, a fresh, bright, full wine with forward fruit. Despite its alcohol, the wine has a light touch with a hint of pepper and rounded red fruits making it ideal for food. The wine will be best to drink from late 2016.
title: Château d'Esclans 2015 Rock Angel Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Organic grapes grown north of the Mediterranean port city of Toulon have produced a ripe wine with an intense burst of red-currant fruits given extra dimension by perfumed wild-strawberry flavors. The wine's richness means it will be better with food than as an apéritif.
title: Château Trians 2015 Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: This ripe, earthy wine with spice delivers a lightly tannic character. Rich, it's made to go with food, full of red-berry fruits and acidity. The aftertaste has a tangy, peppery edge.
title: Château Vannières 2015 Rosé (Bandol)

description: From a 1,350-acre family estate divided among five chateaus, this crisp wine is packed with red fruits cut with citrus acidity. Refreshing and mineral textured, it will make a fine apéritif.
title: Fabre en Provence 2015 Château de l'Aumerade Cuvée Marie-Christine Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Rich and lightly structured, this wine is shot through with bright acidity that offers a crisp, tight aftertaste. The red fruits flourish happily at the end.
title: Maison Saint Aix 2015 Aix Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Mas des Bressades is one of the standard-bearers of Costières de Nîmes, and this rosé is a perennial favorite. Red berries and cherries lead the way, wrapped around a core of citrus acidity. It's light to medium in body, with a pleasantly silky feel to the finish.
title: Mas des Bressades 2013 Cuvée Tradition Rosé (Costières de Nîmes)

description: This plump, medium-bodied rosé offers hints of peach and melon fruit, then finishes long and citrusy. It's very pale salmon in color, with an attractive coppery tint.
title: Château d'Or et de Gueules 2013 Les Cimels Rosé (Costières de Nîmes)

description: Made from Syrah and Grenache, this is a big, powerful blush wine, with jammy strawberry and raspberry flavors. It's sweet on the finish, almost a dessert wine. If this is your style, it's for you.
title: Francis Coppola 2011 Sofia Rosé (Monterey County)

description: While this opens with sharp citric aromas, there's no denying that it's fresh up front. Linear, pinchy and high in acid, this rosé of Malbec tastes of nectarine and citrus fruits. A slightly round oily finish holds onto snappy fresh flavors.
title: Fabre Montmayou 2016 Rosé (Mendoza)

description: Subtle notes of bramble, smoke and raspberry entice on the nose of this dry rosé. While delicate in concentration, its supple silken mouthfeel and yielding acidity are approachable and comforting. The finish is bright and clean. Drink now.
title: 240 Days 2015 Rosé (Finger Lakes)

description: Not a simple refreshment, this has a deep pink color tinged with copper. In aroma and flavor it's almost as substantive as a red wine. It has plummy, rich and slightly earthy aromas, a smooth mouthfeel, and soft cherry and spice flavors.
title: Galatea Effect 2013 Conoscenti Rosé (California)

description: Here's a pale and luminous rosé from Southern Italy with a pinkish-peach color and delicate aromas of stone fruit, wild berries, white cherries and a touch of chopped mint or basil. The wine is tart but also slightly sweet in the mouth and there's a touch of bitter almond on the close.
title: Giordano 2008 Primitivo Rosato Rosé (Puglia)

description: Fresh, tangy and medium bodied, this wine has crisp apple and peach flavors and a mouthcleansing texture.
title: Fount NV Batch No 01 Rosé (California)

description: Candied strawberry fruit and a touch of lemon peel make for a fairly mellow nose on this bottling, named after winemaker Adam Comartin's daughter. There is a sizzle of acidity, a grippy texture and clean lines of sour cherry flavor on the palate, which holds its tension deep into the finish.
title: Comartin 2016 Adelaide's Rosé (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: St. Helena is the source of this blend of Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Entirely unoaked, it's a dry, crisp, rustic wine, and full-bodied for a rosé, with heavy flavors of cherry pie filling.
title: Casa Nuestra 2007 Home Vineyard Dry Rosado Rosé (Napa Valley)

description: Ruby in color yet delicate in extract, this blend of Zweigelt and Lemberger is a concession between a red and rosé wine. On the palate, bright red-berry flavors are layered in unusual tones of caramel and spice. The label suggests it can be served both chilled and at room temperature.
title: Shalestone 2013 Beyond Rosé (Finger Lakes)

description: A lightweight Pinot that's actually marketed as a rosé, this wine nevertheless manages to pack in decent flavors of apple skin, red berries and cinnamon, capped off by some leathery, meaty notes.
title: Hargrave NV Fleurette Rosé (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Peach and faint berry flavors in a light, crisp rosé with just a hint of residual sugar. A versatile picnic wine that's a cheerful copper hue to boot.
title: Corey Creek 1998 Rosé (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Showing fresh watermelon and canteloupe flavors, this light-bodied, dry wine is crisp in texture, with enough concentration to be mouth-filling. It's made frm 80% Barbera and 20% red Rhône varieties.
title: Day Owl 2016 Rosé (California)

description: Made from 40% Syrah, 30% Grenache, 20% Mourvèdre and 10% Carignan, this Roussillon rosé opens with elegant notes of green pepper and savory herbs that frame the tight red cherry and underripe melon fruits. Medium in weight and a touch plush in feel, red cherry and berry tones dominate the palate, but finish bright and with a slightly bitter, fruit skin-like edge on the close.
title: Domaine Cazes 2016 Les Clos De Paulilles Collioure Rosé (Collioure)

description: This starts off shy, but with time allows aromas of delicate peach, cherry and orange blossom to come through in the bouquet. Pleasant ripe-fruit flavors unfold on the clean, well-balanced palate, with lingering notes of peach pit and orange peel on the finish.
title: Les Vignerons de Florensac 2016 Rosé été Rosé (Côtes de Thau)

description: Very light in flavor and texture, the wine has hints of strawberry flavors with acidity and a crisp, clean character.
title: Miradou 2010 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This wine is  refreshing, its red fruit juice laced with acidity and a touch of herbs. Easy and light to drink.
title: Andrieux & Fils 2010 Cuvée Victoria Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Ripe and fruity, this is a pale pink-colored wine from Raymond family organic vineyards. In the winery, the wine is full of red berry flavors and with a crisp final texture. Refreshing and lively, it's ready to drink now.
title: Les Hauts de Lagarde 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This collaboration from winemaker Austin Hope and Texas chef Tim Love starts with a crowd-pleasing—albeit sweet—nose, full of cherry sorbet and berry candy scents. The palate brings decent structure and offers plummy flavors.
title: Love & Hope 2016 Rosé (Paso Robles)

description: This is a one-dimensional wine, and it offers confected raspberry and club soda notes that rule the nose and palate. It's light bodied and sweet tasting.
title: Veramar NV Rosé (Virginia)

description: Medium-intense aromas of lingonberry, cherry and legume mark the nose. As the wine progresses across the palate, the acidity subjugates the fruit, and the palate turns tart.
title: Annefield Vineyards 2011 Rosé (Virginia)

description: Intensely fruity notes of red currant and raspberry abound on this fragrant full-bodied rosé. It's boldly concentrated on the palate as well, bursting of fresh berry and plum flavors. Primary and juicy in style, yet elegant and penetrating, it's an excellent rosé for year-round consumption—if you can still find a bottle.
title: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2015 Dry Rosé (Finger Lakes)

description: Here's a fun rosé that opens with aromas of spring flower, wild red berry and a whiff of crushed stone. Made with Syrah and Vermentino, the bright palate doles out juicy red cherry, yellow peach and a hint of white pepper. It finishes fresh and clean.
title: Marchesi de' Frescobaldi 2015 Alìe Rosé (Toscana)

description: Pale pink in color, this primarily Grenache- and Cinsault-based rosé (which also has five other grapes involved) shows light watermelon, orange rind and crushed chalk on the nose. There is buoyant citrusy energy to the sip, which goes down incredibly easy.
title: Municipal Winemakers 2016 Pale Pink Rosé (Santa Barbara County)

description: Aromas of yeast, grape skins and dust are less than compelling but not offputting. This is a high-acid, shearing type of rosé, tasting citrusy and a bit sour. A mild orange flavor is found on a crisp, racy finish.
title: Artadi 2015 Garnacha by Artazu Rosé (Navarra)

description: Lightly briny aromas of citrus set up a tight, grabby palate. This wine is a touch sour and pithy, with cantaloupe notes. A pithy, tangy finish is dry and basic.
title: Bodegas Paniza 2015 Garnacha Rosé (Cariñena)

description: Light and fruity, with a touch of pepper and spice, this is a immediately attractive, red-fruited wine. It has enough crisp freshness as well as richness to go with food. The aftertaste emphasizes both spice and fruit.
title: Château Thuerry 2012 Le Château Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: More complex and richly textured than most Provençal rosés, this wine is a treat, from its mineral-laden, smoky aromas to its ripe cherry-berry flavors and layered finish. Drink now, although it has enough stuffing to suggest it might last longer than just a single summer.
title: Domaine Sorin 2007 Terra Amata Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Lightly mauve in color, this rosé blend of 51% Syrah, 21% Grenache and 28% Mourvèdre shows ripe watermelon, bubblegum and strawberry on the juicy nose. The palate is quite restrained for such a ripe nose and deep color, but ripe plums emerge alongside graphite minerality and a pithy grip.
title: Rideau 2014 Estate Rosé (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: This attractive and fruity wine blends Niellucciu with Sciacerellu, both local Corsican grapes. The freshness is right there, crisp and hinting at red currant flavors and bright acidity. Drink now.
title: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté 2014 Domaine Petroni Rosé (Corse)
winery: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté

description: There is a caramel edge to this ripe wine with its strawberry fruits. It has spice and flavors of vanilla along with the crisp aftertaste of acidity. Drink this Pinot Noir-based wine now.
title: Nicolas Millet 2016 Champ Secret Rosé (Sancerre)

description: A crisp, caramel- and red-fruit-flavored blend of Castelão, Touriga Nacional and Syrah, this is ready to drink. Produced at Casa Ermelinda Freitas winery, it has a salty edge from the nearby ocean, finishing with plenty of acidity.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Monte de Baía Rosé (Península de Setúbal)

description: This wine combines notes of melon and candied apple with hints of pepper and ginger. Despite its modest alcohol level, it seems weighty, and even a bit sweet, then finishes on a mouthwatering, spicy note.
title: Koonara 2016 Emily May Pinot Noir Rosé

description: This light-bodied wine offers a fruity nose of cherry and raspberry and fresh flavors of strawberry, cherry and a touch of herbs. Balanced but with assertive style, the wine is perfect for spicy cuisine or burgers.
title: Achaia Clauss 2015 Demestica Semi Dry Rosé (Achaia)

description: This taut, intense wine is a bit angular compared to many Tavels, but pull out a bottle around Thanksgiving, and it should be singing. Cherry and citrus flavors collide on the palate, but should merge into a seamless whole with a bit of bottle age.
title: Domaine Chantepierre 2016  Tavel

description: Dark in color and meaty, this stainless-steel-fermented wine is made from Pinot Gris grapes from the Rocky Hill Vineyard and Pinot Noir grapes from Gold Rock Vineyard. Together, they offer a crisp interpretation of strawberry, watermelon and peach, finishing light and bright.
title: Stewart Cellars 2016 Rosé (Sonoma Mountain)

description: On the basis that anything goes with rosé, this wine is 100-percent Sangiovese, known locally as Niellucciu. The acidity that is typical of the grape is very present as are red cherry and tight fruit flavors. It is so crisp and lively, bouncing from the glass and leaving a beautiful array of red fruits at the end.
title: Domaine Terre de Mistral 2015 Pauline Rosé (Mediterranée)

description: Attractive fruity tones of red currant, raspberry and strawberry hull dance in the bouquet of this pretty rosé, graced by garrigue accents of lavender and rosemary. Flavors of red berry skin and peach pit unfold on the medium-weight palate, framed by soft tannins and a delicate spice note that lingers on the close.
region_1: Coteaux du Languedoc Pic Saint Loup
title: Château de Lancyre 2015 Le Rosé (Coteaux du Languedoc Pic Saint Loup)

description: Full-bodied for a rosé (as Tavel should be), this wine boasts plenty of cherry-berry fruit, but also appealing, complex notes of fresh thyme, ground clove and aniseed. Drink this blend of 60% Grenache, 20% Cinsault, 10% Syrah and 10% Clairette (a white grape variety) over the rest of 2017.
title: Les Vignes des Prêcheurs 2015  Tavel

description: Cherry Chap Stick and strawberry jam notes dominate the nose on this rosé of Merlot and Chardonnay. The palate is soft and sweet tasting, and the finish is lightly textured.
title: Miracle Valley NV Cobbler Mountain Red Rosé (Virginia)

description: This lovely rosé brings a complex mix of citrus, strawberry and melon flavors, etched with vivid acidity. It's poised, balanced and clean in style—a great example of how a seemingly simple wine can surprise with unexpected depth.
title: Amalie Robert 2016 Pinot in Pink Rosé (Willamette Valley)

description: While bright and fresh with fruit, this robust structured rosé offers enough substance to thrive beyond a summer season. Dry and sprightly, it offers crisp raspberry and cherry flavors nuanced by complexities of garrigue and earth. A pleasant bite of tannins elongates the finish.
title: August Kesseler 2015 Pinot Noir Saignée Rosé (Rheingau)

description: The word scrumptious applies here. This rich and complex rosé from Eric Hamacher is a mix of saignée juice and Pinot Noir blanc that wasn't quite blanc enough—a happy accident, since it's packed with raspberry confit and plum jam flavors, with a hint of cranberry sauce. Coming up on two years past fermentation, it's a wine to drink now.
title: Ghost Hill 2015 Spirit of Pinot Noir Rosé

description: A big improvement from the previous vintage, this pretty, salmon-hued wine is packed with subtle but flavorful fruit. Tart citrus and strawberry notes underscored with crisp, clean acidity make it refreshing and a real winner.
title: Rain Dance 2016 Nicholas Vineyard Estate Rosé (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Caramel and strawberry aromas lead to a ripe, while still, crisp crushed red berry wine. Good acidity, a light just off-dry texture.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2010 Azul Portugal Rosé (Setubal)

description: Fresh and forward flavors mix rhubarb, ripe strawberries and sweet Bing cherries. This vibrant wine finishes with a refreshing snap of acidity, making it a pleasure to drink.
title: Ponzi 2015 Pinot Noir Rosé (Willamette Valley)

description: As if its electric pink color wasn't enough to attract attention, this medium-bodied wine has effusive candied fruit aromas and just-picked red fruit flavors. Flavor intensity and good acidity give it a lot of personality.
title: Boeger 2016 Primitivo Rosé (El Dorado)

description: Balanced acidity and fruit give this Lobre wine its immediate attraction. It has a bright character, the fruit and the acidity in harmony. Drink this ripe wine now.
title: Château de l'Aubrade 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This is a tight, mineral-textured wine. Crisp fruit keeps it bright, but the texture adds a more serious, structured note. Wait until late 2017 for it to come completely together.
title: Château Petit Moulin 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This enchanting rosé starts off slightly flinty and citrusy on the nose, but follows up on the palate with waves of creamy concentration and ripe berry fruit balanced by a bright, refreshing finish.
title: Chateau Mourgues du Gres 2010 Les Galets Rosés Rosé (Costières de Nîmes)

description: This is rosé by virtue of blending a white grape (Pinot Gris) with a red grape (Zinfandel); hence the color. You'll find simple, slightly sweet strawberry and peach flavors.
title: Hip Chicks NV Riot Girl Rosé (Umpqua Valley)

description: Dusty, sweaty, soapy aromas offer little to no fruit. Flat and chunky on the palate, this rosé of Garnacha tastes like nectarine along with the bitter pit. A melony, peppery tasting finish feels hollow.
title: Borsao 2014 Rosé (Campo de Borja)

description: A bright, candy pink colored blend of Touriga Nacional and Syrah, this has plenty of acidity although its weight and ripe fruit give the wine a heavy feel. It is ready to drink.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2015 Rosé (Tejo)

description: Even the very best Txakoli won't appeal to everyone, and this rosé is far from the best. Fruitless aromas of arugula and vinaigrette set up a sour palate with arrow-sharp acidity. Piercing, tart citrus flavors end with scour and sizzle.
title: Txomín Etxaníz 2014 Rosé (Getariako Txakolina)

description: With its light prickle, this off-dry wine has a candied flavor, a tangy texture and a crisp, light aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Caves Velhas 2015 Lagosta Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: A wine that lacks balance. Its strawberry fruits are shot through with shocking acidity and then sweetened, none of the elements hanging together. Drink seriously chilled.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2012 Rosé (Tejo)

description: This complex rosé effortlessly combines hints of flowers, dried spices, garrigue and red berries. It's full-bodied yet paradoxically weightless, buoyed by a long finish of crushed stone and fresh lime juice. Drink it over the next few years.
title: Domaine Maby 2014 Prima Donna  (Tavel)

description: This fresh Saint-Chinian rosé exhibits a beautiful, earthy, floral core, as notes of peony and baby's breath take center stage against a soft white strawberry and peach backdrop. Medium weight with good, lifting acidity and a clean, refreshing finish.
title: G. Moulinier 2010 Rosé (Saint-Chinian)

description: A crisp, fruity wine, bright with red-cherry fruit and a touch of pepper. The acidity and the lively texture give this wine a refreshing character. Drink now.
title: Terras de Alter 2015 Terra d'Alter Aragonez-Touriga Nacional Rosé (Alentejano)

description: Fresh and fragrant, this is a lively, bright and tangy wine. With crisp acidity and raspberry fruit that is twisted with orange peel it is ready to drink.
title: Château de Blaignac 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This is what rosé should be: pale in color, dry, delicate and tart in acidity, with subtle but complex herb, tea, orange zest and spice flavors. It represents a significant milestone in California rosés.
title: Kokomo 2011 Pauline's Vineyard Grenache Rosé (Dry Creek Valley)

description: As soon as you unscrew the top on this 100% Syrah blush wine, the aromas of raspberries and strawberries release into the air, like incense. Those fruits follow through in the taste, turning jammy, heavy and sweet. The alcohol is a heady 14.9% by volume.
title: Vina Robles 2012 Roseum Huerhuero Rosé (Paso Robles)

description: This is a pale-colored wine, very fruity and crisp with an impressively refreshing quality. A touch of pepper gives interest to this dry, easy-drinking wine.
title: Château de Saint-Martin 2014 Cuvée Grande Réserve Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Light and fresh, this is a crisp and tangy wine. Attractive acidity dominates and gives life to the bright red fruits. A slice of lemon brings a tangy dimension to this juicy, fragrant wine.
title: Château Montaud 2014 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Organically grown grapes give this wine a pure and fruity character that makes it instantly attractive. It is crisp, laced with lemon and lively, juicy red fruits. The aftertaste is dry and full of flavor.
title: Domaines Pierre Chavin 2014 Pierre & Paul Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This fresh, crisp, textured wine has pepper as well as red fruit flavors. There's a touch of spice, ripe strawberries and delicious final acidity.
title: Château Cavalier 2014 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This pale pink rosé is 100% Cinsault--an oddity in the Rhône, where so many wines are blended. It's only moderately weighty and rather crisp, with tart, citrusy notes and hints of underripe stone fruit, giving it a straightforward, linear appeal.
title: Laurence Féraud 2012 Pink Pégau Rosé (Vin de France)

description: Loads of fruit show on the nose of this wine: green and red apple, strawberry and ample, zesty citrus. The palate is taut, fresh, dry and precise, shot through with appetizing fruity flavors. A wonderful, flavorsome rosé, with or without food.
title: Schloss Gobelsburg 2016 Cistercien Rosé (Niederösterreich)

description: The current edition of this nonvintage rosé is a blend of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay. Bone-dry, tart and tangy, it's a versatile, food-friendly wine, with flavors of tart citrus flesh and rind. A dash of white pepper marks the long, full-bodied finish.
title: Domaine Serene NV R Dry Rosé (Oregon)

description: Feral, feline, sweaty aromas precede an awkward palate with bitter flavors of weedy berry, citrus fruits and pyrazines. A scallion-like quality drives the finish on this strange, bitter rosé.
title: Arrocal 2014 Rosa de Arrocal Rosé (Ribera del Duero)

description: Full, soft and rounded, this shows flavors of ripe strawberry and red plum. The texture is smooth, with just a tang of minerality. Nutmeg and pepper complement the acidity on the finish.
title: Château d'Esclans 2011 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Rusty in color and metallic in aromas, this does not smell fresh despite being young. A full, chunky palate is home to mealy peach and cantaloupe flavors, while the finish falls flat and tastes bitter.
title: Marco Zunino 2014 Rosé (Mendoza)

description: Sawdust characterizes the nose of this strained rosé. The palate is heavy, resiny and low on acidity, while flavors of forced wood and cream are devoid of fruit.
title: Viejo Isaias 2013 Malbec Rosé (Mendoza)

description: This has already past its sell-by date. The color is tan and maderized, while the nose is soft and mushy, with raisiny aromas. Like the nose, this is flabby and past its prime in the mouth, with a bland, bitter finish.
title: Bodegas Corellanas 2011 Viña Rubican Rosé (Navarra)

description: Cabernet and Syrah are an unusual blend for a rosé, but this fresh and crisp wine works well. It has a vivid pink color followed by equally vivid red fruits and refreshing final acidity. Drink now.
title: Domaine D'en Ségur 2013 Le Rosé (Côtes du Tarn)

description: This 100% Grenache pink wine kicks off with a fairly light nose that shyly presents steely aromas of lemon wedge. There is a firm structure to the sip, where pink grapefruit and other citrus elements ride a chalky structure. Texture is key here.
title: Archium 2015 Rosé (Santa Barbara County)

description: Cherry, raspberry and candied aromas announce a plump but bland palate with sweet, candied flavors of red fruits. These turn slightly harsh before finishing with good feel and controlled bitterness.
title: Rio Madre 2013 Graciano Rosé (Rioja)

description: This is a terrific value wine (a rosé made from the indigenous grapes of Sicily) that opens with a bright pink color and fragrant tones of raspberry, white almond and rose petal.
title: Tasca d'Almerita 2010 Regaleali Le Rose Rosé (Sicilia)

description: Planeta breaks new ground with this Sicilian rosé made from Syrah. Clean packaging and a screw cap bottle set the stage for a modern, pristine and impeccably made wine that is fresh, zesty and very easy to drink.
title: Planeta 2010 Rosé (Sicilia)

description: Darker in color than most Provence rosés, this impressive wine is made almost entirely of Mourvèdre. With a rich, full character, it is generous and ripe. Sweet strawberry fruits are right up front, balanced with a touch of citrus and freshly ground pepper. The aftertaste is tight and spicy.
title: Domaine de la Bégude 2015 L'Irréductible Rosé (Bandol)

description: The almost luminous pink hue promises exuberance: the wine delivers a plethora of fruit notes—spicy elderberries, luscious strawberries and juicy red cherries all take turns to dazzle. Is this your typical rosé? Certainly not—it's more of an ultralight red that needs chilling. But it certainly delivers sophisticated yet fun drinking. Simply abandon yourself to its joyful flavors and celebrate summer!
title: Umathum 2015 Rosa Rosé (Burgenland)

description: High-altitude (up to 1,800 feet) mainly north-facing vineyards give this wine its intense character. It is crisp, tight, mineral and concentrated. Acidity cuts through, making this wine right for seafood and spicy Asian cooking. The aftertaste continues this fresh, textured character.
title: Château Grand Boise 2015 Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: Faint notes of red currant and rhubarb appear on the nose. The palate is fresh and light, combining lemon and berry freshness with earthier notes. This is slender, dry and very refreshing.
title: Domaine Fernand Engel 2016 Pinot Noir Rosé (Alsace)

description: A copper rose hue, this has a strong phenolic grip and a burst of heat at the finish. There's good texture, with wild strawberry and a push toward cherry-fruit flavor, with a wash of citrusy acid.
title: J. Scott Cellars 2016 Dry Grenache Rosé (Rogue Valley)

description: The entry-level wine from Sacha Lichine's Château d'Esclans. It is soft, broad, with more caramel and spice than fruit. It is definitely a food, not an apéritif, wine.
title: Château d'Esclans 2009 Whispering Angel Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: From one of the top estates in Provence, this is a rich wine, packed with fruits. It has a layer of spice and caramel, and an edge of fennel and herbs. For food.
title: Domaine Gavoty 2009 Cuvée Tradition Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Made from Merlot, this blush is a bit on the heavy, fruity side. It has vanilla and caramel-infused flavors of cherry pie filling and spices that finish sweet and spicy.
title: O'Brien 2008 Flirtation Rosé (Napa Valley)

description: Great price for a blush wine this sophisticated. Lynmar manages to tame Syrah's power and exuberance into elegant sleekness, resulting in a dry, tart wine with vibrant raspberry, orange zest and vanilla richness.
title: Lynmar 2012 Rosé of Syrah Rosé (Russian River Valley)

description: Rhubarb and peach pie flavors are at work in this pleasant rosé. It's clean and refreshing, with just the right profile for that leftover holiday turkey or ham.
title: Gård 2011 Lawrence Vineyards Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This is the second vintage of sparkling wine production for winemaker Blair Fox but the first he's controlled from start to finish, and the early results are exciting. Zesty lime, graphite and raspberry scents lead the nose, while red plum, pomegranate and citrus flavors converge. It's full and foamy on the palate.
title: Fesstivity 2014 Brut Rosé (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This rosé is warm and soft, with an attractive perfume and lively acidity to balance. Its red berry fruit is finished with a touch of spice that gives a final lift to the smooth vanilla-inflected aftertaste.
title: Florent Descombe NV Syrah Rosé (Vin de France)

description: The wine is simply crisp red-berry fruit. It has red-currant and wild-strawberry flavors along with intense bright acidity. It's an attractive Pinot Noir, ready to drink now.
title: Henri Bourgeois 2016 Les Jeunes Vignes Rosé (Sancerre)

description: Soft aromas of raspberry, strawberry and terracotta are elegant in this Cabernet Franc and Merlot blend. This shows a palate of brambly raspberry, under-ripe apple, grapefruit and powdered ginger. Dry in style and crisp with decent acidity, it finishes tingly and slightly spicy.
title: Paradise Springs 2016 Nana's Rosé (Virginia)

description: More of an orange shade of pink, this rosé of Syrah offers red plum, grapefruit pith and chalky minerality on the nose. The palate shows broad red-apple and tangerine-skin flavors, although the texture is lacking a bit of grip and acidic brightness.
title: Refugio Ranch 2016 Rosé (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: This is an aromatic, flowery wine, fresh on the palate and delicious with strawberry and apricot flavors. Some spice goes with the fruitiness and fresh, tight aftertaste.
title: Cellier Saint-Sidoine 2014 Saint-Sidoine Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Ripe and tangy, this full-flavored wine may miss out on some fruitiness but it has plenty of other flavors with herbs, spice and pepper. The blend holds 50% Mouvèdre, 25% Tibouren, 15% Grenache and 10% Syrah selected from old-vine plots. It could wait a few months, so drink from the end of 2015.
title: Château des Demoiselles 2014 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A classic rosé blend of Grenache and Cinsault, this is soft, crisp and fruity. The smooth texture gains attractive lift from acidity and raspberry fruits. It is light and bright at the end.
title: Château Pas du Cerf 2014 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Produced in the area of the Alpilles mountains surrounding Les Baux de Provence, this fruity wine is full and ripe. A touch of caramel gives richness and balances the acidity and the intense red currant final fruitiness. The blend is Grenache, Cinsault, Syrah, Mouvédre and Cabernet Sauvignon
title: Domaine de Valdition 2014 Tradition Rosé (Alpilles)

description: From vineyards near Bandol, close to the Mediterranean coast, this full and fruity wine has a lighter side with its fresh acidity. Red berry flavors are cut with a lemon zest texture, the aftertaste bright and refreshing with its acidity. The blend is 30% Grenache, 20% Syrah, 15% Cinsault, 15% Mourvèdre, 15% Carignan, 10% Rolle and 2% Ugni Blanc.
title: Domaine Sorin 2014 Terra Amata Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This wine is soft and rich with dense apricot and red berry fruits over a spice layer. That gives the wine a tangy character, textured with minerality. A bite at the end comes from the pepperiness.
title: Château du Galoupet 2014 Le Galoupet Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A soft, full-bodied wine, this has touches of caramel and ripe strawberry flavors. It is rounded, smooth and rich, while the acidity adds the essential freshness.
title: Château Rimauresq 2014 Rimauresq Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: An inaugural release, this blend of Mourvèdre (85%) and Cinsault is pale copper with salmon tinges. Aromas of strawberry and rose petal lead to dry, full-feeling fruit flavors that linger.
title: Coral Wines 2014 Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: The pale, pink-gray color indicates how light this wine is. It does have attractive red fruits, crisp acidity and a refreshing shot of green apples, all packaged in a dancing, buoyant body. Drink now.
title: Domaine de Caseneuve 2014 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Light, fruity and balanced, this combines acidity, red fruit and a bright feel. For drinking over this year.
title: Domaine de la Sanglière 2011 Breezette Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a pretty wine with its elegant pale color and delicious fruit. Made from organically grown Grenache (85%) and Cinsault (15%), it is crisp, full of fresh red currant fruit and has a nervy, very fresh aftertaste.
title: Château Henri Bonnaud 2014 Terre Promise Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: The heavy bottle signals this is statement rosé. It's certainly rich, full in the mouth with spice, acidity and tangerine flavors mingling well together. The wine is deliciously textured and could do with some more aging. Drink from the end of 2015.
title: Château Hermitage Saint-Martin 2014 Ikon Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Fresh citrus aromas follow through to the crisp, lemon and grapefruit flavors of this wine. To balance, a tangy texture, red currant fruits and intense acidity give this tasty wine all its poised presence. This blend of Grenache, Cinsault, Syrah and Mouvédre is from certified organic vineyards.
title: Château les Valentines 2014 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a selection from parcels on the Rimauresq estate. Well balanced, it has enough weight and texture to be food-friendly. Intense red fruits dominate, put easily against fresh acidity that finishes the wine with a lift.
title: Château Rimauresq 2014 R de Rimauresq Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Orange-pink in color, this is a ripe, full-bodied wine. It offers red fruits along with apricot and peach. Together with its lightly peppery texture and edge of caramel, it is a rich wine to go with food.
title: Château Saint-Maur 2014 M Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: With 50% Mourvèdre in the blend, this is an aromatic, ripe and complex wine. It has a sense of structure, with tannins as well as zesty orange and layers of spice. The aftertaste is more floral and fresh, although there is a touch of pepper right at the end.
title: Domaine des Baguiers 2014 Rosé (Bandol)

description: One of the lightest rosés in color, this wine does have plenty of flavor as a contrast. It is ripely fresh, full of red fruits and delicious, refreshing acidity. It has the fruit weight of a Sainte-Victoire wine, full right to the end.
title: Domaine des Diables 2014 Bonbon Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: This entry-level wine of the Saint André de Figuière range is pretty impressive in itself. It has a rounded, smooth character that is lifted by attractive red berry acidity and a nervy, mineral texture. Balanced acidity completes the picture.
title: Domaine Saint-André de Figuière 2014 Cuvée Signature Magali Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A robust rosato made from Sangiovese grapes, this wine has been saignéed and aged in oak for three months. It has a meaty edge about it. Medium-to-full in body, it tastes of ripe strawberry and watermelon.
title: Sorelle Winery 2011 Sogno Dolce Rosato Sangiovese Rosé (Lodi)

description: This good varietal rosé has a little more body and a little more breadth in the mouthfeel than many others, along with mild strawberry and cherry flavors that give it substance.
title: Cline 2016 Ancient Vines Mourvèdre Rosé (Contra Costa County)

description: After several years working in wine commerce and tourism, Céline Guguen-Brocard in 2013 studied winemaking. This is a bright result in partnership with Frédéric Gueguen, a former winemaker for her father, and Jean-Marc Brocard. This rosé is bright, crisp and full of cranberry fruit and tangy acidity. Drink now.
title: Domaine Gueguen 2016 Domaine Marie B.  (Bourgogne)

description: This is a finely balanced wine. It is dry with its red fruit right to the fore. The acidity and the tangy texture both promise some further aging. This is a great food-style rosé that will be good to drink from late 2017.
title: Château de Brigue 2016 Brigue Prestige Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: With vines close to the sea, this estate has produced a strongly mineral wine with a firm edge as well as plenty of red-berry fruits. The wine is crisp and full-bodied without losing any of the balancing acidity. Drink the wine now.
title: Château des Bormettes 2016 Argentière Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Owned by the Abeille family of Château Mont-Redon in Châteauneuf-du-Pape, this wine is delicious. Crisp and clean with great red currant and citrus fruitiness, it is finely judged with acidity and a light texture balancing the fruit. Drink now.
title: Château Riotor 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is crisp and lemony, with intense acidity. It has a spicy note that gives the wine an exotic character, enhanced by lychee fruit. The wine is full in the mouth, really fruity and crisp at the end.
title: Château Roquefeuille 2016 La Combe Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: The main estate wine from Roubine is a rich, ripe and fruity with a light edge of spice. It has a soft character, the result of the malolactic fermentation reducing the acidity. That gives a great balance between the red fruits and tangy zesty aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Château Roubine 2016 Premium Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The top wine in the Sanglière range is delicious. With its finely balanced fruit and acidity, it is bright with orange and red-currant crispness as well as a warmer sunny character. With its final acidity it is a great food wine. Drink now.
title: Domaine de la Sanglière 2016 Cuvée Spéciale Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The estate wine at Mapliers is rich, full-bodied and rounded. It has raspberry and apricot flavors that give it richness. To balance that there is a strong mineral and spice edge along with final acidity. This powerful wine should be aged a few months, so think Thanksgiving and drink from late 2017.
title: Domaine des Mapliers 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The wine tastes sulphured, with suppressed fruit. There is some weight, with caramel and red berry fruit flavors, but it is all muted.
title: Les Vignerons de Grimaud 2010 Cuvée du Golfe de Saint-Tropez Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This wine is tart, with considerable crisp acidity. That gives it a fruit-juice freshness, although the acidity should be calmer than it is.
title: Château Haut-Rian 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This is a simple fruity wine. It has attractive red-berry fruits, giving it a light and bright character. The wine is rounded and smooth, with an attractive lift of acidity at the end.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Coreto Rosé (Lisboa)

description: With its light prickle, this crisp strawberry-flavored wine is medium sweet but with acidity to balance. It's easy, fruity and ready to drink.
title: Quinta da Raza 2016 Dom Diogo Padeiro Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: A candy-pink-colored wine, this is crisp, fruity and off dry. There is a touch of caramel that fills out the otherwise acidic and red-currant-flavored palate. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Quinta das Arcas 2016 Arca Nova Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: The palest pink in color, this wine has a crisp texture but not much fruitiness. It is light with a touch of perfumed acidity. Drink now.
title: Château Thieuley 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: While the wine is dry, there is a fruitiness to it coupled with a caramel flavor that certainly makes it seem sweeter. With a crisp aftertaste, the raspberry flavored wine is ready to drink.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2016 Alandra Rosé (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: Ripe and smooth, this is rich with red berries. A touch of pepper accompanies a zesty texture that backs up the fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Château de Cornemps 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This delicious, crisp wine conveys a great bite of fruit and acidity. It has light tannins, tasty crushed raspberry fruits and lively acidity at the end.
title: Château la Verrière 2014 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Ripe and full, this wine is balanced with its rich strawberry fruit, with enough acidity to keep everything fresh. It's a fruity, spicy wine that is ready to drink.
title: Clos Teddi 2015 Rosé (Patrimonio)

description: This is a very fragrant and floral rosé, reminiscent of peach gummy candies, orange blossom and orange-ginger tea. The palate is surprisingly lush, with round ripe-fruit flavors that are just barely lifted on the finish. Drink now.
title: Vintales 2015 Sunset Rosé (Western Cape)

description: Neutral, dusty and a bit damp-smelling, with a leanness to the palate feel as well as flavors of semitart melon and peach. Decent but fails to excite. Drink now.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Tapeña 2010 Rosé (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: This Vino da Tavola rosé has no appellation or vintage date, butopens with ripe strawberry nuances and sweet almond paste. It offers a powdery, semisweet feel in the mouth.
title: Il Valentiano NV Note di Rosa Rosé (Toscana)

description: One of this vintage's prettiest rosé wines from the Finger Lakes, this perfumed, full-bodied sip offers loads of cherry-blossom and raspberry exuberance. Ripe red-cherry and watermelon flavors are a few shades sweeter on the palate than most, but it's zesty and pert on the palate.
title: Sheldrake Point 2016 Estate Bottled Dry Rosé (Finger Lakes)
