description: From La Moussière vineyard, this Pinot Noir-based wine is refreshingly crisp with red fruits and tight lemon and orange-zest acidity. It is lightly textured, with a minerality that comes from the chalk soil of the vineyard. Drink now.
title: Alphonse Mellot 2014 La Moussière Rosé (Sancerre)

description: From a high altitude estate in the Vaucluse, this blend of 60% Grenache, 35% Syrah and 5% Cinsault is pale and coppery in hue, yet shows ample richness and weight on the palate. Notes of wet stone, berry and citrus linger on the mouthwatering finish.
title: Chêne Bleu 2014 Rosé (Vin de Pays de Vaucluse)

description: The nose does not give too much away. But the palate holds grapefruit zest cushioned by red fruit aromas that are reminiscent of rosehip and hibiscus tea. Lovely, grown-up, restrained and serious enough for food with lasting length and elegance.
title: Schloss Gobelsburg 2014 Domäne Gobelsburg Rosé (Niederösterreich)

description: Domaine de la Mordorée's 2014 rosés are fitting tributes to proprietor Christophe Delorme's final vintage (he died in June 2015). This blend of 50% Grenache, 30% Syrah and 20% Cinsault is weighty and rich, blending raspberries and white chocolate into a wine that could be served as a light red wine, with grilled meats or poultry.
title: Domaine de la Mordorée 2014 Le Dame Rousse Rosé (Côtes du Rhône)

description: This organically grown wine celebrates lavender, used for perfumes and other famous products from Provence. Soft and gently fruity with attractive strawberry flavors plus a touch of spice, the wine is immediately drinkable as an apéritif.
title: Domaines Pierre Chavin 2015 Lavandelle Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This wine is light and perfumed, with crisp red currants and a tangy orange-zest texture. It dances from the glass, refreshing and poised to finish.
title: François Lurton 2015 Les Fumées Blanches Rosé (Vin de France)

description: This delicate rosé offers a subtle bouquet of muddled cherry, carnation and mentholated berry. The light and slightly astringent palate boasts tangy, tart notes of currant and lime rind that linger through the medium-length finish.
title: La Vieille Ferme 2015 Rosé (Vin de France)

description: A deep pink or coral color, strong fruit and herb aromas and equally strong, dry fruit flavors call for something rich and spicy to pair with, like sausage and mustard or pulled pork sandwiches.
title: Sobon Estate 2015 Rosé (Amador County)

description: In its distinctive Provence skittle bottle, this wine conveys a warm seaside feel. It is soft with a touch of caramel and flavors of wild strawberries and cream. The acidity at the end is what makes this wine, giving it the refreshing character it needs.
title: Maison Belle Claire 2015 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: With earthy, rustic aromas that translate onto the palate, this wine seems to miss out on some of the fruitiness normally associated with rosés. A few more months in bottle may help.
title: Château Coussin 2015 La Croix du Prieur Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The palest pink in color, this wine is light and easy with the merest hint of fruitiness and acidity. Red currant and lime mark the finish.
title: Château Maupague 2015 Cabaret Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A pioneer in rosé Vinho Verde, this producer makes a dry wine and one of the few rosés from the region that really make sense. It is balanced with crisp red fruits as well as tight acidity and a shot of lemon. Drink now.
title: Casa do Valle 2015 Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: This is an unusual blend of Grenache and Pinot Noir, which are not often combined, neither in California nor in France. The winemaker is Jess Pisoni, and he has crafted a highly likeable blush. Pale in color and delicate in the mouth, it has ever-so-slightly lush flavors of orange tea, peaches and vanilla. The acidity is wonderful.
title: Luli 2012 Rosé (Central Coast)

description: The top rosé cuvée from Léoube is full and rich. Find its generous red plum and berry fruits well encased in a complex structure. A touch of vanilla goes well with the final acidity.
title: Château Léoube 2012 Secret de Léoube Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A full, earthy, warm wine that has a strong herbal character as well as rich caramel and red fruits. It has a rare density for a rosé, textured and ripe. Try aging this wine for a  few months.
title: Domaine les Fouques 2012 Cuvée de l'Aubigue Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Full in the mouth, this is a tight, caramel and red fruit flavored wine. It has tang and a textured character that suggests a light amount of tannin. With this nervy, mineral character, the wine could do with some aging. so wait a few months.
title: Domaines Ott 2012 Clos Mireille Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Cloudy to the eye, with strained aromas of sauerkraut and barnyard animal. Feels heavy and tastes rustic, with burnt, stalky, anonymous flavors. Shows bitterness and stalky flavors on the finish.
title: Piattelli 2010 Premium Rosé of Malbec Rosé (Luján de Cuyo)

description: New producer Hannah Nicole has done a nice job, working in a light style, sourcing from Grenache Noir grapes and fermenting in 100% stainless steel. Totally dry, the wine is all strawberry and watermelon, with a tiny note of wax like the kind found around Bonbel cheese.
title: Hannah Nicole Vineyards 2010 Grenache Rosé (Contra Costa County)

description: Closer in style to a light red wine than a traditional dry rosé, this is dark pink—nearly pomegranate—in color, and boasts hints of leather, berries, dried herbs and white chocolate. Textured and round in the mouth, the only quibble is its relatively quick fade on the finish. Drink now.
title: Zonte's Footstep 2010 Scarlet Ladybird Single Site Rosé (South Australia)

description: Dry and snappy but also with a little depth, this nicely balanced wine made from Pinot Noir shows light flavors like watermelon and canteloupe. The texture is appetizingly crisp and the body rather light.
title: Navarro 2015 Rosé (Anderson Valley)

description: This foot-stomped, Sangiovese rosé offers aromas of lush strawberries and cream, with a hint of watermelon sweetness. It's fun, forward and fruit-powered all the way.
title: Airfield Estates 2012 Ruby Rosé (Yakima Valley)

description: This is rich with fruit as well as a mineral, tangy texture. A ripe character comes from the delicious raspberry fruit and acidity (60% Grenache, 40% Cinsault). The aftertaste is fresh, while remaining textured and ready for food.
title: Château de Calavon 2014 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: This unusual rosé blends Merlot rosé with substantial portions of Chardonnay, Cabernet Franc and Gewürztraminer, highlighting textural and flavor attributes from each. It's luscious in mouthfeel with a dense concentration of tropical fruit flavors, yet brisk and effortlessly quaffable. A delightful new take on a Hamptons classic.
title: Wölffer 2014 Summer in a Bottle Rosé (Long Island)

description: A smooth and ripe rosé from Touriga Nacional and Tinta Roriz, this is a cherry and red berry flavored wine. It has weight and a rich texture that are balanced by the crisp raspberry and fresh apple brightness at the end. Drinkble beginning now.
title: Casa da Passarella 2014 O Brazileiro Rosé (Dão)

description: This progressive domaine in Tavel reaches into neighboring Lirac for this wine, which is a high 70% Cinsault (the balance is Grenache). It's fresh and citrusy despite having ample weight, ending on a zesty note.
title: Domaine Maby 2014 La Fermade Rosé (Lirac)

description: This is round, ripe and full of rich fruitiness. It has a tannic structure that gives the wine concentration and a tight texture. The fruit is less obvious making this much more a rosé for food. Drink now.
designation: Domaine des Brosses Secrets des Tronbochards
title: Alain Girard et Fils 2014 Domaine des Brosses Secrets des Tronbochards Rosé (Sancerre)

description: This is a clean, refreshing rosé from the generally higher altitudes of Luberon. In the modern, cold-fermented style, it's a bit confectionary in fruity esters—somewhat reminiscent of bubble gum or cotton candy—yet dry on the finish.
title: Marrenon 2014 Classique Rosé (Luberon)

description: This plump, medium-bodied rosé is a blend of two-thirds Syrah and one-third Mourvèdre. It's a fruit-driven style, driven by hints of peach, cantaloupe and bubble gum, that should have broad appeal.
region_1: Vin de Pays de la Méditerranée
title: Jean-Luc Colombo 2014 Cape Bleue Rosé (Vin de Pays de la Méditerranée)

description: Fragrant, fresh, young and zippy, this is a simple, fruity summer rosé. The nose expresses only citrus but the mild palate shows some of the cherry-ish roundness of Zweigelt. Its light body and full fruit make it the ideal light refreshment. Drink as soon as possible.
title: Winzer Krems 2014 Zweigelt Rosé (Niederösterreich)

description: A bright pink color and absolutely fresh grapefruit aromas suggest a crisp and lively wine, and that's what this 88% Grenache and 12% Viognier delivers. The flavors are quite dry but vivid, like lemon, tart cherry and ruby grapefruit. The texture is lean, the body is not heavy and the finish is tangy.
title: Midsummer Cellars 2014 Grenache Rosé (Yolo County)

description: An enterprising blend of Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Malbec and Syrah, this zippy, light-footed rosé is full of tart cranberry and sour cherry acidity. Crisp yellow peach notes add sunshine on the palate. It finishes crisp and clean.
title: Bedell 2014 Taste Rosé (North Fork of Long Island)

description: This pretty light pink wine's acidic bounty is apparent on first sniff, as the underripe raspberry aromas are cut by a baking soda-like freshness. The sip of this mostly Grenache-based pinkie is all about the sizzle, where more club soda zest is painted with a light bubblegum flavor.
title: Jamie Slone Wines 2015 Rosé (Santa Barbara County)

description: Full and soft, this wine is a rounded style of rosé. Ripe strawberry flavors are cut with crisper raspberries. The wine, produced at the Pessac-Léognan estate of Domaine de Chevalier, has attractive, refreshing acidity to complete a harmonious package. Drink now.
title: Domaine de Chevalier 2015 Rosé de Chevalier Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This is ripe and soft, with its red fruits well integrated into the rounded texture. There is a crisp edge to the wine, with spice, lemon and apple skin flavors.
title: Château Sainte Roseline 2011 Cuvée Lampe de Méduse Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This has a bright pink color and unique aromas of wild berry and forest floor, with delicate menthol overtones. A blend of Pinot Noir, Lagrein, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, it's mouthfeel is more structured and firm than standard rosé. Pair this with white meat or salted cod.
title: Kellerei Kaltern Caldaro 2010 Signé Rosé (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

description: Strawberry and other red-fruit aromas run the bouquet. The palate is tangy and crisp, with dry but clean red-fruit flavors. Mildly spiced on the finish, this has length and purity. A very good quaffer.
title: Ochoa 2011 Rosado Garnacha Rosé (Navarra)

description: Pink in color, this has fresh, clean aromas of stone fruits. Feels medium to full, with red licorice, sweet baking-spice and raspberry flavors. Quick, round and solid on the finish, which lingers for quite some time. A fine summer sipper.
title: Marqués de Cáceres 2011 Rosé (Rioja)

description: This 100% Sangiovese leaves a lot to be desired. It's vegetal, with sweet and sour raspberry and vanilla flavors.
title: Toccata 2009 Rosato Rosé (Santa Barbara County)

description: This rosé—a blend of Tempranillo and Grenache—is light on flavor. A thin note of watermelon and a hint of peach pit quickly fade.
title: Ott & Murphy 2011 Chanson Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Ruby dark in hue, this has a light fruity aroma of watermelon, strawberry and mint. It's easy drinking and dry. Its slow buildup of acidity lingers on the finish.
title: Clos du Lac 2011 Chalaye Rosé (El Dorado County)

description: A fresh-faced rosé, with a rose-grey color, this has red fruit acidity and an attractive, creamy character to go with the crisp finish.
title: Domaine Sainte-Marie 2011 VieVité Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Made from 100% Cabernet Sauvignon, this is a full-bodied wine. It has a light tannic character over intense acidity. A caramel underlay cuts down on the freshness and adds some richness. Drink now.
title: Domaine de Ballade 2014 Ballade Rosé (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: With a hot-pink color and aromas like a light red wine, this rosé has enough heft in the texture and complexity of flavor to substitute for a Pinot Noir or Sangiovese at lunch or dinner. It's medium bodied, has red-cherry and raspberry flavors and a smooth rather than crisp mouthfeel.
title: Uvaggio 2016 Rosé (Lodi)

description: There are extreme amounts of citrus on the nose of this bottling, particularly reminiscent of fresh-squeezed grapefruit juice, as well as an edgy, crushed slate minerality. The grapefruit character explodes on the sip, which is very refreshing, unique and compelling.
title: Woodstock Collection 2016 Misty Roses Rosé (Santa Barbara County)

description: Really candied pink in color, this is an attractive, open and fruity wine. Easy to drink and bright with acidity, it is given a backbone by the Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend. Drink now.
title: Moncigale 2016 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: In its classic Provence skittle bottle, this is a wine for quaffing at a patio or restaurant table. Pale in color but packed with red fruit, it is an immediately attractive fruity and lively wine. Drink now.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2016 Soleillades Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: This refreshing aromatic wine will appeal to the sailors with its nautical theme. It is light and fruity, just touched by spice and with lemon and red-currant fruitiness. The wine is lively and bright at the end.
title: Château de Brigue 2016 Nautiqa Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The wine is soft with a warm caramel and spice character. That contrasts easily with the red-currant fruits and lemon zest acidity. It is a clean fruity wine, ready to drink now.
title: Domaine de Bendel 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a blend of the unusual Egiodola (a disease-resistant cross of native vines) and Syrah. This rosé version of two naturally tannic grapes turns out to be fruity and juicy. It is lively with crisp acidity and a lightly turned texture. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Domaine de Millet 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: This is a caramel-flavored blend of Merlot, Tannat, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Syrah and Malbec. That's a range, but the result is an attractive fruity and soft wine. It is bright at the end with plenty of acidity. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Domaine de Pellehaut 2016 Harmonie de Gascogne Rosé (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: This is a warm and ripe wine with a smooth caramel texture. That lies over the ripe red-berry fruits and balanced acidity. The result is a rounded wine that is ready to drink.
title: Georges Vigouroux 2016 Pigmentum Malbec Rosé (Côtes du Lot)

description: This is a lightly fruity wine with attractive acidity and citrus and apricot flavors. It is light and lively, fresh and crisp. There is a just a touch of spice and pepper at the end. Drink now.
title: Château de Brigue 2016 Brigue Vin de Provence Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a soft pretty wine with a light fruity character. It is gently fruity, finishing with a peppery edge and crisp acidity. Drink now.
title: Château Sainte-Béatrice 2016 Cuvée des Princes Rosé (Var)

description: This sweet rosé is light, with some attractive ripe strawberry flavors. Grapefruit acidity gives it a fresher side, lifting the bright, fruity aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Alliance Loire 2014 Demoiselle Bleue  (Cabernet d'Anjou)

description: Made from a majority of Cabernet Sauvignon grapes, followed by Merlot and a curious 1% of Sauvignon Blanc, this penny-colored wine is herbal in jalapeño and not terribly fruit-forward. It's extremely low in terms of alcohol and finishes diluted.
title: Delectus 2014 Rosé (Knights Valley)

description: This is a GSM rosé, loaded with watermelon and strawberry fruit, and sporting a slightly dusty mouthfeel. The persistent finish and texture keep it interesting all the way through.
title: Quady North 2015 Rosé (Rogue Valley)

description: A bright pink color from the Touriga Nacional in the wine, this shows a fruity, lightly tannic character. It has red fruit notes, soft acidity and a touch of sweetness at the end.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2012 Rosé (Tejo)

description: Vineyards around Mont Sainte-Victoire have their own appellation, accorded because of the extra ripeness the wines often have. This ripe, full, strawberry flavored wine has a fine balance between its crisp acidity and the ripe, warm texture. It could age for a few more months.
title: Château Maupague 2012 Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: Full-bodied and richly fruity wine. It has good depth of flavor from the zest and red berry fruits. They give a nervy, almost-mineral poise to the wine. Warmth and ripeness come in at the end.
title: Château d'Esclans 2012 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: All estate grown and stainless steel fermented, this is a pale pink rosé that's packed with flavor. Watermelon and strawberry fruit flavors stand out, with plenty of citrus tang in the aftertaste.
title: Abacela 2015 Grenache Rosé (Umpqua Valley)

description: Pale and refreshing, this is lightly scented by orange blossoms and strawberries, with similar flavors following. It's a splendid sipping wine, with plenty of acid to buoy up the light fruit.
title: Portlandia 2015 Pinot Noir Rosé (Willamette Valley)

description: Crushed strawberry aromas, followed by flavors that are fresh, sweet and a palate that has the delicious prickle of a young wine. Screwcap.
title: Aveleda 2009 Casal Garcia Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: Stalky, sulfuric and oaky on the nose, then plump on the palate, this rosé from Valdeorras is made from Mencía, not one of Spain's normal rosé grapes. This tastes woody and like sawdust, with generic red-fruit flavors, sugary sweetness and vanilla on the finish.
title: Avancia 2014 Rosé (Valdeorras)

description: This eclectic blend of Pinot Noir, Cabernet Sauvignon and Tannat along with Syrah, Malbec and Merlot is, in fact, a fresh, soft, caramel flavored wine. It has red fruits, light acidity and a smooth texture. It is ready to drink.
title: Domaine de Pellehaut 2015 Harmonie de Gascogne Rosé (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: This is an aromatic, lightly sweet wine. It has ripe strawberry fruits that have just enough acidity to keep the wine crisp. Drink now.
title: Enoport 2015 Vinhas Altas Rosé (Vinho Verde)

description: Tart, fresh and a bit chunky and rustic, this blend of 60% Syrah, 20% Grenache and 20% Cinsaut features bold lime notes, scouring acidity and hints of crushed stone. Drink now.
title: Château de Pourcieux 2009 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Reserve is rarely a word found in front of rosé, but here it seems meaningful. The 82% Merlot and 18% Grenache complement each other nicely. Cherry-pie tartness with a bit of sweet blueberry flavor make for a full-bodied, round and bone dry rosé that's substantial and delicious.
title: 3 Horse Ranch Vineyards 2011 Reserve Rosé

description: A pretty pale-peach color, this wine is a blend of Syrah (69%), Cinsault (15%), Grenache (9%) and Mourvèdre. Pleasing aromas of wild strawberry and watermelon lead to tart, dry drinking flavors with a mouthwatering, orange-rind-filled finish.
title: Renegade 2016 Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This bone-dry high-acid wine puts flavors of grapefruit flesh and rind front and center. It's a no-fuss summer sipper, perhaps not quite as rich as previous vintages, or maybe just exceptionally young. It's tangy, fresh and focused.
title: Stoller 2016 Pinot Noir Rosé (Dundee Hills)

description: With reverberating notes of crushed stone, this dry rosé, made predominantly from Pinot Noir, suggests a more mineral expression of rosé. The palate offers delicate raspberry and cherry flavors and a surprisingly plump mouthfeel that clings nicely through the finish.
title: Glenora 2015 Dry Rosé (Finger Lakes)

description: Here's a light, sweet and aromatic pink wine with a definite Moscato flavor. A slight spritz and welcome acidity keep the texture lively, and the floral, candylike flavors last on the finish. Should go well with appetizers or dessert.
title: Barefoot Refresh NV Rosé (California)

description: This is one of the more interesting rosés of the vintage, in part because it is almost as hay-colored as a white wine and doesn't adhere to the standard pink profile. Aromas of crushed Marcona almonds, sea salt and oak smoke show on the nose, and the acid-driven palate continues that nutty and smokey drive. It's intriguing and unique, though not particularly pink.
title: Daou 2016 Rosé (Paso Robles)

description: Mild citrus, melon and peach aromas are clean. This wine feels solid and a touch plump, but with agility. Peach and melon flavors are simple, and it's fresh, tasty and fairly elegant on the finish.
title: Evaia 2016 Rosé (Rioja)

description: Soft and ripe, this has attractive red-berry fruits that are layered with acidity and tangerine flavor. It's delicate, light hearted, and great as an apéritif.
title: Château de Brigue 2011 Brigue Prestige Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: On the rich side, this is a full-bodied and forward. It's concentrated and spicy, and with its weight it is a food-friendly wine.
title: Château Revelette 2011 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: This is appealing from the beginning, with fresh raspberry, strawberry and mineral aromas. It feels nice and bright, with flavors of citrus, pink grapefruit and green herb. Finishes with forward acidity and mild flavors of sage and tarragon.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
title: Storks' Tower 2011 Tempranillo-Shiraz Rosé (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)

description: This is attractive, fruity and lightly balanced wine. It has great wild-strawberry flavors that are laced with just the right amount of acidity. The finish is tight and crisp.
title: Miradou 2011 Miradou Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The weight here is palpable, sweet peach and strawberry going with richness. There is enough acidity, but the pepper edge is less attractive.
title: Domaine de Souviou 2009 Rosé (Bandol)

description: From the home estate of wine academic and guru Denis Dubourdieu, this tight, nervy wine has a mineral character rounded by wild-strawberry flavors. An attractive citrus tang gives it good bite at the end. Drink now.
title: Clos Floridène 2015 Le Rosé de Floridène Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: A blend from a wider area than just Côtes de Provence, the wine is lightly spicy, full of red fruits and citrus acidity. There is a typical touch of pepper that adds extra interest to what is a refreshing wine.
title: Domaine de la Sanglière 2015 Juliette Rosé (Mediterranée)

description: Made by the Barcelo family in the east of Corsica, the wine is ripe with strawberry fruit flavors that are balanced with apple acidity. It is lightly textured, just hinting at citrus. This is a fine apéritif style.
title: Domaine Vetriccie 2015 Rosé (Ile de Beauté)

description: This pink blend of 64% Grenache, 31% Syrah and 6% Marsanne offers the expected array of bubblegum, pink roses, peach, watermelon and cool steel aromas on the nose. It's wound nice and tight on the palate, with warm notes of strawberry and bubblegum emerging on the midpalate, leveled by lemon-skin tartness and a chalky tension.
title: Kaleidos 2015 Rosé (Paso Robles)

description: Rich, fruity and soft, this wine has a tang of orange peel along with ripe citrus and red fruits. Fresh and crisp at the end, it is ready to drink.
title: Yves Leccia 2015 Domaine D'E Croce Rosé (Patrimonio)

description: This is an attractive, soft Pinot Noir rosé. With its ripe red-strawberry flavors, it is rich but has plenty of crisp acidity. The balance and juicy, crisp aftertaste are deliciously refreshing.
title: Jean-Max Roger 2015 Cuvée La Grange Dimière Rosé (Sancerre)

description: This Syrah-Grenache rosé is fresh, inviting and lively, starting with scents of strawberry, raspberry, citrus peel and pink florals. Light and bright on the palate, tart berry and melon rind flavors lead seamlessly into the garrigue-kissed finish.
title: L'Ostal Cazes 2015 Rosé (Pays d'Oc)

description: This is a ripe, red-fruit dominated wine with rich strawberry and cream flavors that are immediately attractive, With its balanced acidity, the wine is ready to drink now.
title: Château de Lardiley 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: A good tannic edge to this Gonfrier family wine gives it structure and places it in the food category. With plenty of acidity, it is also refreshing, textured at the end with a lift of zesty lemon.
title: Château de Marsan 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: The wine comes from vines planted on a small island off the Provence coast. Its cool seaside climate has given a crisp red-currant flavored wine. Light and bright with lively acidity, the wine is textured with taut minerality. Drink now.
title: Domaine Perzinsky 2016 Les Forts de Porquerolles Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: From vines close to the Sainte-Victoire mountain, the wine is crisply textured, with tangy red currants. It is a bright stylish wine, finely balanced and lifted with acidity and fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Domaine Sainte Lucie 2016 MiP Made in Provence Classic Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Rosés are an extreme rarity from this appellation, let alone 100% varietal Tempranillo. Pale peach in color, aromas of strawberry hard candy, bubblegum and spice lead to dry well-measured fruit flavors. It delivers enjoyment.
title: Tertulia 2016 Estate Tempranillo Rosé (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: A pale, dry wine, this is crisp and lightly textured. It has a bright lemon character as well as red-currant fruits. Produced in the hills behind Saint-Tropez it is named after the painter who had strong connections with Provence. Drink this wine now.
title: Vignobles de Saint-Tropez 2016 Domaine Cézanne Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Packed with fruit and spice, this is a great food wine. It is full bodied, rich with raspberry flavors gathered into a structure of light tannins and edgy minerality. The aftertaste brings out a crisper character.
title: Les Vins Bréban 2015 Mimi en Provence Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Raspberry notes flit from the glass, then the palate follows with zesty, appetizing lemon flavors and creates a perfect picture of summer-berried freshness and easy, enjoyable lightness. There is a backbone of fresh acidity that makes this a classy winner with and without food. The finish is clean and hints of ripe cherry.
title: Pratsch 2015 Rosé (Niederösterreich)

description: This wine comes from vines south of the Mont Sainte-Victoire and close to the edge of the Aix-en-Provence region. The cool vineyard site helps the wine keep extreme freshness. Plenty of wild strawberry flavors are lifted by acidity and a refreshing citrus edge.
title: Provence Wine Maker 2015 Rose Infinie Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Produced from 40-year-old vines, this wine is ripe, full of red fruits with good concentration. It is packed with crisp acidity and lively fruitiness, making it refreshing and drinkable. The lees aging before bottling has added extra depth to the flavors. Drink now.
title: Château Barbeiranne 2015 Tradition Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Organic grapes grown on limestone close to Mont Sainte-Victoire have produced a wine that is tight, mineral and ripe. The texture and the structure suggest a wine for food. Plenty of juicy red fruits in the background give weight and richness to the wine and to its peppery aftertaste.
title: Château Henri Bonnaud 2015 Terre Promise Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: This smooth, ripe wine comes from organic grapes grown in clay and stone soil that adds a mineral edge. Spice balances with citrus and red-plum fruits to give a lively wine with a perfumed aftertaste.
title: Château la Mascaronne 2015 Quat'Saisons Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Deliciously attractive wine, crisp and clean as possible. It has a light caramel edge along with a more fruity aspect. To finish, the wine is light and bright.
title: Château Sainte Roseline 2012 Perle de Roseline Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Sobon's dry rosé (made from 96% Grenache grapes and 4% Syrah) is pinkish-red in color, brisk and structured with acidity, and a great, great value to boot. Drink on its own—plenty chilled—or find some fresh seafood and enjoy.
title: Sobon Estate 2012 ReZerve Rosé (Amador County)

description: This wine is rich, full in the mouth and softly textured. Ripe berry fruits are cut with acidity and with pepper. The fresher character is confined to the aftertaste.
title: Château de Landué 2014 Flaveur Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The merest hint of red currant berries plays on the nose and then relaxes into a fresh but fruit-filled palate. It's a light, dry rosé that is simple but very refreshing. Drink soon.
title: Markus Altenburger 2013 Jerry & Barry Rosé (Weinland Österreich)

description: A soft wine, it has a rounded, open texture and offers red fruits, an attractively aromatic character and fresh acidity at the end.
title: Château de Beaupré 2014 Cuvée du Château Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Loud citrus and berry aromas precede an overloaded palate that carries stalky plum flavors. Pickled tasting on the finish.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
title: Peñascal 2011 Tempranillo Rosé (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)

description: Bone-dry, tart in acids, and with rose petal, crushed raspberry, dried red currant, herb tea and pepper flavors, this rosé is zesty and versatile with food. It's a blend of Zinfandel, Syrah, Pinot Noir and Cabernet Sauvignon.
title: Fritz 2007 Rosé (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Savory and crisp, this pretty blush wine has flavors of rose petals, herb tea, strawberries and black pepper. It's pretty dry, and fairly full-bodied for a rosé.
title: Calcareous 2007 Twisted Sisters Rosé (Paso Robles)

description: An easy and bright selection, this offers direct aromas and flavors of red currant, underripe strawberry and a touch of banana. The palate is light, with low-intensity flavors and a short, clean finish.
title: Villa des Anges 2013 Old Vines Rosé (Pays d'Oc)

description: Plum and cherry aromas are good but undistinguished. The palate is a bit rubbery in feel, while the flavor profile is fruity but nonspecific. The finish offers citrus and red-fruit notes, but nothing beyond that.
title: Oveja Negra 2013 Syrah-Carignan Reserva Rosé (Maule Valley)

description: This bottling starts with a pretty nose of peach, melon and nectarine. It's more about the crisp, refreshing mouthfeel than anything, and would partner well with lightly seasoned shellfish or soft cheese.
title: Proulx 2013 Resistance Willow Creek Farm Rosé (Paso Robles)

description: Almost white in color, this is a rich wine with intense red-currant and raspberry fruits. It is a dry wine, destined to partner food, with fine acidity as well as a herbal edge. It is a concentrated wine, ready to drink from the end of 2017.
title: Bernard Magrez 2016 Excellence des Muraires Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is one of the vintage's knockout rosés, thanks in part to the Grenache and Gamay grapes that make up the blend. It's pale pink in color, with supple lime pith, strawberry, chalk and melon aromas. The palate is tense with structure, its bubblegum and lemon peel flavors riding a wave of acidity that persists long into the finish.
title: Joyce 2016 Turbidity Current Rosé (Monterey County)

description: In its singular oval bottle, this is the top cuvée of this prestigious estate close to Saint-Tropez. It is a lively and fruity wine with great acidity and richness. It has spice as well as red-currant and raspberry fruitiness. This is definitely a wine for food, with its edge of structured acidity and bone dry aftertaste. Drink from late 2017.
title: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez 2016 Château de Pampelonne Légende Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
winery: Les Maîtres Vignerons de la Presqu'île de Saint-Tropez

description: This wood-aged rosé is complex and intense. The rich fruit is only one part of the structure of the wine which is perfumed, mineral and, for a rosé, dense. It is surely intended for food with its concentration and ripe aftertaste. The extra year of aging has made it ready to drink.
title: Château d'Esclans 2015 Les Clans Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: An attractive silver-pink colored wine, this is beautifully ripe and fruity. It has a great balance between acidity and raspberry fruit. There is a herbal edge that gives the wine a fine tangy character. Drink this wine from the end of 2017.
title: Château Saint-Maur 2016 L'Excellence Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Although it is not indicated on the label, the fruit for this Jean-Pierre Fayard family wine comes from the La Londe cru region. The wine with its organically grown grapes is complex, ripe and fruity. It has great elegance and a stylish character that comes from the cool collected acidity and red-fruit flavors. Drink this wine now.
title: Château Sainte Marguerite 2016 Cuvée Symphonie Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The high proportion of Mourvèdre (80%) in this Sénéclauze family wine gives it great richness and a fine perfumed character. It is has ripe apricot and pineapple fruits along with a strong pepper character. The mineral texture and fine acidity make this a great food wine.
title: Château Val d'Arenc 2016 Rosé (Bandol)

description: A rosé of Tempranillo, with Syrah and Malbec blended in, Matchbook always offers good value on its wines, with this one basic and simple in its ripe raspberry and jasmine qualities. Drink cold.
title: Matchbook 2012 Estate Bottled Rosé (Dunnigan Hills)

description: This wine is ripe and simple, with jammy raspberry and cherry flavors, but it's clean and vibrant in acidity. The blend is Pinot Noir, Syrah and Grenache.
title: Burt Street Cellars 2011 Rosé (Sonoma Coast)

description: The nose of this Pinot Noir rosé is enticing with hints of ripe raspberry and violet. Subtle yet elegant on the palate, it's brisk and tonic with delicate berry flavors accented by a refreshing mineral tone that lingers on the finish.
designation: Sawmill Creek Vineyard Pinot Noir Dry
title: Bellwether 2013 Sawmill Creek Vineyard Pinot Noir Dry Rosé (Finger Lakes)

description: Made from 96% Grenache Noir and 4% Syrah, this is a fresh, pretty and easy to like rosé, with attractive notes of peony, strawberry top, orange blossom and thyme. The mouthfeel is light, but flavorful, with a pleasant citrus-pith and watermelon-rind bitterness that lingers on the finish.
title: Penya 2016 Grenache Noir-Syrah Rosé (Côtes Catalanes)

description: Gently fruity, the nose has hints of strawberry and orange zest. The featherlight palate carries notes of lemon and tart redcurrant with ease and freshness to finish dry and moreish. Lightness and ease are the virtues here.
title: Zantho 2016 Pink Rosé (Burgenland)

description: This Grenache-dominant rosé, with 10% Carignan and 10% Cinsault, opens with delicate notes of just-ripe peach, white flowers and garrigue herbs. Lightweight and dainty, the clean, bright palate offers similarly subtle flavors of peach and melon. It's balanced and refreshing, and best enjoyed now.
title: Castelmaure 2016 Vin-Gris Rosé (Corbières)

description: A pale copper-pink color in the glass, this is a bright and fruit-forward wine, with upfront notes of peach, yellow melon, ripe berry and pink florals. Flavors of white peach and cherry follow through to the lightweight palate, with lively acidity that lends refreshment to the close. Drink now.
title: Château de Jonquieres 2016 Rosé (Languedoc)

description: Light, crisp and fresh, this is the epitome of summer rosé apéritifs. It comes from a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, bright and lively with just a hint of the typical caramel flavor of a Merlot rosé. Drink now.
title: Producteurs Plaimont 2015 Colombelle L'Original Rosé (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: This light wine has crisp raspberry fruits, and lively acidity. It is all fruit with only the lightest texture and very ready to drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Casa do Lago Rosé (Lisboa)

description: This wine is a blend of Touriga Nacional and Syrah, with an off-dry fruitiness and soft, raspberry flavors. It is light and crisp with just a touch of caramel. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2015 Terra de Lobos Rosé (Tejo)

description: This has subdued aromas suggesting beeswax and toasted almond. The straightforward palate offers apple and white cherry alongside tangy acidity.
title: Albino Piona 2016  Bardolino Chiaretto

description: This value-priced low-alcohol wine has all the refreshing elements for a good rosé: light body, mild watermelon and peach flavors and a crisp texture. It has fresh acidity and good balance, too.
title: Bota Box 2016 Dry Rosé (California)

description: Very lightly textured, this fruity, fresh wine has a hint of caramel to accent flavors of citrus and red berries. The aftertaste is clean and always packed with fruit. Screwcap.
title: Strauss 2012 Rosé (Steiermark)

description: Pale apricot in the glass, this rosé made of Cinsault, Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon has a bouquet of peach and clover. There is a bit of heft on the palate that belies its light color, with flavors of ripe peach, apple, and lemon curd. The finish is marked by touches of thyme and oregano.
title: Massaya 2014 Rosé (Bekaa Valley)

description: The color is dark for a rosé, and the wine is heavy, but then, the blend is Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Pinot Noir. You'll find ripe, strong flavors of raspberries, red currants and vanilla.
title: Envy 2012 Rosé (Napa Valley)

description: This is a stand out rosé amidst an excellent lineup of New York pinks this vintage. Made from Cabernet Franc, it juxtaposes plump, silken mouthfeel against bright, crisp red cherry and bramble berry notes. It's a sprightly, yet concentrated and deeply satisfying sip.
title: Paumanok 2014 Dry Rosé (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Ripe and smooth, this is rich with red berries. A touch of pepper accompanies a zesty texture that backs up the fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Château de Cornemps 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This wine is smooth, soft and gently fruity, with a rounded texture that only hints at crispness. It's in an easy apéritif style.
title: Château Suau 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This wine has a ripe texture, rich fruit and touches of spice. Full bodied and tangy, it's smooth, with a hint of caramel. Drink now.
title: Château de Belcier 2016 Fleurs de Belcier Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This wine has a caramel edge that gives richness but also detracts from the fruit. It offers a smooth texture along with a spicy edge. Drink now.
title: Château de Lisennes 2016 7 Hectares Vin Bio Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This vivid pink-colored wine, 50-50 Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, is soft, with gentle fruitiness and crisp edge. Acidity and a herbal edge add a more textured character. Drink now.
title: Château des Arnauds 2016 Les Caprices d'Anaïs Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Soft and ripe, this caramel-flavored wine has hints of strawberries. Drink now.
title: Château Mémoires 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Made entirely with the native grape Bombino Nero, this informal light-bodied wine has subdued aromas of wild cherry and a hint of crushed herb. The aromas carry over to the über-simple palate along with a hint of pink grapefruit.
title: Rivera 2016 Rosé (Castel del Monte)

description: Shiny pink in color, with youthful, crisp aromas of cherry and watermelon. Zesty and fresh on the tongue, with spunky cherry and raspberry flavors that finish with natural sweetness. Candied to an extent, but mostly it's fresh and balanced.
title: Dominio del Plata 2011 Crios Rosé of Malbec Rosé (Mendoza)

description: From Pinot Noir grown on clay and limestone soils, this aromatic, fresh wine offers a delicious balance between the red fruits and acidity. A ripe wine, it shows a distinctly fruity character, and is ready to drink now.
title: Isabelle et Pierre Clément 2014 Châtenoy Rosé (Menetou-Salon)

description: Made from a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and Malbec grapes, aged six months sur lie in barrel, this dry wine has a pleasing ruby color and tannic, woodsy waves of waxy strawberry. It finishes clean and fresh.
title: Patland 2014 Lillá in Fiore Rosé (Napa Valley)

description: Kind of brown, which makes sense seeing that it's an older 2008 model. The nose shows sweet peach and mango aromas, and some oxidization. The palate is drying and short, with bitter-tinged peach and citrus flavors. Flat and dry on the finish.
title: Pacifico Sur 2008 Carmenère Rosé (Central Valley)

description: The wine is very crisp, but a tight, nervy and almost bitter acidity cuts through and is almost shocking. Maybe it will soften in a few months.
title: Estandon 2013 Terres de Saint-Louis Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: A blend of Aragonez, Syrah and Touriga Nacional, this is a crisp wine, full of raspberry fruits and a soft texture. It is attractive with its balance of acidity and fruit, and is very ready to drink.
title: Ciconia 2016 Ciconia Rosé (Alentejano)

description: Don't be fooled by this wine. Although it looks like a typical dry Provence rosé, it's medium sweet. With Black Muscat in the blend, it's soft and perfumed, its sweetness balanced by acidity.
title: Maison Marcel 2016 Rosé (Mediterranée)

description: A very light shade of pink, this wine is quite delicate, maybe too much so, showing light strawberry, bubblegum, nectarine and tangerine-peel notes on the nose. The palate offers a lot of texture but not a ton of flavor, with raspberry and dried-lemon elements.
title: Croma Vera 2015 Rosé (Paso Robles)

description: A very pale rosé, this blend of Grenache and Syrah is medium bodied, features hints of red berries to go along with barely ripe nectarines and finishes crisp and refreshing. Drink now.
title: Gabriel Meffre 2015 Château Grand Escalion Rosé (Costières de Nîmes)

description: A blend of six different varieties with Syrah (61%) taking the lead, this pink-colored wine offers aromas of bubblegum, spice and herb. The off-dry cherry flavors seem a bit watery, winnowing toward the finish.
title: Three Rivers 2015 Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This pale-hued blend of Grenache and Syrah starts off a bit confected, offering up scents of cotton candy. Yet it's less so on the palate, where the fruit resembles underripe melon and the finish is stony and less generous.
title: Marrenon 2015 Grande Toque Rosé (Luberon)

description: Savory smoked-nut notes juxtapose ripe red cherry and strawberry in this full-bodied rosé. While quite substantial in mouthfeel, it has bright citrus acidity that lends some refreshment on the finish.
title: Mattebella 2014 Rosé (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Red in color, with non-punchy aromas of strawberry and red apple. It feels heavy and thick, with red fruit flavors that don't bring enough refreshment to the glass.
title: Montes 2011 Cherub Rosé of Syrah Rosé (Colchagua Valley)

description: Simple and sweet, like a mixture of watermelon, lemonade and raspberry jam.
title: Pink Truck 2010 Pink Wine Rosé (California)

description: This attractive and fruity wine blends Niellucciu with Sciacerellu, both local Corsican grapes. The freshness is right there, crisp and hinting at red currant flavors and bright acidity. Drink now.
title: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté 2014 Domaine Petroni Rosé (Corse)
winery: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté

description: Pale in color, this ripe wine has plenty of flavor. With strawberry fruits cut with intense acidity, it has a fine texture, lightly mineral and with plenty of tangy freshness. Red fruits show strongly at the end. Drink now.
title: Roger et Didier Raimbault 2014 Rosé (Sancerre)

description: This is a deliciously refreshing wine. It's acidity and red-currant fruits are bright, crisp and right up front. The rounder, caramel and spice backdrop to all this fruitiness makes it just right for the table.
title: Château Beaulieu 2014 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Full, rich and fruity, this is a ripe wine. It is finely poised between this richness and a more delicate, fruity character, lively and bright. Age for a few months, although you can drink the wine now.
title: Château Coussin 2012 Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)

description: Intense mineral tones of smoke and crushed slate collide with fresh red cherry and raspberry flavors on the palate of this bang-for-your-buck rosé. Its concentrated fruit flavors are luscious and satisfying but also vibrantly structured, proving dexterous beyond the apéritif hour.
title: Villa Wolf 2015 Pinot Noir Rosé (Pfalz)

description: Ripe strawberries and crisp acidity blend together in this refreshing, crisp and fruity wine. Produced from Cabernet Franc, the wine is lightly perfumed and with a final shot of bright acidity. Drink now.
title: Domaine Dozon 2016 Rosé (Chinon)

description: Robust in body and alcohol, this lavish Pinot Noir rosé offers juicy blackberry and cherry flavors. Dry in style with a rich, slightly dense texture, it suggests pairing with a full meal rather than enjoying as an apéritif.
title: Heron Hill 2016 Reserve Pinot Noir Rosé (Finger Lakes)

description: Exquisitely fresh and fruity, this delicious rosé has crisp red currant fruits that are tangy, bright and tight. It is very refreshing now, although in a few months the almost shocking acidity will soften. Drink from mid-2016.
title: Patient Cottat 2014 Anciennes Vignes Rosé (Sancerre)

description: This is an attractive wine with its ripe red fruits contrasted with the tangy orange zest and acidity. It's definitely a food rosé, very dry and with bright acidity shining through at the end.
title: Domaine D'en Ségur 2015 Le Rosé (Côtes du Tarn)

description: Made from the local grape Duras (or Braucol), this is a soft, ripe wine. It has strawberry flavors that are lifted by a orange zest acidity. It's all fruit, fresh and ready to drink.
title: Domaine des Terrisses 2015 Grande Tradition Rosé (Gaillac)

description: A fine example of what Tavel can be, this is a full-bodied, luscious rosé with a bit of sturdiness to its structure. Cherry and peach notes fade into hints of fresh herb and cocoa on the long, harmonious finish. Drink now and through the summer of 2014.
title: Château de Ségriès 2012  Tavel

description: This medium-bodied wine boasts aromas reminiscent of trading-card bubble gum. Is that even still a thing? It's vaguely cherry-like, with hints of baby powder, yet completely dry and refreshing, with a crisp, clean finish. Drink now.
title: Yalumba 2016 The Y Series Sangiovese Rosé (South Australia)

description: A ripe, soft wine that is packed with strawberry fruits. It is smooth with a creamy caramel texture that contrasts with the fruity acidity and crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2016 Lagoalva Rosé (Tejo)

description: This wine offers delicious acidity, crisp fruit and plenty of red berry flavors. It has a lively, perfumed aftertaste.
title: Château Roc de Minvielle 2014 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This Tavel rosé contains six grape varieties, although 80% of the blend is Grenache and Cinsault. Despite ample weight on the palate, the result is a bit chalky on the finish, with flavors of underripe berries and melon.
title: Domaine Maby 2014 La Forcadière  (Tavel)

description: This wine tends toward an orange coloration, and shows aromas of warm watermelon, a touch of cantaloupe and even some orange rind. The flavors are very lively, if a little sour, with tangerine peels laced across the cotton-candy warmth.
title: Beckmen 2014 Purisima Mountain Vineyard Grenache Rosé (Ballard Canyon)

description: Tight, bright and very crisp, this is a lively and fruity wine. Citrus fruit flavors compete happily with the red berries to give a bone-dry wine, light and fresh at the end.
title: Château Fonfroide 2014 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: For the modest tariff, this is really good. Aromas of crushed stone and dried flowers lead the way, followed by ample berry flavors and a medium-bodied, silky feel. Drink now.
title: Boutinot 2016 Les Cerisiers Rosé (Côtes du Rhône)

description: Fresh, ripe and fruity, this has bright acidity and a tangy, lemon and orange zest texture. Attractive strawberry flavors come along with a touch of vanilla. Drink now.
title: Casa da Passarella 2013 O Brazileiro Rosé (Dão)

description: This wine is half Syrah with the rest Cinsault, Grenache, Counoise and Mourvèdre. Aromas of red apple, watermelon and bubblegum are followed by lighter tart, lightly spritzy fruit flavors, with the acid pulling it all together on the finish.
title: Renegade 2014 Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: The palest pink suggests the almost-weightless lightness of this refreshing wine. It would be an ideal, zippy and very slender apéritif. Drink soon.
title: Huber 2014 Zweigelt Rosé (Weinland Österreich)

description: This textured wine is tight with layers of nervy acidity. It is crisp, with good amounts of acidity and flavors of red currants that add extra freshness.
title: Mas de Cadenet 2014 Arbaude Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a tangy, spicy wine, a character that makes it seem dry and textured. It has weight as well as great fruit and acidity. With its citrus flavors, the aftertaste is fresh while still tangy.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2014 Domaine Bel Eouve Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Stylish and fruity, this has red currant crispness and an attractive warm, ripe background. It's balanced and fresh, with intense fruitiness at the end.
title: Bernard Magrez 2014 Douce Vie Les Muraires Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This light-bodied wine has a pale pink Provençal color but quite a bit of fruit flavor. It feels soft on the palate and tastes lightly sweet.
title: Black Ink 2015 Rosé (California)

description: With no concession to fashionably pale rosés, this is a boldly colored wine. It has red-berry fruits, a soft caramel texture and crisp acidity to balance. Of course, it is ready to drink.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2016 Defesa Aragonez-Syrah Rosé (Alentejano)

description: This 19th-century chateau is situated on the plateau above the Garonne near Cadillac. A soft wine, it's lightly fruity and with a crisp edge. It offers attractive red-berry fruits and just the right acidity. Drink now.
title: Château Carignan 2016 Château Léon Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This blend of 50-50 Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon is lightly herbal, with a touch of attractive tannins. It's ripe but preserves a crisp edge to balance the caramel flavor. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Château Carignan 2016 L'Orangerie de Carignan Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: While this wine has high acidity, it also offers attractive fruitiness. It is light and bright, with a layer of spice and pepper. Drink the wine now.
title: Château d'Haurets 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Pale in color, this crisp wine offers a touch of yeastiness that contrasts with the red-currant fruits. It has plenty of bright acidity as well as a tangy, zesty aftertaste.
title: Château Fonfroide 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This is a crisp wine, almost tart. It needs to soften to allow the red-currant fruitiness to shine. It will be attractive after late summer 2017.
title: Maison Bouey 2016 Collection Baruaud Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: This fruity, crisp wine offers layers of acidity and bright fruit, with a refreshing burst of red currants. It's delicious and ready to drink now.
designation: Le Rosé Gourmand de la Maison Blanche
title: Maison Bouey 2016 Le Rosé Gourmand de la Maison Blanche Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: A color so deep it could be a Pinot Noir, flavors bursting with plum and wild blackberry and a velvety texture make this dry rosé taste more like a red. Bucking the trend toward lightness, it has medium body, a creamy mouthfeel and lingering finish.
title: Carol Shelton 2014 Wild Thing Rendezvous Dry Rosé (Mendocino County)

description: From the small Coteaux Varois, a hilly region in central Provence, this is a crisp mineral-textured wine. It has lively acidity, citrus zest and a touch of red currants. It's a real food rosé. Ready now.
title: Estandon 2016 Terres de Saint-Louis Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: A vibrant crimson in color, this offers more restrained aromas and flavors than expected. Cherries and citrus pith marry with notes of wet stone, finishing on a refreshing note despite the wine's ample weight.
title: Goose Bay 2015 Pinot Noir Rosé (South Island)

description: This is a really light wine with bright fruit and a crisp texture. It has a breezy feel—all crisp fruit and lively acidity. Drink now.
title: Thomas Carteron 2016 Le Bonheur de Provence Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Pale in color, this is a light-tasting wine. It does have just enough fruit to give some red-fruit flavors. Everything though is light—a crisp reflection of the light of Saint-Tropez. Drink now.
title: Vignobles de Saint-Tropez 2016 Chevalier Torpez Saint-T. Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: It's good to see a wine in that increasingly rare sight: a Provence skittle-shaped bottle. This is a light and fruity wine from vineyards on the Massif des Maures, close to the sea. It has a bright crisp aftertaste with plenty of acidity to keep it all very crisp. Skittles is the precursor to lawn and indoor bowling.
title: Vignobles Ravel 2016 Château Montaud Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The wine is soft and warmly ripe with simple raspberry fruitiness. It has a touch of crisp acidity to keep it in order and to help its refreshing character. Drink now.
title: Maison Belle Claire 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A pale colored rosé, light and attractively crisp. Soft red fruits come through the gentle texture to give a wine that is ripe, fruity and ready to drink.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2016 Lab Rosé (Lisboa)

description: This is a crisp, spicy wine with a touch of pepper as well as fruit. It is lively, bright, touched by both acidity and red currants. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2016 Touriga Nacional Rosé (Tejo)

description: Principally Cabernet Franc with small amounts of Petit Verdot and Malbec (8% each) blended in, this wine is almost irresistible with its pretty, pale salmon color. It does not disappoint with its aromas and flavors of melon, white peach and grapefruit, with a light spritz giving it some lift.
title: Seven Hills 2014 Dry Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: An aromatic, herbal wine with crisp acidity and delicate raspberry flavors coming from vineyards near Saint-Tropez. The wine is tangy and textured giving a tight mineral aftertaste. Its weight shows it is certainly a food rosé. Drink now.
title: Château de Garcinières 2015 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This fluorescent pink rosé is fairly full on the nose, with a grape skins character. Lively, balanced and lightly oily in feel, this delivers plum and citrus flavors prior to a finish that's pithy and tastes like ripe pink grapefruit.
title: Rio Madre 2015 Graciano Rosé (Rioja)

description: The unique nose on this wine—which is comprised of cherry, chocolate and warm spice aromas—is followed on the palate by a delicate wave of cherry, raspberry and vanilla. It's balanced, but has a sweet touch.
title: Lyrarakis 2011 Idyll Rosé (Crete)

description: There's a medicinal cherry hint to the nose of this Syrah-based rosé, with additional notes of ripe peach and melon. It's fleshy and full-fruited on the palate, with just enough acidity to keep the ripeness in check.
title: Les Costières de Pomerols 2016 Beau Vignac Rosé (Pays d'Oc)

description: Made in a more savory style, this shows hints of nutty, putty-like aromas alongside cantaloupe and citrus. It's medium in body, with a dry, earthy finish.
title: Louis Bernard 2016 Rosé (Côtes du Rhône)

description: Dry and smooth textured, this is not your typical fresh-pink rosé, but a mature wine with some heft and meaty, melon-like flavors.
title: OZV NV Rosé (California)

description: Mostly neutral aromas include hints of strawberry and chewing gum. This wine feels dilute, with tangy, tart flavors of pink grapefruit. Pointy, sharp acidity allows the finish to hang around.
title: Arrumaco 2016 Garnacha Rosé (Spain)

description: Quite good and above the masses when compared to the bulk of rosé wines coming from Argentina. Made from Malbec, it's bright and floral, with a touch of citrus to the nose. Healthy, vibrant, balanced and cleansing, with flavors of berries, nectarine and pink grapefruit. Drink now.
title: Melipal 2010 Malbec Rosé (Mendoza)

description: Citrus acidity and raspberry fruit combine in this ripe, sun-drenched wine. It has a fine balance of crispness, with rich fruits and a delicate lemon note on the finish.
title: Château de Saint-Martin 2011 Eternelle Favorite Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This is a taut wine that's full of zest, acidity and delicate wild strawberry fruit. It has a hint of orange and almond, with a great crisp feeling.
title: Domaine de la Courtade 2011 L'Alycastre Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This salmon-colored wine has a bouquet of pear, rose petal and lime zest. It is a little tart at first sip, but is ultimately well balanced and refreshing, with flavors of strawberry, peach and rose that lead to a lime sorbet finish.
title: Jezreel 2016 Dry Rosé (Israel)

description: Light bodied and nicely dry, this is a lean and refreshing wine that tastes like crisp apples and raspberries, has great balance and a clean tangy finish. It's very bright and appealing.
title: Kokomo 2016 Grenache Rosé (North Coast)

description: This crisp wine is as light as a feather—fruity and perfumed. The fruit came from the highest altitude of the quinta, resulting in the wine's cool character and considerable acidity. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Vallado 2016 Vallado Touriga Nacional Rosé (Douro)

description: Delicate watermelon aromas and canteloupe flavors lend a bit of fruitiness to this pink-colored, light-bodied and lean-textured wine made from Grenache and Counoise.
title: Rock Wall 2016 Uncle Roget's Rosé (Yolo County)

description: Strikes just the right balance between Pinot Noir's cherried richness and the sauve elegance you want in a rosé. It's dry and crisp in acidity, with rich notes of orange peel, vanilla and toast.
designation: Wood's Vineyard Rosé of Pinot Noir
title: Ousterhout 2012 Wood's Vineyard Rosé of Pinot Noir Rosé (Russian River Valley)

description: This big and ripe wine is abundant in red and yellow fruit notes. It has a warm feel, with piercing acidity throughout. This full-bodied wine is perfect to be paired with food.
title: Ravoire et Fils 2012 Le Pont Rosé (Bandol)

description: It's hard to believe it's possible to buy this quality rosé for so little money. Mouthwatering scents of raspberry, stone fruit and crushed stone emerge from the glass, followed by rich, ripe fruit flavors balanced by just-enough citrusy acidity. It's full-bodied and plush, yet vibrant and long on the finish.
title: Domaine des Carteresses 2016  Tavel

description: This is made from 92% Cabernet Sauvignon and 8% Pinot Noir, an interesting and fulfilling combination thats robust on the palate. Pinkish-orange in color, it's both tangy and weighty, finishing dry in orange zest.
title: Adair Bachman 2014 Rose & Thistle Rosé (Napa Valley)

description: This is pretty pale for a Tavel, with a coppery tinge to its pink color. Notes of lime zest, wet stone and modest cherry-berry notes finish on a bright citrus note.
title: Prieuré de Montézargues 2014  Tavel

description: Neutral on the nose, with peachy sweetness and softness that suggests it's beginning to fade. Feels honest but light, with pithy, neutral melon and red apple flavors. Dry but sort of bland; still upright. Drink right away.
title: Marqués de Riscal 2010 Rosé (Rioja)

description: This is a big blush wine with bold orange and strawberry fruit flavors. There's a honeyed edge to the palate, but it's vital with acidity. Great with Mediterranean fish stew or paella, or on the beach with cold cuts.
title: Melville 2012 Estate Pinot Noir Rosé (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: With its light color, minerally nectarine aromas and Provence leanings, this is a good facsimile of Old World rosé with peach and raspberry flavors, a smooth finish and integrated acidic cut.
title: François Lurton 2013 Piedra Negra Alta Colección Rosado Rosé (Mendoza)

description: The palest pink grey in color, it is ripe and caramel flavored. Sweet red fruits give a soft texture, full-bodied and rounded. The aftertaste is all fruit.
title: Château de Berne 2013 Romance Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Close to the beach of Pampelonne, this is a ancient vineyard. It has produced a 2013 that is full of fruit, dense red flavors and fresh acidity. The wine is rich and lightly textured.
title: Mas de Pampelonne 2013 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: The use of 100% Syrah gives a deep pink color that borders on purple. Aromas are rather strong too, with the flaky, buttered crust of a hot cherry pie running into the more bitter elements of citrus rinds. Those characters play leading roles on the palate as well, cherry candy toying with just-ripe grapefruit, providing tensions that keeps the sipping interesting. Just 72 cases produced.
title: Solminer 2013 Linus Rosé (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Picturesque with a crystalline salmon color, it begins with the scent of just-bitten nectarine. The following flavors of tart apple and a slightly bitter salinity ensure the uniqueness of this wine. Mourvèdre (57%) is in the lead, followed closely by Grenache (28%) and Counoise (15%), all coming from the original cuttings of the Château de Beaucastel. This age-worthy blend will be fun to track 2017–2019.
title: Tablas Creek 2013 Dianthus Estate Mourvèdre-Grenache-Counoise Rosé (Paso Robles)
